111.content:
http://fireemblem.wikia.com/wiki/Lyn Here is the main page for Lyndis, if you’re unfamiliar with the character.

You slowly wake up, unsure of where you were previously or even what you were trying to do. Everything looks strange and alien, and you really have no idea what just happened. You see a few moderately large green strands that reach up to your chest, but the rest of the area is fairly open and flat, with various shades of greens and browns fading into the distance. Then you look further past you, and you nearly fall over when you see what looks like a nomadic hut, except it was far larger than any building or structure you’ve ever seen.


But then your memory starts to clear up a bit, and you recall your journey to the distant plains of Sacae, as you were ordered to observe and record the various kingdoms and lands of Elibe by the nobles of Ostia, as you were a scholar serving your home kingdom. And you remember that when you neared a Sacaen village, you were stricken with a terrible headache, so you stopped and sat down on a rock. And anything between that and now was a haze, so you figure that you passed out. And now it seems like you have more to worry about than a simple headache, because you somehow shrunk down to a miniscule level. Looking at the blades of grass again, you figure that you were no more than 2 inches tall, which was a frightening prospect.


Before you could decide where you should go next, you saw the flaps of the hut open, and an incredibly massive and beautiful woman walk out of it, shaking the ground around you with her thunderous steps. She seemed to be dressed in Sacaen attire, and from what you remembered from your studies, it seemed that she was a member of the Lorca Tribe. She had long flowing green hair, which was tied in a high pony tail, and matching piercing green eyes. You felt absolutely awestruck, and you couldn’t even will yourself to shout up to her, from being so mesmerized.


Then the mystery Sacaen woman started to speak, saying “Ahh! The winds are flowing softly, and I feel like luck will be with me today. But for now, I should prepare some tea, before I go out to hunt for the day’s meal.” And then she quickly returned to her hut, and you knew immediately that you had to get her attention, because you knew that it would be impossible to fulfill your task, let alone survive, at this strange and dangerous perspective.


You were glad that the Sacaens built their huts in the manner that they did, because you would never be able to get through a normal door because of your size, and yet you were also not small enough to crawl under a door if you would have needed to. After a few minutes, you enter the Sacaen woman’s hut, and you see her sitting down while she waits for her tea to heat up. As you walk closer to the woman, you notice that she wasn’t wearing any shoes, and you were surprised that her feet seemed so smooth and delicate. You would have imagined that a Sacaen, with all their nomadic traditions, would seem much hardier and rougher. You wonder if it was a natural trait of the Sacaen people, and if it was a blessing that was passed down from their crusader ancestor, Hanon.


As you get even closer, you pass her leather boots, and the scent that radiates from them is incredibly strong. You begin coughing, not expecting to experience such an intense aroma from a pair of feet that looked so soft and smooth. But before you could react, the Sacaen woman’s feet started barreling right towards you, and slam into you, causing your head to be jammed between her 2nd and 3rd toes. Your head was held like a vice, and she would periodically scrunch her toes, as your presence was only able to cause an unconscious reaction out of her. They seemed to grip at your head like a mere pebble, and you were treated as ruthlessly as one would expect as a result.


Strangely enough, her toes did not seem to carry the same intense odor as her boots did, even if he did notice a light similarity. He felt like he was being surrounded by nature, and it seemed natural for a woman who completely embraced the simpler life of nature. But he still noticed the overpowering smell that her boots carried, and the two aromas mixed in the strangest of ways, although you didn’t seem to dislike it. It was an odd concept, to be thinking that way about someone’s foot, but you ignore your opinion on the smell, and try and focus on a way to get her attention.


But before you could think of anything, she dragged her feet back under her chair, bringing you with them, and you felt the pressure increase as she put all the weight of her legs onto the balls of her feet. She then began to grind the balls of her feet back and forth, completely smothering you in her toe flesh, as she was completely focused on her heating tea. Your body was harshly pressed into the ball of her foot, and your head and face was crammed between both of her immense toes. For some odd reason, you didn’t feel all that much pain, even though you were sure that you should have been dead by now, and you wonder just how you’re still alive.


Then, the woman shouted, “It seems like the tea is finished. Perfect!” She then shifts towards her table, lifting her legs in the process, which subjects you to strange pressures pulling at you from all directions. (they wouldn’t know what G-force is anyway) When she stops, she crosses her legs, allowing her left leg to dangle over her right, causing you to be held in the air as well. You cannot look down, because her toes gripped your head even tighter than before, but you considered it a blessing, because you had no desire to see for yourself how high you were being kept.


As she poured her tea and prepared her lunch, she happily wriggled her toes, giving your head a vigorous massage. Before she began to eat, she said “Please provide me with your blessing, spirits of the plains, and guide me in my hunt.” She then remained silent for a few moments, and she was completely still as well, including her long and slender toes. You were happy that you got to hear a Sacaen practice their natural customs like this, but you’d much rather be able to have a conversation instead, especially if it provided you some respite from this strange torture. Then she started to drink and eat, while her toes excitedly played with their new toy, while their master was none the wiser to your presence.


All you could hope for would be to escape from this mess, and properly get this woman’s attention. And as you think, you hear her mumble to herself “Sometimes, I get tired of this repeating life on the plains. I wonder if I could ever have an adventure, like my mother and father did when they were young.” You could clearly understand this woman’s desire for adventure, and you are sure that you could provide her with one if you could ever gain your attention.


Traveling alone, from Ostia all the way to the distant plains of Sacae, was fascinating for sure, but it was also incredibly lonely and sometimes even depressing. Luckily, you didn’t ever run into any bandits or brigands, and you even met friendly people at the various towns and villages during your journey. But those days on the road, by yourself, were rough on your morale. Maybe this occurrence was an act of fate, but before you could continue pondering, the Sacaen’s toes squeezed your head one more time.


Then the woman said, “Now that I’m finished, I should head out to find something for tonight!” You hope that your luck changes, and you have a chance to escape from her toes’ clutches, and maybe even get her attention before she heads out to hunt.

Authors note: In Lyn's story at Chapter five if Serra is attacked and defeated she sends Lyn and co ahead saying she is too weak to continue. This is how I will start her story.



Serra lay on the former battlefield she felt herself bleeding, the wound was bad but not fatal. In truth she'd rather have gone with Lyn but at the same time she was having a difficult time keeping her 'Princess' persona up. The Twintailed Cleric sighed as she lay. "Well..." She huffed. "I can call down lightning yet I can't heal my own wounds, maybe one of the dead soldiers has some medicine on them? She pushed herself up and limped over to the nearest body, no luck, the second, nothing, third, nope. She was tired, not dying but tired, although falling asleep would be a bad idea with this wound. Dragging herself with the will she had left she found a mage's body. "Now wouldn't this be-" She picked up a strange spell book, it wasn't any sort of dark arts nor was it fire or anything like that, no this was simply 'growth' "I might be able to use this?" She shrugged. The red river reminding her there were worse ways to die. The book was no more than blank pages which must have been loose or damaged in battle perhaps As they scattered in a simple breeze, however they didn't go far instead they looped right back around and clung to her vanishing as they did. One page remained. Serra was really glad she knew how to translate the mysterious language it was in.

"Speakith the spell and one page will vanish, thy body reborn of new flesh and strength, you shall double in power without human needs, breath need not be drawn, food not consumed, Thy body in perfect health and clean. Be sure to don thy favorite armor or gown before using."

"I do not have the fortinue of choosing." She moaned. "Oh well here we go. Htworg!!" She whispered as she felt her body pulse, she began to notice the world becoming smaller out of the 10 pages she had she felt as if one had vanished, her body seeming to mutate accoring to the book and her robes growing with her. Her wound healed as well she grew still "I could catch up to Lyn now haha!" She let out a laugh. "Oh Lyn...I do believe I shall grant you the honor of my help!" She called as she began walking in their general direction, the now 1,000ft tall Claric smiled brightly. But did she find them?

1152.title: The mysterious Ninian?

choices: She gets a massive growth spurt and is unable to leave the room
11521.content:
Eliwood and his comrades had escaped death upon Dragon's Isle. The vicious battle with Nergal's henchmen and the Marqess of Laus had left heart wrenching scars in Eliwood and his close comrades. Having evaded destruction by a Dragon, they fled to a small port town that was far away from the Black Fang's main force in Lycia. There the group rested and prepared for their next battle with the evil assassins.

Ninian layed silently in her bed at the inn. Her worries and sorrow over being so weak in human form left her in sadness. She was alone in her room, the door was shut and the fire burned peacefully as she layed there. She had a face of despair as she thought to herself. 'Lord Eliwod does so much for me. After his father gave his life in order to stop Nergal, it was him who carried me in his gentle arms all the way to Fargus ship. And he has always aided me when I need him most, ever since we met that time a year ago.'

The beautiful dancer thought back to when she had met the young lord. Eliwood had fought bravely and defeated a horde of Black Fang assassins that had captured her. Single-handedly he crushed a army of 50 soldiers with no trouble. And then he carried her away from them in his arms. Even her brother Nils worked hard to make sure she was always safe, putting himself in danger for her.

But now he didn't all sorts of help. 'The power of Nergal is great, and with every passing moment he grows ever stronger.' Ninian thought sadly. 'Unless I become stronger. I will only be a burden to him.' She believed this to be true. That she was nothing more than extra weight that would be the doom of all those around her.

'If only I was bigger and stronger. Then I could fight alongside him. Maybe even a bit older too.' Ninian blushed as she imagined a older and more busty version of herself. Casting spells and fighting alongside the young Red-haired lord that she loved ever so much. 'But there is nothing that could grant my wish.' Knowing this, she layed down and fell asleep. Hoping her rest would ease her troubled heart and restore her stamina.

As the young Dancer dreamed, she began to have visions. Of what, she was not sure. But she was certain that she was engulfed in a fog of cold and icy mist. "Is anyone here?" Ninian called out to her surroundings. Nothing but icy mist and more icy mist was around her. And only the cold breeze could be heard.

[Do you Desire Strength?] A mysterious voiced called out from the mist.

Hearing the voice, Ninian called out to it. "Hello? Who are you?"

[Do you Desire Strength] It said once again to her.

"Yes. I desire the power to protect the ones I care about." Ninian replied. She didn't know why, but this voice reminded of the voice that brought her to this world. A voice of someone she knew long ago...

[Then I shall grant you strength] The voice said as everything went black.

Quietly Ninian awoke from her deep sleep. Hours passing by like they had just happend. "What a strange dream." Ninian spoke as she rubbed her eyes. 'It's not like a dream can grant my wish.' She thought.

But then she saw it. At the end of her bed was orb. It laid right at the end of her feet. And inside it was a glowing frozen mist. All most like the dream she had had last night. "Who put this at the end of my bed?" Ninian thought as she got out of bed, grabbing the orb into her hands gently.

It glowed a bright light in a flash. "AAAH!" Ninian called out as she dropped it. The orb survived it's fall and landed with a thud. But began to roll under the bed.

"What did that thing just do?" Ninian pondered. 'It was probably nothing.' She decided after a few minutes of thinking. And so she decided to go downstairs. She was feeling much better, stronger even. And she had a sudden urge to go see Eliwood...

1212.content:
Azura was dead.

She remembers the feeling of her body dissolving into water as she used her necklace's power to assist her comrades in Nohr and bring peace between it and the kingdom of Hoshido; at the time, it was a truly painful feeling on her body, and yet Azura felt glad throughout that pain, knowing that her power would end the conflict of the two kingdoms and assist her friend Corrin in saving the world, as the legend of Yato foretold. Now, her time was spent as a ghostly apparition, her spirit traversing around the world, unable to interact with anyone, only an observer as she watched the results of the Nohrian conquest unfold around her. She was glad to see Xander, now King of Nohr, keeping peace and a fair, brutality-devoid rule among the people as his younger sisters, Corrin and Elise, had wished for the kingdom; it was a sight that brought her joy, alongside watching her royal "sisters" & "brothers" trading in their weapons for books and quill pens, and watching her husband, the Hoshidan ninja Kaze, and her children, Shigure and Midori, relish in the peacetime as a faction of Corrin's retainers. Azura was a little sad knowing she died without letting Kaze know, without wishing her children goodbye, or saying she loved them one last time, but the desperation of the final battle presented no chance for final words, and she knew that even if they didn't know she was dead, they all truly loved her back.

On this particular day, Azura found herself in Castle Krakenberg, observing Elise, the royal who called her "big sister", getting ready for bed after an exhausting day of playtime. The young royal kicked her legs back and forth while sitting in front of her vanity, happily letting Camilla brush her hair while she brushed one of a small doll in turn.

"Thanks for helping me get ready for bed Camilla! It's soooo hard to brush my hair now that it's so long!" The older, purple-haired princess giggled at her younger sister, enjoying their time they spent together.

"Anything for my darling little sister; I'm just surprised you can manage to tie all this hair up into those pretty pigtails, and with the dyed strands in such a perfect helix too!" Elise was gladdened by the compliment, never shy to nice words directed towards her. "And how is the hair of that darling little doll you're working with?"

"Oh, it's just doing fine!" Elise answered with glee, "Big Sis has such pretty long hair, but it is kind of a pain to run a comb through sometimes."

"Big Sis?"

"Yeah, Big Sis! Here, look!" With that, Elise turned around and handed Camilla the doll she had, allowing Azura to take a better look at it from over Camilla's shoulder. The doll was a perfect knit replica of Azura, with a fine white fabric sewn to be her dress, beautiful blue strands of yarn for her hair, and a wide knit smile with beautiful onyx eyes. Camilla felt a small murmur in her chest, finding Elise's childish love for Azura to be quite adorable, and a small smile crept over her face.

"Ah, now I understand, you meant Azura." Camilla ran her fingers across the dress, respecting the craftsmanship of the doll. "Elise, you wouldn't happen to have made this yourself, would you?"

"You know it! Hold on a second, you're gonna love this!" Elise leapt off her chair and ran over to the corner of her room, next to her bed, and directed Camilla's attention to a small dollhouse. Elise pulled away the wall of the dollhouse, opening it like a door on a hinge, and began pointing to the dolls inside her home. "You see? I made all of us for this house! There's me, you, and Corrin in the tea party room, Xander's right there in the living room, Leo's in the kitchen, and Father's on that big sofa! The real Father, not that spooky monster thing from before." Camilla came closer and looked at the display she was presented, admiring her little sister's work and love of her family combined into one.

"My, my! This must have been a lot of work for you! Now where on Earth did you find the time during all our marches to make this?" Camilla handed off Elise the Azura doll she held, and the little princess set the doll inside a bedroom, tucking her in and closing the dollhouse's wall.

"Well, the dollhouse I had Effie buy for me from a toy store, and she and Arthur helped me knit these dolls together when Leo yelled at me for using up the royal funds on toys; he was a mean dummy, so we made him last." Elise looked inside the window of the dollhouse, smiling as she looked at Azura. "Big Sis was a last-minute addition. It took a couple spurts of time to do it, but it was so worth it, cause now we're a big happy family! Big Sis even gave me some of her hair to tie in with the yarn to make her more real!" Azura couldn't feel it in her ghostly cheekbones, but she knew she was smiling at Elise's love towards her. Elise sat on her bed, unruffling her pajamas as she got ready to lay down for bed. "Hey, Camilla? When is Big Sis going to come back to us?" Camilla felt a sense of worry, not expecting the question presented; she knew Azura was dead, Corrin having spoke to her, Xander, and Leo in confidence, and was sure the young princess would not be able to handle or understand the information, despite seeing her own share of corpses in her time. Camilla sat down on the bed next to Elise and wrapped an arm around her sister.

"Elise, that's a little...tough to answer. Azura has...gone away on a trip for a while, and she's not exactly going to be coming back anytime soon."

"So, it's like you and Selena?" Camilla bit her lip, remembering Selena's departure; she had told Camilla that she was from a different world and had to urgently go back home, and had taken Odin, Laslow, and Peri with her, the latter two having gotten married under their time as Xander's retainers. The thought was a little depressing, but Camilla understood it, and at least she had the knowledge Selena was alive and well, as well as a pair of friendship earrings shared between the two of them and Beruka.

"That's...different, sweetie. Sure, she's on a long trip, and we might not see each other again, but you see, they had to go back to their hometown, where as Azura is just..."

"'Just' what? Camilla, you're not making any sense." Elise started to tear up a bit and puffed her cheeks out. "Did she go back to Hoshido after the war? To see Sakura again? Does she not like me?"

"No Elise," Camilla answered, stroking her sister's face, "Azura loves you very much, I know that for certain."

"Then why is she gone? Give me one good reason why we can't be a family again!" Camilla took a deep breath and exhaled.

"Look Elise, I can't explain it; sometimes, grown-ups just do things for weird reasons, but I promise you, we're still a family, and the day will come where we're all a family once again. Do you understand, little sister?"

"Not really..." Elise answered, feeling dejected.

"I know it's hard, but I promise that you'll always have Corrin and I around to love you. We promise to love you twice as much until Azura comes back, to make up for her absence."

"...Promise?"

"Cross my heart and hope to...well, let's just say it's a sisterly promise." Camilla leaned into Elise and held her finger in front of her face, quitting her petting. "Now, how about the two of us take you shopping tomorrow in the slums? We'll buy you some toys, chocolate, and new clothes, but only if you get right to bed and brush your teeth tomorrow morning, promise?"

"Okay..."

"Good." Camilla leaned into Elise and kissed her forehead, before removing herself from the bed and walking to the door. "Goodnight little princess, I love you!" Camilla unlit the lamp in Elise's room and left, leaving Elise to her own thoughts in her moonlit room. Azura looked upon Elise, sorrowed that Elise couldn't see her back or that she could never interact with the young princess again, and her heart felt truly wrenched when she watched the young girl begin to cry. Elise looked up at the moon out her window, looking at the sky in the surprisingly clear Nohrian night, and silently asked why things had to be why they were. Just then, a shooting star shot across the sky, surprising Elise. She remembered Corrin had told her Hoshidan stories about shooting stars and how they could grant wishes, she felt now was her chance to get the answers she needed; Elise clasped her hands together and began to pray.

"Oh Mr. Star, please bring back Big Sis to me!" prayed Elise, "I don't care how, I just want to have a happy family again, we've already lost Father and almost lost Corrin, so we really need this one! Please help me out here, I just want her all to myself so we can play together again, with Camilla, and Corrin, and Xander, and even Leo! Thank you Mr. Star! I need to get to bed now, goodnight!" From that, Elise leapt into her bed and stuffed herself under the covers, sobbing herself to sleep softly. Azura watched this whole scene unfold with sorrow, before feeling sleepy herself, an odd sensation considering she didn't require rest anymore; she willed herself to close her eyes and let her mind go adrift.

----------

When Azura "awoke", she instantly felt different, actually feeling a ground under her, feeling the air around her. She ran her hands across her body, feeling the flesh of her arms and legs and the fine cloth of her dress and stocking, alien feelings to her after she became a spirit; Azura rubbed her face, trying to "wake" herself, and pondered the situation.

"I...I'm alive..." She grasped for her pendant, but could not find it; inwardly, she relished that the tool of her demise was free from her person. Azura began to look around, trying to make note of her surroundings. "Where...Where am I...?"
1212.title: A Child's Wish

choices: Azura decides to journey through the huge Castle Krakenberg herself
12121.content:
The first thing Azura noticed was that the room she was in was a pale pink color with white moldings bridging the walls to the floor and ceiling; though the room wasn't lit with a lamp, the color was so naturally bright that it almost illuminated the room, allowing her to see. The second thing she noticed was that she was laying down in a bed, white and green, fluffy as ever, and she was tucked under the covers with such precision that it felt like she had done it herself. Removing herself from the bed, Azura stood up, relishing the feeling of her bare feet touching solid floor once again, and begun to think to herself.

"I can't remember a single thing after my death..." The songstress looked around the room and tried to make sense of where she was; in all throughout Nohr and Hoshido, she had never seen a house colored or arranged like this, even for the nobility who could afford it. "This place is unfamiliar to me, where am I? I'll have to look around and investigate." Slowly, she walked towards the door to the room, careful that there were no traps, and gripped the doorknob tightly; the sensation of touching brass was another pleasurable feeling to her, where previously, all she could do was phase through matter, unable to interact with the world around her. Opening the door, all Azura could see was darkness, the halls unlit with seemingly no lamps she could illuminate the halls with; she began touching the walls, partially to feel out where she was going, partially to enjoy touching things again, and eventually made her way to a stairwell. Slowly, she began to step down the stairs, careful not to slip and fall, and eventually, she reached what she assumed was the ground floor. Going through the first doorway she found, Azura carefully snuck into the room and used the shadows to conceal herself as she looked around the room - what she saw caused her eyes to grow wide; in the darkness, the familiar hairstyle and shining crown of one of her greatest comrades, his figure sitting on a chair and staring out the small window.

"Xander!" Azura yelped with glee, forgetting she was supposed to be stealthy. The songstress giggled a bit and smiled wide as she came closer to the Nohrian royal. "Oh, forgive me for my outburst, it's just...I never thought I would see you again, it's been so..." Azura trailed off as she looked at Xander, sitting in the same position, showing no movement or sign of emotion; something was clearly wrong. "Xander?" Azura reached over and touched the royal's shoulder, and upon feeling him, quickly dashed in front of him to confirm her suspicions; the Xander she spoke to was nothing more than a felt doll, crafted with precision to look like the royal, face crafted in a permanent smile with shiny, beady onyx eyes. "Wha- What is...?" Azura trailed off as she heard a thunderous yawn come from outside the home, startling her as she never heard anything like it.

"Hmm? Morning already...?" The voice sounded familiar to Azura; carefully, she approached the window and knelt over, concealing herself save the top of her head, and was shocked to see the outside world. Outside the window there was another, gigantic bedroom, crafted from stone and lit only by a pale, cloudy light through a single window; out of the corner of her eye, Azura could see a gigantic figure rising from the equally giant bed, wiping her eyes and rolling out of the bed before walking over to a separate bathroom, slowly and groggily. Azura looked at the giant's seemingly short stature, blond hair, and strands of purple clashing with her bright pink pajamas; bells went off in her head as she knew exactly who the giant was.

"Elise?!" Azura sunk below the window and sat with her legs to her chest, arms gripping her dress tightly as she tried to calm herself from the sight. "How did Elise get so huge? This has to be a trick, she couldn't have gotten so..." Suddenly, memories from the night before began to flood Azura's mind, memories of Camilla & Elise, memories of the shooting star, memories of the dollhouse; as the memories came fast, Azura looked up at the life-sized doll of Xander, and the truth hit her like a arrow. "This is the dollhouse." she spoke. Another thought entered her mind. "I've become tiny."

Azura placed her hand to her forehead, she had no idea how to cope with the situation she was presented with. Slowly she got up and walked over to a sofa at the end of the room; a doll of King Garon sat on the sofa, smiling in a manner the King Garon she knew never would, unsettling Azura a tad. She pushed over the doll to the floor and begun to lay down on the sofa, trying to make sense of the situation that she found herself in.

"Alright," she thought, staring up at the dark ceiling, "Not only am I suddenly alive, but I've shrunk to the size of a doll along with it. What could've caused this to happen?" Azura thought about the shooting star again and remembered Elise's wish, it was clear to her that that was what bought her back to life. Further, she thought about the doll Elise made - the doll made in her image contained bits of Azura's hair and was placed in the same bed she found herself in, meaning that somehow, she managed to completely replace the doll, becoming a living person through its body; Azura reached her arm skyward and grasped her hand, feeling the sensation of flesh once again, just to confirm she wasn't made of felt. The songstress closed her eyes and giggled, finding humor in the situation she was in. "So I'm now a living doll, is that it? Midori always did tell me she wanted a doll of me when she was little, the gods above sure do have an interesting sense of humor."

She looked out the window from her sofa, looking into Elise's gigantic bedroom once more; she could hear the young princess humming a tune to herself from the bathroom as she brushed her teeth. At first, Azura thought of the peace in Nohr and the efforts to rebuild Hoshido Xander had instituted, thoughts that made her smile, but then, she began to have other thoughts, dreadful reminders of the world under the Bottomless Canyon, the world she knew as a home. She remembered the monstrous false Garon, the possessed corpse of Takumi, the invisible soldiers that attacked her son; all of these were signs that another war was going to come, one that could destroy both Nohr and Hoshido in the blink of an eye unless she did something. There were two thoughts she cursed; one was that her pendant was gone, which not only meant she would no longer die through her songs, but no longer have power in them either, the other was that she was 8 inches tall, and at her size, she would be unable to do anything meaningful to save both kingdoms, even the journey through the lake would take forever for her to swim through.

"There's no choice," Azura thought, "I'll have to find my way to Corrin, she's our only hope." Azura tapped her foot against the wooden frame of the toy sofa, thinking just how she could get to Corrin in this state. "I know the layout of Castle Krakenberg well, but I'm not able to phase through walls anymore, nor go completely unnoticed. Death could await me yet again if I make one false step, or rather, if someone else makes a false step..." Then, Azura heard Elise close the door to her bathroom, she tilted her head to look out the window and could see her groggily stumbling over to the vanity, mumbling to herself.

"Another boring day..." grumbled the young princess, pouting as she begun to tie up her hair. "I'm happy for Xander's peacetime, but I miss the thrill of our adventures together as a family, out on the field, fighting monsters and saving lives. Most of all, I just miss Azura..." Elise yawned as she pouted to herself, struggling to pay attention as she twisted her big roll of hair into a spiral; suddenly she got more heated as she looked into the mirror with awake determination. "You know what Elise? Today, you're going to ask Corrin to help you look for Azura! You march right into her room, give her your best hug-a-snug attack, and say 'I wanna go find Big Sis'! Yeah, that's what you'll do!" Elise finished tying up one spiral and pushed up on it, admiring its poofiness before moving on to the next batch of her hair.

Azura watched all this from the sofa and slowly stood up, thinking to herself as she did so. "If I let Elise know I'm here now, then she can take me to Corrin with little danger." Azura thought over the implications about this; if Elise took her to Corrin, then she would be involving Elise in her journey, marking her for death with the invisible soldiers. Furthermore, if Elise were to accidently speak of the other world outside of the world itself, she would disappear like her mother had years before; she did not wish that fate upon the young princess. "I couldn't bear to do this to Elise, no matter how strong a fighter she has become. And yet, she is my only way through this castle safely, and if she still doesn't know what happened to me, it'll break her heart..." Azura mulled over the choices presented to her carefully, weighing the outcomes, before reaching a decision.
12121.title: Lost in Thoughts, All Alone

choices: Azura asks Elise to continue looking for Corrin
Azura asks Elise to take her to Kaze, Shigure, and Midori
121211.content:
"Well, here goes nothing..." Azura slowly moved to the window of the dollhouse and watched as Elise finished the second drill of her hair, working herself off the chair of her vanity and moving to the dresser. Carefully, Azura opened the window and took in a breath of air, preparing her voice. "You are the ocean's gray waves, destined to seek life beyond the shore just out of reach..." Elise stopped gathering her clothes, recognizing the tune resounding throughout her room.

"That voice...!" Elise looked around in a hurried manner, trying to look for the source of the song.

"Yet the waters ever change, flowing like time, the path is yours to climb..." Elise came closer to the dollhouse, tracking down the music's source, and began looking out the window over the toy house, expecting the voice to be from across the pit of Castle Krakenberg. "Elise, down here." In response, the young princess looked downward, spying the tiny figure of Azura looking up at her. Slowly, Elise knelt down, eyes wide with shock, lip quivering, and spoke slowly.

"Big Sis Azura," she spoke in disbelief, "Is that you...?" Azura took a deep breath, confirming she was a living thing to the young princess, not a toy, and spoke.

"Yes Elise." Azura eloquently spoke, "I'm home." Elise looked on in shock as Azura began to climb out the window and stood on the desk, facing her far larger sister with a calm expression.

"You're so...You're so..."

"Tiny?" Azura asked, finishing Elise's sentence for her. "Yes, I suppose I am, aren't I? It's come as a shock to me as we-" Azura was cut off by Elise quickly snatching her up and bringing her to her cheek, slightly rubbing her body against it.

"CUTE!" The sharp contrast in Elise's moods put off Azura, and the songstress completely lost whatever calm composure she had, literally shaken up by her sudden shift in position. Wriggling between Elise's hands, Azura tried to compose herself once more and get comfy; Elise noticed this and opened her hands, palms up for Azura to sit on, and smiled down at her older sister. "I can't believe it! You've come back to us Azura! And you're so adorable to boot! Oh man! I should run off and go tell Kaze right now, he'll be so happy to see-"

"No!" Azura shouted, stopping Elise in her tracks. Azura inwardly cursed her reaction, her intent was to continue hiding in this state, she was certain that Kaze would be upset with her having disappeared & died without a word, and equally shocked to see her like this; quickly, Azura thought up a way to stretch the truth and tried to get Elise to run with it. "I mean, at this size, of course Kaze will be shocked to see me, we don't want to scare him, would we? Elise, we should just take things slow for now and-"

"Oh come on Azura! All husbands would be overjoyed to see their wives again! Even if you are super tiny!" Azura cursed her luck again. "Oh, but maybe I should take you to see Corrin first, she was so heartbroken after you left!" Azura begun to panic - Elise's overzealousness could easily cause an uproar in the castle of her return, especially if Corrin was around someone, which was very frequent in her frequent trips outside the castle to inspire the troops and act as a Nohrian mediator; if she was going to get some one-on-one time with Corrin, Azura had to nip this in the bud, quickly. "Oh, did I wake up too late again? Corrin might already be done with breakfast and on her daily walk through town..."

"Yes Elise, that could be true, so if you could just sit down a-"

"Man, I really need to get a clock for this room. Oh well, guess we can just see Kaze for now!"

"Elise, that's not a good idea, if you would just list-"

"Ah, but he could be busy running errands like he usually is. Maybe if we just go see Cami-"

"Elise. Listen to me." Azura's voice was low, but stern, commanding attention from the Elise as she sat upon the young princess' palms. Azura took a deep breath and begun to explain herself. "I was dead, Elise."

"W-What?"

"I was dead, I gave my life up to save you all in our last battle. Nobody else knew aside from the rest of your family. If you were to show me off here, it would cause a panic, and I can't afford-" Azura was again interrupted by Elise's actions; this time, she was clasped tight between Elise's hands again and being shook up and down in agitation by the young princess.

"You big dummy! How could you leave us like that, after all we've done for you?! Nobody asked you to die for us!" Azura felt like she was going to hurl any moment, but her shaking suddenly stopped, and she begun to hear sniffles from Elise; looking up, Azura could see the princess' face covered in tears. "H-How could you leave me like that? We were supposed to be a real family again...!" Elise took one of her hands away from her grip on Azura and begun wiping her face with it, sobbing while doing so. Seeing this, Azura managed to free herself from Elise's single hand, no longer focused on holding the little songstress, and she carefully walked up the span of Elise's arm, coming up to her shoulder. The tiny woman begun stroking Elise's cheek and spoke to her soothingly, causing her to open her tear-sealed eyes.

"Dry your tears Elise," she spoke softly, "There is no need to cry. It was specifically your wish that brought me back from death, our bonds as a family that let me live. Your doll has now become my body, it is the symbol of the bonds that we share together, and I swear to you, so long as I live, I'm not going anywhere anymore."

"P-Promise?" Elise said through chokes of tears.

"Promise." Azura spoke with a smile, "No more secrets between us. We can become a family once more." Elise smiled and dragged Azura closer into her face, sitting down on her bed and hugging Azura for a short while as the little songstress stroked her face and sung to her in a soothing manner.

----------

"So, wait," Elise asked as she tugged her boot up her leg, trying to reach around her large-rimmed dress, "It was that big dumb pendant that killed you in the first place?" Azura sat adjacent on top of the dresser, her legs hanging over the dresser's edge.

"That's correct." Azura responded, clutching her chest where the pendant used to be. "It was a gift from my mother, a remnant of a place we used to go to together."

"Like what, a vacation spot? Did you find it in a cursed stall run by a gypsy?" Azura closed her eyes and remembered the tale of Anankos, the world under the Bottomless Canyon which used to be her home, the curse that prevented her from speaking of it outside of the world.

"...I can't say, for now at least. It's a secret I must carry, but once we find Corrin, I'll be happy to explain it to both you and her." Elise puffed her cheeks and pumped her fist skyward, as she commonly did when heated.

"Well, I'm glad that stupid piece of junk is gone! No more family break-ups, that's what I say!" Azura shook her head for a moment.

"Elise, you don't seem to understand," Azura retorted, "I need that pendant for my songs to have power, especially now more than ever."

"Nu-uh, I said no more family break-ups, okay?!" Elise, now fully dressed, stood up from her chair and flexed her arm, grasping her bicep muscle, and gave Azura a strong, determined look. "This time, you're gonna let us save you from whatever it is you gotta fight! I've been getting stronger too you know - I can now do fifteen push-ups in a row!" Azura looked unimpressed at first, but soon her expression broke into a smile and she giggled at her larger sister.

"She's right," Azura thought, "Corrin's Yato holds considerable power now, and she's been hardened through the trials we've faced. Even then, our siblings have grown considerably as well, I'm sure they would be able to quell the madness that threatens our world." Azura stood up, ready to get on the move once more. "Alright Elise, I'll trust you on this. Please, could you carry me around?"

"Sure thing!" Elise scooped up Azura in her palm, but before the songstress could relax, she felt herself being tilted downward and fell off Elise's palm into the open collar of her dress, pressed close against her chest. Azura held onto the hem of the collar and looked up at her sister, face a little reddened.

"Elise! Don't you think this is a little...close?"

"Sorry Azura," Elise giggled, "But I don't actually have any pockets on this dress! Safest I can manage while also keeping you hidden, just make sure not to wiggle too much, and you should be fine." Elise begun walking over to her door in an upbeat manner. "So, where to first?"

"Please take me to see Corrin, Elise," Azura responded, "I have to see her as soon as possible."

"Are you sure you don't want to see Kaze first?" Elise asked, "I'm sure your kids must really miss you. You can't hide from them forever, and I'm sure they won't hate you for being dead all this time." Azura mulled the thought over in her head; Elise was right, she couldn't keep herself hidden from her family, and both Kaze and her children were strong warriors who helped them through their war on Garon, they would be extremely instrumental in their journey to the other world, as would all the other allies she had fought with, shared meals and stories with. "It's your call Azura, I'm not gonna push you or anything, just gonna walk you around."
121211.title: Sisterly Reunion

choices: Let her sleep: Talk to her tomorrow
I'm not waiting another minute: Wake her up now
12122.content:
Azura's eyes shot open at the sight before her. She recognized the ground she was on. The material. She looked up and her fears were confirmed. Castle Krakenburg!

In any other scenario, she would be glad to see the home of her family. In this case however, she saw it in a totally new perspective. The castle still outsized her but not to the same extent that it had before. The ground she had been laying on was the entrance bridge to the castle, of which she took up the entire length!

She shook in fear looking around in confusion. Fortunately, it didn't appear anyone was around. She placed her hand over her face to control her breathing.

"Calm down. Calm down," she told herself. "Think, think." How do I fix this?"

She couldn't be seen like this. She had to get away. She looked up the pit. Could she climb it? Not like she had much choice.

And so she climbed as silently as possible. It was hard work even at her size. She had been dead for so long that she was unused to her muscles again.

Once she finally reached the top, she looked around for any people. Fortunately, it was past midnight and no one was there to witness the Titaness.

She climbed over and stopped to catch her breath. Once she found it, she moved as silently as possible through the streets towards the gates. This would normally be very hard for someone of her size, yet due to her years of dancing, she was soft on her toes. Of course the added height did create a slight tremor even at her slowest pace.

Once out of the city, she finally took off running at full speed as far from the city as she could. at her height she could move unimaginably fast. Of course since she was no longer tiptoeing, she shook the ground every time her foot impacted.

She finally stopped at a lake, similar to the one where Corrin had followed her into the other realm. She laid down to think.

"What do I do? I can't show myself like this to my friends?" She then rethought that. "Can't I? After all, who else would be willing to help? Then again, I don't fully see how they could." She then remembered Elise's wish to bring her back. Though she doubted this was what the young princess had intended, whatever she had done appeared to have worked.

"Perhaps I should go back. No that would cause too great a ruckus. Maybe I should find someone to find my family and bring them to me? Oh but who? Oh Kaze. If only you could see me now!"

She decided to sleep it over, unaware that she in fact had not gone unnoticed. Someone had seen her leave the city and had followed her discreetly, and was now staring at a sleeping friend, back from the dead, magnified beyond proportion.

"How I am going to explain this to Kaze," Corrin muttered to herself." What do I do? Should I wake her up now? I know it's been a while but still." Corrin took note of the size difference between them. Waking the giantess dancer from her sleep might be risky. What if she rolled over on top of her?

"Maybe I should just let her sleep until morning, when she's thinking more clearly."

What to do?
12122.title: Well, shoot.

121222.content:
Corrin approached the sleeping giant as softly as possible. She was quite good at moving quietly due to years of experience and possibly her absence of shoes.

She stopped at that moment and came to a realization.

"Why don't I wear shoes? And while we're there, why doesn't Azura?"

Storing that puzzle for later, she continued her approach until she found herself within reaching distance of Azura's back.

She just had to stop now and stare. She had thought nothing could awe her after the war, but seeing her friend like this was... well, it was almost as weird as her absence of shoes!

Without thinking, Corrin reached out and touched Azura's exposed back. She pulled back when she noticed the giant body react, giving something like a shudder.

"Uh, Azura?"

Suddenly, the dancer began turning on her side. Corrin ran and leaped out of the way but her cape got caught underneath.

"Get off! Damn it! Why do I even wear this? It doesn't do anything for me. It makes no sense. Like not wearing shoes! Hey!"

Just as Corrin had that thought, she felt Azura's massive hands close around her waist and pull her close.

"Azura! Hey Azura! Let go!"

"Not yet Kaze. Just another few hours," she mumbled.

"Azura! It's me Corrin. Wake your butt up!"

"What? Really?" She giggled in her sleep. "Sure honey. If you insist."

"Come on! Lost in thoughts all- mph!" Corrin found herself pressed up against Azura's massive lips, apparently mistaken for Azura's husband.

"Hmm? What?" Corrin was pulled away from the lips and found herself staring into Azura's shocked eyes.

"Corrin? How?"

"Azura." Corrin looked up at her massive friend's face.

"Remind me to get shoes!"
121222.title: Why doesn't Corrin wear shoes?

1212221.content:
Azura blinked. "Sorry what?"

"I'm just wondering why neither of us wear shoes, you know? ? I mean thinking back on it, how did I survive walking to the ice village like this?"

Azura frowned. "All this time we've been apart and all you can talk about is your feet?"

Corrin looked up and grinned. "Sorry. I just had it on my mind. I mean, I don't really know what else to say. It's just..." She paused and took a deep breath. "It's good to see you Azura."

The giantess smiled. "Likewise. Old friend." She leaned her hand closer and pressed her against her lips again.

Corrin was silent for a moment a bit overwhelmed by that experience.

"So," she said after a long pause. "Care to explain this?"

Explain it she did, after which Corrin again paused taking it all in.

"So you really were dead."

"Yes. I could see you the whole time, but I couldn't interact. So more or less."

"And no pendant? You can't sing yourself to death?"

"No. No more." She smiled. "Once again, I'm a burden with an extra large mouth to feed."

"Nonsense," Corrin assured her. Putting her hand on her hand, and staring at her fiercely. "Everyone will be overjoyed to see you."

"Right," Azura sounded uncertain. "Are you sure they'll be ok?"

"Well they might be shocked, but you're their family. They'll adapt."

"We could do that or..." Azura thought for a minute. "There is somewhere we could go. Somewhere that might have a solution."

Corrin nodded. She knew where Azura meant.

"Well we aren't gonna decide tonight. I say we sleep and decide in the morning."

Azura smiled. "In that case, you can lay here." She leaned onto her back placed Corrin on her chest. "After all that time apart, no way I'm going to let you go away."

Corrin grinned and laid her head down on Azura's chest, her giant hand coering her and keeping her warm, her chest lulling her to sleep.

Azura laid awake for a bit longer, contemplating the future. What would she do? Did she dare return home to see her family, or go with Corrin in search of a solution?
1212221.title: Awkward!

12122212.content:
Corrin opened her eyes to the foggy dawn. She found herself being held against Azura's chest by her mighty arms. Looking up, she saw her larger than life friend's face covered entirely by her blue hair in disarray.

Corrin grinned and slowly untangled herself from the giant's arms. Or rather she tried to, unsuccessfully. No matter how hard she tried, she couldn't break free.

"Uh Azura. A little help here?"

The giantess giggled. "Not yet Kaze. Five more minutes."

"Azura! Wake your ass up!"

"Naughty naughty. Maybe this will change your mind." She wrapped her fingers around Corrin and brought her close to her face.

"Not again! Azu- mmph!"

She suddenly felt her stop and looked up into Azura's eyes.

"Um...sorry." Azura placed Corrin on the ground embarrassed.

Both were silent for a bit, trying to look anywhere but at each other.

"So," Corrin started. "Did you make up your mind?"

"Yes." Azura paused. "As much as I want to see my family again, I'm not sure it's such a wise idea to go there like this. Not just the inconvenience of it, but how would the city react?"

Corrin nodded, saddened the reunion would have to wait , but understanding Azura's reasons.

"So it's off to you know where?"

Azura nodded and stood up. Corrin's eyes widened at the sudden size difference. Azura noticed her shock and inquired about it.

"It's just, up until now I haven't seen you at full height. It's just a bit overwhelming you know?"

Azura gave a disturbing smile at that and actually walked closer to the miniature princess, putting her feet on either side. Corrin had to til her head back to look at her.

You know you're right This is Different. From this height you look like a little doll."

She put her hands on her knees and leaned over her tiny companion. "Would you like that Corrin? Would you like to be my doll?"

Corrin held up her hands and walked back a few paces from the grinning colossus. She trusted Azura, but those jokes which might have been funny once before took on a whole new meaning at that size.

"Hey come on Azura. You're so eager to shrink back to normal, you shouldn't get into the dominatrix role."

Azura frowned. "Dominatrix? What in Nohr does that mean? I'm just messing with you my little dragon. It's just in case I can't find a cure." She winked. "I'll need someone to snuggle with."

Corrin's face flushed. "Ok first rule. Don't call me little dragon."

"But why not? It fits you so well. Seiing how small you are."

"I'm not small! I'm just... little boned!"

Azura grinned again. "And little bodied."

Corrin sighed. It seemed the power had gone to Azura's head. The new her was definitely a lot more mischievous than the old one.

"Now then. I have to ask. How did you follow me before. I doubt a normal sized human could keep up with me and I don't see a horse?"

"I had to turn into a dragon to keep up with you."

"A little dragon?"

"Enough!"

She giggled further.

"Well I suppose you can ride on my shoulder. We have a long way to go to the ravine. But it should take less time at my height."

Corrin nodded and took another step back as Azura kneeled down with her palm flat. Corrin took a deep breath and got on. She almost lost her balance as Azura lifted the palm to her shoulder.

"All set?"

Corrin tied a strand of the long blue hair around her arm to keep herself steady and looked to the massive face.

"Ready. Oh. And one more thing. When this is all over, you stay, all right? I don't want to have you disappearing all over again. Understood?"

"Understood, little dragon."

And Azura began walking east, laughing at Corrin's yells of anger and the two set off, together again,

122.content:
“Come to my room, Takumi.”

Corrin's feminine voice rang through his ears. Takumi froze, not wanting to move but his body taking involuntary steps towards her room.

“W-what did you call me for?” Takumi said, trying to hide his fear behind his usual gruff exterior. He gulped. Looking up he could see her, holding that dreadful pen like object.

Corrin smiled wordlessly. Takumi clenched his teeth in anticipation. He wanted to run, but couldn't move his body at all. At least he could move his head, for all the good it did him.

The giant pen like object descended down on him. He tried to roll out of the way, but he could only turn his head, causing the object to poke him on his cheek.

The touch of plastic felt strange against his skin.

“Ugh being jostled by you is the worst feeling.”

Corrin did not stop her assault, or even bother to respond to Takumi's complaint. Instead she brought the stylus down again, prodding his cheeks once more.

In spite of the situation Takumi smiled.

“Well, I guess it isn't so bad to spend time together as siblings from time to time.”

Corrin wasn't sure what would prompt Takumi to say that at a time like this or why her siblings kept reminding her she was related when she did this but saw no reason to stop poking her brother's cheeks.

As she kept prodding, Takumi tried to look away, but his cheeks lit up red, not merely in embarrassment but something else. Corrin knew deep down there was nothing her siblings enjoying more than being poked in the face with a stylus. She had wondered why they had been so slow to accept it before.

Takumi suddenly smiled.

“I love you... more than anyone else!”

Score! Takumi had always been so cold to her, having been raised by an enemy nation, but Corrin knew that if she tapped Takumi's face enough times, he would come around.

Encouraged, Corrin stepped up her jabbing. The smile on Takumi's face only deepened.

“Because you exist, I am who I am.”

Corrin suddenly stopped. She wasn't sure she wanted to do this any longer.

122211.content:
"Some thing new?" Kamui raised an eyebrow.

"Yes something rather remarkable actually," Azura had a smirk on her face. "Can we go to our room please?"

Kamui followed her back to where she had just left. She looked around taking in a deep breath before turning around to look at her wife.

"So what is it you wanted to show me?"

"I know, my love, I know better than anyone. But it's necessary to keep you and the rest of my friends alive.

"But the war's over. Why do you need it now?"

"For anything. You never know. But I assure you. I am not doing it frequently. But once I learned of this newest trick, I had to show you.

Kamui sighed. "Well, you put yourself at all this risk. I might as well give you this much. Now why are we here?"

Azura flashed a malicious grin. "Oh this is for your safety, where no one can accidentally walk through."

Kamui blanched. "Safety!? What exactly do you plan to do?"

Azura kept smiling. "You'll see soon enough. Now if you can just stand here."

She led her love to the center of the room and placed a circle of sticks around her. Kamui was beyond confused at this point.

Azura stood back and held her fingers together like a window looking through it at Kamui. "There. I should be able to tell where you are.

"Tell where I am?"

"Well depending on the dosage here. I've tested this on many different animals and they all had a different scale afterwards. Depending on your scale after this, I need to be able to know where you are.

"Kamui was starting to get alarmed. "What are you talking about? Do the kids know about this?"

"The kids are away sweetie. Don't worry. They don't know anything. No one else does."

"No one?" Kamui could not hide the worry in her voice.

Azura walked forward and cupped her lover's face in her hands.

"Kamui, Kamui, my dear. Don't you trust me?"

Kamui looked her in the eyes. "Of course. I just wish I knew what I was getting into."

"You'll see soon enough. Just stay in the circle and you'll be fine." Azura walked back, cleared her throat and began to sing.

Instantly Kamui's head began to throb. She felt dizzy and started to sway. However, she remained in the center true to Azura's word, as her wife danced and sang words that she couldn't understand.

Perhaps it was just her, but she could make out her wife's footsteps more and more. The noise created from her dancing started getting louder and louder like she was stomping.

Really though, nothing was changing on Azura's end. The song mistress continued dancing and singing. All the time with her eyes on Kamui. Her excitement growing as the change occurred.

Kamui suddenly noticed something off about the dancer. Was it just her or was she growing ever so slightly upward? She couldn't tell because her head was ringing from the singing and the increasingly intense noise from her wife's feet.

Azura's eyes widened in excitement even as she continued dancing and singing. She had tried this before on animals before, and it was always a shocker. But from what she saw, it was having a far greater effect than on any of the others.

There was no doubt about it now. Azura was growing, or rather Kamui was getting smaller. She looked up in shock at her ever increasing titaness of a wife. Her dancing now earthquakes and her singing now a deafening bellow.

Eventually, Azura couldn't go on. She collapsed down on her bed, panting from all the exertion. She knew she had probably done some serious damage to her body with that song. But the results were worth it.

Curious to see what those results were, she sat up in bed, and looked down at the circle of sticks, her legs dangling over the floor.

She gasped in shock, she couldn't see her! She must have gone overboard this time.

She pulled a lens from the bedside table and slowly got down on her hands and knees on the ground. She slowly inched her way over to the circle and peered down.

Azura was worried. She had meant for a mere 30 mm at least! This was way beyond that.

"Well my little lover," Azura muttered looking through the lens at Kamui, "how small are you?"

12221122.content:
(From now on, feel free to refer to Kamui as she is in the English version of Fates, Corrin. I will be doing so, but that does not mean you cannot still use her Japanese name!)

The tremors start to return, prompting the tiny Corrin to jump to her feet in preparation for what could come. It only seemed to be a single pair of feet once again. "Perhaps she just left to replenish herself and get her energy back! Yeah...", Corrin said, not entirely convinced of her own reasoning. To her, the tremors seemed... different. They sounded a little heavier and faster, and seemed more distinct than the pounding of Azura's bare feet were.

The colossal door is suddenly swung wide open, directly colliding with the dresser next to it, and creating a whirlwind to sweep across the room, forcing the tiny girl to brace herself. The footfall-based tremors got worse and worse, starting to knock Corrin about, until the last footfall lands directly behind her, missing by barely a couple of inches, and sending the little dragon flying upwards at an astonishing rate! Using the height to her advantage, Corrin tried to discern who the perpetrator was, but could only see a black, rising expanse, that seemingly went up for miles! It's only when the object backed up into a more revealing position, that the top of the expanse becomes even remotely visible.

Toes. All five could now be made out in clear terrifying detail, each ridge of the toes hundreds of metres apart, the underside of the nails in full view, each with very little signs of dirt accumulating beneath them, meaning this person has cleaned themselves at least somewhat recently. Looking further up, Corrin could just about make out the general shape and length of the legs, along with a vague look at the clothing this person wore. The long, dark blue cloth piece hanging from the seemingly female figure's waist rings a bell in Corrin's head. This huge, monstrous foot belonged to Hana, one of Sakura's (Corrin's younger sister by blood) retainers and a fledgling samurai.

Corrin’s fall was cut short as Hana’s foot had edged forward just enough for her footwear to end up directly beneath you. Upon landing on top of the samurai’s black sandals, the little dragon met with a sight that really brought everything into prospective. She had seen Hana’s toes before, both from before and after Corrin’s shrinkage. But this was different. The biggest toe appeared to be at least hundreds of times larger than she was, and the moments where Hana subconsciously flexes them were terrifying beyond belief as they seemingly flew up for miles, only to crash back down, causing shockwaves strong enough to make the tiny girl wince in fear. There were plenty of other horrors to speak of, though Corrin made sure to at least try to block out the appearance of underneath the samurai’s sweating feet, complete with dead skin and crushed items, both alive and dead. The little dragon began to feel like she was in a different realm altogether.

However, way above Hana had at least come into the room for a reason. “Corrin? I thought she was in here for sure… We were going to spar soon, too!” Hana says to herself, unaware that the one she was looking for was right beneath her nose; or feet, in this case. Would Hana decide to stay and wait to see if Corrin comes back, or will she leave to continue searching, tiny half-dragon in tow?
12221122.title: An Unwelcome Visitor

122211222.content:
"Hmm," Hana hums to herself thoughtfully, "where could she be?" As she pondered the location of her friend, she crossed her arms and tapped her foot lightly. A light tap for Hana, however, was absolutely cataclysmic for the microscopic dragon on her footwear.

To Corrin, it was as if the entire planet was violently shaking. The black earth beneath her rose up at a nearly incomprehensible speed, sending her tumbling toward the flesh mountains that were the young samurai's toes. As quickly as the sandal had been raised, it descended back to the floor. Before Corrin could even begin to get her bearings, the ground beneath her disappeared and she found herself being forced back down. The immense ceiling formed by Hana's middle toe slammed her back into the sole of the sandal. The dragon princess was so small that she was in no danger of being crushed by the digit that was bullying her, but "harrowing" was nonetheless too a mild a word to describe the experience. And then the foot rose back up again. Hana's foot tapped several times, slamming the poor little dragon princess between entire worlds of footwear and toe like a minuscule rag doll.

"Oh!" Hana finally stopped tapping her foot, "I bet she's already at the sparing grounds waiting for me!"

Corrin rolled onto her back, panting and exhausted. Her vision was blurred, and the dim light under the canopy of the samurai's toes wasn't clearing it any faster.
She had no idea how she'd managed to get through that unharmed. Whether it was her dragon blood, an effect of Azura's song, just the sheer amount of small that she was, or some combination thereof, nothing appeared to be broken and she wasn't in any pain.

Unfortunately, the giantess above her didn't stay still for more than a moment.

"Oh, I hope she hasn't been waiting for me long," Hana fretted as she dashed out of the room towards the sparring grounds.

Instead of being thrown skyward, this time the force of the rising foot tossed Corrin backwards towards the sweaty hell she had glimpsed beneath Hana's sole. She barely had a moment to feel the terror flowing through her before the monster that was Hana's foot swallowed her completely. It was as if the universe itself had collapsed on her, entombing her beneath an infinite expanse of sweaty foot flesh. The force of the mighty retainer's first step, the collision of a sandal that stretched further than Corrin's eyes could see and the ball of a foot that could rival the scale of Naga herself, completely obliterated the senses of her victim. The simple tapping of the colossal foot had been a scarring experience, but being trampled by a sprinting woman millions of times her size was on a whole other level. Corrin passed out almost instantly.

Hana reached the sparring grounds only to find it empty. It was always deserted around this time, which is why they had chosen it today. The samurai stamped her foot in disappointment, once again pulverizing her unconscious passenger. "Oh well," she sighed, "I'm already here. I guess I'll just get started on a practice dummy and hope Corrin joins me later." She reached for a practice sword on a rack nearby, totally oblivious to the fact that Corrin would be deeply involved in her "solo" sparring.
122211222.title: She leaves to search for Corrin

choices: Lady Sakura happens by, and joins Hana on the bench
Corrin succumbs and is drowned or crushed between Hana's toes
1222112222.content:
"HAH!" With a fierce shout, Hana struck one last powerful blow on the practice dummy before her. The dummy rattled noisily on its support even as Hana returned her sword to its place on the rack.

"Whew!" she sighed, wiping gobs of sweat from her brow as she walked over to a bench at the far end of the room. She was disappointed that Corrin had never joined her, but she couldn't help the sense of pride that came with a good training session. Now she deserved a rest. She plopped down on the bench and kicked back, relieving some of the pressure on the prisoner beneath her sole.

Corrin had only just come to, the horror that her situation hadn't been a nightmare was setting in, and things had somehow gotten worse. The princess hadn't had time to notice the scent of her unwitting captors feet before, but now, after her intense workout, the smell of Hana's massive feet overwhelmed her senses. She was practically floating in a sea of warm foot sweat that had already soaked her from the hair on her head to the sole's of her own bare feet.

Corrin's only thoughts in this moment were to somehow make her way to freedom. She had no way of knowing that the nearest exit from under her friend's gargantuan soles was miles away, but her survival instinct compelled her. She felt too weak to stand, and she knew the shock waves created by Hana's movements would inevitably knock her to the ground anyway, so she crawled desperately through the darkness in the direction she hoped would be the quickest route to freedom. Her best chance to escape would be while Hana wasn't moving. The dragon princess scrambled pathetically through the knee-high sea of perspiration. Even on all fours, the tremors of Hana's toes colliding idly with her sandal knocked Corrin face first into the sweat, forcing her to hold her breath in the fragrant liquid between labored breaths.

The humiliation of the experience paled in comparison to her growing fear. If she lived through this, she would probably smell like Hana's feet forever, but she would gladly accept that eventuality if it could mean being free of the sweltering pitch black swamp that threatened to become her permanent home, or worse: her grave. Minutes passed with no sign of light, and she began to panic.

"Hana!" she called out, wasting air that she knew was precious in hope of any kind of aid. She crawled a few more feet, but of course the response she was hoping for never came. "HANA!" she screamed. "PLEASE!"

Another few yards. "HELP ME!" Nothing. The darkness' complete indifference to her struggle was maddening, and Corrin's terror was soon accompanied by frustration and anger.

"DOWN HERE!" She continued to splash through the unending mire of sweat.

"I'M UNDER YOUR FOOT, HANA!" Splash splash splash.

"PLEASE!" Splash splash.

"YOU HAVE TO FIND ME!" splash. "SAVE ME!"

In her frenzy, Corrin quickened her pace, but tripped, her face dipping violently into liquid beneath her for a moment. She coughed and spluttered, her pace slowing down again. Tears begin to well in her eyes, though they were impossible to distinguish from the sweat that dominated her.

"Please," she sobbed, "I don't want to die down here..."

Splash. Splash. Splash.

"I don't belong down here..."

Splash. Splash.

"I'M NOT A BUG!" she finally screamed. And then she froze.

Of course she wasn't a bug. She wasn't even a bug. She was so much smaller than that. She'd seen how thoroughly dwarfed she was by the digits of Hana's foot. Corrin barely qualified as dust by comparison. She practically deserved to be forgotten under Hana's sole and washed away with a drop of sweat, never to be seen or heard from again.

Corrin sat back on her knees, defeated. Tears melded seamlessly with the layer of foreign sweat already covering her face. She sobbed quietly for a moment. Then shook her head. She couldn't be thinking like this. She wasn't dead yet. Even if things were hopeless, they could always be worse. She could have been stuck inside Felicia's thigh-high stocking, or trapped deep inside Setsuna's knee-high boot. The sweat-coated princess shuddered at the thought. Who even knew if the flighty archer ever remembered to take those things off? She was on a sandal. By definition there had to be a way off. So she had to try. She was dehydrated, no doubt. That certainly couldn't be helping her mental state. She hadn't been paying attention to how thirsty she actually was. And then she realized she was surrounded by water. She had to survive. So she did the unthinkable.

She bent down, her nose a few inches above the lake that surrounded her. She inhaled deeply, but there was no discernible difference between the scent of the bodily fluid and the ubiquitous aroma of feet that seemed to permeate her entire universe. She lowered her lips to the water and began to drink. She expected to feel complete revulsion as the liquid passed over her tongue, but the mouthful of sweat simply tasted like warm water with a vague hint of salt. It was almost delicious given how thoroughly parched she was. She gulped it down greedily.

She sat back on her feet. Taking in the full weight of how humiliating what she had done really was. She had just willingly drunk several mouthfuls of her own friend's foot sweat, and even somewhat enjoyed the flavor. If she lived through this, she could never speak a word of it to Hana, no matter how inexplicable the fact that Corrin would probably be foot-scented for the rest of her days became. She would confide in Azura, of course, although given her wife's sense of humor, she would probably never live this down. Her wife would probably teasingly ask for foot rubs or, given her penchant for lakes, jokingly offer to let Corrin go for a swim under her feet. Maybe she'd have to, Corrin thought morosely. She still had no idea if Azura could reverse the song's effect on her. But that would still be preferable to this. Even if she had to live out the rest of her days swimming between her wife's toes, she'd give anything to be noticed. To be known. Azura would go to the ends of the earth to make her feet the perfect home for Corrin, and she'd certainly never forget she was there.

As twisted as her thinking had become, it was comforting. And comfort always brought Camilla to mind. Corrin's elder sister was occasionally extreme in her methods, and her doting could become tedious, but there was nobody in the world she felt like she could trust as much as Camilla. No matter what happened, Camilla was always there for her. Corrin could always turn to the Nohrian princess for guidance, support, love, or just unconditionally having her back. Even in the worst of times, Camilla would let her rest her head on her lap and stroke her hair until it seemed like all of her problems went away. She wondered what that would be like at her current size. Laying on her truly big sister's nearly infinite thigh, staring up at her beautiful face as if it were the sky. The thought brought her peace. Even at this size, Camilla could be no danger to her at all. She blushed as an image entered her mind, of Camilla gently plucking Corrin's dust mite-like body from her lap, and lowering her into her cleavage. By all accounts her sister's breasts should be terrifying at her size, if not already so at normal size. But even though they would be practically flesh planets by comparison, Corrin just couldn't picture them bringing any harm unto her. She pictured the armored boots that her sister wore. Even then, there was no contest between that and any of the other boots she could be trapped in. Camilla's hygiene was immaculate. It probably smelled great inside her sister's boot, she probably didn't sweat at all, and her feet must be so soft that being stepped on would feel like a hug from a pretty cloud. As implausible as those assumptions may have been, they brought Corrin further comfort. No matter what happened, she'd get out of this, and her wife and big sister would take care of her, even if she never returned to normal size.

These thoughts might have been indecent, even unhealthy, given the crush she'd always suppressed on her stunningly attractive big sister. But being lost or squashed under the sweaty feet of an unwitting giantess was far more unhealthy, so she quite literally bigger concerns at the moment than potentially incestuous thoughts. She'd already married her cousin anyway. Why stop now?

But just as Corrin had finished steeling herself, in her own unorthodox way, and resolved to press onward, Hana stirred.

The sweaty samurai opened her brown eyes and slowly sat up, stretching both arms above her head with a slight moan. The motion caused her sandal to tilt forward, and far below her the microscopic dragon princess was suddenly caught in a raging river of sweat flowing towards the toe of the footwear. Corrin had no idea what was happening as she was submerged beneath a torrent of foot juice, tumbling head over heals in the rapid current. Finally the current slowed enough for her to force her head above the water and, after gulping down more of Hana's sweat, filled her lungs with air. As the tide of flowing sweat lost its momentum, Corrin spilled out onto the soggy black surface of the kingdom that was Hana's sandal. She was momentarily blinded by light filtering down from above, and realized she was back under the samurai's toes.

Corrin was relieved, but Hana wasn't settled yet. With a flick of her ankle, the swordswoman kicked her feet up onto her heels. Corrin was sent skyward, but was blinded by the transition from only partial light, leaving her with no idea what her trajectory was. She landed with a soft thud, face pressed into a soft sweaty surface that was somehow even more fragrant than the cavern she had just escaped.

Hana looked down at her toes in admiration; working up a sweat always filled her with pride. She began to wiggle them, unbeknownst to the plight of her shrunken friend trapped between them.
