13131.content:
It's been but a mere 4 months since Grima was stopped, the Dark Dragon who threatened to destroy the world had been sealed for another 1,000 years by Lucina's father, Chrom, and his best friend, Robin. Robin had fully intended to destroy the dragon himself, being of the same blood, at the cost of his own life, but Chrom forbade it, believing in the strong bonds friendship could overcome rather than saving everyone at the cost of one's life. Lucina had intended to strike Robin down to prevent the future premonition of her father's death, but in hindsight, with Robin's unmatched tactical ability winning a bright future for the next 1,000 years, it was the right decision to believe in her father's friendship.

Since that day 4 months ago, Lucina had married her close friend, Gerome, the wyvern-riding son of Cherche and Gregor, crafter of her signature mask, and childhood crush. The two could not return to their time, the same fate regarding their companions from the future, so Lucina had decided to settle down with Gregor in the Wyvern Valley of Valm to enjoy a quiet life together. Lucina's family, especially mother, Sumia, and sister, Cynthia, had wished the two would have chosen a home closer to Ylisse, but taking care of the wyverns was a joy to both Lucina and Gregor, so the Ylissean Royal Family let the two be; Cynthia had especially taken frequent vacations from her job in the Pegasus Knights to visit her beloved sister.

On this particular day, Lucina had been out gathering wood with Minerva, Gerome's beloved wyvern, to prepare for dinner, Gerome out hunting for deer, bears, and other meat to prepare. It probably would've been more effective for Gerome to use Minerva in hunting, but he considered himself a proud husband, and wanted to become a man Lucina could rely on without a giant dragon crutch; in truth, he also thought Minerva and Lucina bonding was the cutest thing he had seen, and wished to progress the relationship. Lucina flew through the skies, wind blowing through her long blue hair, Falchion sheathed at her side, satchel of logs at her backside, as Minerva flapped her giant black wings through the night sky. Lucina moved a hand from Minerva's reins to brush her hair back, her face was in an ear-to-ear smile.

"The breeze feels so good, doesn't it girl? Gerome must feel blessed to have a partner like you to fly over this beautiful landscape with." Minerva let out a loud roar in approval, a sign of the two bonding well. Lucina had felt so jealous of Cynthia to have learned how to ride a pegasus from mother, to feel the wind blow through her hair, to see the amazing geography of the world from the sky; she felt relieved that the nightmare of Grima had ended and she was able to enjoy herself in such a manner she had never been before in the ruined future. On this particular night, a meteor shower had erupted over Wyvern Valley, beautiful rocks from the vast space had shot across the sky in beautiful trailing whites, a sight that many would call a miracle of nature; Lucina let out a gasp and let her smile grow wide as she saw how close she was to the shower of glowing rocks.

In fact, too close.

A meteor was about to clobber the airborne duo.

Lucina quickly tugged Minerva's reins and the dragon dodged out of the way in response, the meteor almost striking Minerva's wing and shooting the two out of the sky. They watched as the large rock plummeted towards the ground and impacted itself in the Earth, taking an acre of trees with it. Where the two currently were was far from where Gerome and Lucina had built their dream home, etched into the side of a mountain, built from wood and stone with a stable for Minerva to stay, but its only flaw was how high up and far it was from the vast woodland. Lucina figured it was best to go home as usual and help prepare a fire for dinner, but a rebellious streak took over her judgment for a minute, curiosity had struck her for such a rare event.

"It's not every day we see something like this. What do you say girl? Would you like to investigate?" Minerva lowered her neck in agreement, almost as if a nod, and descended towards the impact site.

When the two reached the massive crater where the meteor lay, the wooded area had burned out from the impact, and the area glowed an eerie green that emanated from the mirror. Lucina had dismounted herself from Minerva and approached the meteor, sliding down the earthen crater to get a closer look. The rock was huge, almost the size of her body, so Lucina could only approach and touch the rock, breaking off a souvenir would prove to be tough. Lucina had placed both of her hands onto the face of the rock and stared at the glowing monolith, almost entranced by its glow.

"It's so pretty..." Lucina cooed, enamored by the natural beauty, "I've never seen anything so beautiful..." Suddenly, the rock shook, causing Lucina to remove her hands from the face of the stone. She quickly removed Falchion from its sheath and prepared to leap back, when suddenly the rock exploded into a bright green light that filled the crater like a sphere, knocking Lucina back and blowing Falchion out of her hands. Minerva, concerned, roared and lunged closer as the light dispersed, expecting to burn a creature that may have knocked her master's wife back, but when she entered the crater, she found the rock had completely shattered, leaving nothing behind and no visible signs of anything that exited. After confirming nothing was out of the ordinary, Minerva moved towards Lucina and licked the young woman's face in an effort to wake her, Lucina quickly coming back to reality with the wet, sulfur-smelling saliva.

"Thank you, Minerva..." Lucina had removed herself from the small crater of dirt she left by her impact and dusted herself off, she looked for Falchion and sheathed the blade once again after removing it from the ground. She looked at the explosion epicenter where the rock once stood and moved her hand to her head, shaking off a headache; she didn't expect the meteor to do that at all, and it'd be a tough experience to shake off. Lucina looked down at her body for any signs of bodily harm, but couldn't find anything. "I don't have any wounds, I don't feel in pain, but...It's strange..."

Gerome wanted to agree with Lucina's logic, but it would prove hard to accomplish this at her current size.

"You are right," Gerome retorted, "But we would have to charter a boat to cross the ocean in order to get there. I mean no offense, but it wouldn't exactly be easy to sneak a giant woman onto a ship without causing a disturbance. You might even sink it." Lucina bit her lip at Gerome's reasoning, he was right, they'd have to figure something out if they wanted to go to Ylisse; she also managed to hold back from slapping Gerome for that last bit, not wanting to break his spine on impact. Lucina closed her eyes and thought for a moment, before coming to a second conclusion.

"Lady Tiki lives in Valm, right? Perhaps she's seen something like this in how long she's lived, she's even close to Naga when it comes to a natural divine ability." Lucina thought that even if she hadn't seen this sort of scenario before, the power of the Divine Dragon could fix it, or at the very least, manage it, in case she started growing out of control again.

"That sounds like a good idea." Gerome figured that was far more manageable of a solution, but couldn't help but think Robin could do something better, having the blood of a godlike dragon himself and a tactical mind that could help hide report of a giant woman being spotted across the continents. "It's your call Lucina, I'll do anything to help you with either option." Minerva let out a cry of approval herself, the three of them were in this together now. Lucina closed her eyes to weigh her options; tactical genius and family support, or the Divine Dragon's power and possible historical background...
13131111.title: Amateur Tactician

131311112.author_name: This site is dead.I wana leave
choices: Tiki is away or in too deep a sleep
131311112.content:
It didn't take Lucina long to decide.

"The Divine Dragon Grounds are not too far away from here. I would normally turn to my friends and family in a situation like this, but Tiki is closer to us and this minimizes the chance of me being seen." Lucina blushed lightly as she said that

Gerome opened his mouth to tell Lucina she far from being an unpleasant sight, but thought better of it.

"Very well, it's your call. Minerva, to me!" He whistled. The dragon flew over enthusiastically and Gerome quickly mounted. The dragon flew up beside Lucina, who was rising to her feet.

Lucina smiled at the toysized dragon and her husband.

"I thought you did not wish to rely on a giant dragon."

"I do not, but I would not match your stride otherwise." Gerome said defensively.

Lucina took a stride and Minerva followed after her.

"I know, I was merely jesting. In truth I am happy to have you both with me."

Gerome relaxed and smiled back.

"This will be like the long walks we used to have together."

Lucina's stride settled into a steady pace. A human would have trouble keeping up with her, but Minerva did not, not even needing to fly at her full speed.

"Yes." Lucina looked to the landscape and started reminiscing for a while, before she suddenly looked serious. "I had also wanted to visit Tiki, though under different circumstances. I hope she will feel I was worthy of the Hero King's name."

Gerome ordered Minerva closer, now flying right by Lucina's face.

"You inspired all of us and helped save the land."

"It was a group effort." Lucina said.

"As it was for Marth."

"And Robin and Chrom played a larger role than us."

Gerome waved a hand.

"Your part was as vital as there.Without you Chrom would have lost his life and Robin would have been consumed by Grima. You should be proud of what you achieved, if you hadn't gone back our future would still be bleak and hopeless. There's no one I admire more than you."

Lucina leaned over and kiss him, her lips large enough to cover the majority of his face. Gerome was speechless and even wearing that mask, it was clear how flustered he was. In spite of the situation, Lucina could not help but giggle. Gerome worked so hard to appear always appear serious and stoic, so she could not help but enjoy glimpses of his other side.

Gerome soon regained his composure and the two continued to converse. With Lucina's long steps they soon reached the Divine Dragon Grounds.

Lucina cautiously approached, stepping over the trees and called out for Tiki.
131311112.title: The dragon next door

choices: "Sorry Lucina, I don't think I can help..."
1313111121.content:
"Lady Tiki? Are you here?" Lucina tried to be quiet as she could, in case Tiki slept as she usually did, but at her size, her voice had become quite louder than usual, and could easily awake any person in the area. As Lucina focused her gaze towards the ground, she found Tiki, fast asleep in a meadow, surrounded by flowers, she almost gave off an aura of life that seemed to make the flowers tall and healthy. Lucina didn't want to wake the sleeping manakete and get her in a grumpy mood, but she needed her help more then ever. "Lady Tiki-"

"Halt!" From behind a nearby tree came Say'ri, the princess of Chon'sin, and personal aide and friend to Tiki; she spoke in a low shout as not to wake Tiki and wiped sweat from her brow, a clear sign she was training her swordsmanship. As she came back to reality, she spoke directly towards Lucina, "Princess Lucina, please mind your voice as not to awaGYAAAAH!!!" Say'ri screamed and fell backwards upon the sight of the 60 foot Lucina, clad in her skimpy outfit, husband and dragon flying at her side, almost toy-sized in comparison. Say'ri rubbed her eyes before continuing, "L-Lucina?! Is-Is that really you?!"

Lucina let out a small giggle at the small princess' reaction before breaking into another whisper; "Yes Say'ri, it's me. And, uh, please mind your voice as not to awake Lady Tiki." Lucina chuckled a little at her joke while Gerome just moved a hand to his head and shook it, Lucina's sense of humor in the Shepherds always was hit-or miss. Say'ri's face flushed red and she looked to make sure Tiki was still asleep; out like a light, almost dead. She took time to compose herself and brush off her outfit before returning to her talk with Lucina.

"Yes, well," Say'ri continued, still visibly shaken up by the sight of the giantess, "It's not every day you see a comrade in arms at such a size and, um...attire." Now calmed down to a more manageable state, she continued; "Now, what brings you here? I thought you and Gerome had settled down in Wyvern Valley for a quiet life together."

"What?" Lucina retorted, "Can a friend not visit another friend to talk?" She gave a false huff, having fun with the conversation, before returning to her serious demeanor. "But to be honest, it's about my...condition. I was hoping Lady Tiki could provide insight to what's happened to me, even possibly a cure."

"I can understand why you'd come. However," Say'ri turned to Tiki and continued her thoughts, "Lady Tiki is in an important slumber right now, I'm afraid you cannot wake her in this time."

"I see," Lucina responded, curious of the importance of Tiki's nap, "Is she performing another ritual to further her Divine Dragon powers?" Anything that would help protect the world from the dark forces that may threaten it, Lucina figured.

"Well..." Say'ri bit her lip, not ready for how Lucina may react. "Lady Tiki...Partook in a Chon'sin feast, and sampled too much of the turkey and ale. I'm afraid she'll be in a bad mood if she awakes."

"That's all?! I'll be in a bad mood if I'm stuck like this!" Lucina got low to the ground and started childishly banging her fists on the earth, sending shockwaves through the ground in an effort to awake Tiki. "TIKI! WAKE UP! I NEED YOUR HELP!"

"Not so loud! Cease immediately!" Say'ri began fuming herself and started yelling at Lucina. "If you don't halt your noise right now, I'll take up my blade and make you stop!" The two began to childishly argue with each other, the noise miraculously not awaking Tiki, but wearing on Gerome's nerves. As the noise reverberated through his ears and grew ever so louder, something inside Gerome snapped.

"BOTH OF YOU, QUIT IT WITH THE WHINING!" Both girls stopped at Gerome's outburst, they've never seen him get so loud before, as aggravated maybe, but not loud. Say'ri cursed and looked at Tiki, hoping she wasn't awake; she was still as dead as a corpse, not even a snore erupted from her mouth. As Gerome and Minerva landed upon the ground, a cloud of pollen fluttered through Minerva's nostrils, causing her to let out a small, high-pitched sneeze.

"Ugh, quiet, quiet, quiet!" Tiki awoke in a cranky mood, looking ready to turn into a dragon at any moment. "Honestly, you don't see me sneezing around everyone when they're sleeping!" She let out a small hiccup and rubbed the sleep from her eyes. The first thing Tiki noticed when returning to the world of the living was the giant Lucina. Not even fazed, she spoke; "Oh, Lucina, hello, you look taller. And what is with those clothes?" Everyone gathered around Tiki and Lucina began to explain what happened to her.

"Ah, I see, so a meteor made you a giant? I guess that's strange, but I've never seen a meteor up close before though..." Tiki rubbed some more sleep out of her eyes and mumbled a little, prompting Lucina to retort.

"Forgive me for disturbing your rest, but I felt you were the only person who could help me. Well, the only person who could help me without causing a scene in a city. Can you help me in any way?" Tiki yawned a bit and pondered Lucina's situation, wondering if there was anything that could help.
1313111121.title: The Other Awakening Ritual

13131111211.author_name: This site is dead.I wana leave
13131111211.content:
Tiki finished her yawn.

"Meteors making people huge? If we had seen such a thing before, don't you think someone would use to win of the land's many wars?"

"Isn't there anything you can do? Some divine dragon power or anything?"

Lucina got to her knees shaking the ground nearby and compelling several birds to take flight. She held up her hands in a prayer stance.

"Divine Dragon power doesn't work like that."

Lucina raised her hands as though she was praying.

"Please there has to be something you can do. Dragons like Grima have been able to walk around in human form, could you not forge me a similar stone?"

Tiki shook her head.

"It doesn't work that way, the stone's just because we can't hold our dragon forms in this world without some help. I've never heard of a giant human before."

"I-I see."

Tiki hung her head.

"I'm sorry."

Gerome scowled.

"Come on Lucina, let's get out of here."

Lucina bit her lip.

"But where? I am not even sure any vessel could support my size."

"Wait." Say'ri said suddenly. "I remember once hearing rumors of a shrinking elixir. I thought it was just a fanciful tale, but if it's true."

Lucina hastily leapt to his feet, shaking the ground so much she almost knocked Say'ri down.

"Even if it's just a rumor, please tell me!"

Say'ri's training and grace let her quickly recover her balance.

"Be mindful of your size!" She snapped.

"Sorry." Lucina said, making sure to stand in place. "What do you know of this elixir?"
13131111211.title: Big girl big problem

choices: "We'll travel to Rosanne and get a ship."
131311112112.content:
"I'm afraid not much," Say'r answered to Lucina, "It was only but a tale passed down for children." Say'ri closed her eyes as she tried to remember the specifics of the tale. "The folk story involved a treasure hunter who crossed the continents to search for an elixir to grant them eternal life. They were rude and greedy in their method to attain the treasure, and when they finally found a village elder who knew of the elixir, they were pointed to the content of Akaneia. Eventually, they found the elixir, but instead of immortality, the hunter began to dwindle in size rapidly, regretting all their bad deeds, until all that remained was a pile of rags." Say'ri finally opened her eyes again. "I always believed it was a tale told to introduce the concept of karma to the children. If it's to be believed, then I'm sure it'd get you back to normal size."

"Akaneia was the name of Ylisse thousands of years ago," commented Tiki, "Back when Mar-Mar was alive. We heard a tale similar on our travels, but I never put any thought into it myself." Lucina was glad to hear there might have been a solution to her problem, but was equally distressed by the story's context.

"But even if it were to exist, what would stop me from shrinking too far? I may end up half my normal height, the size of a doll, or..." She trailed off her thought as everyone fell silent, not wanting to finish the grim thought.

"In any case," Gerome spoke, breaking the silence, "It seems we'll have to travel to Ylisse anyways."

"Yes," Lucina nodded in agreement, "It seems we'll have to charter a ship to cross the ocean with." Lucina turned toward Tiki and bowed, doing the same in kind with Say'ri. "Lady Tiki, Say'ri, thank you for your help. Please tell us if you remember anything else out about the tale." Both girls bowed in kind and watched as Lucina strode off, Gerome and Minerva flying behind her. Tiki moved her hand to her chin and pondered for a moment, before turning to speak to Say'ri.

"You know where Lucina and Gerome settled, do you not? I wish to travel there, this talk of the meteor has gotten me curious on the matter."

"But my lady," Say'ri inquired, "Didn't you say that there was nothing you could do about Lucina's condition?"

"Well, I kind of lied a little." answered Tiki. "I didn't wish to get the young princess' hopes up. There's nothing in my power I can do now to decrease her size, but that's only because this phenomenon has never been encountered before. If we could harness the power of growth in some manner, maybe we could forge something similar to a Dragonstone allowing her to shift her sizes."

"Is that possible, my lady?" Say'ri asked. "Wouldn't a stone make her even larger at her current size?"

"Not necessarily, with the blessing of Naga, there's a chance we could reverse-engineer the meteor's power. Lucina's base state would be as a giant, but the stone would allow her to shrink back to her normal size, almost like a magical charm." Tiki transformed into her dragon state and beckoned for Say'ri to get on her back. "We'll have to study this phenomenon and transport the raw material to Naga. Brace yourself, we may even have to get huge ourselves."

"...You just want to get big to eat more of the feast, don't you?" Tiki coughed a little before responding to her friend.

"Now what gave you that idea?! Ha Ha! Ha..." Say'ri shook her head and sat herself upon Tiki's back, ready to navigate to Wyvern Valley and look for the meteors. Tiki took flight and soared off at a quick speed, one that could easily outmatch even the largest of wyverns.

----------

Lucina and Gerome took a moment to rest in a field for a bit, trying to formulate a plan to get to Ylisse. Lucina sat down on the ground and leaned back to lay down, shaking the ground a little on impact and feeling the tiny fields of flowers rubbing along her backside. Minerva landed next to Lucina, Gerome sat upon her back, leaning forward and resting his chin upon his arms. Lucina's face, normally solemn on the walk, broke into a smile as she closed her eyes and took in the air.

"The breeze is so nice. This is good, isn't it?" She turned towards Gerome to see him nod in agreement, face solemn, a sign he was deep in thought. Lucina adopted a disappointed expression and puffed her cheeks out; she plucked Gerome from his mount and raised him above her chest, watching him squirm around trying to break free. She pulled out her bra and tucked Gerome in, making sure he was tight in, and removed his mask from his face; his face was red and his eyes looked a little panicked, Lucina could only giggle at her husband as she looked down at him.

"Wh-What's the meaning of this?!"

"Hee-Hee! Sorry, sorry!" Lucina ended her giggle fit and spoke a little calmer now. "It's just that you looked so stressed ever since I got this big. I figured that after all that occurred at the Divine Dragon Grounds, you needed something to help you relax." Gerome wouldn't call it "relaxing", he felt embarrassed being so close to his wife's chest, and even more embarrassed to be without his signature mask, which always hid his emotions from others. He took time to calm himself a little before continuing to talk with Lucina.

"I'm sorry for my outburst before, I was just worried for your well-being, Lucina. I know this 'shrinking elixir' seems to be our only solution, but I'm worried it'll backfire. I don't want to lose you, especially after we lived through the horror of the future." Lucina felt Gerome's words and felt a warm sense of love in her chest, the warmth transferring to Gerome's body; the two lovers both felt this event helped them become closer.

"Your words please me Gerome, but if Say'ri and Lady Tiki were to be trusted, this is the only way." Lucina felt an even bigger smile crawl onto her face. "Besides, Father, Mother, Aunt Lissa, and Robin live in the continent as well, if we told them about our problem, they'd be sure to help. It'd be nice to see the other Shepherds as well."

"'Our problem'?" Gerome grimaced. "Lucina, you're never a problem for me, you're the ray of sunshine in my dark life." Lucina blushed and hugged her chest tight, Gerome felt the crushing weight of his wife's arms and gasped for air when it was all over. "In any case, we'll have to charter a ship. Our best option without sneaking onto a ship would to appeal to Virion in Rosanne." Gerome didn't like this option too well, Virion could barely keep his eyes off his wife Olivia in her dancing attire, he didn't particularly like the idea of Virion ogling his half-naked wife at her current size. Not to mention Cherche and Gregor took up residence in Rosanne after the war; it was petty of him, but he didn't particularly like seeing his parents again, he had no clue what to say to them, nor did he want to know what his parents eccentric reactions to Lucina would be.

"...I could swim." Gerome just looked up at Lucina puzzled at her suggestion. "I'm serious! We all saw the various island chains across the ocean, I could probably go 12 hours swimming without rest, we could take refuge on each island as I'm swimming, and at my size, we could clear the distance easily in a few hours. This could minimize the risk of me being seen." Gerome was still puzzled with Lucina's suggestion, but she had a point, stealth was vital in this ordeal.

"It's your call Lucina, I'm with you either way." Minerva cuddled up against Lucina's face as if to be a part of the conversation. Once again, Lucina was faced with the vital decision, she weighed her options carefully before deciding...
131311112112.title: Support Conversations

1313111121121.content:
Gerome shook his head and called up to Lucina.

"No. Even at your size, the ocean is huge. And even IF you can swim for 12 hours, I can't and Minvera can't fly that long."

Lucina frowned and sat down, still stroking Minerva.

"Minerva can fly faster than I can swim, she should be able to reach on the islands to rest., We aren't under a deadline we can take breaks."

"I don't think it will work and I still think a boat would be easier."

"What ship could carry me?! What captain would let me on board? Even assuming they do not mistake me for some kind of monster."

Gerome turned to Tiki, who was equally worried.

"Tiki, do you have any ideas?"

Tiki was deep in thought.

"All I can think of is gathering wyverns to lift Lucina."

"That could work with enough wyverns but-" Lucina began.

Gerome finished her sentence.

"They might not be able to carry you long enough."

"I still believe swimming is my most likely way across." Tiki said

Gerome put a hand on Lucina.

"I don't want you to risk yourself like that. Even for someone as athletic as you the ocean is a dangerous place to swim and if anything happened."

"I appreciate the sentiment but-"

Tiki interrupted them.

"You're both heroes of the last, even with Lucina's condition someone should be willing to charter a ship."

Lucina tilted her head.

"But will there be one large enough for me?"

Tiki walked in Rosanne's direction.

"We will not know until we try, if that does not work then you can try swimming across."

"Very well." Lucina said, taking a make longer stride towards Rosanne.

"I would like to come to." Say'ri said, speedily following after them.

Gerome grumbled to himself, but whistled for Minvera and quickly mounted.

Realizing Tiki could not match Lucian's pace, Lucina bent down and offered her hand

"Lady Tiki, Say'ri, our journey is long. You should ride on my shoulder."

They nodded.

"I suppose we should." Tiki said.

They climbed aboad and looked around, Tiki's eyes extending in wonder.

"What a wonderful view."

"Yes. I suppose that is one good side..." Lucina said sadly

After a few more steps a troubling thought entered Lucina's mind.

"Wait, won't my appearance frighten the people of Rosanne? Not to mention other lookers." At the thought of it, Lucina blushed and Gerome clenched his fists. Gerome flew closer to his wife.

"When we near Rosanne we'll go on ahead." Gerome said. "We can explain the situation then get you to sea as quickly as possible."

Lucina smiled.

"Thank you."

The trio are alone the next morning and continue the trip
1313111121122.content:
"It's settled then, let's go swimming!" Lucina removed Gerome from her bra and gave him back his mask. "Gerome, can you and Minerva navigate for me?"

"Of course." answered Gerome, as he re-mounted himself on Minerva's back. The wyvern took flight as Lucina got up from her comfy rest and prepared to march. "The ocean is eastward, are you sure you can do this?" Gerome was still skeptical at Lucina's suggestion to swim, but Lucina only looked back with a smile on her face and burning confidence in her eyes.

"Absolutely! We've all trained for the worst battles back in the future, this will be child's play!" The couple nodded at each other and marched towards the sea. When they finally arrived at the Valmese shore, it was completely empty; no ports, no ships, no people, just a patch of nature where the surf linked the land and ocean. Lucina took a few breaths before breaking into a sprint and diving into the ocean, the first thing she noticed was how cold and salty the water was. Gerome watched as his wife shivered before speaking up, focused on her care.

"Are you still up for this?" Lucina looked up at Gerome, trying to stop her teeth from chattering, before answering back.

"N-No, it's fine, I'll get used to it..." Lucina had remembered when the Shepherds all went to the Hotrealm to relax a little during their journey, the Outrealm Gate's time-ignoring system allowing a break in their busy schedule, the water had warmed to her body temperature when she swam during that time, she figured Gerome wouldn't know since he opted to stay in the rest cabana instead of going for a swim with the other Shepherds, she couldn't blame him for worrying since this was his first time seeing someone frolic in the ocean.

"I'll keep watch from up here then," Gerome answered, "I'll fly down towards you to give you directions." Gerome pulled out a telescope from a satchel at Minerva's side, used initially to keep watch for Risen and Grima in the future, now used for navigation, and held it out as if to signal Lucina he and Minerva were ready. Lucina nodded and pointed her body forward, breaking into a front crawl and charging through the churning waves at a high speed.

The sky was vast and blue as the trio continued across the ocean, Lucina swam strong and elegantly, not even breaking a sweat as she reached her 8th hour at sea, as Gerome kept lookout with the telescope. The faint speck of an island came into view from the glass lens, and Gerome beckoned Minerva to descend as he saw it, stopping next to Lucina's head.

"An island is up ahead, bear right and keep going forward." Lucina had no way to say she agreed without taking in a whole bunch of saltwater, but her expression spoke more than enough to Gerome. He and Minerva ascended back to their original position and Lucina picked up her pace, eager to rest with her husband and discuss what to do when they reach Ylisse. By the time they hit the island, the sun was beginning to set and the sky was a deep orange; Lucina reached the shore and lied down on her stomach, gasping for air, as Gerome descended to her face. Lucina looked at Gerome with a smug grin and coughed up a little seawater.

"I told you I could make it." Gerome huffed and Lucina giggled in turn. She flipped to her backside and sat up, feeling the chilling breeze across her body. Her "clothes" were soaked, she prodded at the damp cloth with her fingers, trying to get the seawater to drip from the sheets, her arms shivering as she moved them around her body. Gerome took notice and spoke up.

"Nightfall's coming. I'll gather firewood."

"Thanks." Lucina smiled at her husband as he strode into the forest just off the beach, wielding a large axe in his hand. Minerva cuddled up to Lucina and puffed flames from her mouth, hoping the heat would help dry the young princess off. Lucina moved her damp hand to Minerva's back and stroked the wyvern's scales, Minerva purred in response.

When nightfall came, the three gathered around a large bonfire, Lucina nude once again, lying on her stomach to keep relatively modest, her sheet undies hanging from palm trees to dry. She prodded at Gerome with her finger, causing the wyvern rider to blush, and giggled warmly.

"You really do need to show your feelings more, it's cute." Gerome fidgeted and mumbled at this, causing Lucina's giggles to pick up in pace and volume; she could've sworn she heard Minerva give something similar to a chuckle too. Lucina stared into the fire with a smile on her face, reminiscing about the good times she shared with the children of the future. "You know, I appreciate everything you've done for me." Gerome nodded, face solemn once more, before responding.

"You're my wife, I'd do anything for you." Lucina shook her head.

"Not that, just everything in general. You crafted my mask for me, saved me from Risen, you even sewed my favorite doll back together when we were children." Gerome became even more flustered at the last words.

"Cynthia said she wouldn't tell anyone!" Lucina laughed hard at Gerome's response, never expecting him to get so worked up over the scenario. When she calmed down, she gazed directly at Gerome and pulled him towards her massive face.

"Sisterly bond, you know? But I really do appreciate it, so thank you Gerome. You're more than my husband, you're my best friend." She gave Gerome a big kiss, her massive pink lips consuming the front of Gerome's body before pulling back; Gerome's face was red, but Lucina saw the smile upon his face, she could tell behind that mask that he was happy to be here with her. Lucina looked up at the stars, the sky was dark blue and the moon was full, it truly was a beautiful scene, one they couldn't find in the future. "In any case, it's getting late, we should probably get to sleep."

"I agree." answered Gerome. He gave Minerva a signal and the wyvern took flight, flapping her wings over the flames to put them out, so the forest wouldn't catch ablaze in the middle of the night. Lucina moved her hands over the top of some palm trees and tore a bunch of leaves from their treetops. She gave Gerome a large leaf to use as a blanket while she kept the rest, scattering them over her body as she lied on her back, enough to cover her body's sensitive areas and protect her from the cold. Gerome removed his mask and placed it in Minerva's satchel, he sat down and pushed his back into Minerva's side before draping the leaf over his body, the dragon cuddled next to her master like a sleeping dog, curled up into a ball. Gerome looked at Lucina with a smile on his face, she looked back, smile on hers as well. "Goodnight Lucina, I love you."

"As do I, Gerome." The two lovebirds then drifted off to sleep, ready to continue the journey the next morning.
1313111121122.title: Tropical Getaway

13131111211221.author_name: This site is dead.I wana leave
13131111211221.content:
The couple were awoken the next morning by the sound of a ship's horn. They looked around, seeing what appeared to be a merchant ship sailing to Valm. On boarda group of rowdy sailors. gawking, whistling and Leering at Lucina.

Lucina instinctively covered her body with her hands
"Stop gawking at me you scoundrels!"

The sailors did not gawking, and their cheers and jeers only grew louder

Lucina blushed, she climbed into the water to further cover herself. She though of trying to grab the ship, but it was far out of reach of her arm and she wasn't sure she could swim fast enough to catch up to it.

Gerome did not watch passively. He gnashed his teeth together and shouted.
"That's my wife, you louts!"

A ruffian shouted back, loudly enough for the duo to hear.

"Haha your wife? How do you make love to that thing?"

They both glowered, while the boat erupted with laughter. Neither of them would stand for that, Lucina swam towards the boat as quickly as she could, while Gerome whistled for Minerva, mounting and charging at the ship like an arrow.

Minerva could not possibly understand what was going on, but she growled, clearly receptive to the anger her masters felt, and those were causing it

Minerva flew over the ocean, racing ahead of Lucina, even as she did her finest breast strokes, flying at the ship like an arrow, while Gerome reached for his lance.
The sailor's laughter turned to gasps of panic, and several crewman ran to the cannons, for even a merchant ship needs to defend itself from pirates.

Neither Gerome nor Minerva were deterred, dragon and rider moving as one, now moving in graceful zig zags, while Lucina dived under the waters, but continued swimming.

Soon he was directly above the crew, his lance ready, while Minerva bared her fangs, with the same readiness to strike.

The crew gaped up, their expressions fearful. After watching his flight and seeing the way Gerome held his lance, it was obvious the rider was no rookie. The crew ran for cover, seeking safety below deck. Gerome chased after the loudest heckler, easily out running him and knocking him over with Minerva. He held his lance over him, as Minerva did the same with her jaw and impressive row of teeth.

Fearing for his life, the sailor got to his knees, and raised his arms as though praying for his life.

"Wait- please-" He grovelled.

"Don’t kill me! I'll give you whatever I want!"


Gerome grunted.
"We're no thieves, all I want is for you to apologize to my wife and acknowledge her as a human being!" Gerome pointed with his lance.

Lucina,was closing in and bobbed her head out of the water, glowering at the man as though she was a sea monster.

The sailor glanced at her and his trembling increased.

"O-of course m-miss giant lady-"

"My name is Lucina!"

"Y-yes,miss Lucina."

Gerome place his lance inches from the sailors throat.

"Now apologise to my wife."

"I-I am sorry miss Lucina."

Gerome growled.

"For what?"

He looked at Lucina, whose was now wearing a monstrous scowl.

"F-for staring, and whistling and uh- please don't kill me!"

"Get him out of here!" Lucina said.

Gerome nodded.

"Go." He withdrew, flying into the air but shouted down to this. "And tell the rest of the crew this, remember next time that a person no matter how big she is, or we'll make you sorry you were born!" Gerome yelled after them. Minvera growled something in agreement.

The ship sailed away faster than any ship the duo had ever

The two were so busy with the hecklers that they barely noticed Lucina catching up to them until she was almost there, hearing a loud splash below them. Lucina smiled up at them.


"Thanks for standing up for me."


He dived down to her, until Minerva was close enough to nuzzle Lucina's face.


"Think nothing of it, what kind of man would I be if I did not?"


Lucina placed a hand to chest.


"Thank you. I have never been in a situation like this before."

Gerome blinked.

"Well I can only imagine how strange the whole giant thing must be, but you've never had men leer at you before?"

Lucina was surprised at her husband's surprise.

"Not often, why would I?"

Gerome's mouth opened for a second but he quickly closed it.

"You really don't see it?"

Lucina stared blankly.

"See what?"

"Your're-" Geromme hesiated, choking back the words, not used to showing much affection. "Your.. you truly don't know?"

Lucina cocked head.

"I'm what?"

Gerome turned his head to the side, looking at her peripherally.

"-Beautiful."

"Thank you." Lucina said dryly. "But you're just saying that to make me feel better."
Gerome whirled.

"Do you truly believe I am one for false flattery?""

Lucina gave it a second of thought before responding.

"I suppose not. But what do you see in me that you would call beautiful?"

He shuffled in his seat, clearly embarrassed.

"Do I have to-"

Lucina slumped down and frowning as she stared at the ocean.

"No I suppose not...." she looked down at the ocean.

"Fine!" Gerome growled and threw his arms in the air. "I don't normally do this, so listen to me! I said I felt the way I did about you from the moments I first laid eyes on you and if I have to prove it then so be it!"

Gerome circled around again, stopping at Lucina's hair. He lifted a handful.

"The first thing caught my eyes, were your long blue locks, which always seem to shine no matter what you went."

Lucina smiled.

"I always took pride in my hair."

He flew back to Lucina's face.

"Then their was your face." He touched Lucina's face. "It was uh- very shapely."

Lucina frowned. Gerome fidgeted.

"I said I'm not very good at this!"
Lucina laughed.

"I remember. You said you were no poet. All the same, I appreciate the effort."

Gerome tried to continue as though he hadn't mistepped

"So yes, there's something I like about your face that even if I can't find the right words. And I've always liked your eyes."

Lucina smiled.

"My hair and my eyes, they have always reminded me of father."

"When you phrase it like it sounds kind of wie-" He cut himself off when he saw Lucina glare. "I mean-"

Lucina shifted back, her posture becoming less tense

"I do appreciate your effort, Gerome, I would be surprised if my body could turn the heads of many men, even at this size."

"It certainly drew the attentions of those sailors."

She pursued her lips.

"I suppose, but they had been at sea for a while, and perhaps it was merely the sight of a giant maiden in the middle of the ocean..."

"You sell yourself short."

Again she blushed and folded her arms around her chest,

"But I lack.... curves." Her eyes darted as she said it.

Gerome couldn't help but look as she inadvertently drew attention to that area.

Not at this size he thought to himself, but was not so tactless as to say it.


"There is more than a woman than curves, or Tharja would be the most sought after women in the army."

Lucina chuckled.

"True enough.."

131311112112212.content:
"Well then Gerome," Lucina said while standing up, not bothering to cover herself knowing the ruffian sailors were gone and completely fine with Gerome seeing her naked body, "I think we should continue our trip to Ylisse." She took her makeshift underwear off the trees she left it upon and stared at them for a minute, before looking into the island's vast jungle. "Actually, do you mind if I frolicked around the jungle a bit?"

"Not a problem." Gerome answered. Lucina smiled and nodded and walked off into the jungle with her undergarments in hand, while Gerome sat upon Minerva's back. "Come Minerva, I wish to do reconnaissance." Gerome didn't want a repeat of what happened with the sailors, he thought it'd be best to circle the island and find a safe route for travel. Minerva bellowed in agreement to her master's wish, and the two took to the skies and began to circle the island. The two flew around for about 3 hours before Gerome was confident with their solitude and travel route, he touched back down on the beach and waited for Lucina to get back from her nature walk. It was only a mere 3 hours later until the ground shook, a sign that Lucina was done with her walk.

"Gerome, I'm back." Gerome turned around to look at his wife, he didn't expect to be blown away by the image of Lucina after her walk. Lucina had finally donned her sheets, but had decorated them with the flora of the jungle; palm leaves hung from her ties like the ends of ribbon bows, her makeshift bra and panties were bordered with flowering vines, the flowers in varying colors, a large necklace of colorful flowers was draped around Lucina's neck and hung down to her chest, and a large rafflesia flower had found itself nestled into Lucina's hair, right next to her left ear. Lucina held her arms together behind her back, rubbed her legs together, and blushed as she addressed Gerome. "So, uh, w-what do you think?"

"It's, uh, good. It looks good on you." Gerome's answer would normally make any woman think twice about their fashion choice, but Lucina saw the blush on Gerome's face and could hear the stammer in his words, she's been around him long enough to know his reaction was sincere. Lucina giggled and relaxed her body a bit with the knowledge the edits to her clothing weren't awful to Gerome.

"Thank you Gerome," she answered warmly, "I just thought my outfit was looking a little plain, so I wanted to splash some color onto it, and so we could remember our time together here." In truth, Lucina really did this for Gerome, figuring he'd rather see her in a brighter outfit than plain, faded white cloth; she was just afraid she'd overdo her fashion edits, since Sumia had always thought Lucina had too much of a...flashy fashion sense. "I just hope I didn't burn too much daylight with my venture."

"It's fine," answered Gerome, "I won't rush you. You're your own person Lucina." Lucina smiled at Gerome's words and faced the ocean, ready to continue the trip. She fixed the flower in her hair to keep it taught and broke into a sprint, making an impressive leap from the shore before gracefully diving into the ocean. Lucina began a quick front crawl as Gerome and Minerva soared behind the giantess.

For 8 hours straight, the trio crossed the ocean before reaching the mainland of the Ylissean continent; by the time they arrived, the sky was night, and various ships could be seen by a dimly lit harbor, luckily not able to see the trio at the distance they were out in the ocean. A humid air was palpable in the night sky, it almost felt dry, like sand lined the air. Lucina squinted her eyes and saw a group of guards armed with lances on the port, clad in a mild amount of armor and tunics emblazoned with a symbol of 6 purple eyes, crossed together with a zigzagging pattern; Lucina grimaced at this emblem, she knew far too well where they were now.

Plegia. The desert kingdom of the Grimleal, who worshipped Grima like a god. It was this nation, under rule of King Validar, and the Mad King Gangrel before him, that almost plunged the world into ruin by reviving Grima and bringing his dark power to a head again, which almost destroyed the world. Nowadays, the nation had become a mere shadow of what it once was, it was now a lawless nation ruled by nobody but the ruffians that lived there, and the population had dwindled heavily when the Grimleal had fed themselves to Grima to increase his power; the nation still managed to find business as a trade nation and was a popular rest stop for traders, pirates, and thieves, but much of the desert kingdom had relinquished its land to the desert that it came from, and various surrounding villages had expanded into the territory, now happy that their peace would no longer be tainted by the Grimleal.

Lucina felt anger burn up inside her at remembering the horror the nation plagued Ylisse with, but she managed to keep herself calm, not wanting to blow her cover to the ruffian continent. She looked around for a safe haven and found a large bridge she could swim under, the gap between the water and rock easily allowing Lucina's head and shoulders to fit under it and Gerome and Minerva to soar under it; the trick was just finding out how not to be spotted by the guards or citizens. Lucina turned towards the wyvern rider and wyvern and motioned for them to follow her, they quickly darted under the bridge and found hiding spots in the shade, Lucina clinging herself to a wall and Gerome and Minerva perched on a ledge under the under the bridge, close to the river leading out to the ocean. They heard two guards walk above them and kept quiet as they listened close to their conversation.

"So did ya hear?" spoke one of the guards. "That merchant ship headed to Valm came back earlier this evening, crying about a 'sea monster' that attacked them."

"So like, was it a serpent or a dragon or something?" responded the guard's colleague.

"No, no, that's where it gets freaky; the 'monster' was a giant woman!"

"What? That's stupid. You're stupid. There ain't anything like a 'giant woman' out at seas."

"I'm telling ya, the chief sailor said she was going to swallow him and his crew alive unless they left that island they were sailing close to." The guard spoke more excitedly, "I tell ya, I wish those wenches down at the tavern were that huge, I'd love to climb up the front of her legs and crawl right into-"

"Woah, woah! I don't want to hear that crap! Keep it to yourself!" The other guard was clearly bugged by his colleague's lewd imagery. The other guard merely chuckled.

"Admit it, it'd be hot though, wouldn't it?"

"...Yeah, I guess it would be..." The other guard was defeated by his colleague's words, but quickly went back to his serious demeanor. "But we got a job to do, alright? No more thoughts of giant wenches on the job, I don't want you getting distracted by your stupid lewd daydreams, or the chief will have our asses!" The two walked off, and from under the bridge, Lucina and Gerome were clearly distressed by the conversation.

"Damn!" Lucina whispered. "Those sailors started a rumor, it's going to be harder to sneak past the nation with people on the lookout for a giant maiden..." Lucina was especially offended by that middle part the guards spoke of. "And what was with that 'swallow him alive' tale?" Lucina thought to herself, "I should've eaten him if he was going to start this rumor..." She shook off the thought, not particularly enjoying the thought of eating someone whole, it went against her nature, her code of ethics.

"We'll have to be swift getting out of here," whispered back Gerome, "Do you know the way out of here?" Lucina looked around and closed her eyes, she remembered that time from two years ago when she invaded Plegia to try and save Aunt Emmeryn, memories of the city came back to her and she opened her eyes again, staring down further at the river, opposite to the ocean's mouth.

"I remember," she spoke quietly, "If we continue down this river, it'll flow into a canyon. We should be good to travel into Ylisstol if we avoid the villages on the way there." She thought a bit more, and corrected herself. "Actually, we could manage to stop in Themis, Maribelle's mansion is there, we could easily spend the night as we talk to Robin about this." After the war, Robin and Maribelle had bought a large mansion in her home of Themis with all the excess war funds, ready to enjoy a married life together; the parlor and ballroom could easily fit Lucina at her massive size, and the vast vineyard could easily feed Lucina with all the grapes and wine the duo had access too. Gerome thought it over before responding to Lucina.

"Alright, we'll stop in Themis to see Robin and Maribelle." He could see the clear advantage at taking refuge at the two's castle-like mansion, and if anyone could sneak a giant woman into the castle of Ylisstol without the citizens reacting negatively, it would be Robin. Gerome looked and listened for more guards before waving Lucina on, the coast was clear. The three swiftly moved up the river, hoping not to alert anyone in Plegia as they moved towards the canyon.

1313111121122121.content:
Lucina and Gerome traveled through the canyons of Plegia, doing their best to combine speed and stealth.

Every few steps, Lucina looked around.

"What if someone seems me?"

"You're not still cautious about your body, are you?"

"Not as much, but those sailors thought I was a monster...."

"I'll fly ahead and keep a lookout, but don't worry about it. Even if some lowlifes see you and assume the worst, what are they going to do? You were more than capable of looking after yourself before this happened,"

"Hmm.. the Falchion is no more than a toothpick to me now, but my body itself should prove a formidable weapon."

"Exactly, and even ignoring that, you've always been a survivor."

"Thank you, I suppose I've had to be."

"All of us have, but you were the best among us."

"It pleases me to here you say that."

They traveled on. Gerome noticed Lucina had been silent for a while.

"What's wrong? You haven't said anything for a while."

Lucina stopped, twitching her fingers.

"It's just.. what if I am stuck at this? Will I ever be accepted again."

Gerome opened his mouth to speak, but Lucina raised a finger.

"I know you will always love and accept me, but will everyone else? Once glance at me and those sailors assumed I was some terrible sea monster."

Gerome clenched his fist.

"Those were just small minded fools. I never mistook you for a monster, nor did Say'ri or Tiki."

"It does not seem like much could phase Tiki."

Gerome continued.

"And I am certain Robin and Maribelle will not either." He hesitated for a second. "At least I think Maribelle won't..." he cleared his throat and hastily corrected himself. "But Robin has always made the right calls."

"Yes. Robin has an open mind. I'm sure Maribelle will get quite a fright from my appearance,, but I've heard Lissa vouch for her many times. She is a good friend and a dependable person."

"Good. With the two of them on our side, we will make sure no one treats you like a monster!"

"I'm sure they will happily provide their finest hospitality, though I do not wish to eat them out of house and home..."

"They have plenty to spare and you are one of us, they will not consider it a burden."

"Yes."

Minvera had been quiet for much of the trip, but suddenly started growling. Lucina stroked her snout.

"What is Minvera?"

Gerome clenched his teeth and drew his lance.

"She must be smelling risen!"

Gerome looked around, seeing a large group of undead warriors shambling towards them.

"We still haven't wiped out all the risen." Lucina assumed a combative stance, instinctively posed like Marth, despite lacking her Falchion. "At least I can put this body to good use!"

"Be careful Lucina, you're strong, not invincible!"

"I know that!"

Lucina ran towards the Risen, while Gerome charged. He reached the enemy first, skewing one through, but Lucina soon caught up, her every step boom across the area, and when she was in reach, it was a simple crushing the enemy beneath her feet, while still pulling back from those who got too close to her.

Gerome fought his hardest, slaying several Risen, but could not come close to the rate his wife was destroying, stomping or kicking them, while still moving with a speed and grace that seemed to contradict her size.

Soon the Risen were no more

Lucina, tried to wipe the remains of the her opponents off her.

"I suppose I will need to find a way to wash, and a way to secure my privacy."

Gerome blushed.

"Er- Yes...."

Lucina rubbed her feet in the sand, trying to get more of the mess off, or at least cover it. Despite this annoyance she was smiling.

"Few things are better stress relief than destroying those things..."

Gerome flew level with her face.

"I knew you were a great fighter, but I had no idea you could move so quickly and with such agility, even at this size."

Her smiled widened.

"I am well trained and well practiced. I'm sure I have inherited father's talent for battle as well. Perhaps their are good points to being so large."

13131111211221211.content:
Maribelle sat at the table of her 3rd floor terrace, taking occasional sips from her teacup, admiring the serene night sky, dimly lit by candles lining the veranda. She had just finished a busy day of legislature, wine shipments, & parenting duties and found herself quite tired by it. "It feels good to get a spot of tea after putting the children to bed." thought Maribelle. While the future versions of Brady and Morgan, her children, had differed in age, they somehow ended up being born as twin brother and sister in this timeline; Maribelle occasionally pondered if this was because the Outrealm Gate's interference had caused a rift in the timeline to be, but either way, she was happy she could love both of her children the same amount at the same time. As she drank, her beloved, Robin, had come to join her on the veranda, wiping away some sweat on his forehead and greeting his wife with a smile.

"Come now Robin," spoke Maribelle, "You're absolutely drenched from work today! You're not even wearing your signature coat! You really don't need to work the vineyard, that's what we have service for, no?" Robin poured himself a glass of tea and laughed, beaming with that signature smile that always lit up the Shepherds.

"Nonsense Maribelle," answered Robin, "Everyone deserves a break in life, even the vineyard workers, and it's a great boost of morale for work. If I can just take over everyone's duties and let them rest, then I'm more than happy to harvest the grapes on my free time." Maribelle only could smile at her husbands sincere kindness, he truly was the Shepherds' rock during their marches against Plegia and Valm; it was this same tact and kindness that caused her to fall in love with him when Robin prevented the Grimleal from chopping her head off those 2 years ago.

"You really are too kind, dear." she spoke warmly. "Then perhaps you wouldn't mind caring for Morgan and Brady when the season begins to wear down? It does exhaust me so, the constant feeding and lullabies."

"It'd be my honor Maribelle." answered Robin. Maribelle closed her eyes and sipped her tea with a grin on her face, Robin chuckled after taking a sip of his cup and unloaded his thought onto Maribelle. "Hey, you know what would be goofy? If our children were to grow up like their future selves, and our timeline's Brady ends up marrying Cynthia and our timeline's Morgan marries Inigo too?" Maribelle opened her eyes and suddenly adopted an expression of shock, as she spit her tea all over Robin's face, leaving the tactician confused. "Well gee Maribelle, Cynthia and Inigo aren't that bad..." Maribelle's face looked white as a ghost, her eyes were wide, her jaw was agape, her hand shook as the teacup rattled; Robin suddenly adopted a look of concern. "What's wrong Maribelle?"

"Uh, Uh, Uh..." she raised her free arm as she stammered and pointed behind Robin, her free arm also shaking wildly. Robin turned around to look out the veranda, expecting the worst, but hoping to see just the night sky and unobscured view of the veranda and servant house. Robin's eyes grew wide and he jumped back, falling out of his chair and hitting the floor of the terrace with a loud "THUD"; he moved his hand to his head, gathering his thoughts, and spoke with slight shock in his voice.

"Uh, Lucina? Is that you?" Robin looked straight at Lucina's massive face, covered in a slight blush, her fingers wrapped around the railing of the terrace; she spoke calmly to respond, very much expecting this reaction.

"Yes, it's been a while, Robin, Maribelle. I, uh, bought Gerome and Minerva with me too." Robin got up to look over the veranda, leaning next to Lucina's head, Maribelle had remained in her chair, her body and face frozen into position; Gerome and Minerva looked back at Robin from the ground. Gerome waved to Robin, the tactician waved back, still trying to comprehend what's going on. "The, uh, front door is locked. We knocked, but got no answer."

"Uh, yeah, uh, let me get right on that." responded Robin. The front door to the mansion was large, more than enough for Lucina to squeeze through if she crawls in, and the ceiling was high enough to support her size if she sat or kneeled down. Robin got up and ran out of the room to open the front door, Maribelle remained frozen in place, her chair leaned backwards and she hit the floor, still in the same pose.

----------

The entire group had gathered in the mansion's parlor, Lucina, Gerome, Robin, Maribelle, and the various butlers and maids employed in the couple's service; Minerva had to wait outside due to a strict no-animal policy, Maribelle was being tended to by two maids, fanning her and applying a bag of ice to her forehead as she sat on a chair at the top of the stairwell. Lucina had just got done explaining her story to the mansion's residents, from the impact of the meteors, to the talk with Tiki, to the sailors, to sneaking to Plegia, all the way up to entering the mansion. The butlers and maids looked on in awe and spoke with enthusiasm in their voice, clearly responding to the giant princess better than their master.

"Amazing!" spoke a maid.

"How can rocks from the stars even do that?" spoke a butler.

"Isn't that the brand of Ylissean royalty?" asked another maid, looking at Lucina's left eye. Lucina froze up, she had forgotten about her eye's brand and the problems it may cause if someone were to spot her.

"Lucina is Chrom's daughter from the future," spoke Robin, trying to defuse the confusion, "That brand is a birthmark to prove her lineage."

"Ah! So it's like Young Master Brady and Young Madame Morgan, correct?" responded the maid.

"Yes," spoke Maribelle, now fully revived, "Lucina was an important hero in the war, I expect the utmost treatment from you all, despite her...condition." Maribelle moved her hand to her forehead, still trying to wrap her head around the idea of a meteor turning people into giants.

"We're sorry to impose," Lucina spoke, "But we needed your help Robin, as well as a place to stay. We realize it's rude, but do you mind if we stayed here for the time being? Until we could get into Ylisstol to see Father?"

"Absolutely," spoke Robin, "You're a friend to us all, you and Gerome are allowed to stay here for as long as you like." Maribelle nodded her head to agree, but she felt like she was going to have a heart attack to let Lucina sleep on the floor of her mansion almost nude, especially with the floors just waxed, and she didn't like the idea of allowing Minerva to stay in the horse stables.

"Thank you both, we're truly grateful." responded Lucina, smiling ear to ear. Gerome had a slight grin on his face too, happy to relax in a warm home once more.

"Some ground rules, dear." Maribelle spoke, now a little more calm, grasping the situation better. "I'll allow you the ballroom to sleep, Gerome may join you too, but you are to leave the windows shut and the blinds closed so nobody can see you, and absolutely no tearning any cloth for use as a blanket." She faced Gerome and continued her ultimatum, which felt like a rant. "Minerva will be allowed in the stables, provided she doesn't go after any of our horses."

"Minerva's a nice girl." responded Gerome, a little offended at Maribelle's words, though he knew she only said it because of her mild neurosis. "She won't even breathe on your horses."

"Right, thank you." Maribelle continued looking at Gerome, not finished with him in her speech. "And while you're here, you're to help us with the vineyard, but only you, I don't want Lucina working in her time of need." Gerome looked annoyed, but Robin spoke to him cheerfully.

"Don't worry Gerome, I'll show you the ropes, it really is fun to work the fields!" Gerome always thought Robin's glee and optimism was foolish and unbecoming of a tactician, but the man gave results, so he couldn't disrespect his nature.

"And Lucina, dear?" asked Maribelle, looking directly in Lucina's eyes, "Will you allow my tailors to make something more...decent for you to wear? I mean no offense, but you look like a greenhouse threw up on you." Maribelle grimaced at having to say that, feeling Brady had rubbed off on her, Lucina merely smiled, knowing full well her fashion choices weren't the best in the army.

"I appreciate the offer Maribelle," spoke Lucina gently, "But I don't wish to impose on you. My outfit allows my best movement too to sneak around. If my size becomes common knowledge to Ylisse, then I'll take up your offer."

"Nonsense darling," responded Maribelle, "You aren't a burden at all, but if that is your wish..." Maribelle slowly got up, her maids supporting her up, and turned towards her bedroom. "I will retire for tonight, I still need time to get over all this. May you both have a good night." With that, Maribelle's maids practically carried her to her room, the young woman looked absolutely exhausted and definitely needed a nap.

"I'll see you to your room." said Robin, waving the manor staff to retire for the night. "We'll talk in the morning about getting you to Chrom and Sumia, I think Maribelle needs a good cuddle tonight." Robin opened the large doors to the ballroom and the three entered, Lucina crawling inside. Robin helped the two prepare for bed for a while before retiring to his bedroom shared with Maribelle, stopping to kiss the sleeping babies Brady and Morgan goodnight. As the butlers dimmed the lamps and closed all the doors, everyone had retired to their rooms to sleep.

It was one wacky day for the House Maribelle.
