131311112112212111.content:
Gerome and Lucina had retired for the night, but had not yet gone to sleep, taking some time to relax and talk about their long, hectic day.

Gerome lay beside Lucina.

"I am surprised how well Maribelle and Robin are taking this, as well as all these servants."

Lucina was surprised, but less than Gerome would have expected.

"Robin has always kept a cool head on the battlefield. After dealing with time travelers, cultists and dragons who thought themselves gods, a giant woman must not seem so strange to him."

Gerome considered this, but wasn't completely satisfied.

"But what of Maribelle? I thought the sight of a giant would send her shrieking."

Lucina shrugged her shoulders, careful not to disturb Gerome with a careless move of her arms.

"Lissa's praise must have been accurate, she is clearly a stronger woman than we would expect."

Gerome nodded.

"And if the heads of the household remain calm the servants follow in their lead."

"That must be so. It heartens me that my companions still see me for who I am and that they can indeed sway others. The Shepards will never see me as a monster, perhaps they won't even view me size as something frightful."

"...Except for Yarne."

Lucina looked worried for a second then laughed.

"Even you would frighten Yarne just by yelling boo too loudly."

Gerome rolled away.

"A lot of people feel uneasy around me."

Lucina stroked his face, gently rolling him closer.
.
"Never me. I think you just need a friendlier demaner so people can see the sweet person beneath."

Gerome turned his head and shuffled his back leg.

"I don't want to be "sweet".. and I'm not a people person."

Lucina continued stroking.

"There is no one I'd rather have at my side than you."

"Thank you..."

"You could easily be better with people if you put your mind to it."

"I do not have you're charisma. Others flock to your words, and always have."

Lucina frowned.

"I was only a leader because I needed to be. And I was still powerless agaisnt Grima."

Gerome looked into Lucina's eyes.

"We all were. You rallied us together, all of us, and Chrom's band in the future."

"True but I was only to succeed because of the foreknowledge i had, and everyone's effort. Especially Robin's, even after I tried to..."

She did not want to say it and Gerome did not let her.

"You did better than me, I had given up all hope on the future."

Lucina smiled.

"It was you who gave me the idea to don this mask and be an inspiring symbol."

"But you did all the inspriing by yourself."

"Prehaps you'll never be a public figure. You are a dependle fighter and husband, and skilled wyvern rider, that may well be enough for you. But I believe your people skills would show a marked improvement if you just smiled a little more."

"Maybe, but I don't care. You're all I need."

"We all need others, Gerome. Like how right now I am benefiting from Maribelle and Robin's kindness."

"Can we change the subject?"

"Very well, what do you have in mind?"

Gerome quickly looked around the room for anything that might divert the discussion. While he was not one of luxury or decor, the lavish drapes caught his eye.

"Why do you think Maribelle was so insistent that we draw the blinds and close the doors?"

"I suppose it's in case we-" both blushed and looked away form each other.

"Can we ever-" Gerome realized that once again he spoke too quickly and without thought. He realized it was sometimes better to say nothing than to say something stupid, but it wasn't obvious until he had said that thing...

"Let's not think about that tonight." Lucina said quickly. "If nothing else, I am tired from our long journey."

"But what if you are stuck like that and-" He suddenly realized he had done it again Shut up Gerome! he chided himself.

"We'll worry about that another time." Lucina said, then sense Gerome's poorly hidden disapointment. "If worse comes to worse, we'll find a way...." She extended a hand. "Right now I believe we should stick with cuddling."

"Fine." Gerome rolling towards Lucina as she pulled him close.
131311112112212111.title: Pillow talk

1313111121122121111.content:
The song of birds welcomed the morning, the warm natural light flooded through the manor's windows, signaling Robin and Maribelle to awake from their slumber. Robin opened a window to let in the natural air as a catalyst to help wake up. He sniffed the fresh scent of nature and turned to his wife, who was beginning to disrobe herself behind a folding screen to prepare for a shower.

"If it's alright with you, I was thinking we should eat in the ballroom this morning." Robin spoke to his wife. Maribelle poked her head out from behind the curtain, having removed her lingerie.

"Why?" she inquired, "What's in the ballroom? Why not the dining hall?"

"I just thought it'd be a better idea to eat in the ballroom while Lucina and Gerome are here," responded Robin, "To help Lucina feel welcome with her size."

"Ah, yes." responded Maribelle. "How could I forget about that? We'll eat in the ballroom then." Maribelle was remembering all that transpired the night before, with Lucina showing up and scaring her half to death with her massive size, and having to allow her and Gerome use of the manor to hide out in. "Oh gods, it wasn't a dream..." she muttered, not amused with the idea of trying to hide a giant woman on top of her busy schedule.

"Great, I'll give Brady and Morgan a bath and bring them downstairs. We'll see you in the ballroom." Robin whistled as he left the room, heading to the Twins' Room down the hall, closing the door behind him to give Maribelle her privacy. Maribelle had finally disrobed herself and moved out from behind the curtain, moving into the bathroom linked to the bedroom. She grabbed a towel from the rack and stepped into the shower, she turned the handle to let the hot water flow onto her body.

"What a morning this will be..." she thought aloud.

When Maribelle had finally come downstairs, she entered the kitchen and prepared her breakfast - a bran muffin, a grape bunch, and a cup of tea - and joined her family and guests in the ballroom, her maid carrying a tray of her breakfast behind her. When she opened the door, she was greeted by the laughter of her children and the massive frame of Lucina taking up the ballroom. Lucina was playing peek-a-boo with Brady, who was clearly amused by the giant princess, Morgan had stolen Gerome's mask and giggled uproariously as Gerome tried to remove it from her tiny hands, Robin only watched and laughed as he saw the scene unfold. The shut of the door had alerted the group Maribelle had joined them, Robin picked up the babies from their playtime and moved to a table with Gerome set up in the room to eat breakfast, Lucina kneeled down next to a cart filled with well-done steak and eggs and a large barrel full of tea, facing the table to join the discussion that would take place.

"There goes that soufflé I was going to make..." thought Maribelle as she sat down at the table to join her family and Gerome. She took a sip of her tea and popped a grape into her mouth before addressing her guests. "Forgive me if I don't seem amused today," she spoke to the duo, "I'm still trying to get adjusted to this situation. It may sound priggish of me, but I've grown comfortable with my usual daily rituals, it is the magic that is me, and even the slightest changes in my morning drive me crazy." Lucina felt as if all the food the servants prepared for her might have set Maribelle off.

"I'm sorry about all this Maribelle," spoke Lucina, taking a swig from her barrel, "I appreciate your kindness, but if you want us gone at any moment, then please don't hesitate."

"Nonsense dear," responded Maribelle, "You aren't a bother to me or Robin, I'm just used to my usual routine is all." She faced Brady and Morgan, playing with their baby food, before continuing, "Besides, Brady and Morgan have taken a liking to you two, and if my children enjoy your presence, then so do I." Lucina grabbed a handful of steak and eggs and stuffed them into her mouth, coughing a little bit after swallowing, as if she was afraid to ask something.

"That having been said..." she started, "You wouldn't happen to have a bathing area for me, would you? I haven't actually bathed ever since I've gotten this big." As she said this, Maribelle could notice the stench of the sea, sulfur, and rotting corpse on Lucina, and pinched her nose, moving from the table to open a small window.

"There's a lake and a waterfall near here." said Robin, responding for his wife, "I'm going to be busy with the vineyard today, so I'll have a maid come with you and show you the way. It's a popular fishing spot around here, so she'll keep watch for you while you bathe." Robin smiled at Lucina and she smiled back, clearly pleased with his kind demeanor.

"Thank you Robin, I appreciate it." Lucina took another swig from her barrel, gladdened by her hosts' hospitality and their estate's many features to support her. Gerome on the other hand winced at the word "vineyard", Maribelle did say he had to work while he and Lucina stayed here, and the thought upset him a bit, he was much better fit for hunting and woodcutting than harvesting fruits. Robin took notice of this and spoke to Gerome.

"Don't worry Gerome," he said, grapping one of his grapes as if to illustrate his point, "Harvesting is fun and builds stamina, and the most fun part is when we stomp on the grapes to make wine! I'll let you and Lucina sample some when we make it, it'll be like learning a new skill!" Robin beamed with a childlike smile, but Gerome only looked annoyed, bothered by the idea of stomping on grapes, thinking it was unbecoming of a warrior. Maribelle returned from opening the window, and the group all continued eating breakfast together.

Once breakfast finished, Maribelle took to her usual duties with the babies and writing up shipment logs, while Lucina, Gerome, and Robin had gathered in the vineyard, Lucina carring a maid upon her shoulder as she kneeled down to address the two men.

"I'm going off to take my bath now, I'll try to get back as soon as I can, and then we can take some time discussing how to see Father."

"Alright," responded Robin, "Have fun. We'll be working here if you need us, and feel free to take a few grapes when you get back!" Robin grabbed a large basket and Gerome grabbed one in turn, the tactician faced the vineyard and walked towards the grape vines, but Gerome looked his wife in the eyes with an annoyed expression.

"I'll try to make something up with him while we're working, don't worry, we'll get into Ylisstol." Robin beckoned Gerome to come on, the wyvern rider sighed and began walking to the grapes. "At least the butlers are washing Minervykins..." he mumbled in a defeated tone. With that, Lucina got up and a maid began directing her to the lake.

The two girls talked for a while about various things as they walked through the woods behind the Maribelle Estate, Lucina spoke praise for her father and mother and told embarrassing stories about Gerome showing his emotions, the maid spoke highly of her masters and expressed the idea of how great it would be to be giant like Lucina, stating it would make her job far easier and please her masters better. When they reached the lake, it was devoid of people; the clear waters reflected the vast blue sky and the waterfall powered down from the cliffs above, sending a powerful sound of water crashing through the air.

"I'll keep watch from down here," spoke the maid, "If any fisherman show up, I'll shoo them away with a staff. Please take your time, Miss Lucina." Lucina thanked the young maid and removed her from her shoulder. She looked around for a bit before disrobing herself and stepping into the lake, the maid grabbing Lucina's undergarments and dragging them atop one another, folding them as she overlayed them. Lucina dived under to get her whole body wet and shook the water from her hair, feeling absolutely refreshed to get the stench of sea air and Risen off of her. She moved under the waterfall and closed her eyes as she ran her fingers through her hair, cleansing all the salt from it and removing the knots from her hair. She hummed an upbeat tune Sumia used to sing her to sleep with and gyrated her body under the waterfall, rubbing her hands across her body to fully clean it, she truly felt in touch with nature as the birds sang in her ears and the water ran over her body, a small rainbow even entered her field of vision; the maid watched from the shore and couldn't help but feel mesmerized by the young princess' catchy tune and dance.
1313111121122121111.title: The Morning After

13131111211221211111.author_name: This site is dead.I wana leave
choices: Tiki and Say'ri show up at Mairbelle's mansion
13131111211221211111.content:
Even as she cleaned herself, Lucina looked around in all directions, paranoid someone would spy on her. Even with the maid watching her back, there was no guarantee someone would not be able to escape the maid's notice, especially at the distance from which Lucina could be seen.

I wonder if anyone else has ever been in my situation. Lucina thought.

After Gerome's "pep talk", she was less conscious of her body now than she was yesterday, but she still did not want others gawking at her, regardless of whether they thought she was a sea monster or a beautiful woman, though naturally she would prefer people think the second rather than the first. But then if even Maribelle's kids were able to see her as a human being, their was hope yet. Those sailors were possible a particular loutish lot.

Though perhaps Gerome looking that way would not feel so bad either....

Taking another look at the late, Lucina was relieved to see how clear it was. She had indeed lucked out.

As she cleaned herself, she wondered how Tiki and Say'ri were doing. Presumably they had a smoother than she did? Though surely a full dragon crossing the skies must have been cause for alarm. But in her advanced age, Tiki must have come up with a way to manage unwanted attention. Lucina would have to ask her how. She wondered if the two of them had got involved in any adventures. Lucina suddenly bolted up. How was Tiki and Say'ri going to find her?!


****

Earlier the previous day.

Tiki flew high in the sky, almost reaching the clouds.

"Lady Tiki why are we so high up?" Say'ri asked.

"To avoid unwanted attention." Tiki said calmly.

"I see, that makes a lot of sense."

"I hope you don't mind the journey, it may be quite boring."

Say'ri smiled

"I appreciate being able to talk with you. Not everyday needs to be an excitement filled adventure."

Say'ri's grip suddenly tightened.

"I just realized... if we get separated from Lucina, how are we going to find her?"

Tiki remained calm.

"I would expect it to be easy to track a giant girl, but failing that I'm sure their will be rumors abound the second anyone sees here."

***

Lucina wanted to relax and enjoy her "bath", but having to keep an eye open meant she fully couldn't her wash. She decided not to tarry anylonger and finish cleaning herself as quickly as possible.
13131111211221211111.title: Didn't really know what to write here

131311112112212111111.content:
Dot the i's. Cross the t's. Write neatly and clearly. These were the rules Maribelle followed when writing up her shipment logs for her family's wine brand. Her shared brand with Robin, "Winery Emblem", had won the hearts of nobility all across the world, its rich flavor being sampled in high-class taverns, noble weddings, and royal feasts, and the popularity had turned Robin and Maribelle into celebrities almost overnight. When asked about the secret to its exquisite flavor, Robin only responded "Hard work and a lot of love"; now if only he could have a better explanation for the name than "I thought it'd be funny if we named it after the Fire Emblem". Maribelle sacrificed her legislature study to work hard on the paperwork for orders, logbooks, and sales charts, and Robin worked hard in harvesting the grapes and making the wine, giving up almost all his free time; even so, the couple managed to always make time for their beloved children.

Maribelle was carefully writing into a final box on her spreadsheet, adjusting her reading spectacles, when Minerva's loud roar rang through the outside air, causing Maribelle to scribble wildly and ruin the sheet she tirelessly worked on for the past 20 minutes. She threw her quill pen up into the air, removed her spectacles, and banged on the desk, she felt like she could deal with Lucina's size and Gerome's antisocial behavior with enough work, but if she had to hear Minerva's roars one more time, she was going to flip.

"Can't that Gerome train that dragon to act properly around company?!" Maribelle cried, grinding her teeth together. A butler knocked on the door, beckoning for his master, and Maribelle couldn't help but flip out at that too. "What now?!"

"Forgive me Madame," spoke the butler politely, "But there is a woman at the door claiming to be Lady Tiki, the Voice of Naga from Valm."

"Tiki?" thought Maribelle, "Could she be here to see Lucina?" Maribelle thought it strange for Tiki to be visiting all the way from Valm, but she figured it'd help Lucina faster, and get Minerva out of her hair faster by extension, so she jumped at the chance to speed up Lucina's care. "All right, thank you. I will see to their company immediately." Maribelle opened the door to her study and walked out, moving down the halls into the parlor, facing the large regal door, hearing a weak knocking sound and what sounded like panting from behind the door. Maribelle opened the door with a small steel handle and came face-to-face with Tiki, panting like a dog, gasping for air, and sweating profusely.

"Good...Day, Maribelle..." Tiki spoke, wheezing at her pauses. "Is...Lucina here...?" Maribelle was concerned for Tiki's health, it's not every day the strong, stoic Voice of Naga was reduced to looking like she ran a marathon, even in the heat of battle she always looked calm.

"Lady Tiki, are you alright?" inquired Maribelle, worried for her former Shepherd comrade. "Can I get you a glass of water?"

"C-Can we just please come in?!" spoke another voice from outside the mansion. Maribelle came outside to look for the voice's source and found Say'ri, completely nude, covering her body with her hands, ducked behind a large bush. The woman's face was tomato red and she definitely looked larger, about 15 feet tall by Maribelle's estimate. "A-And no men!" spoke Say'ri in a girlish tone, "N-Nobody can see me like this!"

"Oh gods!" Maribelle cried, pinching the bridge of her nose, making an annoyed expression; she looked ready to have an aneurysm at any moment.

"What are...You complaining about?" Tiki coughed out, panting and gasping for air at her pauses, "You...Didn't have to...Carry her all...The way here..."

Maribelle shooed away all the butlers and the two further guests entered the mansion; Say'ri stood tall at her full 15 foot height and covered her privates, looking around erratically for any peeping men, Tiki collapsed into a plush chair and began fanning herself heavily with a regal hand fan at the chair's side table. Maribelle took a deep breath, purifying any urge to scream and start hitting things with her parasol from her system, and spoke as calm as possible to her new guests.

"Okay, enlighten me. How did this happen?" she spoke in a passive-aggressive tone. "No, no, don't tell me; it was a meteor, from space, right?"

"Y-Yes..." responded Say'ri, stuttering as she kept looking around and wriggled her body. "W-We inspected the m-m-meteors in W-Wyvern Valley, a-and it m-made me like th-this..."

"And it's unfair," interjected a now-relaxed Tiki, "I broke the chunk off, I should've gotten big instead!" Tiki felt her dreams of eating all the meat, sweets, and ale with no stomachache or hangovers leave her mind and it left her heartbroken. "And the rock doesn't even reactivate as we fly it over the ocean either; absolutely perfect." Say'ri looked erratically for cover and focused on a large red and gold curtain covering a window, she started towards it, intending to tear it down and turn it into a makeshift dress.

"YOU TOUCH THAT AND YOU'RE LOSING YOUR ARMS!" yelled Maribelle, causing the Chon'sin warrior to freeze in place out of fear. She took more deep breaths and faced Tiki, continuing her thoughts on the matter. "And why, pray tell, have you bought this rock here? To make more giants? To send me to an asylum?"

"I already told you," spoke Tiki, fanning herself less, "It ran out of power. I used my Dragonstone to take a small chunk off the larger rock and Say'ri caught it, then she grew big and burst right out of her clothes after it glowed a bright green." Say'ri collapsed to her knees, embarrassed at Tiki's words, and hugged herself tighter as if to cover herself better. "After that, it became an obsidian rock and it wouldn't activate again, even for the whole day we carried it across the ocean. From this we can summarize that the meteor triggers growth based on the size of the stone and that it only triggers growth once."

"As long as you keep that thing far away from me, I don't care what you do with it." chimed Maribelle. "But I must ask, why take a stone that doesn't function with you across the ocean? What is the point of it?"

"That's actually why we wanted to see Lucina." answered Tiki. "I don't want to get her hopes up, but if Naga's power can modify this rock, we could forge it into a new stone to allow users to shift sizes, like Dragonstones and Beaststones." By this point, Tiki put the fan down. "I felt bad about fibbing to her, so I wanted to check in on her as well, but I don't know whether or not to tell her about our back-up plan yet. Minerva's roars had guided us to this mansion actually, thankfully too, I would've collapsed to hold Say'ri's new size if we flew all the way to Mount Prism without rest." Maribelle was surprised at Minerva's ability to sense Tiki and use sonar, perhaps she was smarter than she gave her credit for.

"And this rock? Where is it exactly?" inquired Maribelle.

"Outside, in a hollow tree." answered Tiki. "I hid it so nobody would steal it, if one had the urge. I won't lose track of it." Tiki got up and directly faced Maribelle. "You wouldn't mind if we spend the night here, would you?" Maribelle's eye twitched at the prospect of two more guests to look after and feed, but she shook off the oncoming tantrum she was about ready to throw and cleared her throat, addressing Tiki with grace.

"It'd be my honor, Lady Tiki..." Maribelle said, bowing to the Voice of Naga. She then turned to Say'ri, still covering herself on the floor, and spoke with a less graceful tone. "You on the other hand!" Maribelle walked to the stairwell and rang a bell, calling out for some maids to assist her. On cue, three maids came down the stairs, slowing their movement to gawk at Say'ri for a minute before facing their master. Maribelle faced the maids and pointed at Say'ri, and on command, the three women grabbed her arms and helped lift her off the floor.

"W-What is this?!" Say'ri said, confused and flustered by the three pint-sized women holding onto her.

"Now listen here," spoke Maribelle, almost like a drill sergeant, "I won't tolerate anyone, be it man or woman, walking around my manor completely nude! You are to be seen to the fitting room immediately and my tailors will prepare a new outfit for you to wear on your journey to Mount Prism! I do not wish to waste fine cloth, so state your favorite colors, designs, and style of dress when you enter the room immediately, and absolutely no changing your answers! You will be bought to a guest room for your meals with the blinds shut, and so help me gods, if I find you wrapping any of my sheets around yourself to freely walk around the mansion with, not even a staff will be able to cure the hell I will unload onto you!" Maribelle clapped her hands together and the three maids began to drag Say'ri down the hall past Tiki and Maribelle towards the fitting room; the young princess' face turned bright red and she struggled to keep up as the maids drug her down the hall, her feet almost breaking into a run and her footsteps being audible throughout the manor's interior. Tiki turned towards Maribelle after watching the scene unfold and coughed, as if to draw attention to herself.

"You, uh, wouldn't happen to have any fried apples, would you?" asked the manakete. Maribelle wished she had a pillow to yell into, but she tried to keep her frustration in as much as possible, not looking to deny the request of another she called friend during the marches against Valm and Grima; she beckoned Tiki to follow her as they entered the kitchen, Tiki ready to raid the pantry.
131311112112212111111.title: Surprise Guests

1313111121122121111111.author_name: This site is dead.I wana leave
1313111121122121111111.content:
"What about regular apples?"

Maribelle sighed.

"I can see you're very hungry. I'll tell Robin you're here, but feel free to ask the maids for a bite to eat."

Tiki's face lit up, though she tried to avoid letting her grin grow too large. Yet she couldn't shake off her disappointment.

"If I was big as Say'ri or Lucina, think of how much I could eat!"

Maribelle sighed.

"But if you were giant sized, then all this food would seem so tiny to you."

Tiki stopped eating and starred into the distance, as though Maribelle had just revealed some universe breaking though to her.

"Woahh...."

"Anyway, I should inform Robin and Gerome." She said, walking away. Maribelle somehow managed to wait until she was out of site of Tiki before she shook her head.

That woman....

She soon reached her husband and Gerome, both taking a short break from work. Robin was certainly surprised to hear of Tiki and Say'ri, but had no trouble remaining calm. Maribelle couldn't help but admire that.

I suppose this is nothing compared to our war or struggle against Grima.

Gerome however was crabby as always. Did Cherce not show that boy any kind of discipline?

"So now we have two giant woman? It's like some kind of epidemic!"

Robin was deep in thought.

"Magic stones from space turning people into giants... it's almost as hard to process as our adventures.."

Gerome's eyes widened.

"I thought Lucina would be the only one! We have to get rid of those stones Wyvern valley will be overrun with gigantic dragons!"

Maribelle shook her head.

"Actually the stones did not affect Tiki when she was in her dragonic form."

Robin and Gerome relaxed a little.

"That is relief." Robin said. "I suppose Tiki can dispose of them once she returns."

Gerome frowned, though it was hard to separate from his usual expression.

"Or she'll just make herself gigantic so she can eat endlessly..."

Maribele almost chuckled.

"I told Lady Tiki that if she did that, it would only make her meals seem that much smaller by proportion. I hope she got the message."

"Don't count on it." Gerome said.

Robin looked up from his thoughts, now looking focused and determined. A part of Maribelle shivered happily when she saw him that way.

"Our first priorty should be ensuring the giants stay safe. At their size they could easily attract unwanted attention."

"I know that already!" Gerome snapped.

Robin ignored that outburst.

"Next, we need to try and understand these stones and find a way to counteract their magic. If they truly are from space, their may be no record of them and its possible no earthly magic will be able to counteract them. However it's more than likely that in this planet's long history, their is some myth of legend alluding to them."

"Hmm..."

Maribelle hung Robin's arm.

"Sound's like a good plan, dear."

Robin nodded.

"Then I should get to work. Our wine can wait."
1313111121122121111111.title: Neither option?

choices: Tiki comes out to speak with Lucina
Tiki doesn't speak with Lucina, the plan begins
13131111211221211111111.content:
In the distance came the thumping of footsteps, signaling Lucina's return from her bath. Maribelle had kept the information about the possible shrinking stone from Robin and Gerome since Tiki herself wavered on telling Lucina, however, Lucina might think something's up if Tiki came to visit, the girl wasn't as blissfully ignorant as her sister, Maribelle even felt Gerome might've pieced some information together already.

"Robin," whispered Maribelle as the footsteps drew closer, "What should I do about Lady Tiki?" Maribelle thought hard about how to handle this, there was a high chance that Tiki's appearance would end in hurting the young woman's feelings, she didn't want to give Lucina any false hopes or sorrows.

"Discuss it with her first, and if she chooses to see Lucina, then we'll play it off like a gourmet tour." Robin was fully aware all the Shepherds knew of Tiki's love of dining from the countless dinners they shared together as well as the way her mouth watered when she talked of the sweets she sampled at the Hero King Marth's side, it wouldn't be rare for her to go off looking for new cuisine. Robin turned towards Gerome to ask a request; "I know you love Lucina, but can you not tell her about Tiki if she doesn't come out? I don't want the thought of further meteors to get her upset." Gerome knew Robin's heart was in the right place, he treated all his comrades like family, and he would hate to see a close friend upset for any reason; as much as he wanted to tell Lucina to help her, Gerome had to agree.

"Alright," he said begrudgingly before turning to Maribelle, "But I expect Tiki to do the right thing." Maribelle nodded and went back inside to discuss the matter with Tiki, as soon as she closed the back door, Lucina had arrived in the vineyard and faced the two men.

"Hello boys," said the woman with a smile on her face, feeling refreshed and looking radiant from her wash, "Reached a break in your work?" Lucina grabbed the maid from her shoulder and let her to the ground, the woman bowed in return and entered the mansion to continue her duties.

"Yes," said Gerome, "We were in the middle of discussing a plan to sneak you into Ylisstol." This was a fib, but not fully a lie, Robin and Gerome had indeed begun discussing about sneaking Lucina into Ylisstol before Maribelle had come out to talk about Tiki, albeit for a short while. Lucina beamed with glee from Gerome's words.

"That's great!" she cried while clasping her hands together, "Mother's library is an extensive collection of legends & fables and Father's words could encourage me through any situation, they're sure to help us! Thank you Robin, and thank Maribelle too for letting us stay here!"

"Well thanks Lucina," Robin said scratching the back of his head, "I'd do anything to help a good friend in need!" He gave Lucina a few bunches of grapes as a snack and beckoned her and Gerome to a small table on a backyard patio; on it lay a game board and a couple chess pieces, a map of Ylisstol overlayed the board's face. Robin and Gerome sat while Lucina laid down on her stomach to get a clear view of the table, she began to pop the grapes into her mouth as Robin started. "We'll use this to help plan our route. These pieces represent us." He took a White Bishop, Knight, and Queen and placed them at the edge of Ylisstol, before sliding another Bishop to the side. "This one represents Maribelle, in case she's not busy enough to help us out. We'll start at this postion here and swing into the back of the city, before moving into the theater district." Robin became more in-depth in his explanation and begun moving various pieces around, Black Pawns and Rooks to simulate Ylisstol gaurds, as he went over the plan; even though the job of a tactician was to put 100% focus into the plan ahead, Robin couldn't help but let his mind wander to Tiki and Say'ri's presence within the mansion, hoping nothing was going wrong and Maribelle wouldn't flip.

----------

Say'ri had been blown away by the sheer size of the fitting room, even at her Amazonian stature, her head barely touched the high ceiling and various closets and cabinets were distantly placed from one another. She was put behind a privacy screen, but it could only cover her lower half, and some of the tailors were male, so she turned her chest towards a wall to remain decent, even though the male tailors could care less at the sight of a naked woman. Several maids had gathered around Say'ri, some standing atop ladders, and begun taking various measurements of her body; the young woman blushed and squealed as she felt the maids wrapping tape around her body and the cold strips touch her smooth, sensitive skin.

"Favorite colors?" spoke a male tailor, a slight accent in his voice. Say'ri was alarmed by his sharp tone and loud voice, the man was clearly a professionalist, and his direct inquiry with no prior small talk had caught her off guard.

"U-Um, p-purple and lavender..." answered Say'ri, completely flustered.

"Favorite designs?"

"F-Flowers are nice, an-"

"Style of choice?"

"Wh-Wha?! B-But I-" Say'ri had no time to answer as he clapped his hands, beckoning the maids to come over. He took a chart of measurements from them and glanced over it quickly before clapping his hands once more and beckoning his fellow tailors to work; his expression clearly showed he knew what he was doing and was a born leader. Say'ri looked on in awe as she saw the synchronization of all the tailors, almost like bees, gathering the various cloths, cutting the material they needed, and sewing material with such precision; either she was around true professionals or completely crazy people. She ducked behind the curtain, overwhelmed by the site, and curled up into a fetal position. "Someone get me out of this crazy mansion!" was the one thought that ran through her head.

----------

"And that's the plan." Robin had finished up with his explanation and successfully moved the four pieces into the center of the castle next to a King and Queen, representing Chrom and Sumia. Lucina and Gerome were in awe with Robin's strategy, it just seemed too perfect to go wrong, there were no flaws or do-overs in his moves; the man had a natural talent for battle plans and Validar would've wasted it on resurrecting Grima.

"This is...Perfect." complimented Gerome, mouth still agape at Robin's plans and suggestions. He was especially amazed at the thought of using fireworks and theater props to dress up Lucina like a float to simulate a parade and break right into the front gates of Castle Ylisstol right in front of the unsuspecting population.

"It's like they never knew a giant maiden was there!" Lucina absolutely fell in love with the plan, but still had one hang-up on it; the Black Knight, simulating Cynthia, surrounded by Pawns of Pegasus Knights. "But Cynthia and I share a strong sisterly bond, she'll know that I'll be there. She will feel it in the Mark of Naga upon her back." Any other tactician would pass that off as hogwash, but Robin could feel Validar's influence run through his blood in the past and there were times where Robin felt like Chrom was his right arm; the ties of family blood and true friendship ran deeper than one would think.

"You have a point there," replied Robin, "We'll have to have a distraction to keep her busy." Robin fumbled at the thought, there was one distraction he had in mind, Tiki in her dragon form taking to the skies to alert the Pegasus Knights and lead them away, but that would require her presence to be made known to Lucina beforehand, and the plan could most certainly fail if the threat of more meteorites caused Lucina's heart to waver and her emotions to overwhelm her. Perhaps he could use a troop of butlers disguised as brigands? No, no, that would cause them to get hurt, he needed another disguise to minimize the threat to all his friends.

"In any case, it's a good plan, despite the wall Cynthia presents." complimented Lucina, "When will this take place?"

"Tonight." answered Robin, "I wish you two could stay the night longer, but you wish for a quick cure Lucina, and I intend to deliver you one. Besides, I think Maribelle's going a little crazy with all that's been going on." Robin giggled a bit, it was cruel of him, but the thought of his wife running ragged over the slightest issues to trigger her OCD tendencies always made him laugh, it was the most attractive feature of her he had always thought.

"That's fine," answered Gerome, "Minerva wishes to stretch her wings anyways instead of being cooped up in a stable all day."

"Yes," added in Lucina, who began to stand from her position, "I wish to see Father and Mother as soon as possible anyways, I do miss their company a little." Lucina resolved to leave the two alone after the war on Grima in order not to mess with the timeline further, but the other children of the future were totally fine with not returning to their period and quickly adapted to the past, Brady, and Owain especially, the former becoming a pro violinist in Ylisse, the latter becoming an experienced stage actor and expecting a child with Severa; Lucina couldn't help but feel a little jealous of her baby self getting to spend time with Chrom, Sumia, and even Cynthia more than her.

"It's settled then." Robin said, taking a sip from a teacup next to the board. He set it down and got up before looking at the couple in front of him. "Operation: 'Firework Emblem' begins tonight!" Robin expected a good reaction from his thought up name, but both Lucina and Gerome just looked at him funny; it may have been the lamest thing the two had ever heard the star tactician say.

Tiki came out of the mansion. She immediately caught sigh of Lucina, waved to her and ran towards her.

"Hi Lucina!"

Lucina smiled.

"Oh Tiki, you made it. It took you long than I expected."

As Tiki began to explain, Gerome stood behind Lucina, miming something to he formed a circle shape with his end to fingers and made an x with his hands, hoping Tiki would get the hint.

"We came through Wyvern Valley and Say'ri picked up on of those rocks and ended up a giant as well."

Lucina's eyes widened.

"What?"

The sound of Gerome's palm hitting his head filled the air. Lucina cast her husband an odd look. Robin sighed glancing at Tiki.

"I'm guessing Maribelle didn't catch up to you...."

Just then the door flung open and Maribelle came running after Tiki.

"Lady Tiki there you are! You mustn't tell Lucina that-"

Lucina coughed and glowered.

"Tell me what?"

Maribelle looked aside.

"Never mind..."

Gerome sighed.

"I'm sorry Lucina, we didn't want to add to your worries."

She placed her hands on her hips.

"I'm a big girl, you don't need to keep anything from me. You shouldn't be keeping anything from me!"

Gerome flinched, but said nothing. Tiki frowned at the drama she had unwittingly caused.

"I am sorry I did not know-"

"Lucina don't take this persoanlly, we didn't want you worrying about the stones in the valley when we were still trying to help."

1313111121122121111111111.content:
"...Fine." huffed Lucina, who clearly was upset over the thought of danger in Wyvern Valley and Tiki's secrets. It's true that giant humans paled in comparison to Grima on the threat scale to this world, but the thought of an innocent villager having their life changed by the rocks or a large brigand bringing terror to local villagers still ate up at her. "But we are to immediately work on disposal of these rocks as soon as this adventure for the shrinking elixir ends. Even if I return to normal, I want nobody else to have to deal with this."

"Thank you Lucina," chimed in Robin, "We didn't mean to get you upset, sorry for trying to hide this from you." Robin took his signature Plegian coat from a rack on the patio and adjusted it over his upper body, a sign that the work day was over. "Shall we move inside to prepare for tonight? We should stock up on supplies for the operation and say goodbye to Brady and Morgan." Robin began walking around the side yard to the front door of the mansion, Lucina and Gerome trailing behind him. "You know," Robin started, trying to lighten the mood, "Brady's going to miss you when you get back to normal Lucina, he'll be asking 'What happened to the giant lady?' when he learns to talk!" Robin's little joke worked as Lucina giggled at his comment, Gerome even cracking a smile; from behind the joyful trio, Maribelle and Tiki had stayed behind for a private conversation.

"Well you aren't great at breaking news to people," commented Maribelle, "But at least you didn't tell Lucina about your little 'Giantstone' project. The poor girl would've been in tears after all she had to go through to get here."

"Yeah, evidently my people skills aren't good, but I won't tell Lucina about this until I find her a real cure, and I won't rest until there is one. I'm skeptical about this 'shrinking elixir' myself, but if anyone can truly cure Lucina's condition, it's Naga." Maribelle smiled at Tiki's resolve and the two moved to rejoin the other three Shepherds; Maribelle couldn't help but think how dense Tiki was for such a strong, brilliant, and deep Voice of the Divine Dragon, but it was without question that she was one of the kindest people this world has ever seen. "And Maribelle? Can I take some snacks for the road? Like a turkey or two?"

"She certainly has a one-track mind..." Maribelle had thought to herself.

The five comrades gathered together in the manor, Robin and Gerome had gone around gathering materials for the trip, Tiki raided the kitchen, and Maribelle helped Lucina adjust her clothes to provide minimum attention-grabbing and maximum movement; Robin's plan involved dressing Lucina like a parade float, so she figured the jungle accessories over the swimsuit-like attire could easily pass her off as a giant dancer effigy. Everyone had fully gathered in the parlor, a few butlers and maids gathering alongside the quintet, intending to help their masters and guests in their journey to Ylisstol.

"Lady Tiki," started Robin, "It's rude of me to ask, but will you accompany us on our journey to Ylisstol? I think you'd be a big help to our plan if you could manage it." Tiki moved her hand to her chin for a few seconds, internally weighing her options, before answering Robin.

"Sure, anything to help my good friends out." Everyone was thrilled with Tiki's answer and equally flattered by her declaration of friendship. Tiki had figured she could easily depart from Ylisstol, double back to Themis, grab the stone, and go see Naga with nobody prying into her secret plan, the only problem lying in carrying Say'ri around without raising alarms or passing out.

"And Say'ri?" asked Gerome, "She came with you, did she not?"

"She's currently in fitting," replied Tiki, "I don't know how long that'll go over, I don't think she can join us."

"N-No, that's quite alright..." spoke Say'ri's voice from down the hall, alarming everyone to turn to her direction. The young woman had come out from her fitting accompanied by a team of tailors and maids, towering over them three times their body size and her face completely red. She wore a large, stunning Victorian ball gown in the colors of purple, lavender, white, and gold, her arms were covered by radiant silk white gloves, white roses decorated the lining of her dress, and a large purple headband adorned her jet black hair. The party couldn't help but stare at Say'ri's elegant dress and admire how well she wore it, but Say'ri only looked completely embarrassed and urged everyone to stop looking at her, she still wasn't adjusted to her size or attire. Maribelle gave a smug look and addressed the Chon'sin Amazon.

"You look positively dashing, darling!" Maribelle gave a audible chuckle before continuing her talk with Say'ri. "You're surprised at the speed you came out of there, yes? I hired only the finest tailors in Themis, many of whom had served my family in the past, their work in dress-making is unchallenged, both in quality and speed! Yes dear Say'ri, you truly look like the princess you are! How do you feel?"

"Well..." Say'ri replied, still blushing, "It's a beautiful dress, it's just...I preferred the kimonos and warrior attire of my homeland..."

"Oh come now!" shouted Maribelle, "You did tell them your preferences, did you not?"

"H-Hey!" replied Say'ri, once again shaken by Maribelle's words. "I tried to tell them, but they got to work immediately as they got my measurements! I had no opportunity!"

"Ah, I see. They must do things differently in Valm." Maribelle walked up to Say'ri and dismissed the maids and tailors, she looked straight up into the blushing woman's eyes. "Once we get Lucina a remedy for her size, then I'll give you only the finest Themis etiquette lessons I can muster."

"You look very beautiful Say'ri," spoke Lucina, "I wish I could've worn a dress like that in the future." Say'ri smiled at the Ylissean princess' warm words as Maribelle smugly laughed, taking Lucina's compliment to Say'ri as if it were meant for her and her staff. "Will you join us on our journey?"

"It would be my honor Lucina," Say'ri responded with a bow, albeit stiff with presence of a corset, "We're both in this together now, quite literally in fact." With the formalities settled, Robin and Maribelle retreated upstairs to kiss their children goodbye while Lucina, Gerome, Tiki, and Say'ri went outside with the caravan of maids and butlers to wait for the couple, Gerome petting Minerva and mounting her when control was returned to him from the stable butlers. When Robin and Maribelle joined the party, they all set out in a march towards Ylisstol.

The night had fallen when the group arrived, just as Robin had planned for, and they all stood from a Cliffside, looking down at the brightly-lit city.

"Father and Mother are inside, I can just feel it." Lucina truly did feel a sensation in her left eye to indicate Chrom's presence, like a radar, and knew Sumia was close behind like the faithful and loving wife she was. She squinted her eyes and saw a few black silhouettes in the distance soaring around the exalt's castle; the Pegasus Knights, lead by Cynthia, who had received the position from Cordelia when she had taken leave to Regna Ferox to live with Lon'qu. Lucina's eye twitched at sight of Cynthia's patrol as she felt her presence, and deeper down, she could even feel the presence of her baby self and Owain in the city, since the latter had a birthmark as well upon his arm; Lucina had felt one more presence of her bloodline in Owain's viscinity, could it be the child Severa was pregnant with? Now aware of Owain's presence, Lucina had now thought Lissa could be in the city as well, her not being as strong to detect since she had no mark; usually Lissa was farming out of town with her husband, Donnel, and her mother-in-law, but the three were free to make trips to the castle when they came to the farmer's market in town, and Lissa took that completely for granted to mess with her brother and sample the luxury food she used to enjoy. Lucina kneeled down and faced Robin to relay the information to him; "I can sense Father and Cynthia's presence, but I can feel Owain in the city as well, near the theater district. There is one more in the area too, I think it may be Owain and Severa's child, though she's still pregnant. Aunt Lissa could be here as well, be careful."

"Thank you Lucina, I'll keep that in mind." responded Robin. He looked at the city for a bit, thinking of how to handle the new intel, before turning to the group. "Okay everyone, we're going to have two teams take charge of this operation. Lucina will be the captain of Team A, who will work on bringing her into the theater district to dress her up. Tiki will be the captain of Team B, tasked with distracting the Pegasus Knights and leading them out of the city. Team A will be a couple ground units to simulate a parade, Team B will be a few Pegasus Riders and another flying mount rider as a co-captain. By this logic, I and Say'ri will be a part of Team A, but we're going to need a co-captain for Team B." Robin looked at Gerome & Minerva and turned to Maribelle and her black Pegasus; both riders flew with their mount as one and cared for them with equal amounts of love and care, both were more than suited to help Tiki ride through the skies, but both could easily compliment the show they'll put on in main street. "Gerome, Maribelle, I'm going to need one of you to help Tiki distract the Pegasus Knights. Could one of you help her divert Cynthia's attention from Lucina?"

"On patrol! We're on patrol! We're on patro-o-ol~!" Cynthia flew through the skies with her squadron of Pegasus Knights in her stead, happy to feel the wind through her blue pigtails and even happier to guard her family and her home alongside Ylisstol's best. She had practiced her skill every day in the future, with the Shepherds, and after Grima's defeat, she wanted nothing more than to be a hero that'd make her mother proud, and while Sumia insisted that Cynthia had already made her proud, Cynthia always wanted to go one step beyond, to protect all important to her; Chrom, Sumia, Lissa, Brady, and most importantly, her beloved sister Lucina. The other Knights had thought her a klutz and a crazy person with all her fighting poses and theme tunes she sang, but they couldn't doubt Cynthia's raw skill and bravery, and they all looked up to their captain with complete admiration. The girl happily looked upon her beloved city to watch for any intruders, when a Knight came up at her starboard to give a report.

"Captain!" he spoke with utmost respect and a powerful voice. "A black wyvern approaches, a masked hoodlum rides it!"

"Masked?" thought Cynthia, "I only know one masked wyvern rider, and that's..." She looked dead ahead and saw a man with burnt orange hair riding upon a black wyvern at a high speed towards them, his mask came into view as he slowed his charge. "Gerome!" Cynthia happily flew towards her brother-in-law with her Knights in tow, concerned for their captain's safety. "It's alright guys, Gerome's family, you can stand down!" Cynthia lurched forward for a moment to pull Gerome in for a hug. "Oh Gerome, it's been forever! It must've been a whole 2 weeks since I went to Valm! How is Lucina doing anyways? Any new stories to share?"

"About that," Gerome responded, "I've been meaning to ask you; are there any other secrets you wish to tell Lucina?"

"Oh, you heard about the doll thing, huh?" Cynthia just giggled at Gerome's annoyed expression. "I couldn't help it, it was just such a cute little love story to tell your kids!" Gerome coughed and blushed, he hadn't even thought about kids with Lucina yet, he had to nail this distraction quickly before Cynthia gets more embarrassing.

"Look, Cynthia, I've come to help you run..." Gerome sighed as he tried to choke the words out, "...'Hero Training' at Chrom's request. There's a group of Pegasus Knights accompanying me and our task is to hunt down a dragon in the area and haul it in for capture." Gerome hoped Cynthia would buy it, she had never seen Maribelle's staff before, so his ruse could easily get past her, and by the time she realizes the dragon was Tiki and everything was a trick, Lucina will already be in the castle. Gerome sweat as Cynthia rubbed her chin.

"Father really said that? But I've been showing him all my newest tricks, spears, and fighting poses..." Cynthia wasn't buying it. "I dunno Gerome, I think I'm just gonna check with Father real quick about this..." She prepared her reins to make a descent.

"I-I'll do a set of poses with you!" Cynthia stopped her movement and stared at Gerome. "I-If you run this exercise, I'll...Help you with your hero poses..." Gerome felt sick at the thought of saying it. "Anything for Lucina," he thought, "I just have to buy her some time..." Cynthia's eyes lit up and she let out a squeal.

"The return of the Dragon Hero Gerome?!" she cried. "Ah, the Justice Cabal is complete again! Yes, yes! Let's go get a dragon!" Cynthia turned to her men and gave the order: "Everyone, our Exalt has ordered us to capture a dragon with Gerome's help! This will build bonds and skills between you and your Pegasi! Now men, let's go bag us a dragon!"

"Yes Captain!" shouted the platoon of riders. Gerome pointed towards the woods far from Ylisstol and Cynthia excitedly led the troop towards the designated area.

"The things I do for love..." thought Gerome, as he rubbed his hand against his forehead. He beckoned Minerva to follow the Knights and they soared through the night sky.

----------

The theater district was relatively empty, devoid of an audience with no plays to be run. In a large run-down theater, the couple of Owain and Severa were hard at work trying to get the place up and running again; the two had received permission and a loan from Chrom to re-open an old, famous theater to begin a family troupe in, hoping the shows could drive up the morale of the people and tourism. Owain hammered at nails and painted old sets with vibrant pastels, shouting lines and making poses on the spot as he worked, Severa sat down in a seat usually reserved for audience members, a medium-sized bulge in her stomach signifying her 4 months of pregnancy. Severa watched her husband's one-man show and scoffed at his antics.

"You know," started the raven-haired beauty, "If you worked as much as you played, we'd be done with this dump by now." Severa moved a hand to her stomach and rubbed it tenderly. "Think: What will Ophelia think when she sees her father is more of a kid than she will be?" Owain merely chuckled and struck another eccentric pose.

"Oh Severa," spoke the brown-haired youth, "I'm merely practicing for when we open this theater! It is our duty, as heroes of the future, to bring smiles and instill bravery in the hearts of men and women everywhere, and I wish for Ophelia to see our noble deeds and grow from it!" He took a knee and pumped his fist down, as if to look deep. "She is, 'The Chosen One'..."

"Okay crazy." retorted Severa, not impressed with Owain's display. "And explain to me this 'Chosen One' role? Is it going to make her a successful child? Give her friends? Make her, you know, normal?" Owain took a normal stance and actually spoke his thoughts normally for once.

"Well, I was thinking we should train her to be a professional Dark Mage so she could use magic in our shows, it'd really wow the other kids and make her a lot of friends! We could get Henry to train her so she could learn about animals too, and she could use his nature talk to grow up and be a doctor too! You know, just in case she wants more than the Family Troupe." Severa huffed at Owain's remarks, she didn't want to admit it, but he did make sense, even if he suggested Henry as a teacher; it was a cold day in hell when Henry sounded like a desirable teacher. Owain looked a little sad at his wife's face and tried to get her in a good mood. "I didn't mean to get you upset...Here, let's do this: Give me a scenario and I'll act it out, it'll help the writing and feel of our shows we put on!" Severa sighed at the childish suggestion, she couldn't get what she found so cute and attractive about him.

"...Bears." she said curtly. Owain took a deep breath and took a pose.

"Kneel, foul beast! Your terror to the local hunters and villagers ends here! May your pelt lay at the cold end of my steel! BUUURNING BLADE!!!" Owain looked absolutely ecstatic. "Quick, give me another!"

"Risen." responded Severa, now paying more attention.

"Corpses of the Damned! May you return to your eternal slumber as the dark power escapes from your veins! The light of my blade paints an arc across the ether! RADIANT DAAAAWN!!!" Owain was completely jazzed up now. "Another, something unexpected!"

"G-Giant Lucina?!"

"Ooh, nice suggestion, and nice feeling! Woe is me, my beloved cousin now a colossal puppet of my sworn evil enemy! Fear not, brave Lucina! I will free you from your curse! ILLUSORY REVELA-"

"Gawds, you blockhead! Look behind you!" Severa yelled as she pointed past Owain. He looked past the set props he was painting and saw Lucina trying to crawl behind a background, 60 feet tall and barely covered by the pastel sky and trees; Owain leapt back with a yell and fell off the stage, almost taking the expression "break a leg" seriously. Robin, Maribelle, and Say'ri poked their heads out from behind a wooden bush and saw the two future children staring at Lucina, mouths agape.

"Whoops," said Robin, "I, uh, thought this theater was empty. Sorry Lucina."

"No, forgive me Robin," retorted Lucina, "I got a little charged up and didn't notice Owain's presence. My fault."

"Hey, hey!" Severa said while snapping her fingers, Owain shuddering next to her legs, "Can someone explain to us what the hell is going on?!"

It took a while to explain the situation, even with Lucina's cliffnotes, but Severa and Owain got it quite well, and the two had managed to calm down well enough at the sight of their giant, half-nude comrade and the Amazonian Say'ri. A light had glimmered in Owain's eyes at the mention of size-enhancing meteors, as he thought aloud it'd be neat to get his hands on some; Lucina had verbally reprimanded him for even thinking it.

"So, let me get this straight: there's these space rocks making people huge and you're looking for a legendary cure?" Owain was taking notes on a pad, looking to make it a scenario for a play. "And you want to borrow our props to make a float out of your huge body? To sneak into the castle?"

"That's right." responded Lucina, "I don't wish to impose on you both, but is there any way you can help us?" Owain had gotten fired up at Lucina's question and broke his pencil in half with his fingers, striking a pose to express his supercharged state.

"My dear cousin, you may have our sacred family props, passed down through generations!"

"Really?!" responded Lucina, clasping her hands together, "Thank you Owa-"

"But on one condition! In exchange for our sacred sequins, our consecrated cloths, our shimmering streamers, our-"

"Spit it out dear! We're busy!" shouted Maribelle, tiring of her best friend's son's antics. Her outburst had thrown off everyone, even Severa, who wasn't easily fazed by words.

"R-Right, Auntie Maribelle..." responded Owain dejectedly. He twiddled his thumbs together and spoke softly. "If it's alright with you Lucina..."

"Absolutely!" responded Owain. "I'll just grab a couple props out of my costume and special effects trunks and we'll get around to dressing her up! You guys have a float bed already prepared, right?"

"Yes," responded Lucina, "It's out in the back."

"Great! I'll meet you guys out there!" With that, Owain dashed off, charging with an energy as if he were leading the charge in a war.

Lucina's group waited outside with Maribelle's servants and the float bed, making themselves comfy and chatting all the while.

"So Severa," began Lucina, "Forgive me for prying, but how long have you been carrying Owain's child?" The mercenary blushed and put one hand to her stomach, stroking her raven pigtail with the other.

"Four months." responded Severa. "It was right after we defeated Grima, we had that huge party afterwards, Owain gave me a ring to actually seal us being together, and things just sort of...happened in the tents." She gave a warm smile, a rarity for the usually sour girl. "They're saying it'll be a girl, Owain decided on 'Ophelia' for a name; I honestly thought he'd call her 'Darksworn Bloodmane' or something stupid like that." Lucina gave a chuckle, it definitely sounded like a name that screamed "Owain's Child". "I think we'll be good parents. Well, at least I will. I'm looking forward to wrapping her in my arms, singing lullabies to her, and rubbing her cute face in Mom and Dad's faces."

"I wish you two luck," responded Lucina with a smile, "I have no doubt she'll be a beautiful child."

"How about you Luce?" asked Severa. "You and Gerome thinking about children yet?"

"T-That's-!" Lucina's face turned red and she pushed her fingers together, clearly embarrassed by the topic. She fumbled for an answer. "I-It's just, we, uh, we've been taking things slowly for a while, we've just been so content with tending to the wyverns, the thought really hasn't crossed us yet!" She calmed down a bit more and adopted more of a solemn expression. "I think Gerome would be a great father, but what if I'm stuck like this? It'd make it much harder to...you know..." Severa eyed up the princess before giving a response.

"Yeah, I can see the problem in that. I mean I guess you could have a child if you put him in your-"

"Stop!" shouted Maribelle, "My ears scream at such unrefined speech! For the love of gods, please stop!" Robin and Lucina blushed trying to remove Severa's mental image from their heads, and Say'ri looked almost ready to hurl.

"I'm back!" Owain ran out to the float to rejoin the party, carrying a cart of multi-colored cloths, long ribbons, and shiny decorations with him. His upbeat attitude clashed with the mood of the party before him. "Uh, did something happen while I was gone?"

"It's, uh, nothing Owain..." Robin got up from the float bed and walked over to Owain, dusting off his coat and coughing the blush from his face. "Let's see what you got here." Robin rummaged through the cart and grabbed all of Owain's decorations, admiring the texture of the cloth at hand and the luster of the metallic decorations.

"I have only the best costumes and props at our disposal!" remarked Owain, feeling pride in his tools. "I've named them all individually to compliment our family's acting! What you hold is the Flannel of the Wolves; it's brilliant purple luster can only be complimented by the Shiny Sequins of Shiny Shine!"

"Oh gods..." remarked Maribelle, shaking her head with her hand to her face at Owain's childish dialogue. Robin ran his fingers across the cloth and inspected each decoration, smiling at the quality Owain's collection.

"This is perfect Owain!" said Robin, very impressed by Owain's collection. "These can easily dress Lucina up and compliment the show we'll put on; you're a natural stage talent!" Owain blushed and rubbed the back of his hair.

"Well thanks Robin, that's good to hear when we haven't even had our first show yet!"

"And the type of show?" inquired Severa. "I'm assuming you'll want something to detract attention from Lucina's mass on the float?"

"We were thinking magic to captivate the audience's attention." responded Robin. "Both Maribelle and I are accomplished magicians, and some of our staff know some card and rope tricks that could impress an audience." Maribelle adopted a smug look, flattered by Robin's words, she couldn't see it with her eyes shut, but Severa was making a funny face to imitate Maribelle. Owain raised his hand to get Robin's attention.

"If it's fine," he asked, "Could Severa and I put our own show on the schedule?"

"Sure, what is it?" Owain took a huge breath and struck a pose.

"A drama of two young warriors, madly in love, as they travel the land to protect the innocents before them! It is dubbed: 'Owain Dark and Severa Light: Avengers of Righteous Justice'!" The setup sounded very familiar to Robin, being a topic of he and Owain's talks in the Shepherd barracks. "It's only a sneak preview for now, since we still need to get the theater up and running, and as the years go on, we're going to put Ophelia in the show once we reach the 'Children of the Future' arc." He jumped up on the float as he continued explaining the act. "It will be a hero show put on with fake swords and a lot of heroic poses; I'll be playing myself, and playing Severa..." Owain looked at the rest of the party for a moment, eyeing up some of the maids before stopping at Maribelle. "Um, Auntie Maribelle? Would you be okay with playing Severa?" Maribelle was taken back by Owain's words and expressed shock at the inquiry.

"M-Me?! Why not Severa?! She's in the play's name!"

"Uh," responded Severa, pointing at the bulge in her stomach, "Baby on board? Hello? I won't be good to act in these things for another 5 or 6 months." Maribelle fumbled, trying to find an excuse not to perform in the play.

"B-But I've never held a sword in my life! Isn't Severa a mercenary?!"

"Don't worry," cheerfully responded Owain, "I'll give you some quick practice! It's only just play anyways, not real fighting, so you won't have to take a battle stance or anything." Maribelle ran out of excuses, she lowered her head dejectedly, defeated by Owain. Robin came over and laid his hand upon her shoulder.

"Don't worry honey," spoke Robin softly and gently, "I'm sure you'll be a great actor! Trust in Owain on this!"

"I think I'm going to cry..." complained Maribelle.

"We could get these butlers and maids to play villagers, and Say'ri could be the demon terrorizing them!" Now Say'ri looked shocked by Owain's words.

"M-Me?!" she cried, "B-But why?! I've never acted before in my life!"

"Well, to be honest," responded Owain, "It's because you're so big, but you still look like three people on top of one another, so you could easily play the villain role and hide in plain sight to boot." Say'ri looked flustered, this time it was Lucina to provide encouragement.

"Come on Say'ri, I bet you would make a great actor. I only wish I could see it instead of hearing it."

"I-If you insist..." responded the Chon'sin warrior. "B-But I don't think I can do the villain role to well, I've never done anything evil at all..."

"It'll be easy!" encouraged Owain, "Just do a lot of 'BWA HA HA!'s and strike some poses too, but they need to be evil poses, ones that provoke fear into the hearts of men and women everywhere!" Say'ri wasn't following Owain, she thought he may have become crazier than usual after the war on Grima. "And we need some special effects, do you have anything for that Robin?"

"Some fireworks," he responded, "And if you want, I can use some of my tomes to help give some more magical weight to your act."

"Perfect!" he responded, "Then let's get to decorating!"

"Alright, places everyone!" shouted Severa, imitating a director. "We need this thing to be perfect if you want to sneak your little giantess into the castle! Let's get to work!"

----------

"Did you hear? There's a parade that's going to go on in main street in a few minutes, there's flyers all over the place about it!" The people of Ylisstol had gathered in the plaza, ready for whatever show was going on. The guards lined the streets to prevent anyone from interfering with the performance and aid anyone who may get hurt, they were ready to escort the Themis performers and Dark-Light Troupe into the castle. Severa had spoken with the head guards beforehand and received permission from the head guard to end their performance in the castle yard and entertain the Shepherds for a while, she and Owain were two of Chrom's close companions from the war, the guard wasn't about to go against the Exalt's wishes to allow them free access to the castle. The citizens squeezed tight together and conversed loudly about what the show could be about and what type of acts they'll see, children chattered with glee, hoping to see a mystical performance that'd blow them away. Suddenly, a loud horn rang out, gathering the attention of everyone present to a large float and platoon of performers, really Maribelle's servants.

"Ladies & Gentlemen!" spoke Robin, clad in a mask and magician's outfit, "The Themis Family and Ylisstol's own Dark-Light Troupe are pleased to present a magic show and heroic play that will leave you all dazzled beyond your wildest imaginations! May you enjoy our show for tonight and share the bright feelings of joy with those you love and care for!" He pointed to the sky and on cue, a set of fireworks had shot into the sky, exploding into a shower of bright rainbows. "It's showtime!" The float moved and the magic began; at the center of the float laid Lucina, obscured by a mass of cloth and papier-mâché.

"I hope the act goes well..." she thought. All she could do is hope her friends came through for her so she could see Father, Mother, and Cynthia soon.

131311112112212111111111111111.content:
Robin and Maribelle went through their tomes, both light and dark magic, each complimenting the other's display.

The audience marveled at the display, with many making approving noises or cheers. It was easy enough to keep their eyes off Lucina's hiding place.

Maribelle and Robin launched one last display, then as the audience clapped and hollered Maribelle used the opportunity to run behind the curtain and changed into Severa's mercenary outfit and donned a wig.

"And now for the next part of our show, Owain and Severa's troupe will now be performing uh-." Robin pulled a piece of paper out of his pocket, unable to remember the improbably long and flowery name Owain had come up with for his play. "'Owain Dark and Severa Light: Avengers of Righteous Justice!" Robin cringed a little as he said that, feeling like he had tasted more ham than Stahl ate in a month.

Owain did not seem to notice, immediately leaping out, fully in costume, his arms raised high.

"Thank you, thank you! GOOD EVENING YISSTOL!" He yelled like a rockstar. "Are you ready to be entertained? Because I have a story all about THE GREATEST HEROES IN YLISSE!"

Owain continued to showboat and work the crowd, partly for his amusment and partly to allow Maribelle time to get ready. She looked down at herself and frowned.

"Now that I think about it, I really should be Lissa rather than Severa."

Fortunately, Robin had come to see her.

"We already had a good actor for Lissa, but none for Severa."

Maribelle furrowed her brow.

"Do I really remind you of her?"

"Of course not, I just trust you with this."

Maribelle seemed a little happier, but was still uneasy.

"How am I suppose to portray her?"

"Act grumpy and emotionally evasive? I must confess, I'm a tactician not a playwright. Don't worry if you're not perfect, your performance only needs to be good enough to hold everyone's attention until we're inside the castle."

Maribelle gave it some thought then brightened up a little.

"Hmm.. I think I can manage that, but I'm still not sure how to project Severa's persona."

"You could always ask her for advice."

Maribelle shuddered.

"I-I think I'll be fine."

"Very well. You should get out there soon, I don't know how long Owain can keep that up."

They listened, hearing the shouts of his yelling even from here.

"I'd say he could go a good while longer. He does enjoy the sound of his own voice"

Robin chuckled.

"That maybe, but we don't know how long the audience would enjoy it."

Maribelle cautiously pushed through the stage curtain. As it turned out, Owain was doing a fine job keeping the crowd's attention, with a combination of his hammy sayings and his flashy sword work.

"HEYYYAHHHHH!H" He yelled, jumping and slicing through the air, and landing with surprising grace. As he did, he suddenly noticed Maribelle and gestured to her.

"Ah my lovely wife, Severa is here. Say hello the audience my lovely."

"Umm... no..." Maribelle imitated Severa's poutey face and looked away.

Owain seemed surprised, but had no trouble rolling with it.

"Haha she's just shy." Owain said. "And now we're ready to begin! Lights!"

Torches lit and Owain began reciting. The play turned out to be an embellished adaption of the war against Valm and the Grim leaf, while also detailing Owain, Severa and Lucina's journey through time and exaggerating Owain's prowess and heroism.

While somewhat over the top, the audience enjoyed it, and heartily clapped and cheered. They soon reached the castle, and at the sight of Robin, the guards cleared the way.

"Good we're in." Robin said. "Now to find Chrom."
