1313111121122121111111111111111.content:
"Good, you made it, how was the show?" Severa approached the party who had entered the castle, guards around her, the castle's front doors wide open.

"Oh, it was GREAT!" shouted Owain with childlike glee. "I got to show off my latest hero poses, and Auntie Maribelle did a great job at the swordplay, and Say'ri was really scary as the monster, and-"

"Okay Ham Knight, didn't ask for a full review." Owain was used to Severa's derogatory remarks at this point and took it as a compliment, he knew full well she didn't mean the name-calling just for the sake of being mean. Severa turned around to the royal guard to address them. "Now, for you boys, we have a full line-up of stage magicians tonight to help raise Shepherd morale. Just head to the barracks and they'll take the stage in a few. We'll get the door for you on our way in." Severa was referring to Maribelle's servants with their birthday party-tier magic shows, the final distraction in Robin's careful plan.

"Thank you kindly, milady! May Lord Chrom enjoy your act!" The guards gave a salute to Severa, who in turn saluted back, before clearing the courtyard and going to the barracks. Severa looked around for a bit and walked to the cloth mass of the float, pulling some of it up and coming face-to-face with Lucina's massive branded eye.

"The coast is clear," she whispered, "Haul it before someone comes looking around!" With that, Severa leapt off the float and begun to pull a rope attached to the front, the rest of the party joined her taking more ropes until the front of the float was pulled off. Lucina crawled out from beneath her large blanket and peeked around quickly, before lunging into the door and waving her friends to hurry. When everyone had come inside, she pulled the massive doors shut and got to work looking for Chrom and Sumia.

----------

"I see it! It went that way!" yelled a Pegasus Knight. The group of Knights flew through the air chasing after their dragon with skillful evasive maneuvers in response to the dragon's hailstorm of ice breath. Its shining golden and emerald body and red eyes seemed to illuminate the night, making it an easy target to spot, but its speed in the air made it a hard target to catch.

"Fall back!" yelled Cynthia, worried about the well-being of her men. Gerome had taken her and the other Knights' weapons for this mission, the only way they could fight the dragon was to tire it out and capture it with a net.

"I told you it'd be a hero's challenge!" yelled Gerome. He made no attempt to help the Knights, which Cynthia did not think odd for a training mission, but what seemed odd was that the dragon seemed to be purposefully missing the Knights with careful precision. "You won't be able to catch it with that predictable movement!"

"Predictable?" thought Cynthia, "My movements are too predictable?" She watched the dragon dance gracefully in the air, barrel rolling, doing full loops, lunging down at the enemy while firing its ice breath, when suddenly, it started to dart towards her. Suddenly, she had a thought; Cynthia released the reins of her Pegasus and grabbed the net, standing up on the saddle of her Pegasus while taking a good look at the dragon.

"Uhh, Cynthia?" inquired Gerome, concerned she had completely lost it. "What are you doing?"

"Something completely unpredictable!" She jumped from her saddle towards the dragon, intending to capture it with the net by the head and drag it to the ground. Gerome yelled for her sister-in-law, afraid she'd become a splat on the ground from their height in the air. The rest of the Pegasus Knights looked at their captain with concern. The dragon's eyes grew wide. Before gravity could take effect, the dragon had sped up and dived under Cynthia to catch her upon her back; the girl had bagged the net around the dragon's neck in return. "Caught ya!"

"ARE YOU CRAZY?! You could've died from this height!" Cynthia released the net when she heard the voice come from the dragon's maw, the other Knights looked on in confusion, Gerome had slapped his hand to his face.

"Hey, wait a minute..." Cynthia pondered. "Lady Tiki, is that you?"

"Oh...Oh crap..." responded Tiki, realizing her mistake. She had soared to the ground and landed, transforming back to her manakete form as Cynthia dismounted her. The rest of the Knights and Gerome & Minerva had landed around the duo. "Uh..." Tiki coughed. "Hey, Cynthia, long time no see...?"

"B-But-! This was supposed to be a dragon! Not our friend! I knew you were going easy on us!" Cynthia turned to Gerome and puffed her cheeks out, mad at her brother-in-law. "Gerome! You took us off patrol to play?! Why would you do that?!"

"Oh boy..." thought Gerome, he knew this wouldn't be easy. He took a deep breath, ready for his in-law's frantic reaction; he only could hope Team A had finished their job. "Okay, it's about Lucina..."

----------

Chrom sat upon his bed, reading a book in peace by himself. His wife Sumia had left to see the magic show in town, Lissa had drug Donnel to the kitchen to raid the cabinets for spices to bring back home, he was alone for once in the day, and he was never a fan of it. Chrom had always been at his happiest around friends and family, nothing had beat the joy of saving a village or stopping Risen outbreaks alongside his comrades, he loved the feeling of being paired up alongside his best friend Robin in battle, and missed the days of combat in the Shepherds dearly. In truth, Chrom would gladly give up fighting forever as long as it meant peace for all mankind, which his rule as an Exalt had bought to many, but it was really more the sensation of being lonely that ate at him. He had a lovely family to surround him, as well as good friends he could visit any time, but the one person he missed truly seeing was Lucina; though she lived as a baby in the room next to his in this timeline, his daughter of the future made him equally as proud, and he loved her just as much, though he was happy she chose to marry her childhood love and live in Wyvern Valley with him, the thought of her being away did eat up at him - he had even cried the first night he spent without training with her in the day.

Chrom sighed, remembering days of old, and flipped a page, hoping to find joy in his story. A knock at the door had taken his attention away from his book; he had expected it to be a guard, but the voice on the other side had gotten him giddy.

"Chrom?" asked Robin, "Are you in there?"

"Robin!" Chrom answered back, "How did you get in here? Would you like to come in and talk?"

"Well," he replied, "I was hoping you could come out here and talk. It's about Lucina..." Chrom jumped from his bed at the mention of his daughter and walked towards the door, he gripped the knob. "You might want to come slowly..." Wondering what he could've meant, Chrom slowly opened the door, Robin's visage coming to view, and walked outside; the tactician was ready to grab him on the small chance he faints. Chrom's eyes grew wide as he looked upon Lucina at her massive size, her head almost reaching the high castle ceiling as she kneeled upon the floor.

"Lucina..." Chrom said, trailing off as he kept gazing upon her figure. Lucina blushed and coughed for a moment before addressing her father.

"H-Hello, Father..." Lucina chuckled quickly and nervously. "I realize it's been long since we've last seen each other...Things have changed quite a bit, as you may see..." Chrom said nothing in response as he looked up at his daughter, though he didn't look scared in any way, Lucina looked distressed. "Nothing to say?" Chrom began walking towards her as she spoke. "I...I suppose it is weird to speak to your daughter when she's become ten times her size...Father, I hope you think me not as a monst-" She was cut off as Chrom grasped the wall of flesh that was her leg, trying to pull her in for a hug; she could see tears well in his eyes.

"Lucina, welcome home. I missed you." Lucina was overwhelmed by the sight of her Father not even reacting to her size; tears began to well in her eyes as well.

"Oh Father!" Lucina grabbed Chrom from the ground and pulled him in close to her face; Chrom had begun to stroke her cheek as she sobbed and hiccupped. Robin looked on with a warm smile, moved by the family bond; the rest of the party had come out from behind a pillar they hid behind and watched the scene unfold, themselves moved by the act as well.

"It's quite touching..." commented Maribelle, small tears welling in her own eyes as she wrapped her arms around Robin.

"It's truly a strong family bond..." commented Say'ri, remembering the old times she shared with Yen'fay.

"Ophelia better do that when she grows up." commented Severa. Owain gave her a light sush.

"You're killing the moment!" he whispered.

----------

When the two finished sharing their hug and cry, Lucina had explained her story to Chrom, the rest of the party filling in where they came in as well; Chrom remained solemn the whole time, taking in all the information he could.

"And that brings us here." finished Lucina. "We were wondering if Mother's library had any information on this shrinking elixir, can you help us Father?"

"Anything for my daughter," responded Chrom, "I'll accompany you on your journey myself if I have to." Lucina was touched by his words, even though she knew she truly wasn't his daughter in the timeline, even if she shared the same genetic makeup as her baby self of the past.

"Thank you Father." responded Lucina warmly. "I never meant to hurt you when I left, I hope you'll forgive me."

"I could never stay mad at you Lucina. Though my sorrow of you being away from me never leaves me, I find joy in your happiness with Gerome. I hope he's taking good care of you." Lucina nodded and wiped away more tears forming in her eyes; she was home once more, and she would see to it to visit more often when her incident had ended.

13131111211221211111111111111111.content:
Maribelle wiped her eyes and watched the scene before them with happy surprise.

"That went better than expected."

Robin was less surprised.

"Chrom can almost away keep a cool head even in the toughest situations. And he would still recognize Lucina as a human, even at giant size."

Owain couldn't help but be disappointed.

"But where's the excitement?" He gestured Where's the drama?""

Severa scolded him.

"Not everything needs to be dramatic!"

"Indeed." Maribelle began. "There is something to be said for one who can remain calm when faced with-"

"AIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE!" A piercing shriek rang out from behind.

They turned, seeing Sumia having tripped over again. She got to her feet and starred dumbly at Lucina

Owain looked a little more satisfied.

"See? That's what I mean."

"Shhhhh!"

Lucina wasn't sure how to react so she waved dumbly.

"Errr.. hello mother."

Chrom stood up and held her hand out to Sumia.

"Sumia wait, this is Lucina, she's still our daughter, even though she's a lot larger." He ran to her. "See? Robin and Maribelle are here to." They waved.

Sumia gaped up at her.

"But how could this happen?"

Before Chrom could answer, the sound of clanking metal filled the air. Several guardsman were running towards the entranceway Chrom had stepped through, though Chrom barred the way, holding his hands up and standing in a way would block the view of his daughter..

"Sire is everything ok? We heard the Queen scream-"

Chrom answered quickly..

"It's nothing uh-"

Sumia took a deep breath and forced a large smile.

"Yes. I was merely... astonished. And I tripped. Again. I'm sorry to have worried you."

"Are you sure-"

"Yes, all is well, please return to your posts. Thank you for looking out for me."

They nodded.

"As you wish"

And departed.

Chrom and Sumia took a deep breath, Sumaia still holding her hand over her heart. She took another look at Lucina, her eyes still wide. Lucina looked back pleadingly.

"Mother, it's still me."

Sumia took a long, deep breath and sighed. She walked towards Lucina.

"Yes I can see that, I'm sorry for panicking I just didn't expect such a big surprise." She held her hand out to Lucina, and placed it on her own.

"I understand. This came as a surprise to all of us, when I saw what was happening my reaction was not different to you."

Sumia looked thoughtfully at Lucina. Chrom smiled playfully.

"Are you wondering how your going to bake our daughter a pie big enough for her?"

"N-no not at all. There's more to me than pies!"

Chrom wrapped his arm around hers.

"I know, I merely saught to lighten the mood."

"Thank you but I'll be fine as long as there aren't too many more surprises."

Suddenly the heard Cynthia yell out.

"We're back!" She shouted at the top of her loud voice

Sumia gasped and tripped over again.

"Ahh!"

Chrom looked at his other daughter sternly.

"Cynthia, how many times have I told you not to surprise your mother like that?"

"But I really wanted to see sis. Though I guess that's big sis now or maybe really big sis-"

Gerome flew to Lucina and landed, while Minerva jumped on Lucina and licked her like a puppy.

"I'm sorry Lucina, I tried to stall her as long as I could-"

Lucina was happy to see him again.

"It's alright, you did well. We were able to enter the castle, and I'm glad to have my family around me."

Severa was puzzled, looking to the others for answers.

"How come Cynthia didn't panic at the sight of Lucina?"

Cynthia stood tall and stuck out her chest.

"Ha! A true hero isn't afraid of anything, even a giant big sister!"

Gerome rolled his eyes.

"Foreknowledge. I told her everything in advance so she would be ready."

Lucina's smiled widened.

"Thank you Gerome."

131311112112212111111111111111112.content:
The party had gathered within Ylisstol's grand library, the ceiling high enough for Lucina to stay in, even while standing, and wide enough for her to lay down in if she wished for sleep. It took a lot of convincing from Chrom and Sumia to free the halls and room of guards and scholars, respectively, but they managed to sneak their huge daughter within the library with no troubles. Gerome and Cynthia sat upon Lucina's shoulder as she sat down, Tiki had rejoined the party and stood near the door with Say'ri, and the rest had sat upon a series of plush couches; all tried to relax from the hectic day.

"Here is my personal library," explained Sumia to her huge daughter, "It's normally open for public study, but we were able to shoo everyone out for 'roof maintenance'. I'm sure your book must be in here somewhere sweetie, and if you can't find it, you may always sleep here; I just got the latest in the 'Wyvern Wars' series too, in case you want a fun read!"

"Thank you Mother, I appreciate your kindness." Sumia got up from her seat to try and hug her daughter's big toe, but slipped on a pile of papers and fell face-first into a stack of books. Lucina picked her mother up and rested her in her palm. "Are you alright?"

"Ha Ha, I'm fine sweetie...Ouch..." Sumia rubbed her face to detract from the sting of hitting hard leather. Lucina giggled a bit and sat Sumia upon her shoulder, next to Gerome and Cynthia, she never could get used to her mother's pratfalls.

"I'll talk to all the guards tonight to inform them of your situation." spoke Chrom. "I didn't want to raise any alarms while getting here, but I don't wish to raise any tomorrow morning if they happen upon you as well; gods help us if Lissa finds you before I get to her. I promise that they'll treat you like they would any guest." Lucina smiled at her father and gave a nod.

"Well then," chimed in Tiki, "I think we'll take our leave." Tiki and Say'ri turned around to depart.

"Wait, Lady Tiki," responded Lucina, "You won't stay with us to look for the elixir?" Tiki turned around once more to address the princess.

"As I've said before," she started, "I have no information on the exact location of this potion, nor on its true nature. I truly wish I could help, but I'm afraid I would provide nothing to your quest. Please forgive me."

"I see, you have a point." Lucina felt a tad upset Tiki wouldn't join her once more, but she understood Tiki's logic on the matter. "Thank you for helping us back in Valm, and thank you for helping sneak us into Ylisstol." Tiki and Say'ri both bowed at the princess.

"It was our pleasure Lucina. With that, we depart." As Tiki turned once more to leave the library, she shot Maribelle a quick wink; Maribelle knew from that gesture that Tiki was still going to continue her secret mission to cure Lucina. The two Valm residents closed the library doors behind them. Chrom had gotten up from his seat after their departure and prepared to exit himself.

"I'm going to go hold a meeting with the rest of our guards, if you don't mind. If you need anything Lucina, anything at all, do not hesitate to call me, I'll come running." Sumia waved a hand at Lucina's side to try and get her attention.

"I'm going to go with Chrom too," she said, "I think the Queen being there would help convince the guards Chrom's not going crazy." Cynthia waved for attention next.

"I'll stay here with you Lucy, but if you could let me down for a group hug, that'd be swell!" Lucina understood and plucked both Pegasus Riders from her shoulder and set them to the ground. From there, Chrom, Sumia, and Cynthia had wrapped their arms around Lucina's big toe and gave her the best hug they could possibly muster. Sumia took Chrom's hand and prepared to leave the room, Chrom addressed the rest of the party before they left.

"If any of you wish for the guest rooms, don't hesitate to ask us. You're all guests of our family tonight." Everyone nodded as the royal duo left the room, leaving everyone else to discuss other matters.

"So what now Lucy?" asked Cynthia.

"I wish to see if one of Mother's books of fables carries information on this shrinking elixir." Lucina replied. "All fables have some amount of truth to them, if we can just find a rendition of the story with any close or exact locations, we can get closer to finding the elixir.

"Alright then," chimed Maribelle, gracefully unseating herself, "Then allow Robin and I to take to the second floor for you." Maribelle extended a hand towards her husband and helped lift him from his seat, the two then walked down the library hall to look for a ladder. Severa was the next to get up, careful not to put any strain on her body.

"I'm not exactly in 'working condition', so I'll check what I can from the ground floor. Owain, I'll point you to whatever looks right, then grab it for me, K?" Owain got up excitedly and begun shouting, all fired up by the quest.

"Alright! A new chapter in the chronicle of Owain and Severa! I'll call it: 'Owain: Legendary Bookkeeper'!" Severa grabbed her husband's hand and began dragging him along, like a dog on a leash.

"Yeah, yeah, save it for the stage, Sugarblood." Fired up by Owain's display, Cynthia was the next one to speak.

"Alright, this is where Hero #2 comes in for an epic crossover event! I'll take the third floor and grab every single book I can! Lucy, can you give me a lift?" Lucina laid her palm to the floor and let Cynthia jump upon it, Lucina stood up with Gerome carefully gripping her neck as not to fall, and raised her palm to the third floor, allowing Cynthia to jump off. "Thanks Lucy! Now off I go, Hi-Yah!" The other two left watched as Cynthia grabbed the nearest rolling ladder and charged down the aisle with it.

"That just leaves us." spoke Gerome. Lucina sniffed a little, prompting Gerome to look at her; he saw faint tears beginning to form. "What's wrong?"

"Nothing," she replied, "It's just...Everyone's been so nice and so helpful, I feel overwhelmed by the sight of it all..."

"Is that all? You're our rock, Lucina, we'll always be here for you, no matter what happens. Never forget that."

"Right." said Lucina, wiping her eyes. She turned to Gerome and gave him a little peck with her lips, leaving him flustered. "Now then, the fourth floor is all ours. I'll help you with lookout, and if you want to get to the other side quickly, just ask me."

"Understood." responded Gerome. Lucina plucked him from her shoulder and set him upon the aisle. Gerome began walking and Lucina began a slow stride behind him, both ready to look for a book detailing the princess' cure.

----------

Tiki and Say'ri had entered the courtyard, completely empty, save Minerva who slept in the field, out like a light.

"Chrom and Sumia really did clean house on the guards, I'm impressed." said Tiki. She appreciated the peace as it allowed her to freely speak her plans with Say'ri.

"My lady," started Say'ri, "Shall we go back to Themis for the stone and continue onward to Naga?"

"Yes, at once." replied Tiki. She turned to look at Say'ri and grimaced a little. "It's just..."

"My lady?"

"You're still pretty big, and that ball gown looks heavier than you actually weigh..." Say'ri almost toppled over at Tiki's comments.

"M-My lady!" Say'ri responded, flustered by her friend's rude comments, "I-I can't help it that I'm this tall or heavy! Please watch your words more carefully!"

"Alright, alright, no need to get upset!" Tiki shifted to her dragon form and took flight, allowing enough room for Say'ri to stand under her. Say'ri grabbed Tiki's legs and the dragon tried to take flight, straining as she tried to lift her. "Oh gods!" she cried, "It's definitely the dress! What did they use to make it so heavy?!" Tiki finally took flight and strained as she talked. "We're definitely stopping in Maribelle's kitchen before we leave for Mount Prism!"

"Forgive me for my size, my lady..." With that, the duo took off on their own quest, hoping for fruitful results.

----------

"And that concludes our meeting." finished Chrom, as the chatter of the guards filled the air. "And I swear to gods, if I hear any lewd speak about my daughter's outfit or size, I swear I'll-"

"Okay!" interrupted Sumia, "Meeting's over! Everyone back to their posts! Thank you!" The guards left at Sumia's command and left the two royals to their own thoughts; Sumia sighed before addressing Chrom. "I know you love our daughter and want to protect her, but you can get real scary in your 'Tiger Dad' mode, you know?"

"Yes, I know. Sorry about that." Chrom felt like his wife was scolding him, despite her warm demeanor and soft speech. Sumia smiled and gave Chrom a hug.

"Don't apologize, it just shows you're a good dad is all!" Sumia broke away from her hug and gave Chrom some breathing room. "Speaking of Lucina, do you want to check on baby Lucina with me?"

"Absolutely." responded Chrom with a smile. The two began walking to the baby's chambers to check on their sleeping little princess; though Sumia wasn't pregnant yet, the two still had another crib reserved for Cynthia when her baby self would be born. Chrom turned to address Sumia. "I just hope that they're all having luck looking for that elixir book in there." Sumia tripped and fell in shock as Chrom said this, gasping as she lifted herself from the floor.

"Oh no!" she cried, "I forgot to teach them the library classification system! Stupid me!" Chrom laughed as he helped his Queen up.

"I'm sure they've got it dear," he replied, "They're all smart and determined, they'll figure it out." Sumia dusted her dress off and continued with her husband to see their baby, now a little less worked up.

Everyone searched through the book, Say'ri and Lucina having to move carefully to avoid knocking any shelves over. Finally after what felt like hours of fruitless searching, Gerome called out.

"I found it!" He yelled, louder than he intended. "I mean, yeah I found it, it's over here."

Everyone hurried over, the two giants especially desperate to see.

"H-hey your're too big to read over my should." He yelled.

"Let me try this." Lucina extended her palm which Gerome climbed on to, She raised him to almost level with her head, allowing Say'ri, Lucina and Gerome to read it together, though as she did her shoulders sagged with disappointment.

"This is just a children's fable..."

Say'ri tried to remain optimistic.

"It could be a legend so there maybe some truth to it. At this point, it looks like our only option."

Lucina grimaced, squinting to read the compartively small font.

"Hmm these ingredients seem strange. Perhaps father will have some around the castle or know where to get them."

Say'ri asked.

"And if he doesn't?"

Gerome placed a hand on Lucina.

"I would never consider you a burden."

Cynthia shouted up.

"Or us!"

"I wish Lady Tiki hadn't flown back home."

1313111121122121111111111111111122.content:
Lissa skipped through the halls of Castle Ylisstol, humming a lively tune; despite how late at night it was, the young princess of Ylisse could never seem to exhaust her excess energy. "Come on, Donny!" she beckoned, "Hurry up! I got a neat prank we can play on Chrom, we need to find his bedroom, quick!" Where his wife was full of energy, Donnel was exhausted, lugging 3 large sacks of flour in his arms and struggling to keep up with Lissa's movement.

"I'm comin', I'm comin'!" yelled back the young farmer, huffing and trying to catch his breath. "I just don't get why we gotta bug yer brother this late at night, doesn't he got a kingdom to rule? I think he needs a good wink of shut-eye without interruption, ya know?" This wasn't the first time Donnel helped Lissa with one of her harebrained practical jokes; in the past they managed to fill Robin's tent with toads, top all of Sumia's spears with potatoes, and unleash a herd of boars into the barracks while Chrom and Lucina trained together, and while the couple found joy in the pranks, Donnel just couldn't get why Lissa constantly played practical jokes on everyone. Lissa spun around gleefully and addressed her husband.

"Oh Donny!" she replied, "This is just what little sisters do! It's a family thing! And besides, it does get a bit boring tilling the fields, you know? We gotta spice up our lives a bit!" She spun around again and continued down the halls to look for Chrom's room, leaving Donnel to continue running behind her, still trying to comprehend the necessity for Lissa's prankster attitude.

"Well, I guess that makes a tad bit a' sense..." Donnel replied. "Though I still don't think it's a good idea to stuff Chrom's pillows fulla explodin' flour sacks, think 'bout the poor maids who gotta clean it..."

"Hmm..." Lissa thought aloud, "Maybe we should test this out first to see how far the flour goes, those maids always were nice to me after all..." Down the hall, Lissa heard the faint voices of people coming from the library. She couldn't catch the full conversation, but one voice seemed louder than the others, and was easy to identify.

"-couldn't find it. Maybe we should rest and ask Mother tomorrow if she could help us?"

"Lucina!" thought Lissa with devilish glee, "Perfect!" Lissa spun around to Donnel and put her finger to her lips, as if to try and silence him. She grabbed one of Donnel's bags of flour, ready to throw it at Lucina's feet and cover her in flour, and lifted her leg, trying to put power in her foot and kick open the door loudly, startling all inside. After a few seconds, Lissa kicked the door open, ready to throw the bag and run. "The brigands are invading! Hit the deAAAAHHHHH!!!" Lissa immediately caught sight of the giant Lucina kneeling before the motley crew of Gerome, Robin, Maribelle, Cynthia, Severa, and Owain, and completely frightened and overwhelmed by the sight, she threw her bag up in the air and continued screaming. Donnel rushed over to help Lissa, setting down the bags so they didn't explode, and felt his jaw drop at the sight of Lucina.

"Wh-What in tarnation?!" Lissa continued screaming as gravity took effect on the bag, hitting her square in the face; Lissa was covered in white powder and stopped screaming, having fainted on the spot, and fell back into the flour sacks, dousing the rest of her body and Donnel's front in flour. At the sight of this, Maribelle ran over and begun to fan her best friend with a pocket fan, trying to revive her. Donnel wiped his face down and continued looking in awe at Lucina, before his eyes took attention to the rest of the party, most notably his son from the future. "O-Owain?! Wh-What the heck's goin' on here?!"

"Oh boy..." replied Owain, scratching the back of his head, "You might want to sit down for this one Father..."

----------

When Lissa awoke, she felt the feeling of her body sinking into fluffy plush and couldn't feel any contact on her skin. "Wha...What happened...?" She remembered little bits of what happened before she fainted as she moved a hand to her head; when she saw her hand covered in white, she freaked out. "Oh gods! My skin! Wh-What's happened to me?!" Lissa's eyes grew wide as she hit a revelation. "Oh gods, I'm dead! I'm a ghost! I must've had a heart attack! Emm! Emm! Where are you?! I'm not used to being dead!"

"You're not dead, love!" shouted Maribelle, bringing Lissa back to reality; she was pouring a small cup of tea for her friend with the library's stockpile of reading snacks. "You were absolutely caked in that filthy mess, it was so thick that it stuck to your clothes and skin, we couldn't even wipe the stuff off of you. We just sat you down on the couch and hoped you'd wake up." Lissa sighed with relief at Maribelle's comments and drank from the cup her friend gave her.

"Oh, that's a relief...But darn, it was such a good prank gone to waste!" Now more calmed, she took another swig of her tea and giggled. "It must've been some night-time delirium or something, my eyes must've been playing tricks on me..." Lissa said, referring to the giant Lucina.

"Umm...Not exactly, Aunt Lissa..." Lissa turned slowly and spit her tea all over the floor at the sight of Lucina's size once again; she backed herself against the wall in fear and started screaming again.

"G-GIANT LUCINA! G-GIANT LUCINA! AH! AHH!" Donnel and Owain ran over to calm their family's little princess and restrained her as she tried to back towards the door.

"Now calm down Lissa!" said Donnel as he tried to calm his wife, "Lucina here doesn't mean it! It's just li'l allergic reaction is all!"

"Allergic reaction?" inquired a confused Owain. "Father, that's not what I- No, forget it, Mother you got to listen, it's fine! It's still Lucina, there's no need to be scared!" Lissa tried to wrestle from her family's control and everyone began to freak out; Robin, Gerome, and Severa were afraid Lissa was going to alert the guards, while Maribelle was afraid Owain was gripping Lissa too tight, and began to bang her fists upon his back. Tiring of all the commotion, Lucina reached her hand out and grabbed Lissa from Donnel and Owain's control, gripping her aunt like a rag doll.

"Shh, Shh, Shh..." she softly chimed, rubbing Lissa's white-coated hair with her finger. She began to hum a tune to try and calm Lissa, one that was sung to her as a child in the future; Lissa recognized it as a lullaby Emmeryn used to sing to her, and it immediately pacified the freaked-out princess. Lucina loosened her grip on Lissa before turning her clutch into an open palm, allowing Lissa to sit down, now not screaming anymore. "I'm sorry for scaring you Aunt Lissa."

"Oh gods," replied Lissa, "Don't be Lucina! It's my fault, I'm so stupid! It's just, I, I..." Lissa began to cry as she hugged Lucina's thumb, prompting the blue-haired princess to stroke Lissa once more with her finger.

----------

"So that's it?! Space rocks?!" Lissa felt like she was being told a children's tale as everyone recounted Lucina and Gerome's quest to her, she almost wanted to laugh at the absurdity of it all, but didn't want to hurt Lucina's feelings more than she already might have. "I dunno guys, it just sounds too weird to be true!"

"Well, you can choose to believe it or not," replied Robin, "But Lucina stands before you as a giant, and we've been around another friend who grew too, though not as huge." Everyone really glossed over everything that didn't involve Lucina growing or swimming to Ylisse, since Tiki and Say'ri had left and the magic show had ended a while ago.

"I guess you're right." Lissa took a sip of her teacup and set it back down on the table; Maribelle quickly refilled it as if she were Lissa's servant. "But I mean, there's a space rock that makes people big, right? So isn't there, like, a space rock that makes people small?"

"Afraid not." responded Gerome. "If it were that easy, we'd have never left home in the first place."

"Granted, you never told me you looked." chimed in Cynthia. "I dunno Gerome, I think Aunt Lissa's got you beat on this one." Gerome shot Cynthia a glance, feeling challenged by the Pegasus Knight's comments.

"We're actually here to look for a cure." answered Lucina to Lissa. "Lady Tiki and Say'ri had spoke of a shrinking elixir in Ylisse when we saw them, though we couldn't find information on it when we looked in the library." Lissa had nearly jumped at the words "shrinking elixir".

"Oh! You're talking about that old tale about the treasure hunter, right? Let's see...I think it was called 'The Unlucky Hunter' or something like that, Emm always used to read it to me as a kid." Everyone reacted strongly to Lissa's new information.

"You know about it?!" responded Lucina. "That's wonderful Aunt Lissa! You wouldn't happen to know where the story book on it is, would you?"
1313111121122121111111111111111122.title: Mischief Maker

13131111211221211111111111111111221.content:
"Book? Hah! Aunt Lissa can do you one better, I know the full story by heart!" Lissa stood up from the couch and cleared her throat, ready to articulate the old legend. "There once was a young treasure hunter, rowdy and greedy, looking for the secret of eter-"

"We know this already." interrupted Gerome. "Where's the elixir supposed to be?"

"Geez, you're grumpy!" spat back Lissa. "Okay, fine; Blah, blah, blah, skip Chapters 1-12, the hunter was told to go way up north in Aurelis and found his elixir in an old temple, except that he shrank to the size of a bug, and the end. How was that summary, Mr. Story-Time?" Lissa stuck her tongue out at Gerome for his rude behavior.

"Aurelis? Isn't that in the territory of Regna Ferox?" inquired Lucina.

"You got it," responded Severa, "Mom sends me letters all the time from up there, complaining about how cold it is. I never knew there were any old temples in that frozen wasteland though."

"But it's just a story though, ain't it?" inquired Donnel, curious about the nature of this elixir. "I don't wanna dash yer hopes Miss Lucina, but ya don't even know if there's anything up there." Lucina smiled back at the farm boy, pleased at the information and eyes burning with determination.

"I appreciate the concern Uncle Donnel, but I have to do this. Even if it's just legend, even if it's not real, this story is the only lead I have to getting back to my old size. Sure, being big has its perks..." Lucina grabbed Gerome and placed him atop her shoulder, as if to illustrate her point, leaving the Wyvern Rider flustered at his wife's actions. She continued her thoughts further; "But I miss my old size, I miss the feeling of crawling into bed with Gerome to cuddle, to ride upon Minerva's back and feel the breeze, and truthfully, I miss actual clothes."

"So it's settled then?" Robin asked, "You two will set off to Regna Ferox?"

"If that's what Lucina wishes." responded Gerome with a smile. He looked at his wife for her answer, she looked back before adopting a determined look.

"Yes! Our journey will continue onward! To Regna Ferox!"

"I don't think so." chimed in Maribelle with a frown on her face. She got up and began pointing at Lucina. "You mean to tell me you're going to go to that frozen land of brutes wearing those rags? You're going to freeze to death, dear!" Lucina began looking at her body; Maribelle had a point, she was clad in nothing but makeshift underwear, she even had no shoes to wear, she'd lose a limb or two to frostbite in the first 5 minutes they step into the continent.

"I see your point. I suppose I will take you up on your offer for a proper outfit, but does that mean we'll have to sneak back into Themis?"

"Heavens no!" responded Maribelle, now smiling with a more cheerful demeanor, "I'll gather my best and we'll prepare you something here; I'm normally busy, but for you dear, I can manage to take some time away from my schedule. I'm sure Lord Chrom would be more than happy to help make something for you; perhaps an overcoat made entirely out of bear fur, or a winter dress of elk fur and wolf pelts. Ooh! Or maybe we could..." Maribelle begun to trail off, imagining the many possible designs she could commission. Robin stepped forward and took over for his wife.

"Anyways, what I think Maribelle is trying to say is; Just give us some time to prepare you something Lucina, you'll work at your best with the right outfit for the job. I don't think we can join you though with orders for the Themis Ball coming up, but a coat is the least we could do." Lucina smiled at the duo's kindness.

"Thank you for your kindness, Robin, Maribelle. Even if you can't join us, we appreciate your help."

"Thanks Robin," responded Gerome, "You and your wife aren't so bad after all." Robin felt a hint of insult in that thanks, but was happy to have thanks nonetheless.

"We could always come!" chimed in Owain. "Think about it; 'The Five Heroes of the Future travel together, looking for an ancient cure of legend! Their leader towers over them, commanding respect from all in her wake, but bringing kindness to all those she passes; a modern-day goddess!' Truly, it'd be a tale worthy of sacred-blooded heroes!" Owain extended arms out to Severa and Cynthia. "What say you two lovely ladies? Will you take up your weapons for the cause of our sacred goddess?"

"If it gets you to stop talking like a dork." responded Severa, slightly annoyed by Owain's droning speech. "Just don't forget that I'm carrying our child, so unless she makes like us and pops out of the Outrealm Gate, grown up and tomes blazing, then you're down one sword." Cynthia got more charged up than Severa and responded to Owain in a way that showed it.

"Alright! Brady's on tour and Ylisstol is in peace! I was waiting on a cool adventure like this! And with Gerome here, the Justice Cabal is complete!" Cynthia dashed towards Owain and the two struck a group pose, ready for action. "Come on Gerome! Bust out that old hero stance you took as a kid!"

"No." was the only response Cynthia got out of Gerome.

"Welp! I'm glad we got that settled! I need a bath to get all this crud off me!" Lissa turned to prepare to leave the room, but stopped to ask the present party a question. "Um, if you guys are going to be here for a while, then you will use the guest rooms, right?"

"Chrom already mentioned it," responded Robin, "Though Maribelle and I will leave tonight to fetch our tailors back home."

"Oh great! He can be a blockhead sometimes, glad to see he remembered common guest courtesy! Donnel and I will be gone by tomorrow morning, we just had to sell some crops and pick up some spices, so you guys can have our room if you want."

"Which means we're having a sleepover!" cried Cynthia, addressing everyone who wasn't leaving. "I'll lay out the cots in my room and we can talk about our heroic tales together, and we can play Brady's sheet music on the piano, ooooh, this is going to be so fun!"

"I'm staying with Lucina." responded Gerome, disgusted by the thought of a sleepover with Cynthia. "We always sleep together."

"I don't know about Owain, but I'm gone after the first night and I'm going right to Lissa's room." curtly responded Severa. "And don't even think about keeping me up with that stupid piano concert you're going to play."

"Alright, you guys have fun then, I'm going to take a bath and then I'm going right to bed!" Lissa opened the library doors and exited, Donnel following behind her. "Goodnight guys, and good luck Lucina!"

"Have fun in Regna Ferox! And make sure ya catch lots o' elk!" added Donnel as the two farmers went down the halls. Robin and Maribelle were the next to depart.

"We'll be back as soon as we can, and we'll try to get you your new outfit as soon as possible. See you tomorrow guys, have a good night!" Robin was about to exit, but Maribelle stopped him, and directly addressed Lucina.

"So I can grab what we have from home: Favorite color?"

"Blue."

"Designs?"

"Butterflies."

"Style?"

"Soldier's Formal."

"You truly do have your father's refined noble manners! Now we may go, Robin." The two exited the library, and Cynthia, Owain, and Severa were the next to go.

"Alright sis, have a good night's rest! Last one to my room is a rotten egg!" Cynthia ran down the halls, dashing to her room at an animal-like speed.

"Oh no, you're not winning that easily!" responded Owain, dashing after Cynthia as if he were a cheetah trying to catch its prey. Severa just looked at the two with astonishment.

"Gawds, they're such children!" She turned to face Lucina and Gerome before leaving. "Yeah, you two have a good night and all that. Oh, and uh, feel free to take my suggestion from before, Lucina." Severa had a naughty smile on her face as she left the room and closed the door, leaving the princess' face bright red and Gerome confused.

"What did she mean by 'suggestion'?" he asked. Lucina just nervously laughed, trying to change the subject.

"Ha, Ha Ha! N-Nothing! J-Just girl talk is all! Ha..." Lucina plucked Gerome from her shoulder and set him to the floor. "You must want to take the couch, you've been sleeping on sand and floor for the past few days after all."

"I'm good." responded Gerome, "In fact, if it's fine with you, would you mind if I spent the night...Closer to you?" Lucina's face grew a blush again.

"O-Okay! I...I guess we could do that..." Lucina grabbed Gerome and laid down, slowly moving her hand with the Wyvern Rider to her bottoms, other hand inserted and ready to lift up the front, her heart was beating quickly.

"Wh-What are you doing?!" responded Gerome with a deep blush on his face. Lucina was confused.

"W-Wait, you mean you didn't want to try...you know?"

"No, I was just thinking your bra, like back in Valm, it was kind of comfy..." Lucina breathed a sigh of relief and inserted Gerome into her bra, snug between her breasts, as Gerome removed his mask and looked even more flustered than before. "What...What did Severa tell you anyways?"

"Nothing. Let's just forget that ever happened." responded the princess.

"Let's." Gerome flipped over and hugged his wife's chest. "Good Night Lucina, I love you."

"I too Gerome, good night." With that, the two dozed off in the library, ready to prepare for their journey up north.

131311112112212111111111111111112211.content:
Morning came soon enough.

It felt strange being "home" again, though Lucina had not thought of this place as her home for a very long time. It was nice to be around her extended family again, though they were surpsied to see her as she was, even Lissa and Sumia started treating her the same way as before, though Lucina had the sneaking suspicion Lissa was contemplating how to use Lucina's size in pranks, either to target her or use her as tool in her pranks, though she wasn't sure Lissa was brazen enough to prank her as she was now.

It was a surprise someone as level headed as Donnel had ended up with Lissa. She would have suspected someone excitable like Vaike would be a better fit, though she also recalled the time she saw him staring at Libra. But surely that would never have worked out... would it?

Lucina felt relaxed at how normal everyone was treating her. Sumia was still a little nervous, but had ordered the staff to bring her a bountiful breakfast, and while the staff were certainly curious or fearful at the sight of her none ran away screaming.

I suppose even if we fail to find a cure, I'll still have my family. She glanced at Gerome. Though I'll miss out on certain things...

Everyone was more than willing to accompany Lucina on her journey, even as Lucina ensured they weren't needed. Owain and Cynthia will still excited at the prospect of a "road trip" together. Chrom and Sumia wanted to come, but had a kingdom to watch over and both Robin and Lucina assured him their would be more than enough people to watch over her.

Robin organized the supplies, which the others helped to gather while Maribelle and several of her servants worked on Lucina's dress.

A good while later, Maribelle triumphantly approached Lucina.

"Finished! Come this way!" Maribelle led Lucina, her shoulders proudly raised..

The outfit was everything Lucina expected and more and looked perfectly sized to her physique.. It reminded her of the outfit she wore when pretending to be Marth, but with a considerable bump to stylishness and quality and with tastefully done shoulder pads added to it. Looking over it she could also see a butterfly emblem on it, resmebling the mask she was long ago. Feeling it, the fabric was much thicker than expected. Maribelle must have made sure the outfit would be suited to the Ferox winter.

"What do you think?"

Lucina beamed at her.

"Perfect. It looks great, without any compromise to it's practicality. It still feels like me, but also like an improvement over my old outfit. Thank you very much."

Maribelle returned the smile.

"You're very welcome. Now go get changed, I can't wait to see how you look." She raised an arm at Gerome. "But you! No peeking!"

Gerome bristled at the accusation.

"Hey! I'm not the kind of guy to peek-"

Lucina smiled in an unusually flirtatious way.

"Don't worry, I certainly wouldn't take offence."

Maribelle stood between them, wagging a finger at Lucina.

"Uh uh uh! No shenanigans! Gerome you wait here, and young lady you get changed this instant!"

Lucina laughed internally. Despite Maribelle's prudishness she felt a certain respect for her. In addition to everything she had done, how many other woman would have the stones to speak that way to to someone ten times there size? She simply nodded and complied, closing the door to her room. When she came out, there were many ohhs and ahhs The outfit looked even better on her than expected!

Maribelle was pleased.

"Well my work here is done."

1313111121122121111111111111111122112.content:
Lucina ran her fingers across the onesie and tunic she wore with her gloved fingers, they were all made of wool, perfect for protecting her body from the cold, and the tunic was stuffed with down feathers for further insulation, still layered thinly enough to look stylish. Where she normally wore a cape on the smaller version of the outfit there was a fine wool scarf around Lucina's neck, branded with the Brand of Naga that was emblazoned on her left eye, Chrom's shoulder, and Cynthia's back; while normally preferring to keep her relation to Chrom secret in order to prevent conspiracy speech, Lucina figured there was nothing to hide her eye at this size, so she appreciated the logo. While getting changed, Lucina untied her cape from her bra and stuffed it in the tunic for good luck. The only thing Lucina missed from her regular attire was her gold ornate headband, something that'd be hard to remake at this size. Lucina looked down at Maribelle with a bright smile.

"This feels very comfy," she said, "Thank you again Maribelle." Maribelle laughed in a posh manner in response.

"It's nothing darling!" Maribelle replied. "The way I see it, your sister married my future son, so in a way, we are like family! Think of it as a loving aunt's seasonal gift!"

"You look good, the design suits you." remarked Gerome with a smile, causing the princess to blush at his comment. The trio had departed and walked down the halls of Castle Ylisstol, Lucina now free to walk the halls without fear of causing commotion of a giant woman; Lucina got less looks from some of the guards now that she was fully clothed in decent wear. On their walk, they had run into Chrom and Sumia, busy with inspecting the castle and servant morale; the royal duo gave their daughter a intrigued look at her outfit, which Lucina had picked up on, spinning around to showcase her outfit to her parents.

"Oh sweetie, is that your new outfit?" inquired Sumia. "It looks so good on you! I love the design!"

"It looks almost like what you wore while in the Shepherds." remarked Chrom. "You always look good in that tunic."

"Thank you Father, Mother, Maribelle's kindness will surely get me through the Feroxi winter."

"So that's it then?" responded Sumia with a sad tone of voice. "But you just got here though, we have a lot of catching up to do..."

"Forgive me Mother," responded Lucina, kneeling down to get a better look at Sumia, "But I need to find a cure to my size as soon as possible." She moved her finger to rub Sumia's hair. "Don't worry though, after seeing Father again, I've decided to come visit more often. I promise Gerome and I will spend a week here with you when I become small again." Their moment was interrupted by the swift clanking of steel boots down the halls, alerting everyone that Cynthia was coming, carrying Robin, Owain, and Severa in tow with her, all but Owain out of breath trying to keep up with the Pegasus Knight. Cynthia took a good look at her sister with a twinkle in her eyes.

"Wow Lucy!" stated the pigtailed girl, "Your outfit looks amazing! It looks like your usual tunic, but like, better!"

"Thank you Cynthia. What brings you here? Are we ready to depart?"

"About that," replied Robin, "There seems to be a shortage on spare rations because of a Shepherds training march. The animals won't be abundant this time of year up there and you should all be properly rationed food."

"I'll get the chefs to work on it then," chimed in Chrom, "I want you all to be in your best condition for the trip."

"Right, so we're going to rest here for one more day before we depart." said Severa. Owain was looking rustled by her comment.

"My sword hand burns for adventure! I fear I can't control my bloodlust forever! Uncle Chrom! Please urge your chefs to hurry, for the safety of your beloved citizens!"

"Right, I'll get on that." responded Chrom, a little embarrassed by how dorky his nephew was.

"...Also tell them to add fish to the rations." Sumia suddenly clapped her hands together suddenly, turning the attention of everyone present to her.

"Hey!" she began, "If you're going to be here for one more day, let's have a family picnic tonight! Just all of us, eating and sharing stories together!"

"That sounds great!" responded Lucina. "Gerome and I would be happy to attend!"

"Absolutely," added Gerome, "I'd be happy to join, Lady Sumia." Sumia giggled at the Wyvern Rider.

"Oh Gerome, we're family! You can just call me 'Mom' you know!"

"I don't prefer titles like that..." responded Gerome, slightly flustered by his mother-in-law's comments; he hardly ever called Cherche "Mother" when he came back from the future.

"Ooh! Ooh! Mother! Can Owain and Severa join too?!" asked Cynthia, jumping up and down excitedly.

"Of course dear, Owain's your cousin, and Severa is family too!"

"Yaaay!" cried Cynthia as she pulled her cousin and friend in for a hug. "This is going to be so fun together!"

"Oh bother..." remarked Severa, feeling nauseous from Cynthia and Owain's cheerful excitement. Chrom turned towards his best friend and asked for his company as well.

"Robin, would you like to join us? Technically, we are related in a sense."

"I'd love to Chrom," responded the tactician, "But Maribelle and I have a lot of work we have to get done for the season. I promise next time we're up that we'll set some time aside to share lunch together."

"That's a shame," replied Chrom, "But I understand your workload. I wish Lissa could make it too, but she and Donnel have left back home already, she said one of the cows was expecting a calf." Maribelle sauntered over to her husband and wrapped her arms around him.

"We thank you for being so understanding, my lord." she spoke to Chrom. "May you and Lady Sumia have a good family gathering tonight." Maribelle turned to Lucina and gave her a wink. "And I expect to see you back at our mansion once you become normal again, Brady has become smitten with your playful demeanor. May you find good luck in your quest dear!"

"Thank you Maribelle," responded the huge princess, "And thank you Robin; I promise I'll become small for the both of you again."

"I know you will Lucina, I hope you find it soon." replied Robin. He waved towards the crowd of people with Maribelle to signal his departure. "Goodbye everyone, come and visit anytime!" Everyone waved back and wished the two goodbye as they began to depart back home to their mansion.

"Well then," spoke Sumia, "I better go start making some sandwiches and rhubarb pie for tonight! This is going to be so exciting!" Sumia turned around to dash off to the kitchen, but stepped on the hem of her dress and faceplanted into the floor. Chrom ran over and helped his wife from the floor.

"Maybe I should come with you, in case you need a hand in the kitchen..." Chrom turned to address the party. "Well, we'll see you all tonight, hope your stomachs are empty!" The royal duo walked off towards the kitchen together.

"Come on Owain!" said Cynthia energetically, "Let's get the blankets to help Mother out!" Cynthia and Owain ran off together to gather materials for the picnic, leaving Severa to hang with Gerome and Lucina.

"Good grief," she chimed, "What a bunch of dorks..." Severa turned towards Gerome and Lucina and glanced at the two, a naughty smile formed on her face. "So then, did you two do anything special last night?" Gerome and Lucina's faces made a hot flush, causing the raven-haired beauty to laugh.

"N-No! For your information!" shouted Gerome.

"I-I could step on you right now! No one would need to know!" shouted Lucina. Severa only giggled harder, knowing Lucina was far too nice to crush one of her friends.

----------

When the night fell, everyone in the royal family who could make it had gathered together in the courtyard, the castle walls blocking the eyes of Ylisstol citizens from looking in at the scene. Blankets were strewn across the grassy yard, plates of sandwiches, vegetables, and rhubarb pies lined the fabric, all in abundant supply so Lucina could properly eat. Everyone sat upon the blankets together, save Minerva, who laid next to Lucina like a small pet, waiting for pets, and the baby Lucina, who sat in Sumia's lap, cuddled by her mother; the baby Lucina looked at the older version of herself and giggled.

"It's stange..." Lucina giggled back, "I never thought I would be sharing a meal with my younger self, it feels weird. I wonder if she'll remember this when she grows older." Chrom laughed.

"Hopefully not, but should it ever come to that, I'll tell her about you and Cynthia. I don't know how to explain your size to her though." he responded. "Honestly, I kind of want to spend time with baby Gerome, Gregor and Cherche write us all the time about him, it'd be kind of funny if they get married like you two." Lucina and Gerome gave light chuckles at the comment, a rarity for the normally solemn Gerome.

"I'm definitely arranging some playdates with Lucina when Ophelia is born!" chimed in Owain. "I can feel it in my bones, she'll be the cutest little stage star Ylisse has ever seen!" Baby Lucina giggled at Owain's eccentric display and clapped her hands together, the swordsman playfully bowed in turn. Sumia raised her child to her face to kiss her and addressed everyone present.

"Alright everyone, let's eat!"

13131111211221211111111111111111221121.content:
The group shared stories and ate food under the brilliant starlight, the crisp spring air not too warm, but not too cold, just the perfect climate for a picnic. Owain had just finished a 100 minute-long story that could easily be formatted into a play script, its large, expressive words and run-on sentences physically exhausted all that listened to it, all except baby Lucina who giggled and jiggled at Owain's expressive motions and loud onomatopoeias; Owain thought that at least his material would be good children's show material. Lucina had swallowed a whole rhubarb pie, a small candy-like snack at her size, and gazed up at the stars in the sky, admiring the beauty of the sky while deep in thought. She let out a small sigh and stroked Minerva's back.

"What's wrong?" asked Gerome, picking up on the motions of his wife.

"Oh, nothing." responded Lucina, turning to Gerome. "I just couldn't help but think of those meteors that made me like this. What if they weren't just restricted to Wyvern Valley? What if there are more out there?" The mood dampened a little at this, save the spark of adventure lit in Owain and Cynthia's eyes. It took a bit for a response, everyone thinking of what to say at Lucina's thought.

"I understand your concern," responded Gerome, "I'm not going to say there's no need to worry, but there's nothing we can do about the situation. All we can do is just look for a cure for you right now, we'll worry about the rest later."

"I know, it's just...I don't want any of you coming into contact with those meteors and catching what I got."

"Don't worry Lucina," responded Sumia with a smile, "Just worry about yourself for now. Chrom and I can handle keeping everyone in Ylisse away from those meteors, and if we find any around Ylisstol, I'll lead the charge to dispose of them before any citizens come into contact with one." Chrom choked on his mug of ale he drank from and laughed, causing Sumia to turn towards him. "Now what's so funny, Chrom?"

"Sorry, sorry..." he replied, trying to calm down from his laughing fit. "It's just that I can see you tripping into the crater and becoming a giant yourself, I don't think you should be leading the charge on this one."

"Hey!" yelled back Sumia. "That's rude! I am so qualified to handle this, sitting on a throne hasn't made me any less good at riding a Pegasus!" Sumia sat down baby Lucina and lunged at her husband, beating on his left shoulder with her fists. Chrom laughed at Sumia's childish display and tried to defend himself with his arm, everyone else laughed at the two, save Gerome and Severa, who only smiled and gave light chuckles.

"Alright, alright, I'll leave it to you then." responded Chrom, ending Sumia's onslaught. "But just remember that we're two halves of a whole here, don't ever be afraid to ask me to help you out if you need it."

"Thanks Chrom!" answered Sumia as she kissed his cheek and went back to cuddling baby Lucina, feeding her some bits of rhubarb pie.

"Hey Mother!" shouted Cynthia, "Lucy and I could always help too! We could get some rope down and wrap it around the rocks to lift them, or we could just get Lucy to hurl it into the ocean!"

"We're trying to get her smaller, not make her bigger, numbskull!" chimed in Severa. "Didn't Gerome tell you those things were touch-activated?"

"Oh yeah, I guess I forgot. Whoops!"

"I could always try to break it into bits with my expert sword moves!" shouted Owain. "Sonic speed, gone in a flash!"

"You're already a big enough headache, I don't want you bigger!"

"You know, you're a real grouch sometimes Severa!" said Cynthia. "Maybe I should push you into a meteor and make you big, maybe that'll make you more humble!"

"Touch me while I'm pregnant and I'll drop you to the floor, nerd!" Severa responded, face reddening. "I want our child to grow up normal, not the size of a house; how will she get a boyfriend like that?!" Severa realized what she said and turned to Lucina, realizing she may have offended the princess. "Oh uh, sorry Luce, I didn't mean it in that way..."

"It's fine Severa," responded Lucina with a warm smile, "I understand where you're coming from, even if I'm not a mother myself." Severa wiped her brow and breathed a sigh of relief, she was lucky her friend was so forgiving; she hated to admit it, but Cynthia was right, she was too mean sometimes, and it caused her to say the wrong things more often than naught. Lucina moved her hand past Mineva's back and wrapped a finger around Gerome's shoulders. "But I have been thinking about it a bit, and I was thinking Gerome and I should try to have a child once I become normal again. Would you be alright with that, Gerome?" The Wyvern Rider looked flustered at his wife's comments.

"W-Well, I guess we, uh..." Gerome took a moment to take a breath and turned to Lucina, looking more calm. "Yes, I'd be happy to start a family with you, Lucina." Sumia and Cynthia squealed at Gerome's comments, excited to become a grandparent and aunt, respectively.

"Oh, I'll have to get streamers for the baby shower and buy tons of baby clothes!" shouted Sumia. "Oh, this is going to be so fun! My little baby's growing up!"

"M-Mother, we're just thinking about it, I'm not pregnant yet..."

"Alright!" shouted Cynthia, "I'm all fired up to make Lucina mother-sized again! I'm ready to head to Ferox right now!" Cynthia got up and ran over to Minerva, rummaging through the rucksack attached to her back as the wyvern purred. "Alrighty Gerome, let's see what's in your bag of tricks!"

"H-Hey! Get out of Minerva's satchel right now!"

"Let's see, vulnaries, throwing axes, oooooh!" Cynthia pulled Falchion from the rucksack, admiring the bright luster of the sword. "Hey Lucy, you're too big for it now, so can I practice with this?"

"You can," responded the sister, "But the blade will be dull, don't expect to cut anything with it." Lucina still remembered the time they went training in the woods and Cynthia totally missed the log she tried to slice at, they never tried again after Lucina rushed out to cooking duty that night, having no need to anymore with the age of peace at Grima's defeat.

"Nah, don't worry sis! I'm just going to pose with it for a bit and practice my sword thrusts!" With that, Cynthia started spinning around in the open fields, swinging the blade around the air gracefully enough, but adding unneeded "Hyah!"s and "Kyah!"s to her swings.

"Captain Cuckoo's behavior aside, she is right." spoke Severa to Lucina. "We'll stick by you until we find a cure for your crappy little condition, I want to see Ophelia and your future kid become best friends, alright?"

"Hyah!" Falchion swiped through the air.

"Severa's right!" shouted Owain. "As dear cousin to the crown princess, I have a sworn devotion to you your well-being!" He drew his blade and pointed it skyward. "You have Missiletainn's radiant luster on your side! Please utilize it well!"

"Kyah!" Another swing.

"They're certainly fired up." remarked Gerome. "You already know how I feel, Lucina. I'd say that we're all ready for tomorrow's journey."

"Hiii-yah!" Cynthia faced the trunk of a tree.

"Thank you, everyone," said Lucina with warm glee in her voice, "You're all not just my family, you're true friends! I can't wait to journey with you all tomorrow!"

"Our little girl's all-grown up now." spoke Chrom with a smile to Sumia, as he wrapped his arm around her and the baby Lucina, both smiling as well; Chrom realized the irony of what he said when the baby Lucina wasn't even a foot away from him.

"Alright!" said Cynthia, slashing the air one final time before striking a pose with Falchion and facing the rest of the group. "Let's finish the food and make Lucina normal again!" Cynthia's statement was complimented by a loud "THUD" from behind her, as if to end the statement with a bang. Everyone just looked at Cynthia wide-eyed and speechless, save the baby Lucina clapping and cooing.

Behind Cynthia, the tree had split from its trunk in one clean slice.

"What is it?" Cynthia turned around to look at the tree upon the ground, then the trunk, then looked at the Falchion in her hands. "Oh...Ohhh...Uhhh..." Everyone was awestruck, trying to think of something to say, Cynthia included. "Uh, Lucy? Can I...Can I hang on to this? At least until you're normal?"

"S-Sure Cynthia. Use it all you want." Lucina didn't know how to express it, but she was proud of her sister as much as she was surprised. She always wanted to see her sister wield Falchion some day, she just didn't expect it to happen in a manner like this. Cynthia sat back down on the blanket, holding Falchion at her side, the revelation of being chosen by the sacred blade even too much for her excitable personality to process. Everyone was quiet for a while, Sumia breaking the silent tension after a couple minutes with a cough and a laugh.

"Uh, bear-meat Reuben anyone? Ha ha..."

It was an unforgettable family picnic, that was certain.

131311112112212111111111111111112211211.content:
Lucina sat up straight.

"I can't believe it... Cynthia was able to use the Falchion all this time!"

Cynthia stared dumbly at the sword for several more seconds.

"I did it! I actually did it! WHOHOOOO!"

Cynthia started dancing around, still waving the Falchion around.

"Be careful with that!" Lucina scodled, getting flashbacks to her earlier training sessions with Cynthia.

"Sorry." Cynthia sheated the falchion

Lucina smiled.

"I can finally rest well, if anything were to ever happen to me-"

Gerome placed a hand on her.

"Don't talk that way."

Lucina looked at him. Gerome lowered his head a little but still held his firm gaze.

"Sorry, but I couldn't bear to lose you, you're all I have."

"You still have your family Gerome."

He looked to the side.

"We aren't close, not like your's."

Lucina lowered her head.

"You just need to be some time with them, like I'm doing now."

"Hmmph."

Lucina opened her mouth to speak but was distracted by Owain, who had run over to the dancing girl.

"Good job Cynthia. Let me try now! My sword hand hungers!"

Severa snorted.

"Pfft are you jealous?"

"N-no! But I'm the one who uses swords, Cynthia is more of a lance girl."

"Owain, the Falchion is not a toy!" Lucina chided.

"I know that! No one respects swords more than I do. And I have the mark!" He raised his hand and took off his glove. "I have the mark to! Please let me have my chance!"

"Very well, but I have to ask, why did you wait till now?"

"Of course I always wanted to wield such an awesome sword but..." He shuffled his feet. "I didn't want to risk being rejected." Everyone feel silent, puzzled by that response. "I've never been rejected by a sword before... I didn't think I could bear it, but after seeing my cousin step up and succeed I had to try!"

"Owain, it's alright, if the Falchion does not accept you, you are no less my cousin or a Swordmaster. Just as I didn't think any less of Cynthia before I knew she could wield the Falchion."

Cynthia thrusted it through the air.

"Though you gotta admit, this is really cool."

From Lucina and Owain's looks it was obvious to her that it was not the best thing to say.

"Uhh- I mean it's totally alright if you can't wield the Falchion, I mean you still have other cool swords."

"Thanks, but for my WARRIOR'S PRIDE I have to do this!"

He held his hand expectantly and with a moment's hesitation, Cynthia passed him the blade.

Owain flourished the blade, and setting his eyes on the trunk of the tree Cynthia had felled, he leapt through the air. Screaming a battle cry, he dropped down and cleaved the stump in two.

"OH YEAH!" Owain said, holding the sword high.

Chrom clapped.

"Well done, I can't wait to tell Lissa about this."

Owain beamed back, but Cynthia crossed her arms. She wasn't one to sulk or be jealous but couldn't help be annoyed that Owain had stolen her moment of glory. Lucina saw her reaction and smiled at them both.

"I am gladdened that you have both been chosen by the Falchion, I can rest that much easier knowing their are two who can take that place."

Owain was suddenly serious.

"Hey we could never replace you!"

Gerome glared up at Lucina.

"And I told you not to talk like that, I'm not going to let anything happened to you!"

"I know, but if the worse happens and I stuck at this size, I feel safer knowing the Falchion has two more who can wield it."

Gerome placed a hand on his heart.

"I will do whatever it takes to get you to normal, I swear."

"I do not doubt it for a moment, but if nothing can be done..." She didn't finish that sentence, instead cheering herself up. "And aside from that, I am thinking of future generations, I feel that much better if all of our children had a chance of wielding the falchion."

Cynthia raised her hands in a pushing gesture

"Whoo! Whoo! I'm not ready to start a family yet! I've got a career to pursue! I want to be a great hero before i settle down!"

Lucina chuckled.

"I did not mean to pressure you. Take all the time you need."

1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.content:
The dawn broke upon Ylisstol and the warm air had just spread across the plain. Standing outside the castle walls, away from the merchant's road, stood the group of 5 consisting of Lucina, Gerome, Cynthia, Owain, and Severa, joined by Chrom and Sumia to see them off. Lucina stood tall with Gerome and Cynthia in flight upon Minerva and her Pegasus, respectively, close to her shoulders at eye level. Owain and Severa rode in a large horse-drawn carriage with cartoon illustrations of the couple's faces painted on the sides and purple & gold cloth adorning the carriage; Owain was ready to drive the carriage, holding a wooden wheel attached to the two horses' reins, while Severa sat upon a couch in the back, next to the large stock of food rations, camping supplies, and spare weapons. Lucina gently kneeled down and peered into the carriage to talk to Severa.

"Are you sure you don't want to ride on my body? I could store you, Owain, and the supplies in my tunic's pockets."

"Nah," replied Severa, repositioning herself to lounge around, "Heights make me sick, and I'd rather lay down for the baby's health. Sorry if we're holding you up Luce, we'll try to keep our pace up on the way there."

"It's fine," responded Lucina, "I'd rather your child's needs come first. I can live with being big for a little while longer." Sumia and Chrom moved forward a bit to draw Lucina's attention, the Exalt speaking first.

"We'll get the Shepherds and Pegasus Knights to look for any meteors and quarantine the areas. Cynthia, I've appointed your first mate to head the Knights while you're gone, you have nothing to worry about."

"Thanks Father!" replied Cynthia. "We'll try to make it back quickly!"

"Lucina, sweetie," spoke Sumia, "Please come back to Ylisstol once your quest ends, Chrom and I would really love it if you could spend a little time with us before you go back home to Valm." Lucina knelt down next to her parents, a smile upon her face, and spoke to them softly.

"I promise to stop in with Gerome, Mother, I admit I need to spend more time with you two." She extended her palm out to her parents and they stepped on, Lucina lifted them to her face. "I promise the next time you see me, I'll be at a more manageable size to hug and practice swordfighting with."

"Take care, Lucina, and good luck!" responded Chrom. The two royals moved in to kiss Lucina's cheek, the princess responding by covering her parents' bodies with her massive lips. She let her parents back upon the ground and waved to them, prompting a wave back from the duo. Lucina spoke loudly to address her crew.

"Alright everyone, we're off! To Ferox!"

"Hi-Yah!" Owain shouted as he pulled back the wooden wheel, tugging the horses' reins and prompting them to start moving. Lucina broke into a march, covering a larger distance than the usual soldier at her size, as her husband and sister flew right next to her. The 5 had moved onto a trail for the carriage to move more level on and traveled off into the distance as Chrom and Sumia watched, embracing each other.

----------

An hour had passed since they left Ylisstol, and the group showed no signs of stopping. Severa, not occupied by walking or managing an animal, read a map of the Ylissean continent in her carriage; she stuck her head out the front of the wagon and spoke loudly to reach the ears of her heightened companions.

"If we just keep bearing north, we'll reach the border of Ferox in a couple days. This old map is saying Aurelis is where East-Ferox is, Khadein being on West-Ferox."

"Aw man!" cried Owain in disappointment as he continued driving the carriage. "You mean we aren't going to West-Ferox? I was hoping we could stop in and see your parents again, Lon'qu said he'd show me some of his special moves if I stopped speaking to him during the war."

"Sorry Owain, but Luce needs a cure quickly; this is a quest, not a vacation." In truth, Severa never was a fan of going to see her parents, it was too cold up in Ferox and Severa always felt bugged by Cordelia's perfect array of skills and Lon'qu always getting freaked out when she got close to him; she'd rather take Owain's craziness and an actual job over trying to outshine her parents and being stuck ice fishing any day.

"Flavia should let us in just fine," said Lucina, "But I wouldn't be surprised if we scare the guards with my stature and get into a battle at the gates."

"If they do anything to insult you, then they're facing the wrath of Minerva and I." responded Gerome. Minerva roared in agreement, ready to defend her family.

"That's right!" chimed in Cynthia, beaming with excitement. "And if they do battle with us, we got this!" Cynthia removed Falchion from its sheath and pointed it towards the sky in a triumphant pose.

"Careful with that!" shouted Lucina, afraid that the blade would fall from Cynthia's grasp.

"Oh, whoops, sorry Lucy!" Cynthia placed Falchion back into its sheath and went back to focus on riding her Pegasus.

"Falchion is not a toy, Cynthia." spoke Lucina to her little sister. "I know you mean well, but please take care of the blade, don't keep posing with it. This was the same blade the Hero King used all those years ago after all." Cynthia felt like she was being lectured and chewed out by her sister.

"I know, I know, I'm sorry. It's just force of habit, you know?"

"It's alright Cynthia," responded Lucina with a smile, "Just take the time to think before you use it. I'm sorry I can't properly show you my techniques though."

"It's fine!" responded Cynthia. "I'll pick up some techniques from Flavia when we get down there, and I could always let Owain use Falchy if I'm in a lance mood!"

"No thank you," responded Owain, "I'd rather stick with Missiletainn's shining edge."

"I thought you could wield the blade as well?" chimed in Gerome, somewhat annoyed by Owain's response. "What was the point of trying Falchion if you aren't going to use it?"

"Yeah, sorry about that." responded Owain, scratching his head. "It was a "heat of the moment" sort of thing, I was just kinda curious if the sword would let me wield it, kinda like a "family bloodline test"." Owain's response clearly didn't put Gerome in a better mood. "Besides, I feel like our weapons are our sworn comrades. I know you and Cynthia don't name your weapons, but they are still your friend and sworn ally, and should be used whenever you need them; as for the rest of us, Falchion is Lucina's sworn companion, I have Missiletainn, and Severa has Owa-"

"Stop talking!" shouted Severa, cheeks red. "Don't finish that sentence, or I'll choke you with the reins!" Cynthia and Severa couldn't help but laugh, it was painfully obvious what she named her weapon, even Gerome let out a small chuckle. "And you guys! Quit the laughing! Just keep going north and forget about this whole conversation!"

"Alright, alright!" responded Lucina, trying to stop laughing. "We're just having some fun Severa, we have a few days to go until we get to the Feroxi border after all."

"Ooh!" cried Cynthia, "I have an idea! How about we play some of Brady's tunes! I threw some of his sheet music in the back for the ride, so we could have some fun on the trip! Severa, there should be a violin back there too, can you play?"

"Well, yeah," replied the raven-haired mercenary, "I had to learn some instruments for our shows, but Brady is like, stupid good with the violin, I don't want to butcher the music he worked so hard composing."

"Nah, it's fine, Brady'd probably like to hear you play more then hear his renditions anyways! Besides, doesn't your mother have a natural talent for instruments too? I think that would've rubbed off on you or something." Severa's eye twitched at Cynthia's remarks, she hated other people sizing her up to her mother.

"I swear, as soon as you land, I'm gonna..." she trailed off as she dug through the suitcases in the carriage's back before pulling out some music booklets and a wooden violin. "Alright, here goes..." As Severa rubbed the hair of the bow across the violin's strings, beautiful music reverberated through the air, a calm, serene tune that went with the landscape around them.

"Oh! Hold on, we worked on this one together!" Cynthia reached into the satchel at her side and pulled out an ocarina. She wrapped a belt on her Pegasus' saddle around her waist to prevent herself from falling, and stroked the flying horse's mane, signaling it to go on autopilot. She looked down from her mount upon Severa and matched eyes with the mercenary. "Alright, on the count of 3; 1...2...3."

When the count went up, the beautiful tune of the string and wind instruments sang through the air, putting a smile on the faces of Owain, Lucina, and even Gerome, and it had a calming effect upon Minerva and the horses as they travelled along. Though it wasn't the first time they got along with each other, the duet Severa and Cynthia played definitely carried the tune of friendship with it, causing both girls to smile at one another as they continued to play; Severa only wondered if Ophelia could hear the music as she grew inside the mercenary's stomach. As the march continued on, spirits and morale were high between the group of 5 - they would no doubt reach Ferox with smiles on their faces and good moods.
