1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.content:
The five continued on. They remained vigilant of any danger or trouble, but aside from a few gawkers, had a safe and uneventful journey.

They continued to play and sing merry songs, while Owain hollered something about Riding Together, or something along those lines. Cynthia ahead, leaving Gerome and Lucina slightly separate from the rest of the group

Even Gerome was enjoying himself, often nodding his head in time with the music, though he tried to hide this.

Lucina smiled at him.

"See? Being with our families and extended families can be enjoyable."

"I suppose..."

"I do not know what I would have done without everyone's help."

Gerome looked away from her.

"Family can be useful in a tough situation. I wouldn't know."

"You've always had us, Gerome."

Gerome turned to face her again.

"I wanted to be strong and independent, like you."

"Everything I've ever achieved has been with the help of others. Without father I may never have taken to the sword, without Naga I could not have returned to the past, without everyone's efforts we would never have overcome Grima or the Grimleaf, and with you I'd have never put on the mask."

"I guess, but what do you do when you lose someone? I never want to go through that again."

Lucina struggled to find an answer and the silence was broken.

"I see it!" Cynthia yelled triumphantly, circling the sky with her pegasus. "We're at the eat Ferox border!"

"Wonderful! We should be near Aurelis!"

Cynthia titled her head, her pegasus matching the movement.

"Huh?"

"It was a country that existed around here in the Hero King Marth's time."

"Ohhhh."

Gerome flew closer to Lucina.

"I hate to ruin the good mood, but that story was from ages ago. Assuming it even happened, how are we going to find some temple."

"We'll have to find a settlement and see if anyone knows anything."
1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.title: No one cared who I was until I put on the mask

1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.content:
"Halt trespassers!" As the group planned, the clanking of armor and steps of foot soldiers came along the walls, loud and quick at first, but slowing in speed and drowned out by the sound of screams as the Feroxi soldiers caught sight of Lucina. "A-A giant?! What the hell is this?!" spoke Raimi, chief Knight of the Eastern Border. "Take aim men!"

"Please, stand down!" commanded Lucina, "We mean no harm, we seek entry into Regna Ferox!" The archers lining the walls took no heed and prepared their bows, Lucina's group prepared to clash weapons.

"You heard the lady, stand down!" came a commanding voice from behind the fort walls. The archers immediately dropped their attack stance and kneeled to their speaker, Raimi doing the same.

"My lady, forgive us." spoke the Knight. Coming to full view on the face of the wall was a warrior decked out in red and silver armor, brandishing a large sword over her shoulder, her blond hair contrasting her darkened skin. She took a good look at the blue-haired giant and broke into a laugh.

"It's been a while Lucina, what have you been eating to get that big?"

"Flavia!" shouted Lucina with joy, surprised they had met the East-Khan so soon. Everyone in the party let down their guard and found themselves overjoyed at how well events had gone. "It's so nice to see you, but how did you know we'd be here, with me like this?"

"Your little tactician friend sent a carrier pigeon explaining the whole situation, damned impressive how well those things can fly in the cold. You want in to look for something, right?" Flavia turned to her guards and broke into a commanding yell. "Oi! Boneheads! Open the door for our guests, and make it quick before these runts freeze to death!" With that, the soldiers moved to open the iron gates into Ferox. Slowly, the large metal doors opened, allowing for Lucina to crawl in and Severa and Owain's carriage to easily enter. "Alright," spoke the East-Khan, "Shall we hurry to my quarters?" The group quickly took Falvia's offer up with glee and entered the frozen country.

----------

Flavia's palace looked far from as regal as the castles of Ylisstol, Plegia, Valm, and even Maribelle's mansion, but still was a departure in style from the brick and wood homes that comprised Feroxi streets; the palace was comprised of stone and was lit by candle, having very few windows, and along each and every wall there was adorned various trophies, medals, shields, and blades, all symbols of victory from the various wars the country took part in and battles held in the Arena Ferox. In a large central dining chamber sat the party and Flavia, all feasting over a titanic plate of cooked meat and barrels of ale, all clearly made to match Lucina's size, discussing everything that related to the young princess' quest.

"Space rocks, huh?" spoke Flavia, drinking ale from a mug. "Haven't heard anything about those around these parts, and we would easily know, around here, we have a lot of space used up by warrior barracks, citizen homes, and the best taverns to grace Ylisse. You shouldn't worry about our safety on that front." Flavia dipped her mug in an open barrel and took another huge swig of her drink. "More importantly, you say you want to get to the northern parts of Ferox? Where all the old ruins are?"

"That is correct." answered Lucina, only taking a small sip of her barrel, not used to the taste of alcohol. "We intended to go from settlement to settlement around there and ask for their advice. It is fortunate we ran into you first, so as we do not frighten whatever soldiers you may have up there. Khan Flavia, will you allow our journey further north?"

"'Fraid not, little lady." replied the Khan, drinking more of her ale and taking a large crunch out of the steak before her.

"Why not?!" chimed Severa, rudely, "Don't you run this frosty wasteland or something?!" Severa sneezed, everyone could tell the cold put her in a bad mood.

"Fiesty one, aren't you?" responded Flavia with a laugh. "I'd love to help, don't get me wrong, but the tournament's coming up soon, and the Oaf's boasting about a new champion he's got; I'm not at all scared, but they're saying this champion's good, and I find myself short an outsider to use as champion."

"Can't we just ask Basilio if we could travel north in that case?" inquired Gerome. "I'm sure he won't deny Lucina's request after she saved his life."

"True, the Oaf's head would've been lodged on Walhart's axe by now if not for Lucina, so you're free to ask him, it's just that he has no information on your wife's...condition, so you'd probably scare him half to death and get the army all riled up." Everyone felt disheartened at this news, Flavia had a point. "Now, if one of you could lend your skills to me for the ring and help me keep my title of Khan, then it'd make your journey far easier."

"So what you're saying is that we'll have to fight then?" asked Gerome. Flavia nodded in affirmation while chugging down another spot of ale.

"What's this champion like?" asked Cynthia, eyes twinkling with excitement. "Are they a powerful samurai from a faraway land? The descendant of a great hero wielding a legendary blade? Ooh! Or maybe a swordsman who can see the future?!"

"Is she always like this?" asked Flavia to Lucina, concerned about the girl's overenthusiastic imagination.

"She's been like this since we were young," responded Lucina, "But Cynthia's skills outweigh her imagination, I guarantee."

"I'll keep that in mind." Flavia cleared her throat. "She showed up out of the blue one day, nobody knows where she came from. I met her at a feast with the Oaf's side of the kingdom once; she was young, yet boasted about being a master magician. She was pretty quirky, talking about stars and magic stones every other sentence, and she showed a lot of skin, even in this cold." Flavia moved her hand to her chin, pondering a thought. "She said that she was ‘A Warrior of Crimson from Another World’; does that sound familiar to you time-travelers?"

"No, I'd remember a weirdo like that." responded Severa.

"In any case, I need one of you to take this sorceress on in one-on-one combat, sword to tome. Lucina, you could probably take her on with one finger in just seconds flat, but I'd rather you don't compete and put all of Ferox on high alert. No offense."

"None taken, Khan Flavia." responded the princess.

"I'll stay with Lucina," chimed in Gerome, "I'm powerless without Minerva alongside me, and I wish to keep Lucina safe while we're here."

"I'm pregnant, so I'm out." chimed in Severa. Owain shot up from his seat at the table and started shouting excitedly.

"Alright!" he cried, "That just leaves me! I'll cut down this traitor with the dazzling light of my blade and fury of my sword hand! I won't let you down Khan Flavia, seal my blade forever if fate wills me to lose!"

"Hey!" chimed Cynthia, "Owain, not fair! You said I could take on a tournament of heroes as your apprentice when we were younger!"

"Did I?"

"Yes, you did! Gerome, he said that, right?" Gerome said nothing, shaking his head in disapproval. "Besides, I have this!" Cynthia removed Falchion from its sheath and pointed it high. "This is the same blade that Father won the last tournament with!"

"Yeah, but it's also the same blade that lost the last tournament, it's a 1-1 win to loss!" responded Owain. "My Missiletainn has no losses to its name, I should be the one to take this!"

"I'll take you on right now you-"

"Alright, enough, save it for the Arena!" shouted Flavia, breaking up the quarrel. "I appreciate your enthusiasm, but we only need one champion for this, can't you two come to a decision?"

"I have an idea." said Lucina. She got up from her seated position and turned around, leaning back to let her long hair touch the floor. "Pull on my hair, whoever draws the longest strand gets to compete in the tournament; it'll be like drawing straws."

"Gee Lucy, are you sure? I don't want to hurt your head."

"I'll be fine Cynthia," responded the princess, "I've trained for worse injuries than having my hair pulled."

"Alright, if you insist..." responded Owain, as he grabbed one of Lucina's hairs, the size of a small rope, and Cynthia grabbed another. Both cousins started pulling hard, huffing and wheezing at the pull, amazed at how strong Lucina's hair became with its size. Flavia chugged her drink and let out a laugh, excited by the sport before her.

"This is great!" she said, turning to Lucina. "Are you sure you don't want to be bigger a little longer? This could really whip my men into shape!" Lucina laughed at the Khan's comments and leaned back further, hoping that would reduce the strain on her family as they pulled. As Owain and Cynthia continued to pull, Lucina's hair stands started to break from her mane, forming small tears like a rope would. Eventually, the strands gave way and Owain & Cynthia flew back to the ground, the hair strands covering their bodies like long ropes. Everyone had gathered around the two to see who pulled the longest piece.

The Sorceress wins the duel for Basilio
1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.content:
The electrifying aura of Arena Ferox had pierced the air; people cheered and fought amongst another as they waited for the main event to start in the stadium. In a gladiator's hall under the Arena's stands gathered Lucina and her party; a high barred window allowed for Lucina to view through at the fight and still stay hidden, her friends able to watch too if they sat upon her shoulders. On the floor underground stewed Owain, disappointed at his loss in Lucina's test.

"Man!" he cried, walking back and forth, "I knew I should've put my 110% into that pull! If only I had pulled harder and closer to the base...!"

"A loss is a loss, Owain." responded Lucina, smiling down at her cousin. "I'm sure Cynthia will do just fine, and you can always compete in the next tournament."

"But I'm going to be a father though, I can't just drop my little baby girl for a battle!" Owain looked ready to cry, causing the others to laugh.

"I'm going to introduce our little champion here," said Flavia, patting Cynthia on the back, "Try not to stew too much, sword-boy, I'll let you take on my entire army if it'll make you feel better!"

"I guess that'd be okay..." Cynthia drew Falchion and pointed it to Lucina.

"I promise I'll come out winning Lucy, I swear on it! I don't care who this lady thinks she is!" Lucina rubbed her finger across the dull edge of Falchion, stopping once she reached Cynthia's hand.

"Good luck, sister, I have no doubt you'll succeed." Cynthia sheathed Falchion once again and departed with Flavia to the Arena's East-Champion entry. Lucina turned to look at the rest of her family. "Shall we watch the fight together?"

"Leave me out of it, heights don't agree with me." responded Severa. "Owain, tell me how Cynthia's doing from up there, okay?"

"Alright..." responded the dejected Myrmidon. He stepped on Lucina's palm and was raised to her shoulder, he sat upon it with his chin resting in his arms. Gerome soon followed Owain, sitting next to him with his arms crossed.

"I only wish Minerva could take flight in this hall, it feels strange not doing recon alongside her." Lucina smiled at Gerome's words, he really did love the wyvern like a close family member.

"You'll be able to ride upon her soon, Gerome." responded the princess. "For now, I'm happy you're here with me now." Gerome turned to Lucina and shot her a quick smile, before they both turned to watch the battle begin.

----------

After a while had passed, the chatter of the crowds had finally ceased as the two Khans of Ferox gathered together within the middle of the Arena. Flavia locked her eyes with Basilio's one, the two smiled at each other and glared, like two wolves ready to fight over alpha status.

"Well, well, well, if it isn't the One-Eyed Oaf of the West!" spoke Flavia. "Did you not learn your losses from last time, or do you wish to make a fool of yourself in front of Ferox once more?"

"Oh, I've certainly become wiser, you crusty siren!" Basilio responded. "I could easily take whoever you got in mere seconds, but rules are rules, so I have a strong mage ready to do my job for me!"

"That I'd like to see!" The two Khans locked knuckles with each other, as if to recognize each other's strength in their rivalry, before breaking away to introduce their champions. "Alright, you're up!" shouted Flavia to the doors behind her. On cue, out burst Cynthia, breaking into a sprint before sliding into the center ring on her knees, throwing flower petals in her wake.

"Get ready Basilio, for I have arrived; Cynthia, Defender of Truth, Justice, and Love! Throw all you got at me, this one's for East-Ferox!" shouted Cynthia as she pointed to the stands. Despite the crowd's cheers, the cheesy entrance nearly made Flavia topple over.

"Har Har Har! Your champion certainly is enthusiastic!" Basilio wiped a tear from his eye before calming his composure. "I kid, it's great to see you again Cynthia! How's that sister of yours doing? I hope she came to visit old Uncle Basilio and cross blades too!"

"Well," responded Cynthia, chuckling, "That's going to be a bit of a problem..." The West-Khan wondered what that could've meant, but shrugged it off to introduce his champion.

"You must've heard the rumors yourself, so here she is! My prized Sorceress!" Out the door from behind him slowly walked out a young girl draped in a dark cloak. Her solemn look broke into a smile as she threw the cloak from her body, white doves flying from her cloak, as if it were a magic show. The young Sorceress had raven-black hair and she wore a black and yellow bra decorated with black diamonds, yellow underwear, a see-through bodysuit only covering her stomach, black and yellow open-toed high-heeled boots, a yellow cape, and a yellow headdress. She waved her hands up into the air and addressed the cheering crowd, mostly men cheering at her appearance.

"Yes! I'm an entertainer!" she spoke with childlike glee. "I'll be your champion for tonight West-Ferox, and I promise to bring back the rule to your one and only Khan! Let's enjoy tonight's show!" She clapped her hands together and formed an array of flowers from them, before throwing them in the air. "Showtime!" The young girl snapped her fingers and the flowers exploded into fireworks, causing the crowd to cheer even louder.

"You certainly picked a good jester candidate, Oaf, let's just hope she doesn't cower at the sight of a piece of steel!" Flavia once again locked fists with Basilio before the two departed from the ring. The Sorceress had readied her tome from her cape and took a fighting pose with it.

"May the Goddess of Luck shine upon you today, Blue Warrior, for the stars declare that this win shall belong to me!" Cynthia looked at her opponent puzzled.

"That's kinda weird, she looks just like Aunt Lissa..." Cynthia shook off the thought and drew Falchion, taking a stance imitating Lucina's movements. "I've heard of you, 'Crimson Warrior', and I don't intend to lose, I have someone to protect! Now, do you have a name for my blade to take?"

"N-Name?!" The Sorceress froze up, and stammered in a panic for a moment, sweating profusely from the head. "Um, uh, m-my name is, uh, H-Henry...etta. Yeah, that's it! Henrietta!" The girl took her stance again, Cynthia only looked confused.

"You're hiding something, aren't you?" The girl looked shocked at Cynthia's comments. "...Nah, must be my imagination at work again!" The young Sorceress sighed in relief and locked eyes with her opponent again. After a few seconds, the two charged at each other, sword and spells ready to clash.

"Let's duel!"

----------

"What do you make of this?" asked Lucina, watching from behind her window. Gerome put his hand to his chin and pondered for a moment, taking in the scene.

"It's hard to say, I can't hear what they're saying from over here, but she seems very...energetic." Gerome wanted to say "crazy", but his mouth would not let him.

"I mean she looks cute enough though." chimed in Owain.

"You better not be thinking of leaving me for that woman!" yelled Severa from the ground floor.

"I wouldn't dare dream of it, Severa!" responded Owain, trying to calm down his wife. "Though it is kind of strange," said Owain, looking back at the two girls fighting, "Her face looks a little familiar, don't you think?"

"I'm sorry Owain," replied Lucina, "But I can't see it very well with all the action going on. Do you know her from somewhere?"

"...Nah, I'm probably just overthinking it." All three went back to watching the battle unfold before them.

----------

"Roaring Tempest!" Cynthia dodged to her left to avoid the huge stream of wind coming at her. She jumped in the air, ready to drive Falchion down into her opponent.

"Naga's Revenge!" The woman teleported out of the way, appearing behind Cynthia. A shadow of a large arm brandishing a cutlass came from the girl's tome.

"Abyss Puppet!" Cynthia turned and locked blades with the paper-thin shadow; she stared into her rival's eyes deeply. "Well," started the Sorceress, "It seems you are not uncommon to the practice of signature moves! The seeing stones spoke of a rival like you, I respect your might in the art!" The Sorceress stomped the ground and a pillar of fire shot up from the ground under Cynthia, breaking her clash with Sorceress. "However, you are still 18 years short from defeating me!"

"We'll see about that, you spooky magician!" Cynthia charged towards the Sorceress again and clashed blades with her shadowy puppet again. "Though, after I win this, you should try joining our Justice Cabal back in Ylisstol! I have a cousin who acts a lot like you do, you'd just love him! He's married though!"

"I'll take you up on that offer, O Azure Knight! But on the name of my Father's honor, I shall not lose this battle! I've travelled across worlds in order to prove myself here!" The two broke away from their clash and the Sorceress started launching fireballs and lightning bolts at Cynthia. The Pegasus Knight snaked around the attacks and moved in to close the distance once more, the Sorceress prepared more shadow puppets from her tome once more to prepare for the oncoming clash.
1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.title: By Book, Blade, and Crest of Flame

1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.content:
Cynthia stabbed her way through the shadow puppets. The sorceress continued moving back as quickly as she could, continuing to launch blasts of dark magic, however skilled as she was, she could not match Cynthia's speed. Even with her shadow puppets and acrobatic movements, Cynthia had no trouble keeping close to her.

"SHADOW DRAG- AH!"

She tried to call out another spell but was interrupted by the sting of Cynthia's lance. The sorceress tried again, but was hit by a follow up attack, this one sending her to the ground. Cynthia held her lance over the sorceress, sure as victory as she was, she still wanted to be ready for any possible trickery.

"Surrender, sorceress!" Cynthia yelled.

"I-" she looked around any possible escape, but with Cynthia's lance hanging over her their was none. "I yield!"

Flavia stood to her full height.

"Then the winner is Cynthia!"

The crowd on her side cheered, as did Lucina and the others.

The sorceress pouted, folding her arms across her chest.

"I can't believe I lost!"

Cynthia offered her hand.

"You put up a good fight, those spells stung! And you had such cool names for them! But no one's better at beating mages than use Falcon Knights!"

After a few seconds, the sorceress took her hand and Cynthia helped her too her feet. However the sorceress was still unhappy.

"But I wanted to win for mom and dad! And I didn't even get to show off everything I could do with Missiletainn."

Their was some angry yelling from the crowd. Flavia clenched her teeth.

"Basillo wouldn't have... there's no way she's from our clans..."

Severa and Owain's eyes grew wide.

"Did she say-" Owain stammered.

"Missletainn!" Severa yelled. "Like that sword you carry around? How many people would name their weapon that?"

Cynthia took no notice, remaining her cheerful self as she tugged the sorceress around..

"I'm sure you're mom and dad would still be proud if their watching. I mean you lost but you put on a great show! Just because I beat you it doesn't mean you aren't strong."

"Hmm.."

"And that offer to join that Justice Cabal is still on."

The sorceress brightened up at that, clapping her hands together.

"Really? I always wanted to fight for justice!"

Her slow walk suddenly gained a spring. Cynthia smiled back.

"We'd be glad to have you! By the way what did you say your name was?"

"Ophellia."

Owain and Severa gasped. Severa glared at him.

"Does dressing up and travelling through time run in your family or something?"

Owain ignored her, running out and vaulting over the barricade to meet her.

"Ophellia! Daughter! Is that really you?!"
1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.title: Justice wins again.... just kidding!

choices: They make it to the palace and feast
1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.content:
Ophelia slapped her hands to her mouth once she heard her name told back to her, she couldn't believe she let her guard down so easily at Cynthia's kind gesture.

"Crap!" she thought, "I might have screwed up the timeline by giving my real name!" Suddenly, the yells of her name grew louder, louder, from a young voice charging at her; whoever this new foe was she thought, she'd have to fight them to prevent the timeline from going wacky. Ophelia swung her raven hair around, adopting a solemn expression, and slowly turned to this new foe. "Hark! An enemy beckons my name! Prepare to taste purgatory, fie- DADDY?!" Ophelia turned to face Owain with wide eyes, watching the Myrmidon pant and huff, trying to regain composure.

"Hark!" he cried, "My daughter comes from across time to meet me! Mere words cannot express my joy at her appearance!” Owain coughed and wheezed as he tried to recover from his sprint.

"Oh Daddy!" cried Ophelia, burying her face into Owain's chest. She snorted and sniffled as she spoke to him, her words came out obscured by snot bubbles. "I-I've missed you! I-I came back through time! A-And, I'm so glad to see you again!" As she cried like a baby, Flavia came up and grabbed both Owain and Cynthia and drug them off to the coliseum halls.

"Alright, save the waterworks for outside the ring! You got some things to discuss!" The four left through the door, leaving some of the crowd chattering and confused, but the Easterners mainly glad their Khan keeps rule again.

----------

"Holy smokes!" shouted Ophelia, looking at Lucina's large frame, "Is that the crown princess?! How did you get so big?! And when did you come back through the Gate?!"

"I'll explain my situation later," explained Lucina, "But more importantly, I'm not the crown princess you know, I am another Lucina, from a different time, one separate from yours." Ophelia looked one part confused by her words, another part amazed by her size.

"And what are you even doing crossing through timelines?!" barked Severa. "Don't you know that's dangerous?! We nearly bit it when we came back!"

"Oh Mommy!" cried Ophelia, hugging Severa tightly, "I never meant to worry you, but I- Wait, what? 'Came back?' Are you from the future too?"

"We probably should mention that to our Ophelia..." mumbled Owain, scratching his head. He cleared his throat, and puffed out his chest. "But yes, dear daughter! We are all warriors from a doomed future! Travelling through time to save the world as you know it, for innocent children like you to live and love in!"

"I don't really get it..." replied the Dark Mage, "But I guess if you say it, it makes sense. After all, you two aren't..." Ophelia mumbled out that last bit, enticing confusion from all present. Cynthia swung her arm around Ophelia's neck and joyfully responded to her.

"So this means you're my niece, yeah? That's great, I have such a cute and heroic niece!" Ophelia blushed and grinned wide at her aunt's comments, humbled by her kind words. "Alright, let me introduce you to the Justice Cabal; I'm Cynthia, your aunt, a super-cool Pegasus Knight for Ylisstol! And that over there is my really big sister Lucina!"

"Pleased to meet you!" spoke the giant.

"I've never seen the crown princess up so close before, she usually only stepped out for the Exalt's speeches and the Shepherd's exercise routines! You're so pretty!" Lucina bowed her head at the Sorceress' words.

"We're on a quest to shrink her back to normal right now, and it bought us to you, so you must be important! That grump over there is her husband, Gerome; he looks tough, but he's a true hero and Justice Cabal founder!" Gerome blushed and looked away, waving his arm to greet the time traveler. "And those two over there are-"

"I know them!" Ophelia interrupted, voice filled with whimsy. "Those are the greatest and most heroic performers Ylisse, nay, the world has seen; my Daddy and Mommy, Owain and Severa! Their shows brought smiles to all who viewed them! They truly are the greatest Troupe to ever live!" Owain puffed out his chest, ego stimulated by his daughter's words, Severa just crossed her arms and looked surprised.

"I'm impressed," she responded, "That's one way to introduce your parents."

"I can't help it, I'm just so excited!" Ophelia cried. "I spent my whole life trying to be a great entertainer, like Daddy wanted, so I trained with Uncle Henry and Aunt Sully to become an expert magician and performer! I can cast magic while riding a trapeze!" Severa couldn't help but cringe when she heard the words "Uncle Henry", she still thought that guy was a total lunatic, he must've rubbed off on her somehow.

"You still haven't answered us though," chimed in Flavia, "Why come to the past in the first place? And why fight for the Oaf?"

"Well," stammered Ophelia, "I can't really get into it, because Uncle Henry said 'Messing with time and telling people about the future could mess everything up real nice!', but you know, I guess I just really wanted to see my parents again. I fought for Khan Basilio to train for new material is all."

"That's sweet." commented Lucina. "But Ophelia, don't be afraid to open up to us on anything, I had the same fears you once had with my Father, but all turned out for the better in the end once I told him of our future. If you ever want to talk, just talk."

"For starters," chimed Severa, "What's with that outfit? What's with all that skin you're showing?"

"Do you like it? This is my "Performer from the Stars" outfit!" Ophelia spun around to show off her outfit. "I made it myself: Uncle Henry said good Sorcerers wear little clothes to move easier and Big Sis Kjelle said good warriors show off their muscled bodies, so I used both their advice to make this! What do you think?"

"I think I'm going to clobber those two..." commented Severa.

"I think it looks terrific!" commented Owain. "The shining yellow really complements your magic, and the black diamonds really scream 'Behold, my demonic servants!' when they reflect the shadows from your book! And your body is so well toned too; I've never been more proud, you're definitely a true hero!" Ophelia squealed and hugged her father, jumping up and down while doing so.

"Oh, thank you, thank you, thank you, thank you! I knew Uncle Henry was right when he sent me to live with that family of wolves for 2 years!"

"Okay! That's it!" shouted Severa. "We're keeping our child the hell away from that nutjob when she's born!"

"So Ophelia, how about it?" asked Cynthia, "Wanna come with us to help fix up your Aunt Lucy?"

"Absolutely!" shouted the Sorceress, jumping in the air with her fist pumped high. "I could check Missiletainn's spells and see if we could shrink her down! Now that would be a real magical trick!"

"Can you really do that?" asked Lucina. "Is your magic that good?"

"Well...I dunno. But I could give it a try! A good entertainer always gives a new act a try!"

"I expect no success, usual magic has had no effect on me so far, but I would appreciate your help." Ophelia whipped out her tome and flipped through the pages, looking for a hex that could shrink something.

"Hmm, nope, nope, nu-uh...There's this one right here for hair growth, I could try it in reverse." Lucina felt her heart sink a little.

"That's fine, thank you for trying Ophelia, we'll just continue our journey for the shrinking elixir since we've come this far." Ophelia's eyes lit up with stars.

"You're on a journey for a shrinking elixir?!" she cried in awe. "That sounds so COOL! You just have to let me come along! I could make a nice show out of this!"

"Absolutely, you're always welcome to join." responded the princess with a smile. The Sorceress started bouncing up and down with glee, happy that she gets to travel with her family from the past.

"This is great and all," commented Flavia, "But could we discuss this back at my quarters? I don't want people seeing Lucina like this and causing a sce-"

"Hey, Flavia!" came the shouts of Basilio from down the hall. "What's the damned big idea, stealing my champion away after the fight's over?!" He stomped down the hall, the noise reverberating with sounds of fury from off the walls. "I swear woman, I could knock you out right now if you so wis- HOLY HELL!" Basilio's only good eye nearly popped out of his socket as he laid it upon Lucina's giant figure.

"Um, hello, Khan Basilio," she spoke, "How do you fare these days?" Basilio took some time to compose himself before responding.

"So this is what you meant then Cynthia! Geez, don't scare me like that! My heart's not as young and sharp as my mind!"

"Ha!" laughed Flavia. "Your mind is sharp as a brick if you react to a woman like that!" She began to head towards the exit to retreat back to her palace. "I'll throw you a bone, Oaf, join us for a feast tonight in honor of my victory, and we'll fill you in on Lucina's condition and your champion's true identity." With those words, everyone departed from the Arena Ferox and stealthily retreated to the palace before the Arena halls and city streets filled with Feroxi citizens.

1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.content:
Lucina's stomach roared. She held it and looked sheepish.

"Are you sure you'll have enough food for me?"

Flavia stood proud.

"Of course! We Khans pride ourselves on our hospitality and feasts."

"Not to mention you saved our backsides."

Lucina smiled.

"Thank you, we would be honoured to join you."

Flavia cleared the way for Lucina, figurtively and literally, her prescnse allowing the citzens to accept the blue haired giantess, though she still attracted several stares.

Lucina loked away, it wasn't as unpleasent as before, but she did not beleive she would ever get used to drawing this kind of attention.

Basillo laughed, oblvious to her disocmeft and jovial as ever.

"What are the odds? Two champions in a row and they both been time travelling woman in disguises!"

"That is strange...."

"I don't know if I could have gone back if Lucina hadn't left the way open or given me the idea!"

"I wonder what I'll get next time! Maybe someone will show up in a box with a device from the future!"

"Only if we end up a hotspot for time travellers."

"That shouldn't be likely. We came back to stop the Grimleaf, and Ophelia came back to stop.. something else."

"What did you come back to stop?"

"I can't tell you, Uncle Henry told me not to tell too many people."

"Oh? Why? Don't tell me I kick the bucket again!"

Ophelia shook her head.

"No it's nothing like that. And I can't tell people because Henry said the knowledge would change how people would act and those changed actions could affect other things I can't see like some kind of butterfly of doom!"

"When I came from the future I kept a low profile at first, but when I joined the Shepards I had to let people know who I was and where I was from and as far as I'm aware, my precsne did not cause any harm."

"I'm sorry, Uncle Henry insisted and I don't want to take any chances."

"If you insist..."

"Just let us know if anyone's going to kick the bucket."

Ophelia hesitated, but nodded.

Gerome had been riding Lucina's shoulder and shuffled closer.

"Any idea why she could have come back?"

"She's obviously come back to prevent something that happened her time. Maybe someone targeted her mom or dad, or an ancient evil wakes up or a war breaks out. As of now I can only guess."

1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.content:
"To victory!" Flavia raised her mug of mead high in the air, exciting cheers from Feroxi warriors gathered in the palace. The Khan drank from her mug and laughed, clearing her throat to address her crowd. "And now, a special treat; A public speech from the Oaf-Khan himself, Basilio!" The dark-skinned warrior begrudgingly walked up on the stage, lips clammed shut with a annoyed expression on his face. "Go ahead, I'm waiting." Basilio sighed and got ready to humiliate himself.

"Men, comrades, brave warriors. I stand before you not as the West-Khan, but as a Fool, a Dummy, and most importantly...an Oaf. As you drink and feast tonight, may you please yourself with the thought that you all have a sharper mind than this old moron, and may you all appreciate the thought that I was bested by a small, lightweight girl." The Feroxi warriors laughed uproariously, as did Flavia, at Basilio's speech; a vein looked ready to pop on the West-Khan's forehead. "Alright woman, I did your speech, now where's my mead?!"

"You did good Oaf! Here; best mead in the land, straight from the Northern Brewery!" Flavia extended a mug to Basilio and he accepted it in turn, chugging it quickly, hoping the alcohol would help him forget the embarrassment of loss and making a fool of himself. The feast kicked off with roaring celebration, Lucina's friends & family quickly integrated themselves in the celebration with no troubles; Feroxi warriors gathered around Cynthia to celebrate their champion as she posed with Falchion and various lances, Owain and Severa ate from the vast plates of meat and swapped stories of war between the rugged men around them, and Ophelia had gathered a large crowd around her as she put on a wonderful magic show for everyone, some men wowed by the show, others just eyeing up her skimpy outfit. Lucina and Gerome sat by a wall, happily drinking and eating together, Gerome rested upon the princess' shoulder.

"It feels nice to have a moment to ourselves." said Lucina with a smile, sipping a barrel of mead.

"Yes," replied Gerome, "Evidently the warriors of Ferox are far more interested in strong warriors than a giant woman. A proud bunch." Gerome took a leg of chicken from his platter and extended it to Lucina, intending to feed his wife; the princess opened her mouth and Gerome threw the whole drumstick in, Lucina didn't even chew as she quickly swallowed the small snack.

"You're cute at parties, do you know that?" Lucina's comment caused Gerome to blush.

"I only look out for your well-being. I'm more than happy to give you my food if you so wish."

"Whatever you say Gerome." Lucina rubbed her finger on Gerome's head, stroking his hair as if he were a small rodent. "We should set out in the morning and search the settlements nearby for a guide into the ruins. I'm glad Aunt Lissa pointed us in the right direction, but we'll still be lost unless we have a town elder to further direct us."

"Your family truly is amazing, Lucina. I'm...glad to be a part of it." Gerome cracked a small smile as he said this, causing Lucina to giggle in response.

"I knew it, you do enjoy being part of the family! It's going to be fun spending the holiday season with you, Father, and Mother!" Lucina looked down at herself again. "Well...provided I become normal again."

"Ophelia expressed surprise at your size, did she not?" replied Gerome. "If this timeline is a base, then wouldn't that imply you don't remain this size?"

"I appreciate your efforts to cheer me up Gerome, but that was the other me who she referred to, the baby back in Ylisstol. I might just be stuck a giantess with you and Minerva in Wyvern Valley." Lucina placed her hand to her chin for a moment before resuming her thoughts. "Which reminds me, we'll have to restock our tablecloths and bedsheets on the way back home. Perhaps Maribelle could make me some more outfits to wear."

"I only wish to keep you positive, Lucina. I promise to find you a cure for this, no matter how much rest it deprives me." Gerome looked at his platter, noticing it was empty. "Shall we refill our plate?"

"I'd like that." Lucina responded, smiling at her husband. She crawled towards the large carts of meat with Gerome hanging onto her scarf, ready to refill her stomach with meat and share merry stories with the others along the way.

----------

After a long and arduous journey, Tiki and Say'ri reached Mount Prism with their meteor chunk in tow, ready to consult Naga for her sage wisdom.

"My Lady," Say'ri asked, carrying the chunk in her large hand like a small baseball, "Are you positive this will work?"

"To be honest, no." responded the Manakete. "But we owe it to Lucina to try for her sake, especially after all she's done for us. Her growth has not seemed to affect her well-being negatively, but regardless, life as a giant could become lonely, she could be shunned by a society who sees her as different; I know first-hand how it feels to be different from others." Say'ri knew Tiki's near-immortality had always made it hard for her to make friends, so helping those who could be seen as different, like the half-Manakete, half-human Nah, had always been a passion of hers. Tiki stepped forward and took a knee in front of the temple's dragon statue and light-emitting mirror, effigies to the Divine Dragon Naga. "O Naga," she spoke, "Please hear my call! A new phenomenon has entered our world, I seek your divine wisdom to diffuse this matter!" Upon command, appearing in a sacred blue fire, came the apparition of a green-haired Manakete some referred to as a Goddess; the Divine Dragon, Naga, whom was also Tiki's mother.

"Tiki, my child," spoke the Manakete to her daughter, "You have grown so much from the infant you once were. I can see your spirit; you seem to have met many interesting and good-hearted comrades, I am gladdened by your experiences. Speak, why have you come seeking my advice?"

"O Naga, we come bearing a tool from beyond this world." As if on command, Say'ri placed the meteor between Tiki and the apparition of Naga to illustrate her friend's speech. "Its power is to mutate the body of humans and turn them into giants. It has affected a hero of this realm, as well as my close friend Say'ri, and I fear it may affect more humans." The meteor was raised into the air by telekinetic power, and was pulled to the Naga's view. She looked upon Say'ri, the princess kneeled before Naga in turn.

"Your friend appears to be three times your size. Is this the norm of this stone?"

"No, my lady," responded Tiki, "The hero I spoke of has become enormous, ten times the size of a regular human."

"I see..."

"We ask of you now, O Naga; can your divine powers reverse the effects of this mutation? We wish to create a stone to seal the power of growth, as you have done with the Dragonstones of our brethren?" Tiki and Say'ri waited a moment through silence for Naga to answer them.

"Millennia ago, the Dragonstones were created by the powers of the Dragon Tribe Elders, it was not I alone who was responsible." Tiki felt disheartened at this news. "However, I can see what you wish to accomplish, and it is possible. Tiki, my child, if you truly wish to cure the giants of their curse, than you must do this quest." Tiki raised her head, alert at her mother's words. "I wish for a full mass of stone and a giant to appear before me; from this, I can analyze the situation and use my powers and yours to create a cure for your hero in due time. Do you understand, Tiki?"

"Yes, O Naga! Thank you!"

"I shall leave it to you then, go now." Tiki and Say'ri turned to leave the temple. "Tiki, my child?"

"Yes, O Naga?" asked Tiki, turning to face her mother once more.

"I love you, good luck!" Naga gave her child a peace sign with her fingers and smiled warmly at her, before disappearing into the blue flame.

"Nah was right," thought Tiki, "Naga is kind of lame." As the two exited the temple, Tiki spoke to Say'ri about the new plan. "So we're going to need a full-sized giant and a larger meteor. I'm out since we need my powers, and I don't know where Lucina is."

"My lady," responded Say'ri, "Do you require for me to grow again?"

"Out of the question," responded Tiki, "I'm not putting you through that again, nor Lucina if we need a new meteor. I hate to say it, but we're going to need to grow someone else. Preferably a female for the effects of the Giantstone to work 100% with Lucina."

"I understand, my lady. Do you have anyone in mind?"

"Well..." Tiki responded, trying to think who'd be best. "We know where Maribelle is, but she'd probably deck me for suggesting her to grow, and while Queen Sumia would do anything for her child, abducting and mutating Ylisstol's Queen could put us in hot water. Regardless, we'll figure something out. Shall we depart to look for a meteor in Ylisse, Say'ri?"

"Yes, my lady." On that, Tiki shifted into her dragon form again, now prepared to carry the weight of her friend, and allowed Say'ri to grab her legs. The two took flight, and even though Tiki could carry her friend easier with the experience of it fresh on her body, the Manakete couldn't stop from huffing and wheezing as she struggled to soar.

"W-We're taking some stops for food on the way..."

1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.content:
Say'ri put a hand on her stomach, trying to ignore her pangs, at least for now.

"Lady Tiki, I have already been affect with the stone's allfiction, would it not be wise to use me as a test, rather than inflict this on another woman?"

"Are you simply asking because you want to eat more?"

Say'ri looked aside.

"N-no."

"We're not sure what would happen if someone were to exposed to those rock's effects a second time. You could grow to Lucina's size, or you could grow to a truly enormous size or the stones could affect you in a dangerous, possibly even fatal way."

Say'ri's eyes widened.

"I never thought of it like that...."

"I intend to find a volunteer and if all goes well, this affliction will not be permanent."

"Who do you have in mind?"

"I do not have anyone one specific in mind yet. It should be someone we know, so they do not abuse the power granted to them. Presumbly someone who thought alongside Chrom, unless you know of anyone else who might be suitable?"

"I do not...."

"It should preferably be someone beroc, for we do not know if these stones would adversely affect someone who isn't human.... and I do not think making Nowi or Nah giant sized would be a good idea..."

Say'ri shuddered at the thought.

"Who else could we choose? Sully is a disciplined warrior, I do not think she would abuse the power if it were given to her."

"That is a possibility, however for the best results we should choose someone reacted to Lucina."

Say'ri shuddered.

"Not Lissa!"

Tiki to, was alarmed, though her expression changed only for a second.

"Indeed, I fear she would try to make dolls of us."

"Or Ylisstol!"

"And since we want a female like Lucina that leaves..."

"Cynthia? She certainly is spirited and likely willing.... Can we trust her with this power?"

"She was always eager to help her comrades, and she appears to have a good heart."

Tiki thought about it more.
1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.title: Choosing a candidate

choices: Continue with Tiki & Co.'s road trip to Themis
1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.content:
Sumia stood in a stable out in the courtyard of Castle Ylisstol, brushing the Pegasi of the Pegasus Knight squadron. Before becoming the Queen of Ylisse, Sumia was once an accomplished Pegasus Knight herself, with an amazing natural ability to calm the animals around her and a great skill in flying the horses that transferred to her daughter; even after Chrom responded to her crush on him with a marriage proposal, Sumia still flew the path of a Knight in the war against Valm and Grima, her skills as good as ever. Even as peace set in Ylisse and her royal duties increased, Sumia's natural talent around the Pegasi did not dull, as did not her skills as a Knight.

"Easy now Marcia, would you like an apple?" spoke Sumia to one of the Pegasi while brushing its mane. She fed the winged horse and turned to another, ready to brush it too. "And how about you Fiora? Have you been keeping up on your baths?" Sumia sat upon a pail and begun brushing the horse's mane, not caring of the thick white hairs falling upon her royal blue dress. As she stroked the Pegasi's neck, another behind her started neighing at something outside, causing an uproar in the stables. "Ferry? What's wrong girl? Is there something outside?" Sumia ran out to see what all the commotion was and was met with the sight of a dragon and an Amazon touching down in the courtyard; Tiki and Say'ri. Tiki shifted back to her human form as Sumia ran out to meet the two. "Oh, Tiki & Say'ri! Welcome back! I thought a couple brigands snuck into the castle for a moment!"

"Pleasure to meet you again, Queen Sumia." said Say'ri as she and Tiki began to bow before her. Sumia just giggled in turn.

"Oh, no need to be so formal with me! We're friends, forget about the 'Queen' stuff!"

"Yes, Sumia." responded Tiki. The Manakete cleared her throat as she prepared a question for Sumia. "We were just in the neighborhood, and we were wondering; Is your daughter, Cynthia, around?"

"Sorry you two," responded the royal, "She just left with Lucina to Regna Ferox, you missed her by a few days."

"Blast, we'll have to fly back north again." Tiki removed her Dragonstone from her satchel and prepared to shift forms again. "Thanks for your help Sumia, we didn't mean to bother you tonight."

"Wait!" shouted Sumia, arm extended as she ran towards the two. She tripped over a root and hit the ground, prompting Tiki and Say'ri to stop their departure help hoist her back up. "Thanks for that, my dumb little feet..." Sumia wiped the dirt and grass from her face before continuing. "What do you two need Cynthia for anyways? Is it about Lucina? Is she going to be alright?"

"I'm sorry, my lady," responded Say'ri, "But we cannot divulge, there's no reason to involve more people in this." Sumia clasped her hands together and pleaded the two to answer her.

"Oh, please tell me!" she cried, giving her best puppy dog eyes. "I need to know if my baby's going to be alright! Please tell me she will!" Tiki sighed, there was no way of getting out of this one, she had to divulge everything.

"Okay, fine." she replied begrudgingly. The Manakete faced Sumia and gave her a solemn expression. "Lucina will be fine, we've consulted Naga and found a way to cure for her, but to do this, we need a fresh meteor and a candidate willing to become a giant. Cynthia is the closest link we could think of to Lucina, so as much as it pains us, we've chosen her as our candidate."

"That's wonderful!" cried Sumia with joy, "Lucina's going to be happy to become small again!" Sumia quickly lost the joy of her previous expression though as the rest of the explanation set in. "But, does this mean Cynthia will have to live huge now? What about her Pegasus? Her job as Captain? Brady? Wouldn't this ruin her life while helping Lucina's?"

"Believe me Sumia, we don't wish for this to happen." responded Tiki, looking distressed. "Naga told us we need someone as a test subject for this experiment. From what I understand, the meteor only mutates the body to cause rapid growth, so while we need just a female to replicate Lucina's situation, we figured a blood relative would be more willin-"

"I'll do it." interrupted Sumia.

"What?" responded Tiki.

"I said I'll do it."

"Sumia, you can't be serious! You have a kingdom to rule over with Chrom, we couldn't just-"

"I'm dead serious." responded the Queen. "I wish for my children the happiness they were deprived of in the future, how could Cynthia have that when she's as big as a building? I'd be more than happy to give my happiness away for theirs." Sumia adopted a more happy look to break the moment's tension. "Besides, Castle Ylisstol is huge! I'm sure Chrom wouldn't mind if I slept outside his room instead of in bed with him!"

"Well...I guess you have a point there." responded Tiki. "I'm sorry Sumia, forgive me for such selfish words. I should've factored in Cynthia's future rather than prioritize Lucina."

"It's fine! Really!" responded Sumia as she gave Tiki a small hug. "I'm just happy that you we're worried for me!" Sumia moved past the two and began to walk towards the castle interior. "Let's just let Chrom in on the situation before we do this, okay?" The two nodded and began following the royal as she went to consult her husband.

----------

"So, you want to turn Sumia into a giantess to help cure Lucina?" Chrom sat upon an armchair in the library as the three girls explained the whole situation to him.

"That is correct, my lord." responded Tiki.

"All we need is to expand Lady Sumia and bring the raw material of the meteor with us to Mount Prism." added on Say'ri. "From there, Naga will craft an instrument similar to a Dragonstone or Beaststone to allow the user to become normal-sized again."

"I see." said Chrom. He looked upon his wife to ask for her input. "Sumia, are you really okay with this?"

"Absolutely, Lucina's well-being is far more important than mine. Besides, it'll just be a quick big-and-small trip, right? It's not like feeding or clothing me will suddenly become a huge issue or anything." Chrom got up from his seat and rested Sumia's hands in his, he looked deep into his wife's eyes with a smile.

"You're a very caring person, do you know that? You're far too good for me." Sumia blushed at his words and giggled at him. "Just make sure you don't roll over to your stone in the middle of the night and grow on top of me, alright?"

"Oh Chrom!" Sumia replied. She removed her hands from Chrom's and gave him a big hug. Tiki broke up the moment by clearing her throat, bringing the attention of the two onto her.

"I hate to break up the moment, but we need to get rolling on this whole plan if we want Lucina small soon. We need to find a meteor somewhere around here, otherwise we're going to have to go to Valm and grab one. I'm sure the shower wasn't just restricted to Valm."

"I sent the Shepherds on the task after Lucina left." responded Chrom. "I promised her I'd make sure nobody is affected negatively by this. We've already received reports of green glowing stones around the continent and set up quarantine zones to keep villagers from touching them."

"But Tiki?" asked Sumia, "Lucina said her rock burst and scattered when it was activated, wouldn't we need a barrier to stop the shards from scattering too far if I were to touch it?" Tiki froze, she definitely forgot to add that to the equation.

"Thanks Sumia, I completely forgot about that part! We wouldn't want two giants to worry about!" Tiki laughed and rubbed her head, everyone else was a little baffled on how the Voice of the Divine Dragon could have such an empty head. "I doubt a physical barrier would keep, and it'd be uncomfortable for you to grow out of a wooden box, so we're going to need a magic user to help us on this." Tiki sighed as she ran over the candidates in her head.

"Do you have someone in mind?" asked Chrom.

"No...Well, yes..." responded Tiki. She sighed once more and shook her head, she knew this wouldn't be easy. "I told Maribelle about the whole Giantstone project we were working on, so she'd be more willing to help us, but she might just bust a vein if I come to her with more talk of giants. To be honest, I probably would've risked asking her to grow if you didn't know where Cynthia was."

"Alright, then shall we leave to Themis?" asked Chrom. He didn't want to show it, but he was a little excited to hang out with Robin some more.

"Yes, at once." The four left the library to prepare the journey, Tiki stopped as they walked a few steps down the hall. "Lord Chrom, you wouldn't happen to have a carriage, would you? Carrying Say'ri around has become a little...tiring."

"Hey!" shouted Say'ri, feeling inadequate about her height.

"Not to worry," responded Chrom, "I'll have to let Frederick know I'm leaving anyways so he can keep charge while we're gone. We'll prepare a carriage to ride to Themis with at the stables."

"Thank goodness..." responded Tiki. With that, the four continued on to request Maribelle's services.

Even as they feasted, Lucina still worried about her predicament. She asked if Basillo knew anything that could help her, striking up the conversation quickly enough that he would sober enough to reply coherently.

"Shrinking Elxir? Sounds like a children's story. Then again I'd have said the same thing about a giant woman!"

"I see..."

"I don't know this Arkhe- whatever place your on about, but after everything you've done the least I can do is lend you a guide. Well the least I can do is nothing, but I'll go one better! Ha ha!"

"Thank you."

"So come on, why not make the most of the occasion? Your companions certainly have."

Gerome gestured to the main floor, where she could see Owain, Ophellia and Cynthia, red in the face, laughing and chatting loudly. Gerome and Severa were more subdued, Gerome watching Lucina cautiously and acting aloof towards anyone else, while Severa wore her usual scowl, cautiously sampling the food on offer, while refusing any drink stronger than water, placing her hand on the bump in her stomach if anyone asked.

"I fear it would require a lot of alchoal before I felt anything."

Basillo slapped her on the back. Gerome's eyes narrowed, but he said nothing, while Basillo didn't even notice his reaction.

"Ha! You don't know how strong our mead is!"

Lucina took a cautious sip, still draining almost half the mug. Her eyes widened when she felt it's kick.

"This is stronger the anything I've tasted at home."

"Of course it is! No one is tougher than us Ferox!"
1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.title: Thinking of stuff can be hard

choices: The party sets out the next morning
1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.content:
As the festivities really kicked off with Lucina joining the fray, all the Feroxi warriors began to get heavily drunk and started singing songs of war with each other; Cynthia and Owain were quick to join them, both proving to be lightweights to alcohol after a mug or two of ale. The Feroxi warriors caught sight of Lucina and began to demand arm wrestles, the term "wrestle" being taken quite literally, as it came down to each challenger trying unsuccessfully to pin down Lucina's pointer finger to the floor, ejecting much laughs after watching each challenger fail to subdue the giant. Around the 11th drunk man, Gerome got upset at the warriors treating his wife like a circus attraction and offered to take on everyone in the room in arm wrestling - Lucina thought Gerome's display of affection was cute, but she didn't find it too impressive considering it was one sober man against hundreds of drunkards. Lucina sat down and leaned against a wall to drink a barrel of Feroxi mead as she watched her husband's challenge, but before she could take a sip, she felt the tug of Severa's arm against the hem of her tunic.

"Don't get too drunk," she spoke to the princess, "I'm gonna need you sober for a little chat with my daughter later. Look." Severa pointed at the young magician's face, staring more intently at Owain then watching the action on the floor. "I've been watching, she's not a drinker. She's hiding something about the future she came from, I intend to find out what."

"But Severa, why need me?" asked Lucina. "Ophelia's your daughter, I'm sure she'll confide in you easily."

"Right, like when you told Chrom how a dragon was going to kill everyone he knew and loved?" Lucina cringed at Severa's remark; it was rude but she had a point. "Look, I'm not dumb, I can see the girl went gaga over the sight of you, she clearly idolizes you as a person, even if it's not the exact you she saw. I figure she'll easily give up info for the caring Princess of Ylisse rather than her yelling, cranky mother, plus you could easily grab her if she runs off."

"Alright Severa, just call me over when you need me." Lucina responded.

"Thanks Luce," replied Severa with a smile, "Now go cheer on your hubby, he's 43-0 right now!" Lucina moved back to the floor to cheer on Gerome's arm conquest, but kept a close eye on Ophelia for the rest of the night, eyes still glued to Owain and vision moving over to Severa at random intervals.

----------

When the night came, a grand majority of Feroxi warriors had found themselves passed out on the main hall of the Eastern Palace, making it impossible for anyone else to move around there. Flavia had allowed Lucina's party guest bedrooms to stay in, save Lucina who was too big for the room, so she had opted for the hall outside the rooms with a tarp to blanket and keep warm with. While Gerome normally slept with Lucina, she had urged him to actually sleep in a bed by himself tonight, arguing that her chest wasn't a good substitute for a soft bed. Ophelia had helped Cynthia and Owain to beds themselves and went off to go fetch her mother, intending to sleep with both of them; wandering the halls, the two raven-haired girls had met up with each other.

"Mommy!" cried Ophelia, who's overwhelming joy dropped as she tried to correct herself. "Er, uh, should I say Severa, or Mother? I know it's kinda strange for a 19-year old to still be saying 'Mommy'!"

"You're way too joyful kid." responded Severa. "I wanted to talk with you about that actually, me and my friend here. You know Princess Lucina." Lucina moved out from behind a corner to reveal herself and smiled at Ophelia.

"Good evening, Ophelia." The Srceress bowed elegantly in turn.

"It's my honor, Lady Lucina. I'm still not used to seeing you this up close, not to mention so big!" Ophelia had adopted a normal stance once more. "So, uh, Mother, what did you want to talk about? Got some advice for my magic? Some new outfit ideas? I got this mermaid one for a water show I was thinking about..."

"Nothing like that," responded Severa, "But I am surprised how seriously you take your job, but glad how good you are at it. I take it we taught you?"

"Yup!" replied Ophelia with glee. "I learned all my magic from Uncle Henry, but you and Daddy, er, Father passed on the spirit of an entertainer to me, so I took what you practiced and made my own routines from it!"

"Impressive. So I take it you've performed with us, right?" Ophelia froze up when Severa asked her question.

"Well uh, not exactly..."

"Why not? Did something happen?"

"Look Mother, I'm not really comfortable with this questioning, so I'm just going to go to bed with Father..." Ophelia turned to go back to Owain's room. Severa snapped her fingers in response.

"Luce, restrain her."

"Sorry Ophelia!" Lucina reached her hand out and grabbed Ophelia, bringing the magician back before Severa and raised above the floor.

"L-Lady Lucina! Please let me go! This is uncomfortable!" Ophelia struggled to break out of Lucina's fingers.

"Now give me her tome." commanded Severa. Lucina begrudgingly removed Missiletainn from the Sorceress' person and handed it over to Severa. "Now that I have a trump card in this debate, will you tell me what you really came back for?"

"I can't!" cried Ophelia, "Uncle Henry said that talking about the future could ruin the past as we know it!"

"Oh, then you wouldn't mind if I burned this instead, right?" Severa walked over to a torch on the wall slowly, bringing shock to Ophelia and Lucina.

"Severa!" cried Lucina, feeling her friend was going to far.

"No! Not Missiletainn! Please Mother, that was Uncle Henry's gift to me!" Severa slowly moved her arm to move the book over the flames. "Alright! I'll tell you! Please, just stop it!"

"All I wanted to hear." Severa snapped her fingers again, commanding Lucina to release Ophelia to the ground, and gave her back her tome. Ophelia took a deep breath before speaking.

"Okay," she started, "In the future, you and Father...died during a tour." Ophelia started shaking as she kept talking. "I was only 5 years old and you two left me with Uncle Henry when you went to go perform in Valm, but there was a bad storm, your boat capsized, and..." Tears started to well in her eyes as she continued. "Grandma Lissa was going to take me in, but I just wanted to be a good performer like you two, so I stayed with Uncle Henry and practiced magic. He even taught me forbidden dark arts used for Risen summoning, but I couldn't find anything that could bring you two back like I knew you. When I became 19, Uncle Henry and Aunt Sully told me about the Outrealm Gate, so I thought if I could just see you two again, I could...We could..." Severa interrupted Ophelia's tale with a big hug and wiped the tears from her daughter's eyes.

"That's what got you so worked up? Us dying? So we'll just avoid boats, no biggie!" Severa stared deeply into her daughter's eyes. "Believe me, I know how hard it is to break to your parents that they ended up dead, I won't hold this against you."

"Oh Mommy!" Ophelia squeezed herself against Severa and started softly sobbing, prompting the mercenary to pat her back and beckon her it'll be okay; the scene hit too close to home with Lucina and it touched her heart deeply.

"No more secrets now, okay? It's going to be okay, Ophelia." Severa broke her hug once Ophelia calmed down a little more. "Now you know that once you came back through time, there was no going back, right?"

"Yes," responded Ophelia, "I made up my mind with everyone back in the future. I'm going to miss Uncle Henry, Aunt Sully, and Big Sis Kjelle, and I feel really bad for Grandma Lissa, but all I wanted was to see you and Daddy again. I hope I didn't upset you with all the secret keeping."

"Believe me, your outfit gets me more upset than your secrets. I really don't think my girl should be running around in her underwear, but it's special to you, so I'll allow it. Just make sure you bundle up when we set out up north tomorrow."

"Yes Mommy, thank you!" Ophelia turned around to Lucina. "I won't let you down, Lady Lucina, I'll get you small again so you can enjoy my shows without taking up all the seats!"

"Thank you Ophelia, I'm glad to have you aboard." answered the princess with a smile. "Just keep in mind that if you have anything to say, just tell us. I've been in the same situation you and Severa were in too you know."

"Understood, Your Highness." Ophelia turned to Severa. "Mommy? Do I need to tell Daddy about this too?"

"Whenever you feel like it, sweetie, I won't make you. And feel free to keep saying 'Mommy' and 'Daddy' however much you like, seeing as how you never really got the chance to."

"Thanks!" With that, the three girls walked on back to their rooms, softly gossiping along the way, and prepared to get to bed. When they reached the rooms, Ophelia and Severa had climbed into bed with Owain and snuggled under the bedsheets together, the young magician kissing her mother and father goodnight, and Lucina pulled the tarp over her body, staring up at the soft moonlight and listening to Minerva's growls and snores in the stables outside before falling to sleep, ready to set out the following morning.

Chrom looked into Sumia's eyes.

"Before we do this, Sumia are you absolutely certain you want to do this?"

She nodded.

"I am. If I don't, someone else will have and I would do anything ot help our daughters."

Tiki looked solemn.

"Your selflessness is admirable, but I must caution you. This is an experiment and I cannot guarantee results. There is a chance you will be stuck as a giantess forever."

Sumia shivvered, chattering her teeth, then stood straight, trying her best to appear brave.

"I-I accept. If the worst comes to worse.... Ysitrol will just have to accept having a giant queen!"

Chrome placed a hand on her.

"I will accept you at any size, no matter what happens."

Sumia smiled and hugged him.

"Oh Chrom.

"But are you certain you want to go through with this? We can keep searching for another way."

Sumia nodded resolutely.

"I am. As I said, if its not me, it will be someone else."

"Very well I respect your decision."

Chrom arranged for a carriage that could accommodate them though Say'ri had to ride on the roof and spread her weight between two of them. She wasn't entirely happy with the arrangement, nor with not being able to sit next to Lady Tiki, but she endured it.

Naturally having a giant atop the carriage drew more than a few eyes, but Chrom was able to allay anyone's fear, Ysitrol trusting in its rulers.

After making the necessary preparations, they set off for Themis.

Despite her brave front, and Chrom comforting her, Sumia was tense, twitching the whole. However she noticed Chrom was much more relaxed. While he was clearly concerned about her, he also seemed... excited.

"You seem unusually excited about this trip."

Chrom looked out the window, as though admiring the scenery

"Oh it's nothing."

"Are you looking forward to seeing Robin again?"

Chrom turned to Sumia and smiled.

"I suppose you know me well. It has indeed been too long."

Sumia nodded.

"I two would be glad to see them, despite the occasin. We should visit them more often. I mean socially not when someone turns into a giant..."

"Agreed, though we do keep in touch by letter. Albiet less often than I should."

"But that's not the same."

"Well I'm sure they'll be glad to see us in the flesh. Assuming Maribelee hasn't reached her limit on giant woman..."
"Oh it's noting
1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.title: Rejoin Tiki's experiment

1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.content:
Maribelle sat at the tea table of her terrace staring at the night sky, now completely calm with the knowledge there would be no giants to spook her this night. It was a hectic set of days she worked for Lucina's sake, her resources of cloth and food had dwindled hard with the girl's stay, but Maribelle thought it was all worth it if it could make Lucina happy again; after all she did for the Shepherds, Ylisse, and the rest of the world, Lucina definitely deserved anything Maribelle could provide for her. Robin once again joined his wife at the table, dripping with sweat, coat removed, and with a small towel around his shoulders; he wiped his face down and helped Maribelle partake in her favorite blend of tea.

"Alright," spoke the tactician, "It took a bit of work, but I managed to get all the wine packed up and shipped out to the town, Ylisstol, and the Feroxi docks, so we're all set for the month."

"Excellent work Robin." answered Maribelle with a smile upon her face, happy business hadn't fumbled during their time with Lucina. "The Themis Ball is next week, I assume that you have your tunic cleaned and pressed properly for the event?"

"Yup," replied Robin, "I went ahead and handled your dress too if that's alright."

"Most excellent indeed! Robin, you truly do go one step beyond! It's no wonder I fell for your charms!" Robin laughed in response, not expecting such an excited reaction from Maribelle.

"I just do what I can to help out! I must admit though, my dancing is kind of rusty, I think the last time I danced was at our wedding. If you have some free time in the week, would you mind helping me re-learn my steps for the Ball?"

"Why Robin, we could practice right now! I feel so spirited now that I have the burden of giants off my shoulders!" It wasn't even 5 seconds after the statement that a butler had opened the terrace door to address his masters.

"Madame Maribelle, Master Robin," he spoke, "Please excuse my interruption, but Lady Tiki wishes an audience with you. She carries the Exalt and Queen of Ylisstol with her, as well as Lady Say'ri." Maribelle had nearly broken her teacup in two at hearing this, while Robin got excited at the knowledge Chrom was visiting.

"Oh for gods sakes! What is it this time?!" spoke Maribelle, already feeling like her week was going to be ruined. She stomped down the main stairs with Robin in tow and opened the door to her manor; there stood Tiki, the first thing Maribelle's view had rest upon. "What do you want this time Tiki? I'm busy." Maribelle opened the door further and took notice of Chrom and Sumia, standing in front of Say'ri and their royal carriage. "Ah, forgive me, my Lord, my Lady! I do not mean to be so rude tonight!" Maribelle had bowed hurriedly to the royals, exciting a giggle from Sumia, while Robin caught sight of Chrom.

"Hey, Chrom!" spoke the tactician. He ran towards the Exalt and pulled him in for a friendly hug, Chrom gripping tightly in return. "What are you guys doing here? I'm assuming it's related to Lucina, right?"

"Yes," answered Tiki, "It's a bit of a long story, however, we have found a possible cure to Lucina's size and we need a mage with skill in barrier-erecting. Our first thought was you two."

"Ah, so your little pet project finally bore fruit?" inquired Maribelle. Tiki took no time in making herself comfy once more in the main parlor's armchair, and took some time to squeeze into the plush before answering.

"Mm-hmm, that's right, we can create a stone to let Lucina shift sizes with Naga's power, but for that, we'll need a test subject and whole mass of meteor." Maribelle looked ready to explode at the phrase "test subject", Tiki immediately picked up on her reddening face. "Calm down! I didn't mean you! Lady Sumia offered to become our test subject, all we need is you and Robin to help us set up a barrier so we can easily pick up the pieces of rock." Maribelle had calmed herself at these words, Robin just looked confused.

"Wait, honey, you knew about this?" he asked. "What does this mean, Sumia's going to grow too?"

"Yes," answered Sumia, facing Robin, "It's going to be a strange experience, but I'm willing to do it if it'll make Lucina happy again."

"We already talked about it," added Chrom, "I'm completely fine with it and I'll make sure Ylisstol's fine with it too; they already accept Sumia as a wise and loving Queen, I'm sure their opinion of her won't change when she's 60 feet tall."

"Lady Naga assures us the process will create a stone capable of shrinking the subject as well." added Say'ri, helping put Robin's worries to rest. "Lady Sumia will only be giant for a short while, then she will be completely capable of shrinking back to normal and growing back to a giant whenever she wishes. I would be capable of the same with the process, however, my size dwindles to Lucina's, so my stone would not be able to shrink her to normal size." Robin took in the facts calmly and thought for a short while before answering.

"Alright, it sounds like a good plan, but Sumia, you do realize Lucina's clothes were destroyed in her growth, right? Do you have anything prepared to wear once you become huge?" Sumia froze and gasped, realizing the gravity of Robin's words.

"Oh!" she cried, "That's right! Thanks Robin, that would've been a real problem!" In truth, Sumia didn't mind if people saw her naked, it was just part of her personality of being one with nature, but she didn't want the children of Ylisstol to be looking upon her body and getting their minds corrupted by lewd thoughts. "You wouldn't happen to have anything I could wear, would you? You made such a nice outfit for Lucina."

"Sorry Sumia," answered Robin, "But we ran through the last of our cloth with Lucina's outfit. Yarn and linen are on a shortage this year because of poor weather conditions and a sheep flu going around, so it's going to be a while before we can craft any more clothes." The rest of the group walked into the mansion and Sumia started looking around for an alternative. Her eyes fixated on the curtains covering the windows.

"What about those?" Sumia pointed at the red cloths; Say'ri cringed, remembering her experience with trying to pull the curtains down, and Maribelle ran over to her curtains, holding her arms wide to indicate they were off-limits.

"No, absolutely not!" she practically shouted. "These curtains cost me an arm and a leg, I'm not giving them up!"

"Come on Maribelle," answered Chrom, "I'm sure you'd say yes if Lissa asked you." He giggled at his joke while Maribelle froze up, a little embarrassed by the comment. "I promise to buy you some new curtains, the best in all of Ylisse."

"You really mean it, my Lord?" responded the noble, "I don't wish to squander your funds for my needs."

"Absolutely, it's no problem." Maribelle let down her defensive stance at Chrom's words.

"Well, alright then. But I'd rather it not be these curtains; Lady Sumia, is there not any other cloth you could use?"

"Actually," asked Sumia, "Do you have anything in purple or pink? I like colors like those the best." Maribelle sighed, the dining hall curtains were a plain lavender, the only ones in Sumia's favorite colors, but they were her favorites and some of the first she brought to break into her new home.

"There are some in the dining hall, please, follow me so we may take them down." Sumia trailed behind Maribelle as they walked down the halls to the dining hall, leaving the other four to themselves.

"So Tiki," asked Robin, "Do you have a fresh meteor to work with?"

"Yes." answered the Manakete. "On the ride over here, Chrom told us of a few meteors that had touched down at The Crossroads, not far from here or Ylisstol. The area has already been cleared and quarantined, so we have nothing to fear with any villagers in the area being affected. All we need is you and Maribelle to keep the shards in once place, and we'll be good to go."

"It'll be great to travel with you again Robin, as short as it will be." spoke Chrom. He stuck his arm forward and Robin grabbed his palm, pulling him in for a handshake.

"Glad to run with you again Chrom." Robin turned to the bell upon the stairwell and rang it, summoning a group of maids to his call. "Could you prepare a delivery cart for us to use? We need to load up some curtains and head down the road for a bit." The maids bowed and left to prepare the cart, Robin turned back to entertain his guests. "Say, while we're waiting for the cart, Maribelle, and Sumia, would you like to see Brady and Morgan? They've just started crawling, but they aren't speaking words yet; even so, they're the cutest babies in Themis!" Chrom giggled at Robin's overly motherly attitude, it's almost like Maribelle was the father in this relationship.

"I'd be honored Robin." answered Chrom.

"As would we." added Tiki, speaking of her and Say'ri. With that, the four left up the stairs to kill time with the babies while everyone was getting prepared.
