The group travelled back to the small village they came from, intending to take rest before retracing their path back to Ylisstol and regrouping with Chrom and Sumia. The mood was somber and quiet; Lucina and Gerome felt as if they spent a good chunk of their lives on a wild goose chase, though in reality it was merely a few weeks, and the other 4 had no clue what to say to the two without causing distress. Lucina looked towards the ground, looking slightly sorrowful, yet trying to keep her composure to keep the mood happy; for the in-flight Gerome and Cynthia close to Lucina's face, they weren't fooled by her demeanor, and tried to console her.

"Are you okay?" asked Gerome, flying in close. Lucina looked at him and tried her best to put on a smile.

"I'm fine." she replied.

"No you aren't." responded the Wyvern Rider. "I'm sorry about the elixir, I did not intend for our search to end like this."

"It's fine," Lucina said, shaking her head, "It's not your fault the elixir didn't work, we had no idea if it even truly existed." Lucina looked towards the sky. "You are right though, I am a little disappointed over how it didn't work, it almost felt like a waste of time. I suppose I could get used to life as a giant; I have my friends, my family, and especially you and Minerva." Gerome couldn't help but get depressed at Lucina's mood, he felt low knowing he had no hope to lean on, no more words to offer past parroting the same things he's been saying for the past few weeks.

"I could always try that hex out Lady Lucina, would you like me to try?" asked Ophelia, sitting upon the back of the wagon.

"Yeah, make her big and bald, great idea..." muttered Severa under her breath, doubting Ophelia's magic.

"It's fine, but thank you Ophelia, I think I'm done with trying to fix my condition anymore, I'm just going to get used to my size from now on. You are truly a caring niece." Ophelia wanted to relish the compliment, but couldn't crack a smile at the mood; she basically just got to this timeline, and still it felt as depressing as her future.

"I'd cut my sword hand from my body and seal my special moves forever if it could get you back to normal Lucina..." spoke Owain.

"Luce, you can ask us for anything you need as long as you're in Ylisstol, OK? We're part of you're family too, got it?" chimed in Severa. Cynthia raised her fist up in response, addressing Lucina with bravado.

"Yeah! And if Ylisstol's got a problem with my really big sister, well then, I'll just have to arrest the whole city! We're gonna make this okay!" Lucina cracked a small smile at her family's comments, grateful to have such a colorful and kind group to rely on.

"Thank you, all of you."

----------

After a short while, the group had reached the village they departed from, now far more welcoming being aware of Lucina's size. They walked through town a bit, receiving a few stares from townspeople over the still-giant Lucina, before reaching Elder Hubba's residence. The old man walked outside with his cane, coming face-to-face with the not-so-happy faces of the group.

"Well hello there, youngsters! Back so soon?" he asked. Hubba looked upon Lucina before looking at everyone else's faces; he got the mood of the group really quickly. "I see you're still big young lady, didn't find the elixir?"

"It's not that, Elder," responded Lucina, "We did find the elixir, but it appears not to have worked. I doubt someone would make up a story with so much evidence that backs it, so the elixir must've been lost its potency over the centuries. We thank you for your help Elder."

"No problem missy, sorry it didn't work out though." responded the old man, trying to keep cheerful. "Well, seeing as you're here, would you fellas like to participate in our Hunting Festival? We got some delicious meals and desserts to help celebrate this year's bountiful hunt, I'm sure you folks would like them."

"Thank you Elder, but we really must be going back home, south of Ferox." Hearing this, Cynthia fell into a childish tantrum.

"But Lucyyyyy!" she pouted, flailing her arms around, "Festivals come once every year! Can't we just relax a little?"

"I'm sorry Cynthia, but no." responded the giant princess. "You can stay if you like, but I'd really just like to see Father and Mother again. Besides, I wouldn't want you getting drunk again." Cynthia begrudgingly stopped her tantrum, not wanting to further upset Lucina after her sister's disappointing journey, but still folded her arms like a child. Lucina turned again to address the Elder. "We're sorry Elder, but thank you for the offer. We'll be going now."

"Ah, that's too bad." replied the Elder. "That green-haired woman really was looking forward to the Pie-Eating Contest against you as well. She has been eating us out of all our food though..." Everyone was surprised at the Elder's words, save Ophelia who didn't know why her family reacted as such.

"Tiki's here?!" asked Lucina, excited - the Manakete might have an answer to her problem. "Elder, where was this woman last?"

"Right behind you." On those words, the party turned to find Tiki behind them, chowing down on a cooked turkey drumstick, chomping on the bone and all with a smile on her face. "Hey," she spoke cheerfully, "How have you guys been? Nice clothes, Lucina."

"Lady Tiki!" responded Lucina, getting down on her knees to address the Manakete in a desperate fashion. "Oh thank goodness you're here, the shrinking elixir you and Say'ri spoke of existed, but it did not work on me. Is there anything else you can think of to help?"

"Huh, so it really did exist." Tiki remarked. She threw the scrap of bone in her mouth and crunched down hard, grinding it up into a fine calcium powder. "Ah, who cares about that old thing anyways?" Lucina was taken aback by this, feeling Tiki's words were harsh, and was hurt by her words.

"L-Lady Tiki, how could you say that? We journ-" Tiki raised a palm to calm the girl before she might've made an outburst.

"Let me finish Lucina, let me finish. There's no point in caring about that anymore since Lady Naga's fixed you up a little cure for your problem." On this, everyone was in shock, moods brightening now knowing that Naga herself prepared a cure for Lucina. The princess herself replaced the hurt in her heart with hope, and spoke excitedly towards Tiki.

"Really?!" she cried, "The Divine Dragon Naga?!"

"Mm-hmm!" replied Tiki, expecting this reaction from Lucina and feeling gladdened by her hope. "You know Dragonstones, right? We prepared something very similar and dubbed it a 'Giantstone', so now you can shift between your sizes as you please. Want to lie in bed with your hubby? Then go back to normal! Need a boost to view the woods? Then get big! Even those clothes will grow and shrink with you! And all it took was one meteor and you need to participate in a ritual!" Lucina was gladdened by this news, as was everyone else.

"Alright, cut the crap." remarked Gerome. "You said you needed a meteor, how did you get one without growing yourself? We saw what happened to Say'ri."

"Quite perceptive Gerome." responded Tiki. "Alright, it's true, someone had to get big just to get you small, so Lady Sumia took the charge herself." Lucina and Cynthia's eyes widened at this.

"Mother did that for me?" asked Lucina, shocked and touched by Sumia's actions.

"Is Mother alright? Will she be a giant from now on? She hasn't even had me yet!" commented Cynthia, worried about Sumia.

"Calm down you two, Lady Sumia's fine, she shrank herself down as a test subject for this, but she'll have the ability to get big when she wants from now on." responded Tiki. "When we grew Lady Sumia initially however, we accidentally caused Maribelle to grow to your size as well. At first, she freaked out, but she seems willing to give you her meteor to shrink again." At this, Lucina began to tear up and broke into a big smile, not being able to hold her feelings of happiness in anymore.

"Maribelle did that for me...I...I'm so..."

"We just need to get to Mount Prism for the ritual. You probably want to get small sooner than later, but can't we have that Contest first?" Gerome glared at Tiki from behind his mask, feeling angered that Tiki would suspend his wife's cure for leisure.

"If it's fine with you, Lady Tiki," responded Lucina, "I would prefer we leave now, I miss my old size. I promise to hold our own between us when we return to Valm."

"Suit yourself." Lucina turned to Hubba at Tiki's response.

"Thank you for your help, Elder Hubba."

"No problem, little miss! Have fun on your journey!" he spoke, waving his cane in the air.

"Alright, full speed ahead to Mount Prism!" cried Owain, whipping the horse reins to make his wagon move; in an instant, the group had all bolted to Mount Prism, now with Tiki in tow. When they were out of sight, Elder Hubba had retreated back into his house, walking into a kitchen and producing a goblet from a cupboard, similar to the one in the temple.

"I feel bad about lying to those nice kids..." he spoke to himself, "But they looked so needy for that shrinking elixir, just like in the story." Hubba filled the goblet with some water from a in-kitchen pond and squeezed some blueberries into the water, turning it a pale blue, just exactly like the elixir. He sighed for a bit before looking out a window. "Guess I'm gonna have to travel back into that temple, didn't think they'd actually make it that far, I hope I disarmed all those traps when they went in. The things I do for tourism..." Hubba exited his kitchen and went to join the rest of the villagers for the festival, goblet upon his table.
1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.title: When Sorrow Becomes Hope

1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.content:
Tiki turned back into her dragon and flew on ahead, leading the way.

Lucina once again walked with a spring in her step, everyone but Gerome and Minerva struggling to keep up.

After a long but uneventful walk, they reached mount Prism.

Severa paused to catch her breath, holding her stomach.

"I hope this is it cause my feet are killing me!"

Lucina frowned.

"I'm sorry to have dragged all of you this far."

Owain placed an arm around his wife, still as cheerful as ever.

"Hey, we came all willingly."

Lucina brightened up.

"I know."

Tiki gave everyone a ride up, aside from Gerome who insisted on flying next to Lucina.

Before long they reached the top. Robin and Maribelle had left, but Chrom and Sumia were still there, eager to greet their daughters.

"Mother! Father!"

"Lucina!"

They ran to meet her, throwing their arms around her, though neither could reach higher than her leg..

Lucina bent down.

"The shrinking elixir... it didn't work. I don't know if it was hoax or if it had been lost over all this time."

Chrom tightened his hug.

"It's fine. Tiki and Naga found a way."

Sumia stepped back, held up her stone and activated, growing to the same size as Lucina, then returned to her previous size.

"See?"

Lucina gasped then smiled.

"Naga be praised!"

"Yes, you need simply take the meteor fragments Maribelle brought here."

"But if I do that, won't Maribelle be cursed to live as a giant?"

Sumia hesitated to meet Lucina's eyes.

"She's uh... adjusting."

Chrom stepped forward.

"Robin is doing everything he can to ensure Maibelle's quality of life. Initially she was distressed, but as Sumia says she is adjusting. She still wants you to return to normal size."

"But-" Lucina began, but Chrom cut her off, ready with a reply.

"I know what you're thinking. You don't want happiness at the expense of Maribelle's."

Lucina nodded.

"When this is over I can organize a search for further pieces of the meteor. Gods willing, the stones will protect you and Sumia from the effects of further meteor fragments, allowing the two of you to safely collect the fragments so no one else will get caught in this."

"And then we can make a stone for Maribelle!"

"Exactly. And anyone else who is willing to defend the realm."

"Huh?"

Chrom's smile widened.

"What better way to ensure the safety of our realm?"

Everyone was taken aback by this idea.... except Cynthia who raised her hand high and waved it around.

"Oh! Oh! Pick me!"
1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.title: Wrapping things up?

1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.content:
“Forgive me if I may speak out of term, Lord Chrom,” spoke Gerome, “But considering the problems we have faced with these meteors, would it not be better to research before jumping to conclusions?”

“I realize it’s selfish of me to think of,” responded Chrom, lowering his grin a bit, “I don’t wish for you all to deal with these again, especially you Lucina, but there is a clear advantage our army can get from these that I cannot deny. I wish only for the safety of our realm and people, and I’d gladly be the first to take responsibility for anything that may happen out of this.”

“How noble.” answered Gerome, clearly still not amused by the idea of this. “So was it your grand idea, or was it the tactician's?”

“Neither, actually.” Sumia answered, “Maribelle actually pushed the idea, and volunteered for the front lines herself.” Gerome lost his footing at this, not expecting pompous and noble Maribelle to give the A-Okay for a war, everyone else found themselves just as shocked as Gerome.

“Well,” added in Owain, scratching the back of his head, “Auntie Maribelle does seem like the type of person to make rash decisions like that. Just don’t tell her I said that…” Chrom grimaced a little, remembering clearly how the suggestion came about.

“It’s fair to say she might have gone on a bit of a power trip when suggesting to use her power to ‘protect Lissa’s farm'. It was a little horrifying.”

“If it’s okay with you Father,” chimed Lucina, moving forward as she spoke, “I’d be happy with protecting the future ahead at this size, but for now, I would just like to go home with Gerome and sleep in the same bed as him once more. It’s been quite a roundabout journey after all.”

“I ask nothing more of you Lucina.” responded Chrom with a smile. “Take all the time you need. You don’t even have to pick up your stone again, I’d do anything to protect your peace.” Lucina smiled as she looked down at her Father, before turning to Gerome; the Wyvern Rider sighed.

“I’ll take that as an apology for the suggestion then.” Gerome looked up and cracked a small smile. “Thank you for all you’ve done…Father.” Lucina giggled at Gerome’s attempts to address his extended family, causing the masked man to blush and fidget.

“I wanna be big too! I wanna be big too!” Cynthia ran forward and began jumping in front of her parents like a child hopped up on candy. “C’mon c’mon c’mon c’mon Father, pleeeeeease?”

“Well, normally I would say no,” answered Sumia in Chrom’s place, “But seeing as how I’m now capable of shifting sizes, why not? We can be a giant mother-and-daughter team!” Cynthia let out a shriek and hugged her mother tightly.

“Thank you thank you thank you! This is gonna be so fun!” Severa shook her head at the sight of Cynthia acting like a dope again, but Ophelia thought it was sweet, and giggled in turn.

“Alright, now everyone clear out!” Tiki spoke, “I got to concentrate here, let small Lucina be a big surprise for you!” With a wave of her arms, everyone save Lucina bunched up and left the temple, leaving the two girls alone together.

“You didn’t have to do that, you know, they could easily have watched.” Lucina protested.

“Sorry about that,” Tiki apologetically responded, “I just didn’t want them to hear me get mushy with you.” Tiki knelt down towards Lucina and lowered her head. “I really haven’t been a help to you this whole journey, and I feel as if I hurt more people than I have helped, Maribelle especially. I am dubbed the Voice of Naga, yet I feel as if this experience has been a wake-up call; I still have very much to learn about humans and the natural world, and I cannot simply feign the part of an all-knowing sage with big words and a steady demeanor to command respect or favors of people. I hope you may forgive me if I hurt your feelings in any way, Lucina.”

“Are you kidding?” Lucina responded, “You had no way of knowing the shrinking elixir was even real, yet you gave me hope to cure myself and allowed me to journey with my loving friends and family. And even as I traveled on a wild goose chase, you went out of your way to make things right for me, and here you stand, begging forgiveness now when you’ve done nothing wrong. Tiki, you truly are a great friend, and I’m proud to have met you.”

“Thank you Lucina,” responded Tiki, “I’m sure Mar-Mar would’ve been proud to meet you too if he were still alive.” The two ladies smiled at each other, reaching a mutual understanding, before Tiki got back up again. “Now then, shall we?” Lucina entered a circle of meteor shard as beckoned by Tiki as the Manakete summoned Naga before the two of them. In a few short moments, the ritual began, and Lucina found herself bathed in light as rocks swirled around her body.

----------

The party waited outside the temple for Lucina to be done, joined by Say’ri who sat at a pondside, relishing her original stature. Say’ri’s mind wandered to other matters, relieving her of the stress her Amazon size once gave her, but her ears overheard slight words of the group’s conversation, yet she remained far calmer than the shocked Chrom and Sumia.

“You say you came from the future?!” spoke a shocked Chrom to Ophelia. “Just how many kids are going to come back from the future?!”

“Just me, my Lord, I came only for my parents sakes.” Ophelia pondered it for a moment before shuddering & continuing. “Though now that you mentioned it, a blond-haired mercenary had lusted after me in the future I came from, and I wouldn’t put it past her to travel back just for me, she was kinda scary. I can’t remember her name, Sol-something or other, but she said her mother and father were Shepherds too, and invited me out for tea with the both of them.” Chrom put his hand to his face and took a deep breath.

“Oh gods, it’s Morgan and Inigo’s child…” Chrom didn’t know whether to laugh or be disturbed by the irony that one of Robin’s bloodline had fallen in love with a daughter of his family’s, more the fact she was a girl herself. Sumia shook off the shock from Ophelia’s revelation, and got to speaking more calmly.

“Well, I must say, you are a cute child, Ophelia, it makes me proud to know you’re part of my family as well!” Ophelia blushed at the compliment.

“Thank you, Your Highness! I aim to please all!” Severa felt a smug sense of pride in knowing her daughter was complimented by the Queen of Ylisse herself. Just then, the massive stone doors of the temple opened, slowly creaking as they shifted.

“Lady Tiki and Lucina exit!” spoke Say’ri, intent on knowing the fruits of their labor. As everyone watched carefully for the two stepping into the light, their faces of hope turned to disappointment as they saw Lucina still a giant, both her and Tiki’s faces looking sullen. Say’ri was confused; she had saw it work on Sumia and felt it herself, why not work with Lucina? “Lady Tiki?” she asked, “Is there something wrong?” After a moment of silence, Lucina winked and returned to a happy demeanor, as did Tiki.

“Gotcha! We’re only kidding!” With that, Lucina produced a bright yellow orb from her person and held it high, bathing her in a bright yellow light. When the blinding aura cleared, Lucina stood at her original 5’8” stature once again, smiling widely from ear-to-ear, still clothed in her custom-made tunic which shrank with her. “It works like a charm! Thank you all for your help!” Everyone was relieved that Lucina was back to her old self again, and ran over to crowd and congratulate her. Gerome moved forward the most and pulled Lucina in for a deep hug, erecting “Ooh!”s and “Aww!”s from the onlooking party.

“Gods, how I’ve missed this…” spoke Gerome warmly, feeling the embrace of his wife returned to him.

“It’s good to be back, Gerome. Thank you for sticking with me.” The two broke away for a moment before closing in their faces for a deep kiss. The onlookers looked on happily, Severa grabbed Owain’s arm and stroked it tenderly.

“If something freaky like that ever happens to me,” she spoke, “You better sure as hell treat me like that when I get fixed.” Owain nodded, and as he did, Ophelia joined in, thinking the act to be a group hug; the moment might’ve been ruined, but the two did not protest, and leaned in closer to their daughter. Sumia leaned into Chrom’s chest and hugged him tightly as well, Cynthia joining in upon Chrom’s back – love clearly was in the air because of the two Valm residents.

“Now then,” Sumia spoke up, “I believe you said you were going to visit with us after you got back to normal?”

“That’s right Mother.” responded Lucina.

“Well then,” replied the Queen, “I say we have a family picnic to celebrate! Everyone here’s invited!” Tiki’s mouth watered as she jumped at the opportunity.

“Oh please tell me you have a fine turkey for me to eat!” spoke the Manakete.

“Oh, but first we should stop and thank Auntie Maribelle on our way back for Lucina! She’s gonna flip when she sees Ophelia!” Owain spoke. As the group all walked off together, Sumia becoming a larger size and Tiki turning to a dragon to make the journey easier, Gerome and Lucina lagged behind, the two saddling up together on Minerva’s back; the wyvern was overjoyed to see Lucina ride upon her again.

“Would you like to do the honors?” asked Gerome, pointing at Minerva’s reins.

“As you wish.” responded Lucina with a smile. In one sweeping motion, Lucina commanded the wyvern to take flight, and the three journeyed off to join with the rest of their family and friends.

The journey was finally over.
1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.title: End of the Line

1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.content:
“Halt demon!” cried Owain, “Your crimes against humanity end here! For I am the hero of justice, Owain Dark! Come to smite you with the might of the mighty Missiletainn and support of my loving wife, Severa Light!”

“That’s right!” shouted Ophelia, donned in armor and hair up in pigtails, “We make up a duo of justice together, and as long as our spirits linger in this world, your kind has no room to live!” The two bunched up together, back-to-back, before lunging forward with swords in hand, dashing like a charging rhino.

“SHAAAADOOOOW DRAAAAGOOOON!!!” cried the two, as they thrust their blades into the darkness before them, stabbing at the invisible enemy they fought against.

“Aaaand scene!” shouted Severa, sitting in a chair with full view of the stage her family worked on. Owain and Ophelia broke away from each other and begun to stretch, grinning at each other as they did so.

“You did great, honey!” complimented Owain towards his daughter, “You play your mother really well! In terms of face, you’ve inherited your grandmother’s looks, but your hair’s just as brilliant as Severa’s is!”

“Thanks Daddy!” Ophelia responded, giggling as she did so. “I really want to make sure I make Mommy out to be the hero of justice she truly is, so that everyone may know how great she really is!” Ophelia turned towards Severa to ask for her input. “How did I do?”

“Honestly, I think you need to be grumpier, and you won’t ever catch me dead with those ridiculous special moves, but all-in-all, not bad, you make a fine actress, Ophelia.” The sorceress was gladdened by her mother’s words and placed her hands to her rosy-red cheeks in response. Suddenly, the door to the theater flew open, and a loud voice shouted into the auditorium.

“Alright, where is she?” cried an excited Lissa, “Where is my little granddaughter from the future?” Lissa ran down the aisle and jumped up onto the stage, coming face-to-face with her granddaughter before pulling her in for a hug. “There she is! It’s like looking into a mirror! Oh, if I were still a city princess and not a farm princess, I’d spoil you so silly right now!”

“Oh, all I need is your face, Grandma Lissa!” Lissa squealed at how polite her granddaughter was and dragged Owain into the hug with them.

“Oh Owain! You make a mother so proud! I’ve already lived to be a grandmother and I’m not even in my 20s yet, and she’s so polite too!” Lissa spun around to Severa and addressed her. “Hey, Severa, when is the little version of her due?”

“Just in two months or so, doctors say.” responded Severa with a grin. “I need to be relaxing and out of work until then, so Ophelia’s going to take my part in our shows we’ll put on, her magic is sure to blow the audience away too! You and Other Dad are coming to the first show next week, right?”

“You kidding me? I wouldn’t miss it for the world! I’m bringing Donny’s Mom too, she’s never seen a fancy play before!” Owain looked around at mention of his father.

“Where is Father anyways? Didn’t he come with you?”

“Oh you know Donny! Always lagging behind with some sort of thing he’s doing!” Lissa turned to the door and shouted as loud as she could. “Heeey! Donny! Come in here and meet your granddaughter right now!”

“I’m comin’! I’m comin’!” Donnel ran into the auditorium and fixed his hair, trying to look as nice as he possibly could. “Well howdy Ophelia! Nice to meet ya!”

“Grandpa Donny!” Ophelia jumped from the stage and pulled in her grandfather for a big hug, happy to see him again. “It’s been ages since Uncle Henry took me to see you on the farm, you definitely look shorter than in the future!”

“Ouch!” Donnel cried, “That definitely hurt ma’ pride a little! Why, you almost wanna make me sign on ta Chrom’s Giants Brigade like that!” Everyone laughed at Donnel’s displeasure, taking joy in making fun of the farm boy’s short stature. “Speakin’ of, any of you fellas thinking about signin’ on fer that?”

“Tempting, but no,” replied Owain, “My passion is in two things: My sword-hand, and the stage. You can’t just abandon a weapon and a job for another weapon and another job, that’s like losing two best friends for two new friends, and they might not even be cooler!”

“And I’d rather just perform with Daddy.” Ophelia added on. “The stage is my life, and I want to dedicate my time to putting smiles on the people’s faces 24/7. Besides, if any brigands come raiding, I’ll just hit ‘em with the worst hexes I can drag up!”

“You get me anywhere near those dumb meteors, and I’d stomp you out of existence. I like being normal, thank you very much.” Severa pointed at Lissa before continuing. “What about your wife? She seems trigger-happy for a Giantstone of her own.”

“Nah,” Lissa replied, “It’d be cool to have, but Chrom says it’s strictly for military use only, and I’d rather not get drafted into the army again, I got a farm I gotta tend to. Same goes to Donny too, the quiet life’s for us.”

“Welp, then I guess that’s that then!” Donny ended the topic with. “Just thought I’d bring it up cuz I ran into one of the Giant Brigade members on my way here!”

“Oh really?” Owain asked, intrigued, “What were they like? A big, strong man? Worthy of a rivalry with my blade?”

“Nah, nothin’ like that,” Donny replied, “It was a girl first of all, and she looked pretty darn pretty too!” Lissa felt a little jealous, but Ophelia was intrigued by what a female Giant Brigade member would be like, besides those in her royal family.

“What was she like Grandpa Donny? Does she do magic like me? Or is she a seasoned warrior who fights with her muscles?”

“The latter.” he replied. “She was tellin’ me she used to work as a mercenary too, cuttin’ down thugs for loot and takin’ the kidnapped women on nights out as payment.” Suddenly, Ophelia’s eyes grew large.

“D-Did she say she was in love with women?” Ophelia asked, slightly frightened.

“Well, she said somethin’ along the lines of that,” Donnel replied, “But she said she already had a sweetheart she joined the Brigade for, said she fell in love at first sight with her.”

“A-And her hair? What color was it?”

“Blonde, why’d ya ask?” Just then, the family of 5 heard the sound of stomping across the ground, like something large was coming towards them.

“Oh Ophelia~! Where are you~?” came a booming and seductive voice from outside.

“Oh, that’s gotta be her! I told her ‘bout the show next week while we were in the market, and she done perked right up at the poster I showed.” Suddenly, Donnel got real confused as he saw Ophelia shudder. “Wait a sec, do you two know each other?” Owain and Severa immediately picked up on the signals, remembering Ophelia’s story she told on Mount Prism a few weeks prior.

“Oh gods no.” Severa muttered. On that, the gigantic face of a beautiful young blonde blocked the outside of the theater doors, her brown eyes looking into the theater as she spoke.

“Ophelia, my sweet!” she spoke, “Your darling Soleil has traveled across eons just for you! Check out this new power I have, isn’t it just darling? Let’s go out on a tea date, just you and me!”

“Holy crap!” Ophelia screamed, turning around and running to the props room, dragging Owain with her. “Hide me! Hide me! This woman’s totally crazy!” Soleil stuck her hand into the theater and tried outstretching it to the stage.

“Ah~!” she cried, “You can run all you want, but fate destines us to be together! A giant warrior and her tiny princess – it almost sounds like a romantic fairy tale!” Lissa and Donnel ran towards the back to avoid being hit by the giant mercenary’s hand. Severa watched the scene play out before her and just shook her head, annoyed.

“Gawds!” she cried, “Why is it that fate has given me a family of weirdos?!”
1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.title: Epilogue: Dysfunctional Troupe

1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.content:
Chrom stood out in the courtyard, training his blade skills among the various training dummies he set up. Though he was the Exalt of Ylisse, he felt it was no excuse to put aside his training as a warrior, for if Grima was any indication, a threat could come out of nowhere at any moment, and Chrom was willing to put his life on the line to protect his people like his older sister once did. He figured his wife and daughter already protected Ylisstol on their own patrols with far more area covered than he could, so Chrom had a lot of training to his body and mind to catch up to his family. As he dashed, leapt, and stabbed around his large circle he set up with such speed and power in his lunges, Chrom felt the vibration of two monoliths coming towards him, causing him to slow his training to a halt. As he turned around, the giant bodies of Sumia and Cynthia came into view, decked out in their full Shepherd armor, just finished from their Brigade patrol.

“Chrom!” called Sumia, “We’re back!” The Exalt smiled as the two girls stepped over the castle walls into the courtyard, kneeling down to face Chrom.

“Welcome back, Sumia, Cynthia, how was the patrol?” he asked.

“It was great!” Cynthia cried. “We ran into some brigands ransacking a nearby town, so we showed up and used our stones to intimidate them, and they immediately gave up on the spot! You should’ve seen the looks on their faces!”

“Well, that’s not exactly how it went…” Sumia added, pressing her fingers together in embarrassment. “They weren’t exactly intimidated until I…tripped and crushed their caravan wagon…” Chrom snickered, expecting as much from Sumia, causing the Queen’s cheeks to flare up a hot pink. “Hey! It’s not that funny!”

“Sorry, sorry,” Chrom responded, “It’s just such a ‘you’ thing, I could see something like that happening!” Chrom’s chuckles didn’t help cure Sumia’s embarrassment, and it didn’t help that Cynthia joined in on the giggling.

“Welp,” Cynthia added, “We got our patrol done on there, I’m gonna just take my shift in the Pegasus Knights right now!”

“Sweetie,” Sumia chimed, “You’re too much of a workaholic, why don’t you take the night off? I’ll take over your patrol in the Pegasus Knights tonight.”

“But Mother!” Cynthia protested, “I need to be a hero of justice to everyone in Ylisstol, and keeping the ground and skies safe is one of my duties!”

“And you’ve done a great job at that,” Chrom added, “But Sumia’s right, you’re going to overwork yourself at this rate. As Exalt, I’m going to command you to take the night off and spend it with Brady, he just got back from tour after all. In fact, I’ll give you money for dinner tonight, should you spend it at a restaurant.”

“Well, if you say so Father.” In an instant, Cynthia shrank back to her original size and ran to enter the castle to her room. “But just to let you know,” she called back to her parents, “If I see any crime on the streets tonight, I’m getting big right on the spot and busting their butts!” With that Cynthia retreated back to her room, leaving the two to ponder how their daughter could’ve become so reckless.

“She can be such a handful sometimes…” Chrom commented before turning to Sumia. “Are you alright with taking over Cynthia’s shift tonight? I’d think that you’d want to relax in the library after all that ground work.”

“Oh horse poo!” Sumia scoffed, “This Queen stuff really isn’t for me anyways, all I do is just read or walk around the city, it’s too much lax! No, I’m more happy knowing I’m giving back to the people of Ylisstol like this, and I’ll do everything in my power to keep them safe.”

“Well, ever since you showed this power off those weeks ago, the people have seemed more welcome to the idea of giants, you just have that calming effect on people I suppose.” Chrom thought to himself for a moment, appreciating the fact destiny allowed him to meet Sumia and give her the title of Queen she deserved. “But Sumia, I couldn’t help but notice that even though Maribelle suggested this Brigade, she hasn’t signed up for it, and you’re working twice as hard as you should be. Are you trying to take over for her?” Sumia sighed, she was caught.

“Sorry Chrom, I just kinda feel responsible for Maribelle being the way she is now, so I feel I should at least take over her job suggested and let her enjoy life with Robin. It was a private conversation between us, and it took a lot of convincing, so please don’t tell anyone, okay?”

“Your secret’s safe with me.” Chrom responded, gladdened by his wife’s selfless nature. “On that note, since you’ll be out for the night, why don’t we check in on Lucina now?”

“Good idea!” Sumia shrank down to her original size and laid her hand in Chrom’s, and the two began to walk off together to see their baby. “You know,” Sumia added, “We still need to have baby Cynthia now that I think about it, shall I take off early tonight so we may have some fun?” Chrom didn’t know whether to giggle or blush at Sumia’s lewd suggestion, so he did both.

“I’d like that.” Responded Chrom.

----------

“Braaaadyyyy! I’m baaaack!” Cynthia called around her decently-sized room, built like a small apartment, poking her head up the stairwell looking for her husband while his music reverberated through the room. “Where are you? Don’t make me get big in this small space!”

“I’m comin’ Cynthia! Cripes, no need to bring the house down on us!” Brady came down the stairs from the second floor, brandishing a violin in his right hand and a bow in the other. “Sorry ‘bout that, you caught me in the middle of some practice. How was patrol today?”

“Pretty good,” Cynthia replied, “Mother bought down some justice on the brigands and we saved a small village! Mother’s taking my shift too, so we can go out for dinner tonight! Father’s paying!”

“That’s good to hear! I found this new place that opened up downtown, say they got the best damned quail this side of Ylisstol!” Brady set down his instruments for a bit and wrapped his arm around Cynthia’s shoulder. “I don’t wanna sound like I’m complaining or anything, but I still feel like this whole “Giant Cynthia” thing’s gonna take some getting used to; hell, I still can’t get over how big Ma is from now on.”

“Yeah, I feel you on that one. The whole growth felt really weird and everything, and it’s still a little crazy how big I am compared to everyone else, but it’s super fun towering over the bad guys and bringing them to justice! I feel like a real superhero like that!” Cynthia spoke with stars in her eyes. “Say, why don’t you join the Brigade with me and Mother? You could strike some fear into brigands with your face! Uh, no offense.”

“Hell no, I ain’t doing that!” Brady replied defiantly. “It’d give me a damned heart attack to have that much power, and I couldn’t bear the thought of steppin’ on some flowers; nah, music’s more my thing and all, but if you guys need a healer to come around with ya, I’m always up for that. Big you’s fun and all, but I hope I can still cuddle with the Tiny Cynthia once in a while, yeah?”

“You bet!” Cynthia responded, “How else am I gonna watch your home shows at a big size anyways? I’d take up all the rows!” Cynthia giggled and gave her husband a kiss on the cheek. “Now then, wanna go get a reservation?”

“Yup! Just lemme get my good clothes on.” Brady retreated up the stairs again to put on his formal wear, while Cynthia retreated into her closet to find a good dress to wear. The two planned to have a fun night full of joy and laughs ahead of them, definitely the future they envisioned, though not with footnotes they expected.
1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.title: Epilogue: The Royal Family

1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.content:
Maribelle could no longer enjoy the view of her terrace anymore, now being 10 times larger without a Giantstone to shrink down with, but she didn’t mind much, she found some benefits to this size that definitely spiced up her life. First of all, the harvest had become pathetically easy with her size, allowing her to command the grape vines and harvest with ease, and juicing was even easier now that she had to just dip one foot into the tub of grapes to crush them; this allowed the servants of her manor to have a boost in morale and for Robin to take over her shipping log duties and motherly duties on a more full-time basis, both acts which he naturally excelled at. Second, ever since Chrom announced the Giants Brigade, Maribelle had been viewed less as a freak and more as a celebrity in Themis, earning the title of “The Gold Giantess” among the upper nobility for her radiant hair and use of her size to make riches; this admiration came in the form of journalists looking for interviews, artists wishing to paint her radiance, and plenty of invitations for her and Robin as guests of honor to many fine parties and gatherings of the like. As an added bonus, Sumia herself resolved to take Maribelle’s duties up in the Brigade and let her enjoy family life full-time, and she even donated some of her old outfits with use of her stone so she wouldn’t be stuck wearing nothing but curtain underwear full-time; Maribelle chose this day to wear an old pink dress of Sumia’s, which she thought looked darling on her, and chugged down a barrel of her finest blend of tea, enjoying the pleasing flavor and aroma. Still bright in the afternoon, Robin came outside to join her, carrying with him both babies Brady and Morgan; the three sat themselves at the table to join their noble family member and brighten her already glorious day.

“Ah, Robin, how goes your duties today?” Maribelle asked, enjoying the sight of Robin not totally drenched in sweat for once.

“Great,” he answered, “Everything looks to be in order in terms of shipping, and Brady and Morgan are doing just fine today; I thought it’d be fun if I bought them outside to see their mother today.”

“A capital idea!” Maribelle remarked, “The children do need some sun on their faces more than being cooped up in those old cribs of theirs anyways!” Maribelle leaned into the terrace opening and moved her hand inside, rubbing the cheeks of her children gently with her finger, causing them to coo and giggle in joy. “And how are my little bundles of joy this morning? Oh you two just look so cute that I could just eat you up! Though, I do realize how bad that may sound at my stature!” Robin snickered a bit at watching his wife go gaga over the kids.

“You really sound like you’re enjoying yourself at this size.” he commented, laughing a tad between sips of his teacup. “It’s almost as if you’ve forgotten your old life of being small in just these few weeks.”

“How rude!” Maribelle protested. “I’ll have you know that I quite do miss the joy of that terrace, as well as sleeping in a bed with you, cuddling your chest!”

“The terrace I can understand,” Robin replied back, still smirking, “But I did start sleeping with you in the ballroom, it’s just that I’m the one cuddling your chest now, and at your suggestion too!” Maribelle blushed at his answer.

“W-Well! I’ll have you know I slide you between my breasts for your pleasure only! I can stop doing it any time I desire!” Robin laughed at Maribelle’s protest.

“Whatever you say dear.” He answered back, clearly knowing he’s put his wife in checkmate. “Though, I am happy you’ve made this into a good situation, in fact, I notice you’ve made no attempt at trying to return to normal, and you seem to smile more than usual nowadays.”

“Am I really that transparent?” Maribelle asked. “You are right, perhaps I have gone on a power trip with my new size, I’ve never felt so full of life before since seeing the world from this perspective. Maybe I was meant to become like this, it’s definitely changed the way I see people.” Maribelle slid her fingers under Robin’s chair and brought him in close to the railing, near her face. “But most of all, it was you who’s changed my view of my situation, and for that, I am forever in debt. If I am stuck like this forever, then so be it, but know that I love you more than anything.” Maribelle leaned her husband into her lips and covered him in a kiss.

“And know that I love you back; considering what happened during Grima’s assault, I suppose you can say that we both saved each other once.” Robin got up to retrieve his teacup and sat back down next to Maribelle’s face. “Actually, you’ll be pleased to know that Tiki just came by a few moments ago and said she was hard at work finding Lucina’s meteor shards; she’s already collected quite a few inactive pieces, so you might be able to get back to normal soon, though from the sound of it, I think you’d rather stay big!” Maribelle was slightly surprised by the news, but overjoyed all the same.

“Was she here now?” Maribelle asked. “That is good news to hear, it gives me an option, as well as a larger wardrobe, and we could save on the food supply we own as well! Perhaps she’s not so bad after all, maybe I’ll have her a gift basket made, full of our best wine and fruits!” Maribelle wiggled her finger around Brady’s face once more. “Did you hear that Brady? Your Mother’s going to be able to cradle you more manageably from now on!” The baby leaned forward and let out a small burp.

“Mama!” Brady called. Maribelle and Robin were in shock.

“Did you hear that?!” Robin called out, overjoyed. Morgan started rocking in her chair, almost as if demanding attention.

“Papa!” she spoke. Small tears welled in Maribelle’s eyes as she gave an ear-to-ear smile.

“Our babies spoke their first words! This is what all mothers strive to see!” Maribelle couldn’t think of any way her life could be better at this point; she was large & in-charge, healthy, rich, and with a loving husband and children to boot – her life truly was paradise. “This calls for a celebration; let us all go out to the finest restaurant in Themis tonight, I’m more than sure they would let me in with my status!”

“Sounds great!” Robin answered. “Let me just wash up the babies and fetch my evening wear, and then we can head out!” On that, Robin removed the babies from their chairs, each repeating “Mama!” and “Papa!” back-to-back with one another, and began to take them inside for a bath. “I love you honey!”

“As do I Robin!” With that exchange, Maribelle was left to her own joyous thoughts once more, and she gradually took sips from her barrel of tea while grinning, reflecting on the bliss that was her life.
1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.title: Epilogue: A Mother's Bliss

1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.content:
Gerome and Lucina were hard at work on the roof of their home, Gerome hammered away at a set of nails while Lucina laid lumber in her gigantic form. Though she could now live life as normally as before, Lucina didn’t totally want to give up being giant with the choice now available, and decided on the idea of renovating the house to better suit being a giant, alongside allowing Minerva to live as an in-home wyvern, ideas Gerome agreed on; in truth, the couple agreed that the intimate moments they shared while looking for the dud shrinking elixir spiced their relationship up too much to totally give up, and they wished to conduct their couple duties more in private, despite the fact they lived on a mountain secluded well enough from society. With the noise of the mallet ringing through the air once more, Gerome finally managed to finish the renovations on their house, and the once small shack now stood like a wooden mansion along the Cliffside of the mountain. Gerome wiped the sweat from his forehead and lightly gasped for air.

“Alright, our home looks to be done now.” he spoke. Lucina clasped her hands together, happy that their strenuous work was finally over.

“That’s great!” she replied, gazing over the finished work. The home now had doors meant for Lucina in both her normal size and giant state and the interior was far larger for Lucina to do her morning workouts in, and though all the furniture was still the same size for the couple, they had incorporated one far larger bed into their home, of which Lucina and Gerome could spend their more private moments together. Lucina dug into her pocket and pulled out Gerome’s mask, kept on Lucina’s person to prevent it from being drenched in sweat and sawdust. “Would you like your mask back?”

“No thanks, nobody can see my face this far out anyways.” Gerome responded. “If you could get me down, I would appreciate it though.” Lucina nodded and grabbed Gerome, moving him from the stories-high roof of their home to the ground, before shrinking back to normal, taking care to make sure Gerome’s mask wasn’t on her and turned miniscule-sized. Minerva crawled closer to her masters, receiving a pet from Lucina as the princess placed Gerome’s mask in a satchel.

“I don’t want to sound like a parrot, but I really did miss doing this.” Lucina commented, referring to rubbing Minerva at a size where she didn’t look like a small pet. “This Giantstone really was a saving grace, once again we owe everything to Naga.”

“Hear, hear.” Gerome agreed. “It definitely helped increase our supply of raw goods too, it’s amazing how it manages to cause anything on your person to expand as well.”

“A sharp contrast from those meteors.” Lucina added, remembering how her favorite tunic was completely destroyed by her initial growth. “I must admit, the thought of Falchion becoming giant itself is too frightening to imagine though.” Lucina referred to when she used the enlarged Falchion to chop down an entire forest grove for home lumber, and then proceeded to cleave a chunk of mountain away to expand the property of her and Gerome’s home soon after; it’s a good thing only her family could use Falchion, though Lucina would still think twice about lending the blade to Cynthia in her enlarged state. “Still, I’m glad that meteor episode finally ended, we can finally return to enjoying the peace of our marriage.”

“I’m glad to hear it, and may it last forever.” Gerome and Lucina moved to enter their newly-supersized home and pack it in for the night, but Minerva followed behind them, wanting to enter the house herself; noticing this, Lucina grew once again and opened the larger door to the home, allowing the wyvern inside. Minerva cuddled up near the fireplace and immediately fell asleep, cozy by the flames, while Lucina and Gerome disrobed themselves to prepare for bed. The two convened together towards their bedroom, Gerome clad in pajama bottoms and Lucina in a lingerie nightgown, and sat at the foot of the bed to talk to one another before they went out for the night.

“Father’s Brigade seems to be going well,” Lucina started, “Cynthia tells me that she and Mother have seen a decrease in crime across Ylisse.”

“That’s good to hear,” Gerome replied, “Though I don’t think policing the whole continent was a great idea. It doesn’t set right with me for one nation to be looking over others, even for safety purposes.”

“You can’t blame Father for thinking that,” Lucina spoke in defense, “He’s a caring person who doesn’t want a future like we came from, he’s justified in being overly defensive.” Lucina shot Gerome a quick smirk and flexed her arm a bit. “Though if Father does go overboard with this, I’ll make sure to knock some sense into him with Mother and Cynthia!”

“And what of you? Will you join the Brigade yourself? You are more than qualified after all.” Gerome asked. Lucina shook her head in protest.

“As much as I would enjoy being around my biological family again, being around myself would lead to more complication than naught, and besides, I already have a life with you I plan to enjoy. Though, now that you mention it, if we see any poaching up here, I won’t hesitate to use my powers on whomever they may be.”

“I’d be fine with that.” Gerome answered with a grin, gladdened by his wife’s caring nature. The two began to lay back and looked through the large skylight they installed, up into the starry night sky.

“Hey, Gerome.” Lucina spoke, commanding his attention. “What do you think is out there?”

“Out where?”

“There, beyond this world.” Lucina added, pointing at the stars. “The meteors that changed me must’ve come from somewhere, it seems odd to think that mutation was purely natural.”

“You have a point,” Gerome answered, “And it was amazing that Naga and Tiki could use their divine magic to prepare you a cure. Perhaps the meteors themselves were magic from another world?”

“Perhaps.” Lucina pondered for a minute. “Or maybe it was a gift from the gods who made this world?”

“A gift?”

“Yes,” Lucina answered, “At first, we may not have reacted as well to it, but with Naga’s help, we have been granted a new power. Maybe these meteors were brought here to help save us from something? Maybe that’s why I was the first to grow, not by chance, but by choice.”

“You seem to have philosophy on your mind a lot tonight.” commented Gerome, a little surprised by Lucina’s rationale. “But I wouldn’t be surprised at your logic, Grima is fated to return 1,000 years from now after all.”

“Did Father do the right thing?” asked Lucina, gears now running in her head. “I don’t wish for Robin to disappear, but will the future truly be ready for Grima’s return?”

“The key to Grima lies in Robin’s blood; he’ll see to it that his family prevents Grima’s return with Validar dead and the Grimleal on decline.” Gerome responded. “And I can feel it as I look into your eye; your bloodline will be a noble one, strong and unwavering, and if any threat would come to this world, they won’t let it happen.”

“Thanks Gerome,” responded Lucina, hugging his chest, “Your words always put me at ease.” Lucina thought for a moment before opening her mouth again. “Speaking of bloodlines, would you like to try for a child tonight?” Gerome’s face lit up, but he managed to keep his composure steady.

“I suppose we could.” he answered, pulling up the sheets of the bed. Lucina tugged on his arm before he could lay down again.

“I, uh, meant the bigger bed…” Lucina said, pointing at the monolithic wooden frame. Gerome placed his hand to his head and shook it, though he looked at Lucina with a smile.

“You need to stop talking to Severa, you know that?”

“Sorry! It was just too good to give up!” Gerome chuckled and allowed Lucina to go to the center of the room. She pulled out her Giantstone and used it, growing to her 60 foot stature before placing the large orb on her just-as-giant nightstand. She grabbed Gerome and brought him to her face. “Are you ready?”

“Ready as I’ll ever be.” he answered. Lucina was gladdened by his growing confidence and how he seemed to open up emotionally far more.

“Thank you Gerome.” responded the princess with a smile, enveloping her husband with a large full-body kiss. Lucina lowered Gerome into her underwear and placed him inside, before collapsing onto the bed and hugging her legs together; the two seemed to have more adventures in marriage ahead of themselves.

In the starry sky above, shooting stars lit up the night, coming in close to the planet’s surface. Be it other life, a gift from the heavens, or whatever else, it was certain by the meteors alone that the world was boundless, and nothing could be certainly set in stone.
1313111121122121111111111111111122112111.title: Epilogue: Lucina & Gerome

Lucina was reading a book in her room when she heard a knock on her door.

"It's me!" Sumia said, sounding happier than normal.

"Come in mother."

Sumia did so and with a spring in her step, approached Lucina, holding a box.

“Here Lucina, Gaius found this while lurking around. I figured it was more you’re kind of thing than mine.”

Lucina opened it up. Inside was a shining, celebrate forged silver bracelet. Lucina was intrigued by the bright shine it gave and picked it up for a closer inspection. It looked even better in good light, each link was intricately woven and on the largest part were several paintings of the moon , each in varying phases and of a quality she would expect from a Royal Artist.

“Thank you mother… this must have cost you a lot.”

Sumia laughed.

“Actually no. All I had to was agree to bake him a week’s supply of sweets.”

Lucina opened her mouth in disbelief then laughed.

“I know he likes sweets but I can’t believe he parted with something so valuable over… sweets.”

“I’m a very good at making sweets and he has the love with them.” Sumia winked. “Never underestimate the effect good food can have on a man. And I said I’d bake them with extra honey.”

Lucina blinked.

“I don’t understand why that would matter….”

“Never mind, it’s a long story. Anyway it didn’t look this good when he showed it to me, I had to polish it several times before it sparkled like this.”

Lucina held the bracelet in front of her, er eyes drawn to the various moons

“You did a very good job. Are you sure I should have this? Wouldn’t you rather wear it?”

“I’m fine. Besides since I married your father I have more than enough things to wear.” And you could use all the fashion help you could get…. Sumia thought, recalling her times clothes shopping with her daughter.”

“Thank you mother!” She hugged Sumia and put on the bracelet. It fit perfectly, not the slightest bit too loose or too tight, almost as though it had been tailor made for her. She proudly walked, eager to show off her new treasure.

13131221.content:
Lucina walked around the market district of Ylisstol. On her way, many people seemed to notice her new accessory and complimented her on it. She smiled and thanked them as she continued her stroll. She stopped by various places to stop and chat for a bit: the food stalls, the clothing line, and even the armory. All of this made her happy, unlike her...previous timeline. But now isn't the time to look back, she thought, the menace that tortured her for years is now gone.

Her train of thoughts halted as she heard someone yelling quite bombastically. She was on her way until she saw a grouo talking to each other. The purple prose, the intricate structure in his words, and the vitality in his voice. Yeah, Lucina thought, only one person fits that description.

"And so! The samurai, shocked to see him alive in this tainted realm, approaches him with his legendary blade..." Owain appeared to be in the middle of a story. He was sharing it with someone Lucina knew far too well.

"And then? What happened next?" Cynthia screamed, apparently swinged into the exciting tone her cousin is using.

"Up to another one of your tales, Owain?" Lucina giggled as she walked up to the duo.

"Oh ho!" Owain laughed to hear Lucina's voice once again, "Care to join in? I'm sharing my ideas with Cynthia on my next greatest show: Odin Dark and the Invisible Kingdom!"

"Yeah!" Cynthia spouted, "It's about a trio suddenly being transported to another dimension, and must fight to overcome the great evil that will soon consume the one who summoned them!"

"I'd love to hear this, but I got other plans for today. In the meantime, check out what my moher gave to me this morning." Lucina held up her hand that held the bracelet and showed its glimmering design.

"Whoa, that's looks so cool, sis!" Cynthia gawked, "I can't wait to see you kick some butt the next time we go on a skirmish together." She struck a pose, acting as if she was the one wearing it.

"Incredible..." Owain thought out loud as she approached the lord, "May I see it, Lucina?"

"Oh, um, sure...?" Lucina agreed as she handed it over to the myrmidon. Owain wasted no time in scrutinizing its lavish forge. It was going to be one of these moments...

"This silvery gleam shines like the surface of the moon! The elegant design strikes fear into the wearer's foes! It gives a sense of authoeity, but at the same time, shows how caring thay person is. Such beauty can be compared to the moon itself! Even its patterns are of that we see in our moon! I can see you taking this in the middle of a night, the moon shining down on you as you look down on your foes, casting a menacing aura before you-"

"OWAIN!" The sisters screamed to get his attention. Naturally, he jumped in surprise.

"Ack, sheesh, okay! It's a wonderful bracelet, Lucina. But such a bracelet needs a name! I shall dub it: the Lunar Bracelet!" The three looked at each other momentarily. Lucina was the first to break the brief silence.

"It's a wondeful name, Owain!" Lucina said as she placed the bracelet back on.

"Yeah, Owain," Cynthia jumped in, "It's one of the few times you ever gave a good name for something!"

"See, I knew the two of you wouldn't be-wait, what do you mean 'one of the few times'!?" Owain replied as he jerked his head over towards the giggling princess.

"Alright you two, I think that's enough banter for one day," Lucina said as she tamed the mood for a bit. Still, she couldn't help but look at her bracelet. Why was it locked up inside a black box? Perhaps it was a treasure long forgotten in history?

"Anyways, do you want to hang out with us, Lucy?" Cynthia asked, "It would be more fun with you around!" Lucina smiled.

"Sure, I got some time to kill."

"Great," Owain barked as the three began to walk around together, "Now that we're together, let me continue from where I left off. The samurai, Prince Ryoma..."
13131221.title: The Lunar Bracelet

131312211.content:
Owain continued his tale, which seemed to get more far flung with each word. Lucina wanted to believe him, but with each word the tale got more ridiculous.

Some dragon brings Owain, Severa and Inigio to a far off land to fight his other self and makes them change their names? And he can heal their future but he can’t do anything about his other self or the warring kingdoms? And one of the kingdoms is ruled by an evil slime monster that people just obey anyway? And it’s the kingdom Owain chooses to fight for? Not to mention so many of the actions undertaken by the characters in the story made no sense.

Lucina realised if she told her own tale to someone who didn’t know it that it would also sound far flung and ridiculous but it would at least make more sense, as far-fetched as it could be.

Still Owain was a skilled storyteller, he would make a fine bard or actor and he managed to make his yarn entertaining, despite the absurdity of it.

Cynthia hung on every word, not questioning any of the incongruity of it. Lucina herself was able to enjoy it, mainly by turning off the questioning part of her mind. It also felt good to spend some time with her family, and after everything they had gone through to be able to spend time relaxing instead of fighting for their lives or the future.

The trio was having so much fun together, and so lost in Owain’s tale that they did not notice how low the sun was getting. It was almost sunset.

Cynthia marvelled at the sky.

“Wow time really passes when we hang out together.”

Owain stuck out her chest and posed.

“That’s because I’m such a great Storyteller.”

Lucina chuckled.

“Yes. Though I think it’s also because we spent the time together. Shall we watch the sun set together?”

“Yes!” Owain and Cynthia chimed in at once.

They headed for the town centre, which in the short time they had would give them the best view of the sunset. The trio watched the sun’s light slowly leave Ylisse.

Lucina suddenly felt strange. Something tugged at her arm or more specifically her bracelet. If there was anyone else around she would have suspected a theif was trying to steal it from her. She lifted it up. It was glowing, though on a closer look she could see that only the crescent moon glowed. Owain and Cytnhia noticed the glow to, leaning over to check.

“Wow how did you get it to do that?”

“I don’t know...”

“Amazing! This must be some hidden painting technique!”

Both the glow and the strange feeling Lucina was experienced intensified. Cynthia and Owain’s eyes widened.

“Uhh… Lucina are you getting taller?”

Cynthia measured with her hand where she thought Lucina should have been, and indeed she was several inches taller and growing rapidly.

“What’s happening?!”

“You’re-” Owain struggled to find the right words. “… getting bigger!”

It was rare for Owain not to think of a flower way of saying something. This must have been serious. The two backed away as Lucina continued rising.

“The bracelet!” Lucina thought. She tried to take it off, then pull it off it but to no avail. Even when she applied all her strength it remained stuck. Her family and Ylisee seemed to shrink before her, Owain was usually taller than her, then she was a head taller than him and now he didn’t even come up to her stomach and she was still rising.

She was fortunate that her clothes, including the accursed bracelet grew with her, but that didn’t change how awkward she felt.

Most of the city folk had gone home, but the few people around the city centre gasped as the sight of giant Princess, some cowered or yelled in fear while others gawked at the impossible sight before there eyes. Even Cynthia and Owain were stunned

“Woah!” Cynthia said. “Lucina you’re huge!”

Lucina was bigger than a house now, and had a clear view of the square.

“I don’t know what happened, but we need to get out of here immediately!” Lucina said, her voice booming out on account of her new size.

She took giant strides away, distressed at the sound of her giant footsteps. Owain and Cynthia followed after her, though struggled to keep up with her.

1313122112.content:
The rush out of the town was a short joirney that felt like a millenium. It was a miracle Cynthia and Owain were quick on their feet, otherwise they probably would've been held back and interrogated regarding the event at the center. Regardless, they escaped far, and eventually, the three stopped at a plains to catch their breath.

"Wow, Lucy," Cynthia wheezed, "You are...really fast." She collapsed on the ground to catch her breath.

"It's not that I'm fast," Lucina retorded as she too was heavily breathing, "It's my size that made me cover more distance!"

"Does it matter now?" Owain hastily said to change the subject, "Is there anyone behind us?" The three looked around for any signs of scouts, or worse, soldiers looking for the giant princess. A couple minutes later, they grouped back together.

"I couldn't find anyone..." Cynthia sulked.

"That's good," Lucina responded, "I would hate to cause even more trouble."

"Now that the coast is clear," Owain said, "What's with that glowing symbol on your bracelet?" Lucina kneeled down so that the other two can get a clear view of it. On its silver coating, there was a glowing shape representing the moon.

"Such a prisitine, royal glow," Owain briefly monologued, "I have no doubt whoever made this was an excellent craftsman. Why, it's aura reminds me of..." As Owain dragged his sentence, Cynthia looked up at the sky. The stars were shining, but not as much since the moon was out.

"The moon..." Cynthia finished, putting some of the pieces together, "Ah! The moon!" Cynthia looked up at her literal big sister, "Lucy! Maybe the Lunar Bracelet gets its power from the moon!"

"Really?" Lucina asked. She looked up at the sky to see a crescent moon. The moon seemed to share the exact same glow and shape as the moon on the bracelet.

"A waxing moon." Owain added, "They said a full moon appears every eight days..."

"But, that means...!" Cynthia gasped.

"No!" Lucina angrily screamed, scaring the duo, "I do not want to know what happens at each phase of the moon. We're returning this bracelet-" Lucina suddenly paused to see something in the corner of her eye. She stood back up to reveal her full stature. At Cynthia and Owain's point of view, it was very intimidating, especially since this is the princess of Ylisse when she is upset. They looked in the direction Lucina was looking at.

It was a pegasus knight. A scout to more precise. She was unnerved to see the tall princess glaring at her.

"P-Princess Lucina!" She yelled before darting back towards town. Lucina, out of natural instinct, tried to stop the flier from escaping. She pulled out her Falchion and was ready to pursuit.

"LUCINA, STOP!" The duo yelled to calm her down, Cynthia speaking up soon after, "Let her go. Mom and Dad are probably looking for us ever since a few hours ago..." Lucina looked at her bracelet and could make her reflection.

"You're right..." Lucina dejectedly said as she sheathed her blade, "I'm sorry for acting rash..."

"With new powers comes a new challenge, Lucina," Owain prosed, "Eventually you will learn to cope with it and accept it as your own..."

"Thank you, Owain, though I think it will take more than that get acustomed to my new height..."

"So, um, now that we've been spotted," Cynthia questioned, "What are we going to do for the time being?" The three thought about it for a moment. What could they do for the night until reinforcements arrive?
1313122112.title: Things are clear... for now

13131221121.content:
Lucina tried again to pull the bracelet off her arm but it wouldn’t budge. She gritted her teeth. She checked over her shoulder to see if anyone had followed her, but she gotten away from the crowd that was forming. Still it wouldn’t be long before others caught sight of her and gathered. What if they thought her a monster, or some marauding giant from legend?

Cynthia and Owain were clearly looking to her for guidance. Just like in the dark future they had come from… She pushed those thoughts away. But they did remind her of one, she the eldest princess of Ylissee and the leader of the group so she couldn’t afford to wallow in her thoughts. Even this bizarre predicament couldn’t change that.

“We need to get out her, before I cause an even greater disturbance.”

“Right!” Cynthia and Owain agreed.

Lucina strode forward, stopping just short of a run. Owain and Cynthia ran after her, but once again
Lucina left them behind. Cynthia yelled up to her sister.

“Hey wait for us!”

Lucina stopped, just noticing what she had done. She waited for them to catch and realised just how fast she was going. If there was one positive to this predicament, it was that she could recover an unprecedented distance. But neither Cynthia or Owain could keep up, and Cynthia had left her pegasus back at the castle. What could be done?

Lucina bent down, still towering over the pair when it dawned on her.

“I could carry you. I should be strong enough to lift you both and it’s the only way you could match my pace without a mount.”

“Hey that sounds fun-” She saw Lucina's withering stare. “I mean like a good idea.”.

She scooped them both up, surprised at how light they felt, it was like lifting toddlers only it somehow felt easier than that, and placed them under an arm. She hoped she had put them in tightly enough that she would keep hold of them but not so much that they would be uncomfortable.

“Are you two alright?”

“Yes.” “Wow I can see half of Ylissee from here!” “I can see the castle!”

Lucina strode away from the town, trying to the stick to the widest parts possible while exiting town as fast as possible. She decided it would be best to head for the wilds outside of the town instead of heading back to the castle. She feared what would happen if she approached the castle like this and in the dark of night they mistook her for an enemy, but in the morning light even if she was still stuck as a giant it was likely someone at the castle would recognise her.

Although it was dark she managed to make her way through Ylisse without causing any destruction, though she did accidentally kick over a wagon.

Sometime later Lucina looked behind her and saw she was a good distance from Ylisse. She paused to catch her breath and checked on her passengers.

“Are you both well?”

Cynthia actually seemed excited.

“Yep!”

Owain looked behind them, noticing how much ground she had covered.

“You broke record time and lifted us like dolls! You’re already starting to master your new powers!”

“I don’t think of that way but I suppose you have a point, if I could control my size I could even put it to good use, though at this moment I see it only as a burden.”

Cynthia suddenly became animated, her body shaking with excitement.

“If you were this big when we were at you’d be able to just kick away the risen or stomp them flat!” She did the motions with her leg. “Or any enemy soldier who tried to mess with us!”

Lucina smiled a little at thought. “True...that would be useful…” Then she frowned again “Though being this big would make me a target on the battlefield.”

Despite everything else, Owain was still his usual hammy self.

“You never know when a threat will rise up from the shadows. Maybe one day Ylissee will need a giant protector like you!”

Lucina pondered this for a moment.

“Hmm if this artefact could be controlled it might even be an asset, but right now I just want to be normal sized.”

Owain deflated, but only a little.

“Well you might as well make the best of what you’ve got.”

Lucina tried to relax, though she was still a little stiff.

“I’ll have to wait here to till the morning. Hopefully someone at the castle will be able to help me.”
