Morgan turns around to see his gigantic mother looking down at him with a bit of an annoyed look. She was tapping her fingers on the desk repeatedly, as if she was bored out of her mind. Her nails looked freshly manicured and black, likely part of the deal she made with Tharja. She begins to frown at her tiny son and takes a deep breath. Morgan knew he was in for quite the lecture.

“Where have you been Morgan!? I've been worried sick about you!! Do you realize how dangerous it was to go out there alone! It was nice of Panne to care for you, but she could have squished you for Naga's sake!”

“Mother, I'm sorry! I woke up on the floor after your toes knocked me out and Panne walked in and didn't see me! I tried to call out to her, but she stepped on me and…”

“She stepped on you!!! Oh Gods! Thank Naga for Tharja’s hex!”

“Wait, what hex?”

“Honey, Tharja performed this hex on you that fixed up your injuries and made you invincible. Had she not, Panne could have easily made you a…”

Robin pauses in horror at the thought of Morgan being turned into a blood splat beneath someone's foot.

“Mother really, it's all ok! If anything, I'm kinda glad Panne stepped on me. Her feet were so nice and soft and her soles were heavenly to sleep on!”

Robin stares at her tiny son confused at the statement he had just said to her.

“Wait a minute, you liked being stepped on Morgan? Huh, guess that explains why I found you between Panne’s feet.”

“N-no! Mother I didn't enjoy it at all! Well I kinda did but it’s just her feet were…”

“Morgan darling… Do you have a foot fetish?”

Morgan blushes in embarrassment at his mother’s sentence

“No! That's not what I-”

“Wow, it all makes sense now! Running around near your sister’s boots and shocking her bare foot, jumping down into my boot while I slept, getting Panne to step on you and sleeping between her feet, Morgan darling it's pretty obvious. You've gone out of your way and risk your life to get near female feet, that's insane! Yet intriguing…”
Robin smiles a bit at the idea of his shrunken son’s affection. She leans her face in closer to her tiny son.

“Well, with all these reckless actions in mind, I think that as your mother you need to be punished Morgan. And I think that I have the perfect idea to handle this problem.”

Robin takes her hands off the desk to reach for her boot and rests it on the desk right next to Morgan. The impact makes Morgan fall flat on his back, and is a bit terrified of his mother’s plans now. Robin slowly removes her boot in front of her son and places her barefoot back onto the floor. Morgan can smell a moderate stench coming from the boot, enough for Morgan to clench his nostrils shut. Robin grabs her son and holds him close to her face.

“Since Tharja made you invincible and your silly actions will never cease, I think it's a great punishment to make you spend with your mother’s feet. After all, it is what you want honey! Don't deny it.”

“Wait what!? Mother you can't be serious! All of these events are just coincidences! I don't really have an attraction to feet! Please don't do this mother!”

“That blush of yours isn't helping your case darling! Now hopefully you'll learn something from all of this! Maybe I'll even cute your weird attraction. Well honey, down you go!”

Robin drops Morgan down into her boot and lifts the boot back into the air. Morgan falls to the heel section of the boot, surrounded by an enclosed prison of sweat and stench. Morgan tries to run out of the boot, but suddenly Robin slides her foot into the boot and Morgan gets pushed deeper into the boot between his mother’s toes. Robin’s toenails were also pedicured and painted black, courtesy of Tharja. Eventually, the foot reached the toe section, and Morgan was trapped between his mother’s two middle toes. He squirms vigorously to escape the fleshy shackles, but Robin feels her tiny son between her toes.

“Ahahaha, honey you're making me ticklish!”

Robin scrunches her toes up a few times to push her struggling son down beneath the bottom of her foot, right about the middle of the ball of her sole. Robin’s foot was quite nothing like Panne’s foot, while there was no fur there was just sweaty flesh but was at least comfortable and soft from Tharja’s foot treatment. She taps her foot a few times, pressing her son deep within her foot flesh clogging his face with the taste of sweat and foot stench to secure him beneath her foot. Robin giggles at the strange fun she is having with her son. Suddenly, Chrom appears behind her.

“Robin! I'm back from Valm. Say’Ri’s rule seems to be going quite well as the new ruler of… What are you doing?”

Robin quickly stands up to cover up her act, further pressing her son deep into her sole to keep him quiet.

“Oh nothing Chrom! I was just talking to myself is all!”

“Ok then… Well I won't be here for very long. I'll need to head to Regna Ferox to discuss the tournament festival happening there.”

“Busy busy busy! You just always are my sweet exalt! Leaving me to run the army for you!” Robin says walking towards her husband, crushing her bug sized son with each step she takes. Robin wraps her arms around her husband’s neck and looks up into his eyes
“But I suppose it is all for the good of the world. To maintain a stable peaceful world so we all can be happy.”

Robin can hear Morgan’s muffled yells from her boot again, and retaliates by boosting herself up to her husband’s face by elevating her toes, kissing him. Meanwhile, Morgan faces immense pressure from his mother giving his father a little sugar. She lets off her son as she can imagine the immense pain he’s feeling and watches as her husband departs from the camp. Robin walks back into her tent and removes her boot and lifts up her foot to see her tiny son immediately jump off the foot and cough heavily from the lack of air. Morgan begins to walk away but his mother seizes her son beneath her big toe to hold his son in place.

“Now where are you headed off to young man? You’re just getting started! Now hold on a minute.”

Robin reaches for something beneath the desk, and grabs her son between her fingers and drops him in...

Within the confines of Robin's pocket, Morgan sat motionless. The light from outside failed to find it's way in, leaving the boy completely blind. Through the coat's fabric, he could hear his Mother above him moving books and flipping pages, desperate for a solution to his shrinking problem. In the meantime, Morgan yawned into the darkness, profoundly bored and exhausted after all he's gone through today. With nothing else to do, Morgan got comfortable, and allowed to sleep to finally take him after a long day.



Boom

How long had Morgan been running? Time had lost meaning. Right now, Morgan knew only two things, fear, and forward.

Boom

The earth trembled. Morgan was nearly knocked off his feet. Just what was he running from? The boy had no idea, only knowing whatever it was, it's 1000 times his size.

Boom

Another titanic footstep echoed. No matter how fast Morgan ran, the sound seemed to get closer every time. How much longer could he run? Morgan despaired to think what would happen if he let his pursuer catch him.

Boom

Morgan's feet failed him, and the prince fell flat on his face. Pulling himself from the floor, he scrambled to get back on his feet and resume fleeing.

BOOM

The sound came from directly behind Morgan this time. Whatever he was running from had finally caught him. The terrified boy rolled over onto his back, finally getting a good look at whoever, or whatever, had been chasing him.

It was Lucina, one thousand times his size.

Morgan's massive sibling looked down at him with utter apathy written on her face. Despite his fear, Morgan could not bring himself to back away, or even speak. Lucina stepped closer to Morgan, placing her foot only inches from him. Morgan watched in terror as the toe of her boot lifted off the ground and swung in his direction, until it hovered over him. The sky of Lucina's boot descended painfully slowly, until darkness consumed Morgan again, and he was crushed beneath her.



"BWAAAAAA!"

Morgan awoke with a start, sweating profusely. He patted his body over, reaffirming he was alive and no longer dreaming, and sighed. Slowly, Morgan's breathing and heart rate slowed back down to reasonable levels. Robin didn't seem to hear him scream, which he was silently thankful for.

I can't believe I'm having nightmares about my own sister, Morgan thought to himself. The sooner this shrunken business can be over, the better.

Sleep now out of the question, Morgan passed the time in his mother's pocket by trying to banish the nightmarish images from his mind. The inexorable stomping, Lucina's massive face staring down at him, and being trapped under her boot like a bug...

He shivered. Being this small was clearly taking it's toll on his psyche. How much longer would he have to be like this?

Soon, Morgan was roused by heavy shaking and jostling, and felt himself be grabbed by a giant hand. Finally, it seemed Robin was letting him out of that claustrophobic space. Robin deposited Morgan onto her desk, who found saw not only his mother, but also Lucina watching over him. Butch to his dismay, Morgan instinctively reeled away from the sight of Lucina's face, the nightmare still fresh in his mind. "So, did you find something that could help me?" he asked the two colossal women.

She could feel the object being swept down her throat along with the rest of the soup and down into her stomach. Confused, she brought her hand up to her mouth. For a brief second, it felt almost as if something had been moving in her mouth.

(VIEWER DISCRETION ADVISED)

Morgan cried out in terror as a sudden deluge of soup poured into the throat, dislodging him and sending him speeding down the esophagus. He cried out in panic as he continued to fall for what seemed like a few hundred feet, until he could see the entrance to the stomach open below him, giving him a view of the cavernous organ.

“Oof! W-Whoa!”

Morgan yelped as he landed on the floor of the stomach. He had been terrified that the impact would kill him, as he had fallen from such a height that there was nothing he could do to slow himself down. Fortunately for him, the stomach was spongy enough that he was not hurt when he landed, only winded, and he bounced up and down on the spongy flesh of the stomach floor.

When Morgan was able to pull himself to his feet, he tried to look around him.
“O-oh Gods… I-I can’t believe this is happening to me! Lucina said that she wouldn’t let anything happen to me!”

This was the last straw for Morgan, who had been suffering through an increasingly hectic day, and he collapsed onto his knees and began to cry. It was pitch black in the stomach, wet, smelly, and extremely hot and humid, and Morgan felt absolutely miserable.

“I-I… what am I going to do? I don’t want to die! Mom! Dad! Anybody?! Please help me!”

Sadly, Morgan was only half an inch tall, and his voice was far too quiet to be heard by anyone outside the stomach.

Morgan sniffled and wiped his eyes.

“I-I have to do something! Mom wouldn’t let this stop her! She’d come up with a plan to save herself! I’m her son, Morgan, tactician-in-training, and I won’t let this be the end of me either!”

Morgan sat back on the floor of the stomach. What could he do?
Suddenly, he snapped his fingers!

“That’s it! I can use magic! In all the stories I’ve read there were always mages and other spell casters who learned how to cast magic without needing a tome to focus their power through! I can try to do that to!”

Morgan was indeed able to channel his magic without a tome or staff, but there was one problem with his line of thinking; having no experience with such an advanced arcane art meant that he had no idea how his magic would affect him.

“Not knowing what could happen is a problem, but at this point I have nothing to lose. And besides, it might be something really helpful, like teleportation, or a way for me to communicate with Sis!

Morgan closed his eyes and began to channel his magic through his body. A faint aura surrounded him, illuminating the stomach ever so slightly. Beads of sweat crept pooled on his brow as he tried to maintain his focus.

“Come on… I can feel it… Just like in the lessons with miss Miriel and the others. If I can just release it now, and…”

VMMMMMM

Morgan could hear the humming of the magic surround him, saturating the air around him while some of it was absorbed into his body.
“O-ohh… I feel funny… What did that magic do to me?”

Morgan could only hope that it was something good; he had been terrified by all the stories Miriel, Henry, and Tharja had told him about mages experimenting with unknown magic, and how it always horribly backfired on them. Morgan wasn’t feeling so hopeful now. He really hoped that he hadn’t made a grievous mistake.

The magic saturating the air in the stomach was doing something, but Morgan wasn’t sure what it was. However, he could feel the magic his body had absorbed doing something to him, and he felt like he was tingling all over his body.

Morgan gasped; he knew that something had changed in the stomach, but what?

Groaning and covered her mouth with one hand, the nauseous girl sank back against the canvas wall of the tent, coming to a seated position. The queasy feeling was only growing stronger, and moving around seemed to agitate her poor tummy further.

1351121111122121111112222121221132.content:
Deep within the confines of the future princess's stomach, Morgan fought desperately to re-orientate himself. The resulting explosion from his latest magical hiccup had sent him spiraling under the remaining broth. It was as if he had been caught up in some sort of raging whirlpool.

Thankfully he was able to recover and swim towards what he thought was the surface. Once his head broke through he greedily began to suck down the stale of his sister's stomach. This was soon followed by him doing his best to wipe his eyes so he could see.

The pink walls of Lucina's stomach were pulsing and the broth he was currently submerged in was swaying back and fourth. Then there was the sound the reach his ears, it sounded like groaning. More specifically, Lucina was groaning. It didn't take long for the little tactician in training to put two-and-two together.

"She's going to puke."

The realization filled him with equal parts joy and uneasiness. Joy at the fact that his stay here would not be a permanent one, and uneasiness at the fact that he was essentially going to be freed in a wave of vomit. He too felt bad for his big sister as the bubble fiasco was his fault, but hey, he could always apologize later.

All he had to do now was wait and soon he'd be free. Nothing could possibly go wrong. At least, that was Morgan hoped. Unfortunately life wasn't that simple... and fate had other plans. A dark shadow consumed the lad, causing him to look up. What he was next would be burned into his brain forever.

A giant white ball not unlike a marble was headed his way. Fear filled the boy's heart as he let out the loudest scream he could muster. The white orb made contact with the sea of soup... and Morgan world went dark.

… Back On The Outside …

"Feeling any better?" An all too familiar voice asked.

"Yes. Thank you Anna," Lucina said with relief. The queasy feeling that consumed her had began to vanish. "What was that?"

The secret seller smiled. "That my dear princess was what we call a food tablet. They help with both indigestion and queasiness. They're also a great thing to have at buffets and parties."

"Interesting." Lucina said before making to stand. The nauseous feeling was gone now. "Thank you again. I suppose you'll want payment now, yes?"

The bluenette was surprised when the redhead shook her head. "Nah. This one's on the house. Consider it a favor from a friend. Anyway, you be good now. Ta-ta."

Lucina continued to stand stationary for another minute as she watched the secret seller disappear around the tent. Once her mind caught up to her again she remembered her mission and again set off for the kitchen tent.

choices: Morgan attempts to go up Lucina's throat! Will he fit, or is he too big?
Morgan causes a disturbance in Lucina, making the presence of something known
Morgan's got nothing but despair. Lets see how Lucina's day is going!
1351121111122121111112222121222.content:
The tingling sensation spread all throughout Morgan's body- he could feel it moving through him, from the tips of his ears all the way down to his toes. Everything seemed to be... well, humming wasn't quite the right word, but it sure felt like his body was humming. Thrumming! That was it, he was thrumming with power! Screwing his eyes shut, he did his best to focus despite the sweltering heat around him and the muggy, humid air sticking to him like a second skin. Recalling one of many magic lessons he'd received from his mother, he willed his magic to form in front of him. "Light without heat," his mother had told him, and Morgan was rewarded with a small orb of bright white light, hovering just over his head. Candlelight was a relatively simple spell to cast, and most mages were able to cast it without the use of a focus. Even a relative novice like him was able to cast it, although he'd admit that the orb in front of him wasn't looking too sturdy.

Oh well. In his current environment having any light at all was a welcome change, not that there was much to look at. With his light ball shedding a faint light on his new "room," he could now tell that Lucina's stomach was quite spacious. There were a few chunks of food floating here and there, leftovers from his sister's recent lunch that were bobbing up and down in the large, deep pool of broth he was currently standing in. While Morgan was feeling a little hungry, his sister's partially chewed soggy leftovers were pretty far up on his list of unappetizing foods.

He'd just have to get something to eat when he got out of Lucina's stomach. And he WAS going to get out of Lucina's stomach- he knew it. His earlier attempt at focusless magic had done something, he just hadn't figured out what yet. The only thing that he did know was that he still felt distinctly... fuzzy. Like his body hadn't yet released any of the power he'd stored in it.

Maybe he'd unwittingly created a shield to protect himself from his sister's powerful stomach acids? The stomach was free of gastric acid for the moment, but Morgan really didn't want to stick around long enough to test whether or not he'd "acid-proofed" himself. Whatever, for the moment he needed something to take his mind off his current predicament. The fuzzy feeling in his body was starting to get worse, and now it felt like he was building up static electricity. Rubbing at his arms, he tried to soothe the now uncomfortable feeling- he wasn't taking his coat off inside the stomach, but within the sleeves he was sure the sparse, fine hair on his arms was standing on end.

Grumbling, Morgan decided that at the very least he could get to dryer land. Trudging through the muck of soggy food, Morgan did his best to keep his footing while he floundered closer to the 'shore.' Progress was slow due to his thick coat absorbing liquid and weighing him down, but he refused to abandon such a precious belonging of his. Before Morgan could tire himself out completely, he spotted a particularly large morsel near the edge of the broth lake. With the last of his strength he was able to clamber up a chunk of broccoli roughly the same size as him and dive face first onto the spongy flesh of Lucina's stomach. The hunk of broccoli teetered before toppling over, splashing Morgan in a revolting spray of dark liquid. Groaning, the boy shuffled back from the huge veggie, lying back on the sloping surface of his sister's stomach. Morgan silently resolved to participate more often in the Shepherd's many fitness programs after this. The white-haired young spell-caster's stamina was just the worse.

But at least he'd made it to dry ground. Morgan was soaked, his clothes heavy and sodden, but he'd made it out of Lucina's internal lake. He could focus on rescuing himself now! Well, after he took a quick power nap. Swimming for high ground had tired him out more than he'd thought- his eyes were already feeling heavy. Morgan wasn't comfortable by any means, but his exhaustion mixed with the faint, soothing heartbeat of his beloved big sis were more than enough to lull him to sleep right now. Closing his eyes, he allowed his head to fall back on the damp, spongy flesh. He was out like a light within seconds.

-------------

Morgan blinked faintly, disoriented by the total darkness surrounding him. Not sure where he was, he called up another unsteady ball of light, his previous one must have dispelled when he fell asleep in... Lucina's stomach! He was still in Lucina's stomach! Crap. He'd really hoped that was just a terrible fever dream and that his sister hadn't eaten him, and that he was devising some horrible prank with Auntie Lissa to get back at Severa for being a jerk. He wasn't sure how long he'd been asleep for, but an outside observer would know that approximately 3 hours had passed since Lucina had unknowingly swallowed him.

As his eyesight returned to normal, Morgan squinted in confusion. Something had definitely changed in Lucina's stomach- he couldn't spot the familiar chunks of food dotting the broth pond in her belly anywhere. There were plenty of similar looking morsels, but they were all way smaller. No way they were the same. Maybe he'd slept too long, and was looking at Lucina's dinner, the girl having already digested the previous inanimate occupants of her belly. Morgan was relieved to know that his attempt at magic earlier seemed to have paid off- he was still fuzzy all over but it looked like the magic had shielded him from the harmful elements of the stomach. The only thing that seemed strange was that bit of broccoli at his feet... It didn't just look similar to the huge chunk from earlier, it was even in the exact same place as the previous one! The only difference was that it was only a third of the size of...the... wait.

Oh no.

It didn't just look like the broccoli from earlier, it WAS the broccoli from earlier! All of the morsels down in the broth pond? The same food from earlier. Only, now everything had been downsized. Morgan gulped, feeling panic creeping into him. A cold sweat dripped down his back, and his heartbeat thudded in his ears. There was no doubt about what his magic had done now- The hunk of broccoli that he'd had to climb over earlier, a hunk that had been roughly equal to him in height, was now small enough for him to sit on. It was barely a third of his size, if that. Morgan put his head in his hands, tears pricking at his eyes. By his own estimations, he was roughly three times the size he'd been when he'd first entered Lucina's stomach.

He had to get out of Lucina, and fast. Dark was the idea of himself being painfully crushed and suffocated by the walls of his sister's stomach when he finally ran out of empty space to grow in, but even more terrifying was the opposite idea that he might violently explode out of Lucina if her stomach did not hamper his return to normal size.


1) Morgan attempts to force his way up Lucina's throat! But what if he's too big to fit through the sphincter?
2) Morgan doesn't want to try going out of Lucina's body either of the normal way. His best bet is to cause a ruckus in Lucina's belly and alert people to his presence. Lucina would freak out at feeling something alive inside of her, but at least people would know something was wrong inside of her.
3) Morgan can't think of anything to do, and the POV shifts to Lucina, who is looking for her brother. Its strange, he usually doesn't disappear like this...

135112111112212112.content:
"Wait, WHAT?" Morgan was suddenly thrust back into panic mode. "What are you talking about?"

Lissa winked down at the tiny boy in her palm. "You may be my nephew, but you still cheated, and cheaters should be punished, don't you think?"

Oh gods, no, Morgan thought to himself. This woman is insane, what is she planning now?

Lissa continued, "But, I understand being as small as you are can be frightening, to say the least. This time, Luci and I will be extra careful with you." Lucina nodded in agreement.

Lissa lowered her hand and deposited Morgan on a nearby desk. The prince craned his neck upward and saw his monolithic sister and aunt smiling down at him, like goddesses in the heavens. Morgan knew their grins belied their intentions, this would not be enjoyable for him.

The thought of bringing their tiny plaything back to normal had almost completely disappeared from the young women's minds. Lissa pulled two chairs from the edges of her tent over to the desk, and she and Lucina took a seat in front of the scared princeling. The perfectly flat surface left nothing to hide behind, and getting down to the floor was not something Morgan could do alone without breaking half the bones in his tiny body.

The women watching him knew he was now completely at their mercy.

Lucina turned to address her aunt, "So Lissa, how are we going to teach our little man here some sportsmanship?"

Lissa smirked evilly down at her nephew, Morgan gulped in anticipation. "I have a few ideas, how about we..." Lissa brought Lucina's head close and briefly whispered a few words in her ear. Lucina's eyes lit up at whatever it was Lissa had shared.

"Do it, then?" Lucina questioned. Lissa nodded, and they both bent down under the table, and out of Morgan's sight.

Morgan wondered just what they were doing, but was nearly paralyzed with fear of what was coming next.

He would not stay wondering long, however. Soon after, the two women sat back up in their seats and slid them backwards slightly. With little fanfare, they both raised their now-bare feet and rested them on the table with Morgan, who could not believe his eyes. Lissa gave her toes a small wiggle, enjoying the feeling of the air against them.

"Okay Morgan," Lissa decreed down to her nephew. "as punishment for cheating at our friendly little game, you're going to give Luci and I a little foot massage." Lucina giggled at the irony of Lissa's choice of the word "Little".

Morgan stared in disbelief at the four walls of flesh in front of him. His own family couldn't actually expect him to do this, could they?

"Come on Morgan, this won't be so bad. Here, let me make it easier for you." Lucina raised her right foot above Morgan's head, the flawless white surface blocking out the sky from the boy's perspective.

"Sis, No! Don-" The foot slowly lowered until Morgan was pinned underneath it, somewhat uncomfortably, but not painfully. Morgan could hear Lissa laughing out loud at his plight, muffled by his plush prison. With no options left, Morgan submitted and began rubbing his colossal sister's sole. Lucina giggled, feeling her brother's tiny hands work her skin.

Morgan remained under Lucina's sole for what seemed to him like forever, massaging it as best he could the whole time. Eventually, Lucina decided that was enough, and removed her foot.

"Okay, Morgan, now do the other one." Lucina grabbed Morgan between her toes and carried him over to the opposite foot. With no resistance this time, he got to work caressing it's plush surface. Lucina moaned gently, enjoying the feeling of ten tiny fingers on her massive instep.

As time went on, Lissa became impatient. She wiggled her toes and looked on enviously as her niece got what seemed like the best foot rub of her lifetime. Eventually, Lissa decided enough was enough.

"Okay Luci, you've had enough. Now it's my turn!" Lissa took her nephew between her toes and let him get to work. Lucina pouted and crossed her arms. Lissa giggled and fidgeted near constantly as Morgan worked her sole. She was severely ticklish, it seemed.

After a good hour or so of Morgan's treatment, the girls removed their feet and beamed down at their little friend. Morgan was humiliated beyond belief of what he was just made to do, but at least it seemed to be over.

"See, that wasn't so bad, was it, Morgan?" Lucina rolled her foot from side to side, as if to wave hello to her tiny brother. Morgan didn't bother to give an answer, and only glared at the giant foot. "Or maybe you want to rub them a little more?" The blue-haired goddess teased, giving her toes a wiggle.

"So Lucina, think our little friend here has learned his lesson?" Lissa looked to her for an answer. Morgan braced himself for the worse, cursing his aunt for putting this idea of punishment into his sister's mind.

"No, not quite. I think he could use one more punishment, just to be sure he gets the idea." Lucina put her boots back on and stood up to her full monolithic height.

"So what kind of punishment are you thinking of?" Lissa leaned back in her chair and stretched her legs out. Lucina reached down and took her little brother between two fingers. She held him up to eye level and smiled at him. "I know exactly what to do now." she said, as she lowered the boy towards her...

Lucina's hand suddenly began lowering towards the floor. Morgan, through resisting and resigned to his fate, turned his gaze downward as he watched the floor come closer, dreading what punishment his sister could have in store for him next. Rather then drop her brother on the ground, however, Lucina gently deposited him in the middle of the seat of the chair she was sitting in. As Morgan lay on the hard wooden surface, Lucina knelt down to bring her eyes to be level with the seat. Morgan stood and turned his gaze to see the massive blue eyes of his sibling watching his every movement. He took a step back in shock, eliciting a giggle from his captress.

Lucina's voice piped up. "Now Morgan, don't be scared. I'm doing this to teach you a lesson." She said, rising from her knees back to her full height. She turned 180 degrees on the spot, turning her back to Morgan. The boy looked up at her to see her massive backside looming over him. Morgan blushed and looked away by instinct, but when it occurred to him just what Lucina intended to do, the red in his cheeks turned pale. He looked up, paralyzed with fear as Lucina slowly lowered her rear end back onto the chair, with her brother still on it.

Morgan looked around him desperately for somewhere to escape from the wrath of his sister. She seemed to be giving him plenty of time to deliberate his fate. Still, however, there would be no escape for Morgan except a very risky jump from his perch to the ground, a risk he was not willing to take, even in the face of the punishment Lucina had decided for him. Lucina's ever-lowering bottom cut off Morgan's headspace and knocked him on his back, until finally finishing it's descent and settling in the chair, compressing Morgan's tiny body into the hard wooden surface. Morgan struggled briefly under Lucina's titanic posterior, but her weight proved too much for the tiny boy's strength to do so much as budge.

Lucina twisted her body to get comfortable, nearly grinding her brother to dust beneath herself in the process. The princess' behind was toned and firm from her experience on the battlefield, but still soft enough as to not completely crush the tiny boy trapped beneath it. She let out a long sigh as she grew accustomed to the feeling of having a tiny person under you. Lucina felt as though this may be too harsh a punishment, and that she shouldn't be doing this to her own little brother. He needs to learn this lesson, she rationalized to herself. This is for his own good, and I'm sure he'll be fine. Lucina grinned to herself, Not to mention, teaching lessons like this feels... kind of good, actually.

Lucina delighted in teaching this lesson and let her head swim with ideas as to how she could further "educate" her sibling. She could pressure him with her foot like she was currently with her butt. She could hold him in her palm and use one finger to toy with him to her heart's content. She could simply drop him into her breast pocket and carry him with her for a day. Or, she could slide his tiny frame between her lips and use her massive tongue to tease him. Lucina shivered to think of such things, confused as to why this was exciting her so much.

Despite his furious rebellion against the titanic body of his mistress, Lucina had felt nothing from beneath her minus some very faint tickling sensation. Exhausted and broken after what seemed like an eternity of servitude to his sister and aunt, Morgan felt his mind fading, and eventually black out, surrounded by the soft warmth of his sister's body.

13511211111221211221.content:
As his sense returned, Morgan looked towards the source of the voice to find a blurred face. Gradually, Morgan began to make out the long blue hair and girlish face of the figure, and realised them to be Lucina. She stared down at her minuscule brother, still smiling. It was the same smile she had worn during the game of hide and seek, and while Morgan was rubbing her feet, and right before she had sat down on him. Remembering the harrowing events that had just transpired, Morgan suddenly became aware of how sore he was across his entire body. He held his aching body and shivered, wishing to forget what had happened to him at the hands of his family.

Picking up on how distraught the little man was, Lucina took her free hand and gently stroked Morgan's head with one finger. Normally, such a gesture would calm him right down, but after what Lucina had done, Morgan was in no mood to forgive. Despite his soreness, Morgan gave his best effort to reject his sister's care and beat back the fingertip, only for Lucina to retaliate by knocking him over onto his back. "Morgan, don't be like that. The punishment is over, you're safe now." Morgan was not ready to accept her after everything. "Like hell it's over! You could have killed me!" Lucina was taken aback. "Do you really think I would be so careless? You were never in any danger."

Morgan was not convinced. "Do you have any idea what you put me through? All this has been hell to me! What am I to you now, just a possession?!" Morgan's rage had climaxed. "I wake up like this and suddenly everyone in camp has gone completely crazy! I can't go a minute without someone trying to play a crazy game with me, or experiment on me, or SIT ON ME!" The small boy raised his voice higher than even he thought it could go. "Even you, my own sister, can't just let me be! Why can't I just get away from all this?!" Morgan's rage subsided, and the boy breathed heavily, letting what he'd just said sink into his giant sister's brain. Lucina was stricken, she had very rarely heard Morgan raise his voice like this.

The two stood in silence for a brief moment, until Morgan spoke up again, his voice significantly calmer this time. "Look, could you just take me back to my tent? I need to sleep all this off, then maybe we can forget about it all and find a way to bring me back to normal." Morgan stared up at his sister, who still stood mostly still. "Sis? Come on, please? No more of this." Lucina wore a hard-to-read expression, she seemed to be either seething with anger at Morgan's outburst, or struggling with remorse over what she did.

135112111112212112212.content:
Lucina stared awestruck at her brother, still sitting in her palm. She opened he mouth to speak, but found no words to express her disbelief. Instead, she curled the fingers of her hand into a fist around the boy, and her expression turned sour. Morgan was caught in his sister's grasp, with only his head poking outside of her massive fist. He looked up towards Lucina's face to see her scowling down at him. "Lucina, what's going on? Why a- GAK!"

Lucina tightened her grip on the boy, cutting off his voice as well as the blood circulation to his arms. "I can't believe you!" She spat. Her voice was subdued, but noticably bitter. Morgan feared his little outburst had had the inverse effect he had hoped for. "You would accuse me and everyone else of trying to harm you? You cheated at a simple game, so aunt Lissa and I punished you. You brought that fate upon yourself." Lucina brought her captive up to face level, still gripping him uncomfortably hard. Morgan struggled to free himself, but found Lucina's long, feminine fingers to be stronger than him. "Maybe I didn't get the message across with your first round of punishment." Lucina grinned evilly, giving her brother a fine view of her ivory teeth. Morgan shuddered, fearing another round of his sister's indignation.

Picking up on Morgan's fear, Lucina brought her hands together and let her brother fall into her open palm. She covered the hand containing Morgan with the other, created a shelter which shrouded the boy in darkness. With her tiny captive safe in her grasp, Lucina redoubled her pace towards her empty tent. Morgan could feel the shaking of Lucina's footsteps, aware of movement but completely oblivious to where she could be taking him. Upon finally reaching her own tent, Lucina pushed the flap open with a shoulder, stepped inside, and sat down on the side of her bed.

Lucina opened her cupped hands and allowed the candlelight shining in her room to illuminate Morgan. He raised his arm to shield his eyes from the sudden light. Lucina stared down at him, the rage still burning in her gut. "Clearly, you still need to be taught to respect your elders, Morgan." the titaness said, her voice dripping with apathy for the tiny figure in her hands. "Thankfully for you, big sister is always willing to teach another lesson." Lucina giggled, nearly driving herself crazy thinking of new ways to punish her little brother. Morgan stared wide-eyed up at his sister's smiling face, unable to believe his own sister would do something like this to him not once, but twice. "Lucina, sis, please..." he begged, voice trembling.

"Nuh-uh, Morgan. We all learn harsh lessons now and then," Lucina said, licking her lips in anticipation. "and this is just one of yours." With that, Lucina began raising her hands up from her lap towards her face, Morgan along with them. She held Morgan level with her mouth, smiling wide enough to give the little boy a fine view of hew ivory front row of teeth. Morgan backed away from his sister's plush lips, but soon found himself unable to do so, as the platform of Lucina's hands slanted upward, leaving him to slide closer to her waiting maw. Morgan screamed and clawed desperately at the massive palm for a foothold to keep himself from falling, to no avail. Lucina parted her hungry lips and let Morgan slide inside.

Morgan fell onto Lucina's waiting tongue with a soft impact. Immediately, the hot breath of the princess washed over him like a small hurricane and he found himself dampened with Lucin'a saliva. Lucina closed her mouth, leaving Morgan in complete darkness, surrounded by her rows of teeth and at the mercy of her massive tongue. A wave of ecstasy rolled through Lucina's body as she used her tongue to toy with her panicked brother. The massive muscle rolled Morgan like waves in a raging sea, forcing him to the roof of her mouth and pinning him to the wall of her soft cheeks freely. For the next hour, Lucina sat in her tent reading quietly, her brother wrestling with her gargantuan tongue all the while. Occasionally, Lucina would open her mouth wide and tease Morgan with a chance of freedom, only to rob it from him by pushing him back into the moist cavern to begin her punishment anew.

As the candles burning in Lucina's tent grew more and more melted, she finally decided Morgan had had enough. She opened her mouth one final time and reached two fingers inside to grab her little brother and bring him out into the light once again. Morgan was unresponsive, shivering and breathing shakily, but other than that was perfectly fine. Lucina smiled, and left him on the edge of her bed began to strip her clothing off of her. Soon, Lucina was wearing nothing at all, sitting on her bed next to her brother. When Morgan began to stir once more, Lucina spoke down to him.

"Welcome back, sleepyhead. I hope we've learned our lesson now." Lucina smiled her iconic smile, but Morgan did not respond. He didn't even appear to notice his gigantic sister was sitting, nude, directly in front of him. Lucina scooped the boy up into her hand and brought her legs up onto the bed. She lay on her back and lay Morgan back down on her chest. Morgan rose and fell rhythmically with Lucina's breathing, and could feel her heartbeat through the soft skin. "Sleep tight, now. You and I are going to have plenty of fun tomorrow. And no punishments, this time." Lucina yawned and reached for her quilt laying in a heap next to her. "Well, unless you earn it, that is." Lucina winked down at her brother, now moving, but still otherwise unresponsive. Lucina pulled the quilt up over her shoulders for comfort, and gently held Morgan to her chest with both hands. Slowly, they both drifted off to sleep, after a long day of games and punishments.

Her massive red eyes observed Morgan's every tiny movement like a goddess from the heavens, still smiling as she was when she first appeared. 1352.content:
To say Morgan was curious would be an understatement.

Her father, Ylisse's tactician, led the charge into the tomb. She followed close at his side, blowing away revenants with am Arcwind tome. Every time an enemy drew near, she blasted them away and watched them explode into clouds of black smoke.

The presence of these monsters eventually proved to be suffocating as more began to crawl out from beneath them. Luckily, Morgan's father Robin only brought a small core group of Shepherds Unlike their other missions, no lives were at stake. The revenants were only there as a trap, protecting the contents of the tomb from any intruders. Eventually, the father and daughter broke off from the rest, going down a path of there own while the others fought off the hordes of enemies.

Robin studied the map of the catacombs, nonchalantly hitting incoming revenants with bolts of Thoron.

Morgan kept at her father's side, fighting enemies along the way until they broke into an altar room.

"Is this it?" Morgan asked, almost half disappointed. She stared over the podium in the center of the chamber. "All this for a tome?"

"Patience, Morgan," Robin called, marching over the book. "This is no ordinary tome."

"I was thinking untold riches, to be honest."

Robin only laughed, finding his daughter's motivations somewhat humorous.

"You know what?" Morgan piped dryly, "I'm feeling generous, father. You can have my share."

With a short bow, the tactician in training turned around and began marching out the room. But just before Morgan made any progress in leaving, Robin grabbed the girl by the hood.

"It's all yours," he answered back, grabbing the tome and dropping it in his daughter's palm.

"Huh?" Morgan hummed, "You keep it. You practically wasted an entire Thoron tome on revenants just to get it."

"I'm serious. Just take a look through it, and if you see nothing of value, give it back."

"Fine," Morgan hummed. "I guess if it's worth protecting with a plague of a billion and a half monsters, then I could probably skim through it."

After returning to the camp, with the new tome in tow, Morgan made her way over to her tent.

She slumped over at her cot and lazily pulled out the book from her bag.

"All right, tome," she said aloud, somewhat glad to be alone in the tent, "let us see what my father saw in you."

Looking through the titles of the spells, she immediately realized that this was no ordinary tome. The effects of each seemed to be more extreme than the last, proving itself more dangerous than any dark magic by the fifth page.

Scanning one of the pages, Morgan found hersilf grinning at the spell she had in mind.

13521.content:
Morgan's lips curled upward as she flipped through the tome's pages. Spells and incantations beyond her imagination filled each page. It was clear now why Robin wanted his hands on this book. Morgan turned another page, and found herself deeply fascinated at the new spell she had uncovered.

Object & Lifeform Minimization

"That's an awful lot of words for 'Shrinking spell'." Morgan said to herself. Eager and curious, Morgan reached down at grabbed a small stone off the ground of her tent. The words in the ancient text alight as Morgan muttered the incantation. A flash of white light engulfed the stone, forcing Morgan to avert her eyes. When it subsided, the stone had shrunken to roughly 1/4 of it's original size. The once palm-sized rock was now but a pebble. Delighted that the spell worked, Morgan cast the pebble aside and eyed up the tome once more.

Morgan read the text for the shrinking spell once more. "This one could be fun. So many possibilities..." She held her chin and stared into the book, pondering applications for this promising spell, both playful and practical.

The idea crept slowly into Morgan's mind. The spell did say "Object AND Lifeform", does that mean it would work on people? Morgan smiled mischievously as she imagined shrinking one of her fellow shepherds. A test of the spell's capabilities would be necessary, but who would agree to being shrunken like this?

"But do they have to agree to it...?" Morgan chuckled evilly. A surprise shrinking, a prank for the history books! The idea was becoming more and more appealing. Without pause, Morgan tucked the tome into her coat and walked out of her tent, into the sunlight. Who would be her test subject for this new spell?

Gently, Morgan pushed the flap of her father's tent aside. Robin was sitting at his desk, fixated on a tactical board, like he usually is. He didn't even notice anyone peek inside. Grateful for her father's intense focus, Morgan stepped fully inside and turned her tome to the appropriate page. The words on the page glowed softly, and Morgan chanted the familiar phrases. At the last possible moment before the spell cast, Morgan called out to Robin.

"Hey, father!" Robin turned to see his daughter, grinning evilly with her hand outstretched toward him. The sight didn't last long before the spell discharged, and the same white light engulfed Robin, forcing both parties to shield their eyes.

When the light faded, Morgan saw her very confused father, standing level with her knees. The now tiny Robin frantically examined himself, thankfully finding no physical harm to his self or clothing. The tactician craned his neck upward, meeting eyes with his daughter. "Morgan! What in Naga's name did you just do?"

Morgan laughed. "It's a spell I found in that tome you passed on to me. Like it?" The girl bent down and rested on her knees, bringing her father's face closer to eye-level, but still standing taller than him. "You would not believe the amazing spells in here!" Morgan patted the cover of the tome with her hand.

"That's wonderful, Morgan, but this is not funny." Robin tried to be stern with him daughter, but Morgan could only giggle at her diminished father's words. "Maybe not from where you're standing, little guy!" Morgan reached out and playfully ruffled her father's hair, the palm of her hand much larger than his head. Robin was not amused. "Please, stop that. Now, if you would be so kind, could you undo the spell? I have some work to attend to."

Morgan's gut dropped to the pit of her stomach. She had forgotten to check the book for a counterspell! "U-uh...right now?" Morgan asked sheepishly, holding the back of her neck.

"Yes, Morgan, right now. You CAN undo this, can't you?"

"Uh, yeah! Sure thing, hehe..." Morgan flipped the tome open, skimming desperately for a countermeasure to this shrinking spell. Morgan's panic grew, and Robin's patience dwindled.

"Well? I'm waiting"

Silently apologizing for her own screw-up, Morgan opened the tome back to the shrinking spell and prayed to every god she could think of a second cast might reverse the effect. For a third time, the words glowed and Morgan cast, the white light from the spell overtook Robin. But when the light faded, the two would find their troubles were far from over.

She had fully expected Robin to be raving angrily at her, but if he was feeling any emotion at all right now, he hid it well. The tiny tactician only stared at his daughter's boots, seemingly oblivious to anything being wrong.

"Morgan." The minuscule figure spoke, unsettlingly calm. "Yes, Father?" Morgan responded, sheepish and fully prepared for Robin's incoming indignation. "What is the meaning of this?" Morgan breathed deep. "Well, I found this shrinking spell in the tome you passed to me, and, well..." Morgan rubbed her wrists, a nervous tick she had picked up from her father. "I thought it would be funny to, you know, surprise you like this." The girl giggled nervously, knowing any moment now Robin could explode at her. She knelt down to bring herself closer to Robin's new perspective. "I'm so sorry! I really screwed up, and I don't know how to fix this!" Morgan's composure had fallen apart, thankfully, Robin's did not, and he held a comforting hand on his daughter's knee. "Morgan, calm down. I'm not mad at you, if that's what you're worrying for." No matter how bad this may look, I'm sure we can fix this."

Robin's words uplifted Morgan's spirit. "Yeah, you're right!" Morgan stood up confidently, her height bearing over Robin. "Perfect! I'm fully stocked." Anna cheered as she surveyed her new wares. "These news blades and armor will sell in no time. Especially since I'll be manning the store full-time."

The secret seller shuddered as the memory of her daughter running shop came back to her. She would never view the word ''discount'' the same way again.

Right as she was about to open up shop she heard a familiar voice behind her. "M-Mother?"

Anna turned to greet the girl. "Ohm Morgan. How are you-- Oh my gods?!" Faster than the girl or Robin could blink, Anna had scooped her husband off her shoulder and into her palms. "What happened?! You're lighter than my coin purse after I let Morgan run the store!"

Robin tried to gain his bearings but his wife's voice was near deafening as she continued to freak out. All he could do was cover his ears and hope Morgan could calm her down.

"C-Calm down Mother! I can explain!" Morgan said frantically. Her words seemed to do the trick as Anna went silent for a moment, but the look in her told her everything she needed to know, She was worried and wanted an explanation pronto. The future gulped and began to explain.

After about fifteen minutes, the pair were sitting cross-legged on the store floor with Anna soaking in everything she'd been told. "And that's what led us to right now." Morgan finished.

"I see. So that's why Robin's so tiny." the redhead understood. "While your idea for a prank sounded good on paper, it would've been wise to look for a counter spell first."

Morgan frowned as Anna continued.

"But don't feel to bad. Robin's not upset with you and neither am I."

Morgan looked shocked. "Y-You're not?"

"Of course not." Anna waved off. "Something similar happened to one of my sisters when they tried their hand in magic."

"Really?" Morgan sked curiously.

"Yep. I remember our mother was so angry. Anna had turned accidentally turned father into a mosquito." the redhead laughed. Morgan couldn't also help but laugh at the story. Even Robin had a small smile tugging at his lips. Better shrunken than turned into a bug.

"So you're really not mad?" Morgan again asked.

"Not a bit. All we need is to find a counter spell. Do you still have to book?"

"Of course." The fellow redhead smiled before pulling the tome from her coat. The pair traded as Morgan held Robin and Anna took the tome.

Anna flipped through the pages, quickly scanning their contents and filing away a certain spell for her own personal use later. Eventually Morgan stopped her when she reached the page containing the Object & Lifeform Minimization spell. "So this is the culprit, huh?"

"Yeah. That's the one."

"Alright then." The two scanned the page and the rest of the book from top to bottom. Unfortunately for them, this tome contained no counter spells. "Well this isn't good."

Morgan looked panicked now. "W-What are we going to do?"

Anna bit down on her thumb nail as she eyed the tome. She was by no means an expert on magic. She was a master of trickery, sales, and haggling. Maybe it was time to look for some outside help? She looked over at her husband in Morgan's palm and sighed.

"Robin... What do you think we should do?"

13532.content:
“Now, where can I get rid of this?” Ricken walked through the camp, carrying a bottle of potion in his stead. It was created in order to hasten an organism’s growth, but was meant to be used by plants; not exactly fit for human consumption. Ricken had originally intended to use the potion on himself in order to give himself more height, and therefore more respect in the army, but was talked out of it after a quick pep talk from Sully; in hindsight, it was a good idea to opt out, he could’ve accidentally poisoned himself with all the different chemicals he mixed into the solution. Now, he looked for a safe spot to dispose of the potion without causing any trouble in the camp, Ricken didn’t want anyone in the army getting poisoned, nor did he want an overgrowth of plants preventing the march forward or giving brigands and Risen vantage for an ambush. “Ugh, this is so hard!” he cried, “I can’t throw it in the woods because of all the plants, I can’t chuck it in the river without poisoning the water supply, this is starting to seem like it was an awful decision the more I think about it…” Exhausted, Ricken sat down on bench and set the potion to his side, wiping down his forehead with his hat as the young mage thought of how to dispose of his solution proper.

“Hey, nerd.” Ricken turned to see who called him and came face-to-face with Severa, brandishing a bow and face slightly sweaty. The light blue-haired daughter of Virion and Cordelia had a reputation in the army of being a crude, sarcastic jerk, and while her parents and comrades of the future insisted it was because of her rough life in the destroyed future, many of the other Shepherds agreed that genetically, she was a spoiled, stuck-up brat, being the daughter of a Duke, and though she fought valiantly with honor, she flaunted her title of “Lady” around far too much and was a huge money sink, spending a lot of the army’s wealth on expensive dresses and jewelry. Ricken sighed and shook his head, he did not want to deal with this right now.

“Hello, ‘Lady’ Severa.” Ricken responded sarcastically. “And what graces me with your pleasure today?”

“Wow, and people say I’m the rude one.” Severa responded with a smirk, clearly taking pleasure in how she riled up the young mage with her presence. “Anyways, Chrom’s called for a meeting of the troops, and guess who’s needed to discuss the magic training regiments?” Ricken sighed, why on earth was it that he was being called on now when Chrom rarely called him for meetings before? There were clearly other mages in the Shepherds, ones that Chrom didn’t consider too young for war either.

“Can you tell Chrom to wait?” Ricken replied, “I’m in the middle of something a little important right now.”

“Nu-uh, not happening, direct order from the Exalt himself.” Severa responded, shaking her head. “Besides, I didn’t really like your tone, so why should I be inclined to throw you a bone?”

“Perfect.” Ricken thought, “Me and my big mouth, think before you speak next time, Ricken.” The mage decided he was already in hot water, why not protest a little and see where it gets him? “And why don’t you need to go to the meeting? Aren’t you part of the army too, or are you thinking of going back to Rosanne and taking Daddy’s throne while he’s gone?”

“I’m just the messenger, no need to give me that smart-ass mouth of yours, little boy.” Ricken fumed inwardly, he hated being called a child by anyone, more fuel for him to dislike Severa. “And if you must know,” continued the icy-haired Lady, “I’m training for the oncoming march. See the bow in my hand? I’m practicing on my range for the battle, Daddy didn’t really give me his keen eyesight, and bows surprisingly aren’t one of the things Mom’s good at.”

“You’re training? Without your horse? And in that dress?” Ricken pointed out the Bow Knight’s attire, a fancy white and blue dress more meant for a princess or a cleric than a war, and Severa merely scoffed at his answer.

“If you must know, Chrom thinks I need a little more foot training in my life, and he also thinks that if I bought the dress, then I should wear it in our marches too; he treats it like our armor we buy.” Severa giggled and spun around, showing the full radiance of her attire off to Ricken. “Not like I’m complaining; just look how darling I look in this! It really goes with my radiant hair too, you could almost say I’m the face of beauty in this army!”

“Alright, number one: In terms of children, Lucina trumps you in terms of beauty. Second: I’m totally busy right now, so unless you don’t want the army to be healthy, then you’ll leave me alone.” Severa pondered it for a moment before responding.

“Alright, then how about this?” Severa drew her bow and readied an arrow, pointing it at Ricken. “I’ll give you a 5 second head-start before my finger slips, I’d recommend you run to Chrom to tell him I’m threatening you like this.” Ricken flipped, thinking the young Lady lost her marbles.

“Are you crazy?!” he cried, “You can’t just shoot me like an animal!” Severa looked undeterred, closing her left eye for a better aim.

“5…4…3…”

“Alright! Alright! I’m going!” Ricken bolted, leaving behind his bottle of potion, while Severa flipped one of her pigtails in victory.

“That kid’s so easy to intimidate!” she spoke in praise of herself, “’I’m an adult!’ my big toe!” Severa laughed before getting back to other matters. “Now, what was he talking about? ‘Don’t want the army to be healthy’ or something?” Severa looked around where Ricken sat and spotted the bottle of potion, she placed down her bow and bought the concoction to her face. “Is this what he was talking about?”

Severa sniffed the mixture from the mouth of the bottle, smelling a strong scent of lemon and citrus from the potion, a somewhat appealing aroma. “What is this? An energy drink for the army?” Severa thought it over for a moment. “He’s always making up those crazy chemicals in the lab, is he now working in brewery? Should I take a swig of this without any idea of what’s in here?” Severa batted the idea around in her head for roughly 7 seconds before shaking off the thought. “Nah, he can always make more, kid keeps a ream of notes on him!” Severa held the bottle up high, expecting it to help her out on her workout. “Well, bottom’s up!” In one fell swoop, she chugged the entirety of the liquid, completely unaware of its real purpose, before throwing the bottle behind her and listening to it shatter with an audible “CRACK!” from behind her. “That hit the spot!” she cried, satisfied by the drink, “Gotta hand it to Ricken; not half bad!” On that, Severa continued on her training exercise, breaking into a small run before heading off into the woods, looking for wildlife and targets to aim at.

----------

“Who does she think she is?!” Ricken continued onwards in the camp in frustration over Severa’s antics. “’I’m a proper Lady! Listen to me! I’m considered royalty!’ I swear to gods, Virion’s going to get an earful as soon as I get rid of that poti-“ Ricken stopped, the color drained from his face considerably once he realized his mistake. “HOLY CRAP! The potion!” Ricken turned around immediately and broke into a run, hoping for the love of gods that Severa didn’t mess with it, even he didn’t want to see the girl get poisoned, as much as she might’ve deserved it.

----------

Severa wandered through the woods, run now slowing to a small jog as she tired herself out, firing at various targets as she ran.

“This is so tiring!” she huffed, trying to keep a steady pace as she trained in seclusion. “I thought that energy drinks were supposed to revitalize you, not do nothing!” Severa kept a light jog up as best as she could, before stopping suddenly when she felt something in her shoulder. Severa ran her fingers across the fabric of her dress and tried flexing her arm a little. “That’s odd,” she said to herself, “I could’ve sworn I bought this thing in my size when I tried it on…” As she flexed her muscles more, the fabric tore around her shoulder, exposing some skin to the open air. “Dammit!” she cried, “I just bought this one too!”

The pain in her foot came to a head, and as Severa's attention came back to it, she saw both of her feet erupt from the plastic heels, scattering the blue material across the forest floor and causing the young Lady to gasp in astonishment.

"What's going on?!" she asked aloud, slight fear in her voice as she felt the cloth dig into her body more and more. She felt more and more skin being exposed to the air as the sounds of ripping became more and more frequent. As Severa struggled to get up, she felt the expensive fabric falling from her body, and when fully erect and leaning against a tree for support, the entirety of the dress fell away and she was left in her jet-black underwear. Severa felt the smooth bark of the oak rub against her back and the dirt shift under her feet as she struggled to comprehend what was going on, but before she could even get a thought, Severa felt her bra straps begin to dig into her shoulders and her panties starting to tightly hug her hips, before the underwear fully separated from her body with an audible "SNAP!" and fell to the forest floor. Severa leaned against the tree more as she watched the world seem to get smaller around her, before the oak gave into her weight and snapped from its roots, falling down and bringing the blue-haired girl down with it. Sitting up, Severa felt the shifting under her feet stop completely and inspected the world around her. She stood up slowly, and looked around in amazement as the treetops of the tall forest surrounded her head and flapping birds looked almost like floating flower petals; she looked down at the ruined clothing she once wore and moved her foot upon feeling something, gazing upon her ruined bow and quiver in the imprint, and then it finally hit her.

Severa was a 50 foot tall giantess.

"WHAT THE HELL IS THIS?!?!?!"

----------

Ricken looked upon the shattered bottle at the floor of the camp and bit his lip tightly; he was in deep trouble now.

"No, no, no, this isn't happening!" He gathered up the shattered remnants of glass with his gloved hands and tried to salvage what remained of his broken container; the liquid inside was far gone now, as was Severa. "Don't tell me that dingbat drank the entire bottle of this stuff!" He sniffed the mouth of the bottle and smelled the faint stench of perfume, confirming his worst thoughts. Panicked, Ricken set the broken shards on the bench beside him and worriedly looked around for any sign of Severa; the woman was fast, inheriting her gale-force speed from her mother, but she couldn't have gone far. "Okay, okay, calm down Ricken!" he cried, "Severa couldn't have gone far, I just need to find a trail to track her with and then there's no worry, I can use a staff to cure any poison she might have!"

"WHAT THE HELL IS THIS?!?!?!" Ricken heard the cry of Severa's voice from the woods; considering the intensity of the yell, she must've been deep within the woods, which would be a lengthy hike for the young mage, but there was nothing more he could do.

"Well Ricken, don't look a gift horse in the mouth!" In an instant, the young boy looked around to make sure there was no onlookers and dashed off into the woods to correct whatever mistake might've gone about.

----------

"That little brat!" Severa shouted in frustration. She used her hands to cover he privates and kicked trees down in anger as she continued her rant against Ricken. "He knew this would happen, I just know it! This must've been some prank to teach me a lesson!" Her screams became louder and rampage became more destructive to the forest as she imagined the thought of the little mage laughing at her and saying some snarky lines of moral superiority. "Oh, when I get my hands on that little brat, I'm gonna...!" Severa's rant slowed to a halt as she felt the breeze run across her smooth skin, causing her to note her lack of clothing. "...I'm gonna do nothing because I'm naked. Dammit!"

Severa sat down in frustration; she had to get clothes from somewhere, but where? Her dress was obviously shot, and there was no way the small fabrics littered across the ground would be able to cover her appropriately, she had to find some large bundles of clothing fast and preferably with nobody looking at her body in the process. "Alright, think Severa, you need something cute-looking that could show off your curves well, where would you look? Severa pondered the options in her head intensely. "Raid a town's fabric store? No, too many people, I'd cause a riot and they'd be staring at my butt the whole time. Small village? Nah, those hicks probably never saw a women, they'd freak out just looking at me. Gawds! Why was I cursed with such a great body?!" Severa narrowed down the results further and further before arriving at two options.

The first was that she sneak into camp and start stealing the tents under everyone's noses, crafting at least some smallclothes from the white sheets; she was sure the other Shepherds wouldn't react like she was a monster or anything, especially since she now had the high ground in terms of power, but didn't want to take any risks. Although, now that she thought about it, perhaps her mother and father could support her on this, Cordelia and Virion were always very level-headed, and could definitely keep secrets if she so wished, so there was definitely an advantage on that front. The second was to use her hunting skills to take animal furs from the local wildlife in the area and craft clothes out of that, not as disgusting of a thought if she were to clean them in a nearby lake or river. Severa thought it wouldn't be a good idea to diminish the animal population in the area so quickly, as it would have adverse effects on the Shepherds food supply, but those thoughts were quickly overshadowed by the thought of how cute she would look in bear-fur smallclothes; she'd definitely be the talk of the camp then.

"Hm, decisions, decisions..." thought the young Lady, trying to weigh safety & simplicity over fashion. Though she inherited a keen strategic mind from Cordelia and Virion, her personality didn't help make the decision any easier. She looked down at her body and noticed all the grime and dirt that covered it, products of her growth and rampage, and grimaced. "Ew!" she cried, "I'll need a bath before I even think about getting dressed, this forest is filthy!" She remembered a lake she had passed by earlier, deeper into the woods, and got up to walk off, still covering herself.

Arriving at the lake, Severa undid her icy-blue pigtails, not worrying about anybody who might've seen her, and walked into the lake, diving under to fully clean herself. She resurfaced and took 5 more reps of diving and resurfacing, fully cleansing her hair and face and leaving her refreshed. "Ah, much better~!" she said, feeling refreshed and in a much better mood, before sitting down in the lake, noting how it now felt like a bathtub at her size. She raised her right leg up in the air and began scrubbing the dirt from it, humming a tune as she continued to think over her dilemma. "Alright," she asked herself, "Do I go for some...relatively clean sheets to dress myself, or should I really turn the boys heads with some cute little fur clothes?" Severa batted the idea of a giant's fashion around in her head for a while, focusing more on cleaning herself up, before arriving at a conclusion.

13532112.content:
Severa lowered her foot, not intending to stomp Ricken into the ground anymore. "Oh thank gods!" Ricken thought, sighing in relief, "Maybe Severa is reasonable after all..."

"You expect me to believe that crap?!" Ricken's thoughts of relief were interrupted as Severa grasped the young mage in her fist; he yelped as he was bought up to the young Lady's face. Ricken felt the color drain from his face as he looked down at the ground, feeling nauseous at the height he was elevated; color and heat soon returned to Ricken's face as he blushed at Severa's attire, a tent-made set of smallclothes with a short, overlapping skirt that left little to the imagination, it appeared as if Severa wore a bright white bikini and pareo. "Hey! Eyes up here dummy!" Severa snapped her fingers in front the mage's face, bringing his attention back to her angry face, ready to chew him out. "Why would you make a potion that turns the person who drinks it into a giant freak?!"

"I didn't!" Ricken protested. "I mean I did, but you weren't supposed to chug the entire thing! It was only meant for a few applied drops, it was originally for plant growth! Not human consumption!"

"Stop lying!" Severa cried in anger, "Why the hell would you put fertilizer in a vulnerary bottle?! You must've left it on that bench knowing I would've drank it!"

"What?!" Ricken responded, equally as frustrated, "I left the potion there because you tried to shoot me! Excuse me for being a little too panicked to react properly!" Severa's face was reddening in anger, contrasting her vibrant blue hair; how dare Ricken take a tone with her, a Lady of royal blood!

"Well guess what?" Severa responded in a cocky fashion, "Now you're going to be my little chemist and fix up a cure for me!" Ricken responded with shock, he hadn't anticipated Severa actually growing into a giant, instead expecting her more poisoned, and maybe growing a leaf or two.

"There is no cure!" Ricken replied, somewhat afraid of Severa's reaction.

"Would you stop with the lies already?! What kind of potion mixer makes up something that he can't cure?!"

"I told you, I'm not lying! It's a recipe for plants, you can't just un-grow plants! It's just not possible!"

"I'm not a plant, stupid! I'm a person!" Severa tightened her grip around Ricken, intending to intimidate the boy as she listed off her demands. "Now, first, you're going to apologize for this stupid prank of yours, and then you're going to help me out on getting me back to normal! And you're going to say 'Yes, Lady Severa!' and 'As you wish, Lady Severa!' as you're doing it, got it?!"

"Apologize for what prank?!" Ricken responded, reaching the peak of his frustration with Severa. "I'm not going to apologize for something I never did! In fact, you owe me an apology for drinking my potion before I could get rid of it properly!" The two had clearly reached the end of dealing with each other, and Severa's accidental growth had put her in a far better position of power then the young mage. For a moment, Severa thought of throwing Ricken through the sky, dropping him to the floor and grinding her heel atop him, taking him to the lake and drowning her far at the bottom; angry thoughts of torture had run through her mind quickly and furiously, but Severa managed to calm herself, taking slow breaths and adopting a more relaxed expression.

"Okay." Ricken was baffled; one moment she was grinding her teeth together, the next, Severa was all calm again.

"Excuse me?"

"I said okay." responded Severa. "I got other things on my mind anyways, like what I'm going to have for dinner tonight at this size." Ricken sighed in relief, not expecting this turn of events.

"That's a relief! Now, if you could just put me down, we can-" Ricken's thoughts were interrupted as Severa raised him above her face and begun dangling him from her fingertips by his robes. "Wh-What are you doing?" the boy asked in fear.

"Isn't it obvious?" Severa asked, "I'm hungry, and I'm getting dinner; a big hunk of meat, fit for a giant! Down the hatch!" In an instant, Severa released Ricken from her grasp and opened her mouth, dropping the boy inside before closing it. "Mmm~! That hit the spot!" The young boy started screaming, hugging Severa's tounge as she playfully shifted the boy around her mouth; Ricken didn't want to die, not like this, he hadn't even gotten married yet, something he and his family wished for himself.

"Severa!" Ricken screamed, "This isn't funny! Let me out of here right now!"

"What was that?" Severa asked, ignoring the young boy's pleas, "I dunno what you said, it's hard to hear you from inside my mouth, but it sure didn't sound like an apology!"

"Alright!" Ricken screamed, "I'm sorry for making you grow! I'm sorry for the prank! I'll never do it again, just please let me out of here!" Severa grinned and spit the boy out into her palm. Covered in saliva and panting, the boy was happy to be alive, yet aggravated he had to give in to Severa's demands, apologizing for something he never did in the first place.

"Do you understand the position that you're in, little boy?" asked Severa, looking down at the soaked, frightened little Ricken in her hands. "I'm big now, and you're still a little short-stack! You're to respond to me with the utmost respect, or I'm going to torture you even further, understand?!"

"Y-Yes..." Ricken responded, still feeling overwhelmed by the whole situation.

"'Yes', what?"

"Yes, Lady Severa! Just please don't do that again!" Severa smirked triumphantly, clearly feeling victorious in her empty argument.

"Good!" she shouted, asserting her dominance over the young boy. She set him down to the ground, confident that he wouldn't run away, and sat down, relaxing herself once more after her episode. "Now then, onto item #2. How long is it going to take you to cure me?" Ricken dusted off his hat, wiping the saliva from it, before responding, making sure there was enough distance between him and Severa to run and hide, should she freak out again.

"I told you, there isn't a cure." he replied, speaking slowly and calmly so he didn't have to repeat almost becoming Severa's snack. "The potion recipe I read was for plant growth, not human growth, there's no inverse to it to reverse the effects, unlike other potions in my recipe book. And before you ask; no, there is no shrinking potion either." Severa looked annoyed again, and Ricken started shivering slightly, not knowing what she would do.

"So why not use a hex to cure me?" Severa replied, "You magic-users can do that, right?" Ricken shook his head.

"It's not that easy; I'm not a Dark Mage, so I have no knowledge on hexes, and I've talked with Tharja and Henry on the matter, there isn't anything in the way of hexes that can change size. Believe me, I begged them both." Severa huffed and began twirling her blue pigtail around, clearly trying to keep her patience up.

"So, what? Are you saying I'm stuck like this?"

"I'm afraid so, for now at least. I can do some research into it over time, but I can't guarantee results." As Severa was about to shout in frustration, the call of someone through the woods caught their attention.

"Yo, Ricken! Are you out here? What's with all the noise, find that big chick out here?" It was the voice of Sully, looking for the young boy, probably to bring him back to camp; where as Severa looked to be in a better mood, Ricken looked panicked.

"There we go!" Severa spoke, gladdened by the oncoming search party, "Now we can get back to camp and I can put you to work while I go tease the boys!" She shook her body provocatively as if to emphasize her great body and curves to Ricken, as well as her teasing outfit.

"No, no, no, no!" Ricken shouted in response, shaking his hands in disagreement, "We can NOT go back to camp with you like this!"

"Well why the hell not?!" Severa angrily responded, "I'm not staying out in this filthy forest, and at least Daddy, Mom, and the other Shepherds could be better help than you!"

"I am not going to get chewed out by Chrom for turning you into a 50 foot gravure idol! He's going to keep me off the battlefield and on paperwork duty for months if he catches wind that I almost put the camp in danger with my potions!" Ricken got down on his hands and knees and begun begging Severa, looking almost ready to cry. "Please Severa, hear me out! I need to be on the front lines, I have to protect all my friends!" Severa looked at the begging child for a moment, trying to decide what to do; on one hand, she felt like her presence in camp would better put everyone at ease, herself included, and when they went to battle, Severa could absolutely decimate the enemy with her body and ensure the future's safety, but deep down, Severa was starting to feel bad for Ricken, now reducing the rowdy child to a beggar with the mere suggestion of going back to camp. Was it pity? Or did perhaps all that torture, among Ricken's robes, leave a sour taste in her mouth? Severa thought it over for a moment, then gave the child a devious smirk, sending Ricken into fear of her next move.
