Looking down into the frightened boy's eyes, Severa pursed her lips, feigning deep thought.

"Nah, I'm going in anyway," she declared, stepping off towards camp.

"You can't! Please, Severa! Think of what your mother and father will do to me."

The giantess paused, looking down at the small boy in her hand. "You see the thing is, I don't really care." Her words were cold, taunting even as she continued her march, ignoring the tiny mage's pleas. At some point, she grew tired of his persistent whining and wrapped the rest of her hand around him, silencing him. It took her less than a minute to reach the camp thanks to her massive strides. She stopped just as she caught a glimpse of the camp, restraining every instinct to just waltz in and cause a panic. Still, the lingering feeling of pity kept biting after her.

"Hmm," she hummed, "well, a proper lady always makes a grand entrance."

Chuckling to herself, Severa planted herself firmly in front of the mess hall, aware that most of the Shepherds spent their free time inside. A part of her argued to tear off the roof of the cafeteria in a brilliant display of both power and theatrics, but she decided against it, opting to watch the clusters of confused soldiers pour out of the mess hall, like ants attracted to sugar.

To her, that was a perfect analogy to how she felt.

"Helloooooo, Shepherds," Severa chimed, placing her hands on her hips. "I know what you're thinking, 'Severa, where'd you get that lovely garb. Oh, I don't know. It was just lying around."

"Way to be humble," Ricken mumbled.

Down below, the soldiers stood back, carefully eyeing the giant's movements as she waved her hands around while speaking.

"Of all the people," Sully sighed, gripping her lance tensely. The group of knights around her nodded in agreement.

"Let's just hope it doesn't get to her head." Frederick spoke up, keeping his distance from the blue haired giant.

"Thanks for the warm welcome," Severa spat sarcastically, crossing her arms over her chest.

A familiar couple stepped forward, cautiously moving closer to the massive woman. The icy haired giantess' eyes lit up at the sight of her parents, dropping to her knees to meet them.

"My... Severa," Cordelia addressed calmly, not wanting to startle her volatile daughter, "what happened to you?"

"Oh, nothing." Severa brushed off, "I ate my greens and drank my milk like you told me to, Mother. I guess I grew up to be stronger than you and Daddy."

The giantess smirked to her self, satisfied with her coy answer. She kept her hands closed around Ricken, keeping her prisoner hidden, if only temporary.

"Severa, my darling daughter," a rather posh voice spoke up. Her father Virion brought his hand to his daughter's knee in an attempt to reach out to his massive child. "Please do not toy around with the facts. We only want to know how in case we could change you back."

"I dunno, I kinda like being big." Her words earned glares from the group. "But if you really must know." She unclasped her palms, revealing the cowering form inside. "This little squirt tried to poison me."

"I did not!" Ricken defended, "She's the one who decided to go through my things."

"Will both of you cut it out?" A stern voice cut in, stepping closer to the arguing group. They all turned towards the exalt who strode in between the couple and their massive child. "Start from the beginning. What caused her height change."

Ricken stuttered, choking over his words. "Well, I, uh, made a potion-- for myself. It was supposed to make me... taller." He kicked at his boots skittishly. "I decided against using it, so I tried to dispose of it safely."

"You made a growth potion?"

"Yes," the mage answered quickly.

"Severa," Chrom called. "How did Ricken 'poison' you?"

"The little booger deliberately dropped the potion where I could see it."

"You were aiming your bow at me!"

"Enough!" Chrom yelled, "the two of you are at fault. Ricken, you should have kept a better tab on something as dangerous as your potion."

Severa stuck her tongue out at the boy in question.

"And as for you, Severa," Chrom continued, getting the giant to stop in her tracks. "What made you think it would be a good idea to just drink random potions?"

"It looked like an ordinary vulenary. It just happened to smell different..."

Chrom paused, glancing over the giantess and the young mage in her hand. He sighed in frustration, thinking of the proper punishment for the both of them. Gritting his teeth, he weighed his options before reaching a fair but stern sentence.

"Both of you are suspended from the front lines indefinitely." Chrom declared, earning groans of protest from the two.

"Why me?" Severa demanded, "I could literally crush the enemy!"

Chrom paused, "the last thing I want is enemies attempting to recreate Ricken's potion, so we're keeping you and him off the field until we find a way to reverse this."

Severa huffed in frustration. "So what? I just have to wait around camp when I could be winning wars?"

"Exactly."

Crossing her arms, the giantess stood up and angrily stomped to the outskirts of the camp where she sat down with an earth shaking thud. The rest of the Shepherds watched her in awe before continuing their daily routine of training, save for her parents who chased after her. The two, aware of the stiff facade that hid their daughter's true insecurities, rushed over to comfort Severa.

Chrom kept in place, staring down the young mage who only shuffled away in defeat. Once he was alone, the Exalt began to shudder at the sudden realization of Severa's true power. If he hadn't intervened and asserted his authority, things could have easily turned out different. Still, the thought of reproducing Ricken's growth potion could prove useful, as long as it was reversible. He made a mental note to speak to Robin about the merit of recreating it.

When things had settled down, Chrom called Robin into his tent, making sure no one was around to listen in.

Robin to looked around before taking a seat, ever observant of her surroundings.

"I assume you have called me in regarding Severa's sudden growth?"

Chrom smiled nodded.

"Astute as always."

"What is this regarding? The tactical implications of her size or how to manage her or-."

Chrom shook his head.

"None of those things. Instead, I want to ask the merits of recreating the potion that enlarged Severa."

Robin's eyes widened for a second.

"I do not think that would be wise...." She suddenly smiled. "Though I could certainly see the merits of towering high over the battlefield, dwarfing any who would oppose us."

"So you do see the benefits?"

"In battle yes, but giant soldiers would cause all kinds of logistic problems. They would require much more food to eat and space to rest, and at giant size would also be a greater target for the enmies mages and archers, to say nothing of the weapons or armour that would be required."

Chrom clenched his teeth.

"I hadn't thought of that...."

Robin wasn't done.

"On the other hand, if Ricken was able to make a potion to enlarge someone, he might be able to make a potion to return someone to their normal size. Switching between sizes would increase our options and mitigate some of the problems, especially if food or armaments could be enlarged as well."

Chrom titled his head.

"So you are for this?"

Robin pursed her lips.

"I am still not sure, though it could be worth discussing with him. If he were to help us, you could agree to shorten his probation period. But there is an additional issue, what would you do if a giant refused to obey you? You were lucky Severa stood down, because if she had not, she would be difficult to contain."

"That is true... I was calm and commanding on the outside, but inside I feared she might fling me aside or worse..." Chrom shuddered.

"And if she decides to follow us to ignore her probation our next battle, I am not sure even her parents could get her to stand down."

"I see..."

"Despite all this, I still think it is worth pursuing the merits of Ricken's growth potion, but we must proceed cautiously."

"Agreed."

Cordelia and Virion had finally caught up with their daughter, equally impressed and exhausted with the distance the giantess could now clear, and slowly moved in towards her for comfort. As they closed the distance, the two could see their daughter sitting with her arms folded, staring out into the wilderness, stewing in anger; if she was never in a mood to talk before, chances are she wouldn't now. Regardless, Cordelia gently placed her hand on the girl's thigh and spoke softly in an attempt to get her daughter to open up.

"Severa, sweetie," she spoke, "Are you feeling alright?" Severa growled a little at the question, before giving her response.

"It's not fair!" Severa shouted, "It's not my fault I've become so huge! Who does he think he is?!" Severa started waving her hands around in a mocking fashion as she continued her rant. "'Oh, look at me! I'm Chrom! I'm the big Exalt! Severa, you're suspended from the front lines because I say so! Blah, blah, blah!' I could use his stupid sword like a toothpick, and he has the nerve to ban me from battle?!"

"Now Severa," Cordelia replied in a comforting manner, "You know that Chrom wishes only the best for all of us, he must've had good reason to keep you off the field." Severa merely huffed in response.

"Oh," she sternly replied, "Of course you'd agree with him, you practically have a crush on him! Everyone in camp knows it!" Cordelia blushed in response, feeling somewhat offended by Severa's answer, correct as it was, and causing Virion to come to the defense of his wife.

"Now Severa," Virion protested, "Your mother has gotten over her young crush long ago, your brilliant azure hair is proof of that. Cordelia is right though my dear, Chrom doesn't wish for your new stature to affect you negatively or be used by the enemy; intel is the worst weapon after all."

"Negatively? Here, watch this." Cordelia and Virion watched as Severa tore a tree clean from the ground, the two were blown away by how their daughter's strength had multiplied. A few short seconds later, Severa thew the tree at a mountain range as if it were a spear, and both her parents were astonished at how far and fast it flew out of sight; Virion could see with his keen sniper's eyes the faint figure of brown and green jammed into the grey mountainside, like a dart on a board. "See that?" Severa asked, "That is exactly what I could do to the enemy, and we could be over with this damned war just like that! As for the potion, they'd need that little nerd to work on it, and I intend to keep him close to me until I find a cure for this!" Severa thought it over for a bit longer before opening her mouth again. "You know what? Forget the cure! Just look at me now; tall, strong, and beautiful to boot - I'm a force of nature!" Both parents gasped and looked worriedly at each other for a moment, fearing the power would go to her head, the last thing they wanted was the entirety of the Shepherds turning on Severa and chasing her out of camp.

"Honey, don't say that!" Cordelia beckoned, "We'll get you back to normal soon enough, to the regular old Severa we all know and love!" Severa turned her body to face her parents and looked down at her mother with a smug smirk.

"What's wrong?" she asked coyly, "Afraid I've started surpassing the things you're good at? Do you want your titles of 'Tallest', 'Strongest', and 'Most Beautiful' back already?"

"It's not that!" Cordelia protested, "We just afraid you'll abuse this power is all; we love you dearly and don't want to see our friends begin treating you as an outsider for being different." Severa scoffed at the suggestion.

"Oh please Mom!" she responded, "It's not like I'm going to totally push my weight around in camp! I know my friends well, and I practically owe Lucina my life, I'm not going to overstep my bounds just because I grew up a little!"

"Regardless, dear, won't you consider trying to shrink back to normal?" Virion added in. "Why, if you're this big, then how will I ever wrap my arms around you to hug you ever again?"

"You've never hugged anybody." Virion was taken aback by Severa's observation.

"W-Well...It's the thought that counts?"

"Look," Severa sighed as she stood up, "I'm not going to let that blue-haired oaf push me around because he thinks he knows what's best, last I checked, that's what he has a tactician for! Hell, his wife and son are smarter than he is!"

"Severa, that's enough!" Cordelia responded, "Olivia isn't unintelligent because she doesn't speak freely, and Inigo is...Well, you got me on Inigo. But Chrom still is smart and resourceful, he knows what he's doing!"

"Oh yeah? If Chrom knew what he was doing, why did he let his sister fall off that cliff those years ago?!" Cordelia gasped at Severa's insulting remark, it wasn't Chrom's fault Emmeryn had died, but her choice to bring peace to the two kingdoms; if Chrom heard her, he would've surely erupted into a frenzy. "Screw this! Talking with you two is impossible!" With that, Severa stomped off back into camp, somehow more frustrated than she was before.

"Severa!" Cordelia tried to run off after her daughter, but was stopped by Virion's grasp on her shoulder.

"Just let her go, Cordelia, our words clearly have no effect on her in this mood." Virion looked on as Severa's blue pigtails swayed in the breeze, watching his daughter stomp off in frustration. "I understand where she's coming from, battle is her life, her defense mechanism from the horrors she faced in the future. All we can do is wait and hope she cools down."

"But Virion..." Cordelia began, searching for the right words to say. "It's just...I feel like this isn't right, watching our baby with this rebellious streak, at this size...It's just too much to handle." Virion sighed, understanding his wife's words.

"They say all parents need to watch their children grow up, ours just grew more literally than most. And dare I say it, perhaps the talk in camp of my royal blood causing our daughter to grow up spoiled may be right..." Virion began to walk off, turning to Cordelia once more. "I will attempt to engage Chrom and see if he can bypass Severa's punishment, at least for one march, perhaps that will quell her mood. Would you care to join me?"

"I appreciate the offer," answered Cordelia, "But I'm going to keep an eye on our daughter to make sure she doesn't do anything rash in her frustration."

"Then I wish you luck in your endeavor, but please, give Severa some space, I believe that would be best for now." Cordelia nodded and the pair split up in order to relieve their daughter's anguish.

Severa huffed and puffed as she angrily strode through camp, taking care not to step on any of her comrades, but still getting stares from soldiers blown away by how big she was. Severa found a large stack of weapon crates and sat atop of them, using it almost like a stool, before resting her fist upon her chin and thinking aloud to herself. "'Abuse this power' my foot! Severa sighed and thought it over more. "I just need to find something to keep me occupied, maybe that'll get my mind off this."

The prime thought that ran through Severa's mind was to go tease the boys in camp with her size and attire, more specifically, her friends from the future. She figured that while Gerome and Laurent were too serious to get flustered, she could always put on a little dance show in front of Inigo, Owain, Morgan, Yarne, and Brady to have some fun. The routine would be simple: a little sexy dance, a couple shots of her curves, hell, she could probably get away with putting one lucky boy in her makeshift bra for a bit to experience a little piece of heaven; she could probably get some of the other soldiers involved too and get away with it, she could definitely change the male opinion of her in camp and get a little fanbase like that - who said being big didn't have its perks? Then, another more devious thought ran through her mind; what if she were to go out and fight a band of brigands herself? Severa thought for a moment that if she could decimate any thugs in the area and bring back proof of her one-woman victory, then Chrom would have to let her back on the front lines, perhaps as a lead-in alongside the Cavaliers; for a brief moment, Severa envisioned squashing legions of the Grimleal flat under her foot and being hailed in Ylisse and Rosanne alike as a giant hero, with a parade in her honor. Severa thought over her options vigorously, trying to arrive at a conclusion.

135321121121.content:
On this particular day, by pure luck alone, the 5 boys from the future who had once fought together for the sake of the Fire Emblem's gemstones, Sable & Argent, were all gathered together on camp inspection duty, to make sure the camp's supplies were plentiful, the perimeter was secure, and the land itself wasn't dangerous to rest upon. Though they had failed in their mission, prompting the journey to the past in the first place, it was thanks to Morgan's keen intellect in strategy that the 5 of them escaped with their lives that day, and they all promised never to let each other out of their sights ever again. As the future children had found their combined job near its end, they slowed their progress to chat a little about the events of today; they still couldn't believe that Severa, their friend they've known for years, had suddenly grown into a giantess out of nowhere, it was literally only hours ago that Owain and Inigo had seen her on a training run into the woods, still small and garbed in her expensive dress. The boys had stopped near the middle of the camp to rest & chat; Morgan, while carefully scanning his checklist, had opened the conversation.

"Okay, all we have left is to inspect the latrines, and we're done!" This was met with groans from his friends, but didn't dull his enthusiasm one bit. "Aw come on guys, if we really put our minds to it, we can knock it out real quickly!"

"Hey, speaking of 'knock out'," Inigo started, "How about that outfit Severa's wearing now? Me-ow! What a treat for the eyes!"

"Can you be any more of a skirt-chaser?" Yarne responded, a bit fed up with Inigo's womanizing ways. "I mean Inigo, how do you not see the problem in this? Severa's now gigantic and still as mean as ever?" Yarne shuddered a bit as he spoke his thoughts. "I mean, I don't want to complain or anything guys, but if she starts pushing us around while she's this big, I'm gonna start sleeping in the woods from now on!"

"Oh, you're such a coward Yarne!" spoke the young Prince, "Severa's still the same old girl we all knew growing up, and I know beneath that ice-queen exterior lies a sweet woman, begging for a handsome prince!"

"Oh, just get Chrom to unite Ylisstol and Rosanne already!" replied Owain in a sarcastic manner. "I'm with Yarne; if it were anyone else, the excitement of my sword-hand would be too much to control, but I'm honestly fearful that Severa might turn her 'Lady' title into 'Queen' at this size. I mean we all know she's never really been nice and always super-pushy, right?"

"I dunno," Brady replied, "I mean, yeah, Severa ain't the nicest gal in camp, but she's still human, like the rest of us. 'Cept maybe Yarne."

"Hey!"

"You know what I mean! Look, point is, we've all been pals for years, she ain't gonna do anything crazy just cause she's got a couple inches on us now." Morgan nodded, agreeing with the words Brady spoke.

"Yup, my thoughts exactly! I can't even begin to think of how many times Severa's saved us on the battlefield, and now she can do it with far more ease; whatever happens, we gotta stay positive and look forward." Suddenly, the boys heard the sound of stomping coming close to them, and from behind Morgan came the titanic figure of Severa, stopping short of the group and leaning against a sturdy watchtower post.

"Hey Morgan, you might wanna 'look forward' now." Yarne said in a snarky manner. Morgan turned around and nearly fell over, showing he still wasn't used to seeing Severa at 50 feet.

"Hellooooo boys~!" Severa spoke in a playful tone and playing with a pigtail. "I was just in the area and I thought I'd see my favorite little boys in camp for a quick chat!" Severa broke from her lean and struck a provocative pose. "What do you think, boys? Isn't my outfit just darling?"

"Oh Severa!" Inigo spoke brilliantly, "Your dashing white clothes match the vibrant azure of your hair, while charming my eyes with your smooth, beautiful skin! Why, I could just-"

"Dial it down Prince Moron, I'm not here for just you." Owain and Yarne laughed at Inigo getting shot down so quickly while Brady helped Morgan up. Dusting himself off, Morgan spoke calm with his traditional smile and optimism.

"Severa," he spoke, "You look really cute in that outfit and I appreciate you coming to say hello, but we're a little busy, so-"

"Oh Morgan!" Severa cried, leaning down to see the blond tactician, "You always know what to say to get me in a good mood! I've always appreciated that about you!" Morgan blushed a little at the compliment, but inwardly worked over trying to find a way to get out of this conversation without coming off as rude.

"Severa, we are busy with camp inspection, so is there any reason you came to see us?" Owain asked.

"Oh, forget the camp inspection for now," Severa responded while getting back up, "I'm just here to get you a bit motivated for the oncoming battles, so I thought up a little routine to entertain the troops; give it a watch and then tell me what you think!" Following her words, Severa grabbed the stiff wooden pole of the watchtower and begun to twirl around it, rubbing herself against the pole at random intervals and wrapping her leg around it to spin. This went on for a short while, and while the other boys blushed and debated whether they should be watching, Inigo was excited by the sight, and it sent him into a frenzy.

"Oh yeah baby, this is what I'm talking about!" he cried, shaking his fists in excitement. "Severa, darling, we just have to do a duet sometime!" Resisting the urge to say something sarcastic to Inigo, Severa instead noted the other soldiers in camp who were beginning to notice her dance routine, and watched as they piled in to cheer the girl on in excitement.

"Now this is what I wanted to see! Time to put this show into overdrive!" Severa loosened her grip from the post and began to shake her hips, breaking into a free-dance routine. Severa's hair swung wildly in the air as she begun to shake and gyrate in a provocative manner, bringing attention to her hips and chest while she danced; the soldiers and Inigo began chanting Severa's name in unison, starting loud and continuing as loud, putting a smug smile on Severa's face knowing she's successfully captured the admiration of the males in camp. As she slowed her dance, Severa opened her lips to speak. "Thank you all!" she cried, "And now, as my personal 'Thank you' to the army, one of you lucky boys gets to ride up here with me!" Severa pointed to her chest and began looking around at her audience with a finger to her pursed lips; everyone, save Owain, Yarne, Brady, and Morgan, were jumping and shouting at the chance to get close to Severa's body, and some were getting in fistfights with one another over her. Severa scanned the audience very carefully, pretending to look for her one lucky boy, but already having the perfect thought in mind. "Let's see," she spoke playfully, "I choose...You!"

"Huh?! M-Me?!" Morgan pointed at himself in confusion, wondering why Severa would choose him, and looked around at everyone else giving him dirty glares, aside from Owain, Yarne, and Brady.

"Morgan, you lucky dog!" Inigo shouted in jealousy.

"W-Wait a second! I need to get some work done and-" Ignoring his protests, Severa picked the boy up and rested him in her bra, playfully pushing her breasts together while continuing her dance. Morgan looked embarrassed and distressed by the situation, and begged for her to let him down. "Severa!" he cried, "P-Please let me down! Father says close contact like this is a sin! What if he catches me like this?!"

"Oh, forget Libra for one day, enjoy the moment!" Severa blushed a little and looked down at Morgan, speaking to him in a soft voice. "You know Morgan," she cooed, "I always did admire smart, resourceful boys like you, you must've gotten it from your mother, and you definitely inherited your father's gorgeous hair and cute looks; it's almost like you had two mothers! How about you and I go on a nice, quiet date after this?" Morgan blushed and gave a nervous chuckle, trying to think out of how to get out of this.

"That's, uh, really nice to hear Severa! Thank you!" he replied, "But I'm already going steady with Cynthia, I can't just leave her for you like that! It'd break her heart!"

"Oh, forget about the dork and get yourself a real woman! Why, just look at me - 50 feet of beauty, brains, and brawn! Woo~!" Severa kept her provocative dance up and continued receiving cheers from her audience of onlookers; while Severa basked in the moment, Morgan looked even more distressed and tried looking for a way out of this situation, but could find none, even with his smart tactician's mind.

"O Blessed Naga!" he prayed internally, "Please get me out this situation!" Severa continued her dance and intimate moment with Morgan, enjoying every moment of it, enjoying every cheer she received; she wished this moment could never end.

"Severa!" came the sharp cry of a woman from behind Severa. Cursing her jinxing words, Severa stopped her dance and turned around to see who called her, while Morgan almost cried in happiness that Naga had sent him an angel.

Cordelia, although dwarfed by her massive daughter, stood tall, staring into Severa's eyes with a commanding glare. Feeling the need to assert her authority over her child, she took a step forward. "Severa, just what in Naga's name are you doing?" She kept her voice firm, knowing that any hesitation would be admitting that her giant daughter now held control. If what happened with Chrom earlier stood up, Severa still had a respect for authority.

"Nothing..." The giantess played off, her tone reminiscent of a toddler caught stealing sweets.
"Don't lie to me," the pegasus knight pressed, "is that... Robin's son?"

"No..."

In an attempt to hide her actions, Severa used her index finger to push her tiny prisoner deeper into her bra.

Sighing, Cordelia moved closer, curling her finger and signaling her daughter to come to her lever. Surprisingly, the giant obligedm kneeling to meet her mother at a closer level. Severa still towered over her mother, but the smaller of the two still held the advantage. The boy trapped in the giantess' bra struggled for help, finding it difficult to move against the mounds of flesh.

"Get him out," the mother snapped.

Severa huffed, "fine." She dug around for Morgan, pulling him out easily. The boy's face was masked in a bright blush, causing the giantess to giggle in response. "Don't worry, cutie. We'll have some fun later."

She dropped her tiny boy toy off from a safe height, and Morgan landed into Cordelia's arms, taking in deep breaths of relief now that he was free. The boy wheezed, before he was gently placed onto his feet, shaking off balance.

Within seconds, Morgan was met with an onslaught of congratulatory jeers from his fellow male Shepherds. He could have sworn that he would be bruising if another person pat his back.

There was always something about her mother that made Severa feel small. Even when she was a fifty foot giant, she still felt tiny compared to her seemingly perfect mother. Biting her lip, she just stood there as Cordelia chewed her out for her promiscuous behavior. She grit her teeth, not wanting to think about the incoming punishment.

Just then, a single idea floated into her head.

She had no reason to be just sitting there. If she wanted to, she could just walk off on her own. Sure she would be a deserter, but at the same time it wasn't like anyone could really stop her from leaving. Her parents might chase after her, but she could easily out run her mother's pegasus. Still, it would be a bit dull to be off by herself. Maybe she could run off with her new boy toy Morgan like a pair of young lovers. The idea itself seemed romantic enough to her to get her to jump up immediately.

Debating on leaving, another idea crept in.

Her mother was small, relatively of course. She towered over Cordelia, and she finally outmatched her in strength. There was nothing holding her back from overpowering her mother and put her once perfect parent into her place.

"Severa! Are you even listening to me?"

"Huh?" Her thoughts were cutoff by her mother's glare. "Sure, I was just thinking of something."

The blue haired giantess stood up to her full height, towering over her mother, She took a deep breath as her mind settled into a decision.

"Severa!" Cordelia screamed after her daughter, watching her blue hair disappear over the horizon. In the mere span of a few seconds, the two had disappeared into the woods, leaving the imaginary stage for Severa's dance show now empty, with soldiers starting to break away from their circle, returning to their duties now that their entertainment left. Cordelia got to her knees and started softly weeping, feeling beaten by her daughter and overwhelmed by everything that went on today; in just the span of a couple hours, Severa managed to become a giantess, insult Chrom's dead sister, and now go AWOL with the lead tactician's son - it was a worrying series of thoughts for a mother to have on her mind. Morgan's four friends slowly shuffled over to Cordelia, unaware of how to handle the situation that just played out, yet willing to help make it right as they could; Yarne helped Cordelia up while Brady extended a handkerchief forward.

This is a manner of urgency and must be handled in such a manner as if we were all under attack. If you all have any more information to share, please do at once." The four boys smiled, happy that the army's pillar of strength returned to her former bravado, and saluted the Pegasus Knight.

"Yes ma'am!"

"Alright, break!" On command, the four boys abandoned their camp inspection duties and went off to alert everyone they could, while Cordelia marched towards Chrom's tent as quick as she could, intending to nip this situation in the bud before it went out of control. "Dear Naga," Cordelia thought, "Please keep Morgan and my baby safe!"

How perfect! she thought, "I'm alone with the boy of my dreams, far away from those knuckle-dragging dipsticks back in camp, and we can watch the sun set together over the horizon! I must have the greatest luck ever, being huge is awesome!" Severa thought of maybe overpowering her mother some more as a show of who was now top dog in camp, but she still did love her mother enough not to hurt her, and was getting rather bored of her dancing in camp anyways. Severa stewed over the thought of where she and her prisoner could now go since they abandoned the army, since most places wouldn't exactly welcome a giant woman so easily, but she figured it was better off to save the thought for later and enjoy the moment. Severa remembered sticking Morgan into her bra as she was waltzing through the woods, tired of his cries for help on their "romantic" walk; she dug her hand into her right cup and removed Morgan from it, the young tactician was shuddering and looked scared out of his wits.

"Shhh..." Severa cooed while stroking the boy's hair with her finger, "There's nothing to be scared of cutie-pie, I'm still the same old Severa you know and love!"

"Severa, please," begged the tactician, "Can we go back to camp? I'm really scared right now, Mother and Father must be worried..."

"No can do short-stack!" Severa replied as she rested Morgan down on her legs, near her loins. "The sunset comes around this time, and it just has to be beautiful reflecting off this lake! Besides, whole army probably considers us AWOL right now."

"Me?!" Morgan cried, softly but still frustrated, "You're the one who took me away from my work!"

"Oh yeah, I guess I did." Severa playfully stuck a finger to her lip, feigning deep thought as she continued to toy with her little captive. "Oh well, let's forget about those small details! Now, how about you and I go on that date?"

"Severa, I already told you," Morgan replied pleadingly, hoping his words would get through, "I'm already going steady with Cynthia, and I love her dearly, I can't just betray her like that, Father says breaking a girl's heart is one of the most evil sins you can do!"

"Oh, Cynthia, Cynthia, Cynthia! What's so great about her anyways?!" Severa puffed her cheeks out, clearly steamed her crush chose her rival over her. "I mean just look at her; she's a huge delusional dork who wants to be a superhero, she can't calm a horse to save her life, her hair's a putrid ash-white, her mother's a klutz, her father's a psychopath, and she's not even royalty! What's she got that I don't anyways?!"

"It's not a matter of sharing qualities," Morgan replied soft and kind, "It's just that, well, Cynthia's sweet and nice, she never stops smiling, and-"

"Oh, so that's how it is, huh?" Severa replied in frustration, "All the guys in camp say it, mean-ol' Severa can't get a boyfriend because she doesn't smile like a doofus, right?"

"Severa, it's not that! It's just that-"

"Well now, let's see if I can change your opinion and get you interested in a real woman!" Severa lowered her eyelids and gave an ear-to-ear grin as a naughty thought ran through her mind. "Let's start by getting those stuffy old clothes off you so I can set the mood!"

"W-What?!" Morgan looked horrified, he clutched his arms around his clothes, afraid of what was running through Severa's mind. "Severa, don't! We can't just-"

"Nuh-uh-uh! No 'if's, 'and's, or 'but's about it! But, I wouldn't mind seeing your 'but'!" Severa giggled playfully at her own joke and wrestled off Morgan's coat, throwing it to her side as she began to work at his undershirt. "Now, let's see how those abs look!"

"Severa, please stop! I...I..." Instantly, Morgan began crying, completely despaired by the situation he found himself in. Severa instantly stopped her naughty actions upon hearing Morgan cry, she knew the boy was gentle and highly incapable of screaming or yelling at someone in anger, but she had no idea he was this much of a softie.

"H-Hey, Morgan? Are you okay?" Morgan curled up into a ball and continued to cry.

"I-I-I want to go home!" he choked out in bursts of tears, overwhelmed by the situation. "I miss Mom! And Dad! And Cynthia! A-And...!" His sobs continued to get louder and more heart-wrenching, causing Severa to begin to feel guilt for what she did.

"H-Hey Morgan, look, I'm sorry about...What I was doing, okay? Please...Please stop crying..." Morgan ignored Severa's pleas, too despaired to even think a happy thought, and Severa honestly felt like she would start crying herself. "This is bad..." she thought, "I didn't think he'd react this badly, I just wanted to spend some time with him! Why does Cynthia get to keep him?!" She looked upon the boy once more, face drenched in tears, and felt remorseful at her actions. "So much for the sunset. Is there any way I can salvage this? Severa tried thinking of a way to keep her faux date extended, but couldn't think of anything; she thought maybe the best solution was to take Morgan back to camp and hope their friendship was still salvageable. Severa looked down at the tiny object of her affections, heartbroken by his loyalty to Cynthia, and tried reading his face for the next course of action.

"You!" Cynthia cried, saddling up on her Pegasus and taking flight to stare the giantess down. "Why'd you do it Severa?! Did you kidnap Morgan and try to eat him or something?!" Severa's eyes bulged, and she looked terribly offended by the question.

"Excuse me?!" she cried, face turning red with anger as she continued the yelling match with Cynthia. "For your information, just because I'm a little bigger now doesn't mean I'm a monster! What kind of screwed-up mind do you have to think I'd eat another person?! Especially the one I like!"

"Well...I guess you got a point there." Cynthia replied, remembering Severa indeed had a crush on Morgan too. "But still, you can't just go out and kidnap people like that!"

"I didn't kidnap him!" Severa replied curtly, "I just took him out of camp for some fun! Friendly, wholesome fun between two friends!"

"When you take someone away from home without permission, it's still a kidnapping!" Cynthia looked down at Morgan and called to him, hoping he'd add fuel to the argument. "Morgan, did Severa kidnap you?"

"Well, by your definition, yes, but Severa jus-"

"See? I totally knew it! You kidnapped him you, um...Kidnapper!" Severa fumed inwardly at Cynthia's high-and-mighty attitude combined with her lack of vocabulary; she had the temptation to slap her rival out of the sky, but the impact would've surely killed her, and Severa wasn't dumb enough to let anger bump off her greatest rival and occasional ally. Instead, she took a deep breath and tried to speak calmly.

"Look," Severa calmly spoke, "In the heat of the moment, I overreacted, what with Chrom banning me from the front lines, Mom chewing me out; as much as I like being this big, I'll admit it led to some big problems alongside it. And I suppose I was a little...Jealous that you got to spend time with him more than me; I'll admit, that was no excuse to try stripping h-"

"You stripped him?!" Cynthia cried in shock, even she's never seen Morgan without a shirt on at least.

"It wasn't all the way!" Severa cried. "Look, I realize what I did was wrong, and I was just on my way back to camp with him before y-"

"Before I showed up and stopped you from taking off his pants, you perverted kidnapper!" Severa lost it then and there, not able to calmly speak anymore.

"Gawds!" she cried, "Can you let me finish?! What the hell does Morgan see in a moron like you anyways?!" Severa turned her back to Cynthia and Morgan and began to walk away. "I'm out of this dump! You two have a nice life!"

"Severa, wait!" Morgan called, intending to get the Lady to open up more to him. "Where are you going? We're all a team, remember?"

"Not anymore we're not!" Severa called back. "I'm different now, and the rest of the camp can't accept that, so I'm going far away, where they'll appreciate a beautiful giant woman who can protect them!" Severa shot her hand up in the air and gave a mocking wave back to the two. "See ya Morgan, tell Mom and Dad I said bye! Hope your kids don't turn out to be dumbasses!"

"Severa!" Morgan called out. It was no use, Severa ignored her crush's cries and disappeared into the woods. Cynthia landed once more and gave Morgan a pat on the shoulder.

"Oh, forget about her!" Cynthia called, "Severa's just mean and nasty anyways! We don't need her if she's going to be big, mean, and nasty to boot."

"Cynthia!" Morgan shouted, softly yet sternly. He gave his girlfriend a light shove, which was about as physical as he would get with anyone but his enemies; though it felt like a mosquito bite, Cynthia knew the shove meant Morgan was about as angry as he could muster.

"Morgan," Cynthia replied back, "What's wrong? Me and Yarne have been out trying to free you from that kidnapper, why're you mad?"

"I'm mad because we're all supposed to be friends in this army! And honestly, I think Severa's right, you can be a little pig-headed sometimes!"

"Hey!" Cynthia responded, "That hurts! Besides, when has Severa ever done a good thing for anyone anyways?!"

"She does her assigned mess hall duties, she shines the armor up, takes the front-lines in every war..." Morgan put a finger to his lip, thinking up another example, before snapping his fingers at the perfect one. "When we were kids! Your voodoo doll Henry gave you broke, remember?"

"I remember Dolly!" Cynthia cried out. "I remember, Father gave me that doll to play with and curse my enemies, and then I fell one day and he snapped in half! I was so sad! But then Severa came and fixed Dolly rig- Oh." Morgan folded his arms while the thought began to run through Cynthia's mind. "Oh...Ohhh...Oh gods what have I done?! I just turned away one of our best friends from the camp because I was worried about you! Oh gods, I'm a monster, I don't deserve to be a hero!" Cynthia began crying like a baby and Morgan embraced her, all too familiar to the feeling.

"Hey, hey, I'd do the same thing in your boots." Morgan spoke gently, patting his girlfriend's back. "I bet we can still get Severa back if we put our minds to it!"

"R-Really?" Cynthia asked, stopping her crying.

"Yeah, but we have to hurry! At this size now, Severa can cover more distance than a Pegasus could, even when walking!"

"Well alright!" Cynthia cried, now all charged up, "I got the fastest Pegasus in Ylisse, so catching up won't even be a problem for us!" Cynthia grabbed Morgan by his arm and dragged him over to her Pegasus, nearly tearing off her boyfriend's arm with her enthusiastic might. The two sat upon the Pegasus and saddled up, Cynthia grabbed her reins and beckoned her Pegasus to take flight. "Alright, let's go get back Severa!" The two looked like they shot out of a cannon as they charged through the skies, looking for light-blue pigtails in a sea of green trees.

----------

Severa stomped through the woods in anger, completely steamed by what had just happened, and overall frustrated with the events of the day.

"Who does that damned girl think she is?!" Severa cried out in anger, "I do nothing but nice things for her since we were little, and this is how she thanks me?! By stealing the boy I like and accusing me of being some perverted monster?! Argh!" Severa punched a tree in frustration, breaking the thing in two with her fist alone and with no bruising or cuts on her skin in turn. "Well you know what?! If the camp thinks I'm some sort of monster, than maybe I should just live like one! Out in the woods, raiding villages, scaring the hell out of anyone who sees me! If they can't handle a giantess, they'll all get totally decimated by Grima!" Just then, the memories of her time in the future raced through Severa's mind; her ruined home, her dead parents, the stench of death palpable in the air - the thought put a tear in Severa's eye as her lip quivered. "...Again..."

Severa quit her rant and sat down against a tree, hugging her legs to her chest; in an instant, she began to sob uncontrollably, completely overwhelmed by how negatively the army reacted to her new size combined with her horrible memories. "Why?!" she cried, "Why does nobody like me?! They don't like me when I'm small! They don't like me when I'm big! And nobody was around to like me when I was young! I just want to help, and I like the new me! So why can't anyone accept me for who I am?!" Severa continued to cry and wail for a while, unable to think of anything to calm her down, and missing the sunset she went out to the woods with Morgan to see in the first place. Even though every day in the future was a living nightmare for her, Severa could definitely chalk this up as the worst day she had ever had.

"Do you really think we can get her to come back with us? I said some pretty hurtful things..." Cynthia said, hanging her head..

Morgan pursed his lips, even as he scanned the landscape for any sign of Severa.

"Well she was in a bad mood.... as usual, but she still seems like herself... mostly."

Cynthia fumed.

"Except for the fact she tried to strip you!"

"Well yeah..." Morgan shuddered. "But she stopped. I dunno aybe being a giant just went to her head a second."

"I hope that's it, but do you really think she's going to listen to us when her mom and dad couldn't get through to her?"

Cynthia pouted.

"Hmmph."

"Cynthia?"

Cynthia forced a smile.

"Oh it's nothing." She said in a artificially sweet tone.

Morgan was too busy searching for Severa to notice or think about Cynthia's strange reaction.

Although Severa walking speed was faster than Cynthia's flying speed, the fact that Severa had paused to vent allow the duo to gain ground. Severa's size and bright blue hair stuck out like a sore thumb.

"There she is!" Morgan called out excitedly.

"Great! I'll close in!"

Cynthia shifted her weight and the pegaus dived down, soon reaching Severa. The giantess was not happy to see them still sitting sullenly. She turned her head.

"What do you want? Come to berate me some more?"

"No." Cynthia shook her head. "Severa I'm sorry I reacted the way I did, I'm sorry for being insensitive. You're not a monster your still uhh you."

Severa rolled her eyes, though seemed slightly more relaxed.

"Hmmph. Glad you had the guts to say it. Is that all?"

"Come back with us, Severa."

"Why so everyone can treat me like a freak?"

Morgan sighed.

"No one treated you like a freak!"

Severa snorted.

"What about Cynthia?"

"Hey I said I was sorry! And you kidnapped Morgan and half stripped him! What was I suppose to think?"

Severa huffed.

"Whatever."

"If I really thought you were a monster, would I have come all this way to say sorry?"

"I guess not... but you did come here to drag me back to camp!"

Morgan and Cynthia looked at each other for a second.

"Well kinda. I mean we want you to come back but can't and won't make you."

"And you're way to big for us to drag along anyway."

"Forget it!"

"Severa is this about before? Because I'm sure most of the guys would be all over you if you just asked them out in a normal way."

"I SAID FORGET IT!"

The impact of Severa's voice made Morgan, Cynthia and her pegasus flinch for a second.

"Hey, there's no need to shout!"

"I've had enough of this." Severa said, getting to her feet.

"Enough of what?" Cynthia asked

"People pushing me around, telling me what to do."

Morgan shuffled closer.

"We all care about you Severa."

"As if. I'm leaving again and this time don't follow me!"

"Severa." The two tried to think of something they could say that might change her mind.

1353211211211112211.content:
"Severa, please wait!" Morgan cried out, hoping his words would reach his friend's ears. Severa stopped walking away and shuffled her feet together. She sighed, knowing full well her heart couldn't bear blowing Morgan off again.

"Damn his good looks and kind heart..." Severa turned around to the two and stared Morgan directly in the eyes. "What do you want?"

"Look," he started, twiddling his thumbs together as he spoke, "I know it won't mean much, since I'm already in a relationship, but if you stay with us in camp, I...I'll go on a date with you." Severa scoffed, not taking the offer as Morgan had intended.

"It's a little late for that, don't you think?" Severa replied curtly. "What's the point if I go out with you? Your heart already belongs to Hex-Girl, and you're really the only boy I liked like that in our group of friends. Thanks, but no thanks." Severa was about to turn away, when Cynthia spoke up.

"I'm sorry, alright?!" she called out, eyes looking like they were welling with tears. "I didn't know you liked Morgan so much! He was just always there to brighten my day, so I couldn't help but fall for him! Look Severa, I know we've never really gotten along much, but deep down, you're my biggest rival and one of my biggest friends - now more than ever! So if you come back, I promise I'll break up with Morgan, then he'll be all yours, alright?! Just please come back home!" Severa was stunned by Cynthia's heartfelt speech; it was still as dweebish as she normally was, yet Severa could feel a sense of warmth in it. She couldn't help but be shocked that the girl she presumed hated her the most was willing to give up her happiness just so they could all fight together once more; the act of selflessness responded well to Severa, especially considering her outburst not too long ago.

"You'd really do that for me?" Severa asked. The giantess kneeled down and got to eye-level with the pair, Severa wiped down Cynthia's face with her index finger, drying the white-haired girl's eyes. "I appreciate the offer, but you had him first, you can keep him."

"Oh Severa! Please come ba-"

"Moron! Let me finish!" Severa took a deep breath and calmed herself again. "Look, Daddy always taught me: "All's fair in love and war", and he especially held that first part true. I hate to admit it, but I'm a bit of a spoiled brat, and I really do detest the idea that some airheaded witch like you got Morgan first, but you beat me to the punch at something for once in your life, and I'm touched that you think whatever strained thread of a friendship we have is more important than your love life. Thanks, Cynthia."

"So, does this mean you'll come back?" Cynthia asked, confused by Severa's vernacular.

"Gawds! Do I need to spell it out for a idiot like you?! Y-E-S, yes, I'll come back to camp!"

"Alright! Thanks Severa! I'm so sorry for what I said before, it'll never happen again!" Cynthia lunged forward to give her rival a hug, but nearly fell off her Pegasus, prompting both Morgan and Severa to stop her from falling.

"Alright already, calm down!" Severa stood back up and put her hands to her hips, speaking down to her comrades. "And look, as an added bonus, I'll even let you keep Morgan for yourself! Who said I wasn't nice?"

"Gee Severa, are you sure?"

"Bah! I'm a big girl, I'll get over it!" Severa giggled at her height-related joke before turning her gaze back to Morgan, staring at him with lustful eyes and a devious smirk. "But, since you brought it up, I'm looking forward to our private date, cutie-pie~!" Severa giggled while Morgan gave a nervous chuckle, tugging the mouth of his shirt around his neck before gulping.

"O Naga, please let this be the right choice..." Back to her usual pompous, yet cheerful mood, Severa stepped over the duo and took lead, turning her head back to look at the duo.

"Alright, let's get going, I'll take lead in case there's any brigands or Risen out in the woods waiting to attack. Besides, I want to give Morgan the full view of my best features~!" Severa shook her hips provocatively, causing the young tactician to blush and Cynthia to puff her cheeks out in frustration.

"Alright, I know I said what I said, but Morgan's still my boyfriend you know!" Cynthia replied.

"I'm just teasing, jeez! Get a grip! Let's just get back so I can throw a couple tents over my body and get an actual rest." With that, the giantess led her two friends through the woods, ready to get back to camp and get prepared for a better day.

----------

Yarne bounded through the woods in his rabbit form, coming to a small clearing with a view of camp right through the trees. Yarne stopped himself in front of Cordelia and Inigo, both holding lanterns, and shifted back to his human form on sight of his allies. He sighed and looked at Cordelia with sorrowful eyes, afraid to give her any bad news.

"I'm sorry Miss Cordelia," began the bunny, "But I searched everywhere for them, I couldn't find a thing." Cordelia bit her thumb in response, feeling guilty of what she said to Severa.

"My poor baby..." she said, closing her eyes at the feeling of tears forming.

"It wasn't your fault, Miss Cordelia, we all know Severa isn't the easiest lass to handle." spoke Inigo in a comforting fashion before turning to Yarne. "Yarne, you're Taguel, aren't you? Can't they just, you know, use scents or something?"

"Well, I tried to trace some scent of Severa's perfume from a broken bottle Ricken gave me, but it just led to her bow, some torn dress scraps, and her, uh...smallclothes..." Inigo felt a hot flush of blood come up to his nostrils and stuck his hand to his nose to control the crimson flow.

"Yes, well!" responded Inigo, trying to calm himself, "I'll, uh, just keep that in mind for the search tomorrow!" The Prince wiped his face down with a handkerchief before turning to Cordelia. "As it is now, we can't continue onward with the darkness setting in. I'm sorry Cordelia, but I'm afraid we'll have to pick up the search tomorrow."

"Yes, I understand..." replied the Pegasus Knight, looking up and trying her hardest to force a smile. "Thank you boys for all your help, Severa's lucky to have friends like you." Yarne looked a little fired up in response.

"I know I'm not that brave in battle, but Severa's a friend, mean as she is; until I know she and Morgan are just fine, I'm gonna be brave!"

"Boo." Yarne leapt and let out a girlish scream, tumbling over before turning round and coming face-to-face with Severa, leaning down to startle the group. The girl gave a smug smirk at her little trick and fully erected herself again, stepping through the trees with Morgan and Cynthia in tow behind her. "So much for the brave bunny! Is this supposed to be my search party?"

"Severa!" Cordelia cried in joy, dropping her lantern and running over to hug her daughter's big toe. "I'm so glad you're alright! I'm so sorry for what I said, I should've given you your space!"

"Can it Mom," replied the young Lady, breaking her toe from the hug and kneeling down to meet her mother, "I should be the one apologizing, I acted like a huge spoiled brat back there when you were just doing that annoying motherly thing. I guess my new size is a big change for me too, not just you guys." Cordelia was touched by her daughter's epiphany and smiled warmly at her daughter. Morgan and Cynthia landed themselves upon the ground, rejoining Inigo and Yarne.

"Glad to see you're in one piece Morgan!" cried Inigo, patting his trusted friend on the back. He leaned in closer, branded eye looking directly into Morgan's, and whispered in his ear. "So, how was your little 'boing-boing' ride? Slice of heaven, am I right?"

"I...I don't want to talk about it..." replied a blushing Morgan, averting his gaze to the clearing's floor.

"You guys seriously had us worried!" Yarne spoke, heart now beating at an even pace. "I really didn't want to think what would've happened if some brigands or Risen found you guys before we did!"

"I'd squash them, that's what'd happen!" replied Severa, giving a grin like she was ready to go on another power trip. Cordelia glared at her daughter, causing the girl to recoil and rethink her words. "Right, sorry..."

"It's fine though!" chimed in Cynthia, "The forest was clear of any enemies, so we can stay put on this land for a couple more days!"

"We talked it out on the way back," added in Morgan, "Severa's not going to run off anymore, so no more camp emergencies for the time being either."

"Is that so? Can I hold you to that Severa?" Cordelia asked her daughter. Severa stood back up and addressed her mother.

"It's high time I started acting my age! We're in a war! I frankly don't give a damn what Chrom's got to say or what his law is, but I'm not going to run away from it anymore, he's just gonna need to get used to having a giant in his army from now on!" Cordelia looked up at her daughter with determination, pumping her fist in response.

"As long as you're this big, I'll help you every step of the way!" Severa pumped her fist back and begun the lead walking off back to camp.

"Alright, I'm bushed! Let's get back to camp and get this over with!" Cordelia wanted to look supportive to her daughter on this one, but had no idea how Chrom or Robin would react for basically kidnapping the junior tactician of the Shepherds, and worried that her daughter's punishment would just pile on further and further. Cordelia could only hope her husband managed to lessen Chrom's sentence and better his mood.

Meanwhile in Chroms's tent. A map of the forest was streched across Chroms's desk, with a figure of Severa surronded by several of the other Shepard's. Ever the strategist, Robin had been drawing up a plan to confront Severa, before Virion rushed in and pleaded before them, dropping to one knee.

He looked deeped into there eyes.

"If she does so, with Morgan unharmed, will it not prove her humanity is in tact?"

"IF he is unharmed. And even if that were the case, could we trust her to follow orders?"

Virion's fidgeting intensfied.

"See..."

"An astute observation."

"Please lord Chrom, Miss Robin, I'm begging you on behalf of myself and Cordelia, if Severa does bring Morgan back to us, do not judge her too harshly. She is impulsive and stubborn, but not truly malevolent. I'm sure the shock fo the situation merely had a temporary effect on her mind."

"I will think about it."

135321121121111221111.content:
"Severa!" shouted Robin with malice, pushing through the crowd of people while closing in on the giantess. While normally careful and observant, Robin's maternal instinct overtook her logic, and she threw all caution aside, discarding any fear she may be squashed underfoot. Severa noticed Robin closing in and sighed, not wanting to deal with this.

"Hey Robin." she spoke, ego missing from her voice.

"Cut the crap!" Robin yelled, clearly aggravated her son was kidnapped. "Where'd you take Morgan?! He better be safe!"

"Would you calm down?" responded Severa, twitching a finger as if to tell Robin to lower her voice. "He's safe, a little shaken up still, but safe regardless."

"So where is he?!" Robin shouted, feeling an urge to light the Lady's azure pigtails ablaze. "Give him back this instant!"

"Mom!" Robin's anger was disrupted by the enthusiastic cry of a boy, and as she turned her head from Severa, Robin saw Morgan break through the crowd and run towards her, Libra walking in tow.

"Morgan!" Robin enveloped her arms around the boy, as Morgan did in turn, and began to spin the boy around in the air, holding him tight and kissing him intensely. "Are you okay?! I was so worried about you, thank the heavens you aren't hurt!" Morgan giggled as he received his affection.

"I'm fine Mom, really! A little too close to comfort with Severa, but..." At the sound of Severa's name, Robin spun around to face Severa, still clutching Morgan tight to her, and got ready to hurl a venomous set of insults at the giantess.

"I've already talked it over with her," Libra calmly stated, joining his wife and son, "Severa had no ill intent on stealing away Morgan, it was merely her jealousy towards his relationship with Cynthia. While I don't agree with the...things she attempted to do with Morgan, I can see where she came from, and was welcome to hear her repent."

"What things?!" Robin inwardly thought as a series of lewd teenage scenarios flashed through her mind. She shook off her thoughts and protested her husband's logic. "But Libra," she replied, "This is our son! I don't care what her logic was, she can't just take our son away and pretend like nothing's wrong! How can you expect me to forgive her?!"

"Robin," Libra replied, putting a hand to his wife's shoulder, "Wrath is a sin, is it not? I don't disagree with your feelings, but we must forgive the wrongdoings of others."

"Father's right," Morgan added in, looking directly into his mother's eyes, "Can you please find it in your heart to forgive Severa? If not for her sake, then mine?"

"I know it's a little too late..." chimed in Severa, prompting Robin to lay eyes on her again. "Look, Robin, I'm sorry I took your son away, it was wrong of me and totally in the heat of the moment, but let's be honest here; he's got dashing good looks." Robin furrowed her brow, and Severa looked for better words in response. "Alright, look, it's not going to happen again, okay? I don't expect you to forgive me, but can you spare me the lecture til tomorrow at least?" Robin struggled internally to decide between abiding by her family's wishes and forgiving Severa, or just chewing her out on the spot for a somewhat rude response; she tried to keep in mind Severa was still considered a friend, but what if she acted up again? Could Robin, as tactician, put the sake of the Shepherds' safety at risk with an impulsive, loose cannon egomaniac of a giantess running around camp, abducting boys for her pleasure and distracting the camp with petty displays for attention?

"Alright, what's going on here?" Chrom came forward with Virion in tow, joining the group gathered around Severa. Virion was overjoyed to see his daughter again, and ran forward to her as Cordelia touched her Pegasus to the ground to rejoin her husband.

"Severa, my darling!" Virion grabbed Severa's ankle and tried to wrap his arms around it, turning to Cordelia as he got situated. "Cordelia, my dear, you truly are a great scout if you could find her in this short a time!"

"Well, it's night-time, and I didn't exactly find her as much as she found me..." Chrom interrupted the two by clearing his throat, bringing attention back to him again.

"Sorry about that, but we need to get to the matter at hand here." Chrom sternly looked at Severa, adopting his supreme authority as he did before in hopes it would work. "Severa," he started, "I realize you are considered an asset to this team, skilled with both the blade and bow, and supportive to your allies; even now, the changes to your body give us a clear advantage in this war..."

"Oh, you're too kind." Severa coyly replied.

"But I cannot overlook your deeds ever since you grew; in just one day, you managed to distract all the men in camp with an inappropriate dance session, kidnap our head tactician's son and send the whole camp into a panic, and if Ricken's to be believed, you tried to eat him?" Everyone looked shocked, while Severa merely shrugged.

"Yeah, wasn't the smartest decision in hindsight. It was more 'torture' and 'blackmail' than 'eating him' though."

"Regardless, you can't be doing these things, and I fear your size has given you an ego too big for this army." Chrom extended his arm forward and pointed at the giantess in a commanding fashion. "From now on, you're off the field permanently until Ricken finds a cure for this! As added punishment, you're to take down and set up all of camp once we move spots! And if you abandon us one more time, you are to leave the Shepherds and take refuge in Regna Ferox until the war ends!"

"Really? That's it? I thought you'd kick me out of this dump or something." Severa scoffed. "Alright, fine, no more run-aways, no battle, but I'm not intending on getting small again, so don't blame me if I'm not around to save you from some Grimleal." Chrom looked stoic, but inwardly, he breathed a sigh of relief.

"Gods, I can't believe that actually worked." Chrom looked over at Cordelia and Virion and got their attention with his gaze alone. "As for you two, you aren't in trouble, but you're to raise your daughter in a far more dignified manner, understand?" Cordelia looked down, sulking, unable to protest her case against the man she harbored feelings for.

"Y-Yes, my Lord..."

"Now just wait the hell up!" Chrom looked up and saw Severa leaning in at him, face red with anger. "I don't care what you need to say about me, brutal as you can get, but there's no way in hell I'm standing by while you berate my parents, understand?!"

"B-Buh-"

"'Buh' nothing! Mom and Dad raised me just fine when they were around, and they're doing a fine job now! Next time I hear you say anything like that to Mom, I'll drop my fist right on top of that ugly, meathead mug of yours!" Chrom looked shocked, almost frightened, as Severa chided him. "Now I'm tired, where the hell can I get some sleep around here without men crawling all over my body?!"

"...M-Mess tent's cleaned out..."

"Good!" Severa grabbed her parents and placed them upon her shoulder and then grabbed a stack of folded white tents. "I'm taking these for blankets! Good night, Prince Jackass!" With that, Severa coldly walked off towards the mess tent, leaving the army to look at their emasculated leader.

"Chrom, are you alright?" Robin asked, concerned as Chrom kept looking down, traumatized by what just transpired.

"...Do I really look like a meathead...?"

----------

Severa reached the mess tent and set her parents to the floor as she crawled in, flipping around to get comfy. As Severa admired the perfect room and isolation from the other Shepherds, Cordelia and Virion were still stunned by their daughter's outburst."

"You really didn't need to do that, you know." begun Cordelia.

"What? Kidnap Morgan?" Severa answered.

"No, that whole rant against Chrom! If you weren't in hot water before-"

"Bah, screw him!" Severa replied, "I'm not scared of him! I just didn't want you to look like some kind of doormat to the rest of the army!"

"Dear," Virion begun, "While I appreciate the thought, this doesn't bode well for your punishment I so worked at trying to lessen."

"Yeah, nice job on that by the way. If it were any normal-sized girl, they'd have left the army by now." Severa stopped trying to get comfy and leaned forward to look at her parents. "Look, I got over my problems with Morgan and Cynthia's help, but I'll be damned if I let Chrom scold you two for bad parenting. I've been a jerk ever since I got here, and you still get on my side whenever I ask for it. I really don't say this enough, but I love you guys." Severa gave a warm smile and grabbed her parents, bringing them close to her chest for a hug; the two smiled and hugged what they could in turn. "Alright, I'm going to see how well I can manage to sleep at this size, so don't bug me, 'kay? Good night you two." Severa let her parents to the ground again and the two turned to leave for their shared tent.

"Good night Severa! We love you!" they both called before leaving. With a smile on her face, Severa laid down and draped whatever she could of the tents around her body and laid the rest down under her head as a pillow; the cool grass underneath was a natural soft bed at Severa's size, feeling like a fine cloth couch. Severa ran over the events of the day in her head; she managed to become 50 feet of beauty and brawn, attract attention from every boy in camp with her beauty and outfit, work past a few emotional issues, and tell off Chrom & get away with it in one day. Sure, there was some bad alongside all the good, but once she had hit the bottom, there was nowhere to go but up. As Severa drifted off to her dreams, one final thought entered her mind, and she spoke it aloud.

"Being this huge is going to be awesome."

1353211211211112211111.content:
Severa awoke the next morning with a yawn, getting up, stretching, and rubbing the sleep from her eyes, vision still blurry. She shook her head with a hand atop her forehead and spoke aloud to herself to confirm she was awake.

"I had the strangest dream last night..." she started, "I drank a potion and became a giantess, and from there, I got a fan club from all the men in camp and got to push around Chrom..." Looking around, Severa noticed that she wasn't in her usual tent, but in the mess tent, only it looked smaller than before. Severa looked around further and noticed she was sleeping under a pile of tents, and she wore a makeshift swimsuit out of torn tent fabric to cover her body. "Oh, that's right, it wasn't a dream!" Severa giggled and sprang from her rest; she crawled out of the mess tent and stood fully erect, towering over the other tents in camp and head just slightly higher than the surrounding treetops. Severa looked at the sun and stood firm, ready to start her day.

Severa began walking through camp slowly and carefully, making sure not to step on any of her comrades, and waved back to the soldiers who gave wished her a good morning or gave catcalls. Severa noticed they were fully dressed and ready for action, and combined with the hue in the blue sky, Severa realized it was a bit later in the morning than she usually awoke. "I must've overslept," she thought, "Now that was a good rest last night!" Severa closed into the tent of her parents with each step she took; Cordelia and Virion were sitting on some boxes, heating a barrel of food and a small pot of stew with a fire tome. The two looked at their daughter and smiled, happy to see her in bright spirits.

"Good morning Severa!" called Virion, cheerful as ever. Severa sat down and crossed her legs, getting comfy as she smiled down at her parents.

"Morning Dad, Mom." Severa sniffed the scent of the barrel heating before her and looked over the food. "Smells good, what are you cooking?"

"Breakfast." Cordelia replied. "You actually woke up at the perfect hour, I thought we could all eat together as a family! We didn't have enough stew ingredients to go around for us all, so we had to cook you something else instead; I hope that's alright sweetie."

"It's fine, I realize it could get hard to feed me." Severa stuck a finger in the barrel intended for her and licked it, trying to judge the taste. "Mashed potatoes, with a hint of cabbage. Where the heck did you guys get all this?"

"Believe it or not, the rest of the soldiers in camp donated extras from their meals this morning!" Virion replied cheerfully. "Why, if I remember correctly, the fellows handed over their potatoes one-by-one, saying: 'Lady Severa can have as much food of mine as she wishes, so long as she continues that dancing!'" Cordelia shot Virion a small glare. "O-Of course I told them that your mother prefer you didn't! I hope that's to your liking!"

"Hey, I'm not complaining, it keeps me fed!" Severa grabbed the barrel and started chugging the potatoes as if they were mead, while Cordelia and Virion began ladling stew into separate bowls and digging into their meals. As Virion watched his daughter chow down, he cleared his throat and begun an anecdote.

"You know," Virion began as Severa looked up from her meal, "Long before my family begun the Dukedom of Rosanne, we were merely a family of Valmese farmers. Why, it was my great-great-great-great-great grandfather who ran a potato farm before he led a campaign to reform the nation; legend tells that he looked over the crop of his farm and said: 'This dirt is poor, yet what grows from it has become nice and big, beaming with radiance, like the people of this nation! I wish for all my descendants to become strong and healthy just as my crop has!' Why, if only he were alive today to see how you have grown big like the potatoes he treasured so!" While Virion expected awe, he only received looks of confusion from his family.

"You know, not all fathers compare their daughters to potatoes..." Severa responded. "I mean, I guess it was a good enough story. Thanks Dad, I guess..." Virion didn't know whether to attempt to reaffirm his story's point or not, so he just smiled and took the compliment.

"Olivia came by before you came," Cordelia stated, "She said that Chrom just looked very distressed and sounded very self-conscious this morning; what you said really must've had an effect on him!"

"Seriously?!" Severa asked. "Who would've thought I could intimidate the Exalt just like that?! That's hilarious!"

"Now Severa," Cordelia responded, "It's not polite to take pride in others misery. You should probably apologize to Chrom when you get the chance."

"Yeah, fat chance."

"Severa..."

"Alright, fine! But he needs to apologize to you two first, and I need to hear it! I'm not just going to let him get away with whatever he wants!"

"Now Severa, he is the rightful Exalt of Ylisse, he does have some weight to back his words." Virion added in.

"And I'm the rightful Lady of Rosanne with 10 times whatever weight he's packing. No apology, no apology, that's just how this is going to work." Cordelia and Virion nodded as Severa chugged another helping of potatoes. "Has Robin said anything to you two yet?"

"Not yet," Cordelia replied, "She doesn't seem like the type to hold grudges, but she did look angry last night. I talked to Libra through, he and Morgan seem to forgive you."

"Yeah, but Libra is Libra, and we all know how nice Morgan is." Severa responded, taking down another swig of her breakfast. "I just don't want her to keep me from seeing Morgan, I still want to be friends with the little booger."

"You really did like him, didn't you?" Severa shuffled her feet around at her mother's question and hugged her knees to her chest.

"...Yeah..."

"Worry not, dear Severa," Virion replied, "I promise that when the war ends, we will find you a charming rogue who can calm your aching heart!"

"I don't want a rogue though!" Severa replied, "I wanted Morgan! There's never going to be anyone cuter and nicer to me than that boy, and I let it slip through my hands, just like that! I mean, Cynthia's nice and all, but really? Cynthia? Now that's just kicking a girl while she's down!"

"Now Severa," Cordelia replied, closing her eyes for a minute, "I believe we had a conversation like this yesterday; Long ago, my heart ached for Chrom, and I was absolutely devastated when he chose Olivia to be his bride. I spent a lot of time alone and took up some drinking to ease the pain until your father came along and started filling my head with his kind words, until eventually, I just up and stopped thinking about Chrom romantically, just like that. It may hurt now, but I guarantee you, that perfect boy will come along some day; maybe in this camp, or maybe in some far away kingdom - but they'll come and steal your heart away."

"That's indeed correct!" Virion added in, "My head was filled with the bewitching charms of another woman long ago myself until she was married, and like a moth to a flame, I found myself attracted to your mother as a kindred spirit, and I've never been happier since! Just keep your chin up, you're a strong girl, a wise girl, and - dare I say - a big girl now! The world is your oyster, my dear daughter."

"Alright, I get it, thanks guys. It might be a bit hard finding a boyfriend who can handle me at this size though, don't you think?" The group giggled and got back to their meals, Severa neared the bottom of her barrel before a thought hit her. "Wait a minute, who was this 'other woman' you fell for Dad?" Virion stopped and adjusted his cravat.

"Now, now! T-There's no need to go over the details of that!" Cordelia looked at her husband with a smug smirk.

"Come on Virion, I thought you had an anecdote for everything?" coyly replied the Pegasus Knight.

"W-Well, there's a time and a place, and I-"

"Oh Daddy, pleeeaaaseee~?"

"...Sully. It was Sully." Severa erupted into laughter while Cordelia giggled, clearly having heard the story before.

"Sully?! Really?!" howled the Lady with laughter. "Dad, I thought you were into women! What in Naga's name made you want to marry Sully?!" Virion looked red with embarrassment while Severa chugged her barrel between spurts of laughter. Once done with breakfast, Severa dropped the barrel and got up, wiping her lips off. "Well, that was my laugh for the day! I think I'm gonna swing by the lake and take a quick bath before I get the rest of the day done with. Thanks for breakfast Mom, Dad!"

"Have a good bath sweetie!" called Cordelia, giving an energetic wave. Virion tried his best to wave with a straight face, but just looked embarrassed and defeated. Severa walked off into the woods, now breaking into a stride towards the lake.

When she reached it a short while later, Severa disrobed herself and hung her makeshift outfit from a few branches before undoing her pigtails and walking into the lake. Like before, she dived under a few times to cleanse her upper body and began scrubbing herself, wiping dirt and potato from her body. "I'm going to need a new lake soon at this rate." she commented, watching the white clumps disappear from her arms and under the water. Severa leaned back and looked up at the clouds, wondering what move she should make next. "What's the plan for today?" she thought, "Should I go pay Morgan a visit? Maybe talk with Cynthia about last night? I don't really feel like dancing today, I need a new routine... As Severa thought it over, she basked in the beauty of the clouds in the clear sky, for once, actually taking pleasure in a world where the sky wasn't covered in smog and ash.

Severa continued thinking about what to do. The girls would certainly be more likely to act something close to normal around her, but they probably wouldn’t be wooed by her charms. Well unless any played for the other team or were… curious, which would be an amusing way of finding out.

But thinking of Morgan made her feel something deep inside. He was so sweet, so innocent despite everything everyone had gone through and caring and smart… well kind of. But even his ditzy moments could be charming in an odd way.

Stupid Morgan, making her feel like this. She had to go see him today. Robin wouldn’t like that, but so what?

She felt a pang in her stomach. Wasn’t he already with Cynthia? But then Cynthia had given her permission…. Would Morgan ever choose her over someone as nice and sweet as Cynthia?

She sighed. Probably not, but she still wanted to see him. Even if nothing more came of it..

Shaking off that lingering feeling of dread, Severa got out of the lake and dried herself off as quickly as she could and strode off for to Morgan’s camp.

Morgan and his family were relaxing in their tent, only to be jolted by the impact of Severa’s steps .The Shepard’s were getting used to Severa’s tread but as the sound grew louder and louder, Robin growled. She clenched her fists and stood up.

“It’s Severa, she’s coming this way.”

Libra was erriely calm, as usual, still drinking his tea.
.
“She has no doubt come to see Morgan again.”

“I’m not going to let her kidnap our boy again!”

Morgan stood up.

“She’s not going to do that again.. I think. She probably just came to say hi.”

“Robin, she willingly returned Morgan to us and has apologized for what she did. Prehaps she is merely here for atonement.”

“Unlikely!”

“Perhaps not, but we all deserve second chances, do we not?”
