135321121121111221111112.content:
Robin had every urge to chew Severa out for yesterday, especially now knowing what she tried to do after Libra explained it to her last night, but she instead took deep breaths and internally counted, trying to take her mind off the giant before her. "Deep breaths Robin," she thought, "She hasn't done anything else to aggravate me yet, just play it cool and she'll eventually leave." Morgan walked forward to greet his friend, having recovered from yesterday's far too intimate event with her.

"Hi Severa!" he greeted with his usual cheer, "Any reason you wanted to see me today?" From outside the tent, Severa fidgeted and twiddled her thumbs together; inside the tent, she blushed a little bit and gave a small smile, looking sideways as she did.

"Oh, I dunno..." she replied, feigning ditziness, but bordering on the actual feeling. "I guess I couldn't keep you out of my mind this morning, go figure. Maybe we could, I dunno, try that date out?" Severa stopped herself when she realized how warm her voice was getting, remembering that Morgan was already spoken for. "F-For friendship of course! Nothing else!"

"Sure thing!" replied the boy. "Dad, Mom? Can I go hang out with Severa today?"

"Why of course, Morgan." replied Libra with his usual warm smile. Robin however scowled, motherly instinct taking over her forgiving nature and kinship with the other Shepherds.

"Now just hold it!" Robin shouted, losing whatever cool she could muster. "Morgan, do you really think it's wise to just forget everything that happened yesterday? She tried to strip you for Naga's sake!" Severa winced at Robin's mention of yesterday's events, she really just wanted to forget that entire stupid, selfish episode she had and start anew. Morgan did not react in such a way, instead taking a breath and calmly responding to his mother.

"Mother, I am well aware of what happened yesterday, but I'm not going to let that ruin a good friendship with Severa. We all make mistakes, it just means we're all human." Human - Severa liked that word, it reminded her that people still remembered she was a person and not some giant monster, not just her parents. "Please, can I go? I promise we'll both behave." Robin folded her arms, not content with her son's answer.

"Yeah, but still..." Robin mumbled. "Morgan, you're smart, I know that, but I can't just trust Severa so soon. It's a motherly thing, you understand, right?"

"Look, Robin?" Severa spoke up, prompting the tactician to stare the Lady in the eyes. "You're not wrong in mistrusting me, hell, sometimes I don't even trust myself on some things. But for just this once, can you throw me a bone? I still want to be friends with your son, but I won't blame you if you don't want me seeing him again." Robin shut her eyes and took some deep breaths again, thinking up the possible scenarios that could play out with this.

"...Where would you be taking him today?" she asked.

"I dunno," Severa replied, "Just somewhere out of camp for today. Could you let Chrom know if I do by the way? I know you have as much pull in camp as him, and I'm not exactly looking to talk to him anytime soon." Robin inwardly fumed, trusting Severa less and less now knowing she wasn't speaking to Chrom. Libra saw his wife working her mind over and spoke up.

"Forgiveness, Robin." he spoke, "Remember the virtues of life." Robin calmed herself at Libra's words and finished her thoughts.

"...I'll allow it," she replied to the giantess, "But you're to spend time in the woods if out of camp, and in secrecy so you don’t cause a scene with the townsfolk nearby. I'm setting a curfew for sunset exactly, any more time and I'll let Chrom place whatever judgment he wants on you." Robin pointed directly at Severa's face. "And another thing: If I find out you've done anything lewd with my son today, then there'll be hell to pay, got it?"

"I understand. Thanks Robin." replied Severa with a smile. "All right, let's go Morgan!" Severa pulled her head out of the tent, and both Morgan and Robin followed, the latter staying near the tent flaps so she could get back to her book soon. Morgan allowed himself to be picked up by his huge friend; Severa intended to rest the boy on her breasts for a cushion, causing Robin to grimace at the sight.

"Severa...!"

"It's for safety!" Severa replied, "I don't want him falling and hitting his head!" Robin merely growled in response. "Fine!" Severa sat Morgan upon her shoulder instead and walked off to the center of camp with her passenger on board. Robin sighed when the two were out of sight and retreated back into her tent with a hand upon her head.

"You need to be more trusting." Libra spoke to his wife, attention focused directly on her. Robin flopped upon her cot and sighed again.

"I know, it's just...Look, see it from my perspective: What would you do if your son got kidnapped and the kidnapper just wanted to come back and visit the next day? Would you be so trusting?"

"Morgan is my son too, you know." Robin groaned as Libra got up and joined his wife on the cot; he placed a hand to her head to help relieve her tension. "I understand where you come from. Severa is undoubtedly different now, and what she is capable of now is indeed a frightening thought, but she is still a person, like the rest of us. We must all be respectful towards the needs of others, and what Severa needs right now is a friend."

“I guess you’re right…” Robin said as she sat up on the cot. “Maybe I shouldn’t be so judgmental. I’m sure Severa knows enough authority and care to bring Morgan back safely and on time…I hope.”

“Now that’s the woman I fell in love with.” Libra replied with a smile. He brushed away Robin’s hair and kissed her on the forehead, bringing a smile to the stressed tactician.

----------

Severa sat upon a large stack of weapons crates and removed Morgan from her shoulder, instantly resituating the boy in between her breasts. Morgan blushed and looked up at his friend, confused by her action.

“Severa,” he replied, “Didn’t Mother say not to do that?” Severa scoffed at Morgan’s words.

“I’m aware of what she said,” she replied with a huff, “But I’m not taking any chances. One gust of wind or if I trip backwards, then you’re a goner from this height. I’d rather you take the cushioned seats, if you catch my drift.”

“I suppose I can see your logic there, but didn’t you put your parents on your shoulder last night when you went to bed? Shouldn’t you care about their safety more?” A hot blush came over Severa’s face.

“Th-That’s because they have more balance! There's no need for safety with them! They're used to it, dummy!" Morgan gave a playful giggle, realizing Severa's true intent by her response.

"I'll play along for now, just to make her happy!" Morgan thought to himself before clearing his throat. "Okay Severa, safety first after all! But is it alright if I sit in your palm right now before we go?" Severa nodded and grasped Morgan, opening her palm up and allowing the boy to sit on the edge of her hand, easier for conversation. "Thanks Severa. So, do you have any place in mind in the woods? We could go bird-watching, I have some great reference books on local wildlife!"

"Well, I had a place in mind, just not the woods." Morgan tilted his head at the response, not understanding the context. "How about you and I go to town for lunch? If I'm stuck eating potatoes for the next couple of days, I'm gonna go crazy." Morgan looked shocked.

"Severa! We can't do that!" he protested.

"What? I'll pay you back, not like I'll be buying any new clothes soon anyways."

"Not that!" the boy responded, "You heard what Mother said! We can't cause a scene with the townsfolk, or else Chrom will kick you out of the Shepherds!"

"Morgan, I'm gonna let you in on a secret." Severa leaned down closer to Morgan. "I'm not afraid of Chrom, but if last night is any indication, he sure as hell is afraid of me. He says he can remove me from the army, but even as we speak, he's in his tent shaking in his royal boots. Let's just live a little for now, and then worry about the rest later."

"But won't someone see you Severa? No offense, but it's not really easy to hide a giant woman from a town full of people." Morgan replied.

"You're a tactician, aren't you?" Severa responded, "It can't be that hard to find a way to sneak me into town for your brain! If it's really that bad, then just get some take-out and we'll have a little picnic." Morgan thought the situation over carefully, examining all the options presented to him. He could go with Severa's plan and go out for lunch with her, which would be sure to keep his dear friend happy, but at what cost?

"If what Severa said is true," Morgan thought, "Chrom is no threat, but Mom and Miss Cordelia definitely won't be happy with us, I don't want our families to fight. I could always take the blame for Severa if word comes back from town, but Mom would definitely figure it out, and I don't think Cynthia would be too happy with me if I took the blame for something so reckless. I could always just keep at the bird-watching idea, maybe Severa would think it's fun if the finches are in season..." Morgan looked up into Severa's hazel orbs, looking back down at him with expectation. "Oh Severa, don't look at me like that! I don't want to get you in trouble!" Morgan kept batting the ideas around in his head, looking for the best solution.

"Alright, you win. You can be such a nerd sometimes, you know that?" Severa got up and put her hands to her hips, looking down at her chest-bound passenger. "But you're going to buy me some take-out from that place in town that sells the racks of lamb before our next march, got it? I'll pay you back whatever it costs." "Look Severa! It's a family of deer!" It was hour four of Severa and Morgan's nature hike, and while the boy was enthusiastic, busy at work with both a sketchbook and a notebook, Severa was bored out of her wits. She sat with her legs bunched up to her chest and her chin resting upon her hand, trying to resist every urge to fall asleep on Morgan; rude as she was, she at least had the manners not to fall asleep on dates. Morgan was hard at work surveying the nature around the two of them, skipping and dancing around the forest as if it were a wonderland; a flock of birds flew from a treetop, prompting the boy to point them out. "Severa, look at that! It's a flock of Summer Tanagers! They aren't even supposed to be in this season! Look at how pretty they are, a full scarlet coat! What do you think?"

"This suuuucks!" she groaned, flopping her arms about. "I can't even see half these birds because they're too damned small, there's not a single trace of civilization this far out, and we can't even try for the sunset again because 'Empress Robin' stuck a curfew on us! This blows!" Morgan walked over to Severa and stuck a hand on her arm, not even remotely looking hurt by her thoughts.

"That's fair enough," Morgan responded, "You never really were a 'forest girl' type when we were growing up anyways. Still, sorry about making you come out here, I just value your safety as a friend, too many risks with the nearby towns."

"Well..." Severa started, twiddling a pigtail around with her fingers. "Considering you're already dating Dopey, the Magical Knight, I figure I need to get over you eventually and find another boy to be my tiny Duke. Mom said I'll find someone that'll help me get over you, but I just can't see it; you're way too nice and cute to just get over, and that shiny blond hair..." Severa shook her head, rubbing her hands erratically through her hair. "Argh! Being in love sucks! I just want you to help me find a boy, okay?! Give me some advice here, Mr. Junior Tactician!"

"Well, alright!" replied Morgan, as he put his hand to his chin and got up thinking some ideas. "Well, first off, what traits do you want to see in a boy?"

"I dunno, I guess they need to be cute, that's a definite, they need to love me and only me, and they need to be able to carry their own weight so I don't need to rescue them constantly..." Severa thought it over a bit more, letting the gears in her head turn slowly. "...I guess they'd need to be a good cook & a good hunter, since I'm going to be eating a lot more from now on."

"That seems like a pretty steep list..." Morgan replied. He let the thoughts run in his head a bit more, trying to think up specific examples in the army, specifically, in their group of future-friends. "Well, how about Gerome? He's strong, he hunts a lot, and he's a good cook to boot!"

"He fits the bill, sure," Severa responded, "But he's too serious all the time; what's the point of dating if I can't tease him with my body? Besides, that mask thing he's got going on is creepy, and he has an attitude like sandpaper."

"Good point, then what about Laurent?" Morgan asked.

"Science nerd, no fun, I can't even find the guy half the time to talk with him for meetings. Next."

"Owain?"

"He's a little cute, sure, but that thing he does with naming the weapons and screaming attack names is absolutely creepy and weird. Next."

"Yarne?"

"Total coward, next."

"Brady?"

"His face looks like it was run over by a carriage, next."

"Inigo?"

"I would rather stick my head in a bee's nest then ever have to hear another one of that perverted moron's little compliments ever again."

"Well, that just about covers everyone in our circle of friends..." Morgan thought it over a bit more. "Did Miss Cordelia say anything else when you were talking with her?"

"Let's see...I think Mom said something about a 'far away kingdom' or something, like we'd have to look outside of Ylisse."

"Well, that could be a start..." Morgan tried to think up any faces he might've seen in Valm or Regna Ferox that Severa would've thought cute, but nothing came to him. "Well, let's try this: What's your idea of a dream boy? Describe to me the perfect men you could see yourself marrying."

"Perfect men, huh?" Severa closed her eyes and tried to imagine the perfect dream boy for her. "Let's see...Maybe a cool, Pegasus-riding warrior, or a strong-willed, easy-going Cavalier, ooh, or a nice, strong, blond-haired hunk of Prince! I could marry into royalty if I play my cards right! But then I'd have to stay there instead of going back to see my parents..." Severa shook her head in frustration and opened her eyes again. "Ugh! Even thinking of a dream-boat is a chore! Sorry Morgan, but I still got you on my mind, and it's hard to get you off."

"No, that's alright, I feel we've definitely made some breakthroughs here!" Morgan got up from his seat and walked a little closer to Severa. "I'll see what I can do on my end, maybe I can find a secret admirer for you in our circle of friends and I could set you two up. And hey, if there's no spark there, once we defeat Grima, then we'll go off to find you that special dream-boy!"

"Really?" Severa asked, touched, "You'd really do that for me?"

"Sure thing! We're friends! It could be you, me, and Cynthia off on a big journey together!"

"Alright, you were doing good up until that part."

"R-Right..." Morgan responded, "Well, regardless, we're always here to help!" Severa gave a huff, but she wasn't annoyed or upset in any way, rather, she gave a light smile to her tiny friend.

"Thanks Morgan. You're a dumb little squirt sometimes, but you got heart to back those good looks. You make me feel...human." Severa looked up at the sky and noticed the tone of orange that was starting to overtake the blue, the sign sunset was coming soon. "Great," Severa growled, "We must've spent a while out here, and I took you so far out too chasing after that pack of boars; the last thing I want is for your mother to tear me to shreds." She turned back towards Morgan. "You ready to go home?"

"Sure thing, I think I held you hostage out here quite enough!" Morgan joked. Severa stood up and picked Morgan up from the ground, resting him in-between her breasts again and beginning to tread back through the dense forest they traveled into, towards camp before the sun finally set.

Severa's improved mood was obvious from her walk. She traveled with a noticeably lighter tread, almost with a spring in her step.

Morgan tried to remain focused, deep in thought despite Severa's noticeable bumps and bounces. After roughly a minute he looked up at her.

"Hmm, you've ruled out just about everyone we know...what about Basillo?"

"Pfft as if he'd go for a girl like m- I mean too old! Besides he only has eyes for Flavia."

Morgan tilted his head.

"Huh? But their always arguing and bickering, how can they like each?"

"It's because..." Severa cut herself off and looked away. "Nevermind you'll get it when you're older."

"Huh but-"

"I said nevermind! Who else you got in mind for me?"

"Well I thought this through, pretty much everyone who joined the Shepard's before us have found a special someone."

Severa rolled her eyes.

"Yeah I know, that's how we're all here in the first place!"

Morgan smiled triumphantly.

"So what about the people who joined AFTER us?"

Severa stopped and bent down, staring blankly at the tactician.

"Wha?"

"I mean those people Chrom picked up recently."

Severa placed a hand to her head, as though she had a headache.

"Oh brother."

Somehow, Morgan wasn't dettered, as bright and cheery as ever when he was relaying a successful strategy.

"I thought about you're preferences, and the closest match I could think of was Yen'fay."

Severa responded without a thought.

"Pass. That guy is just like Gerome, just without the mask. His attitude isn't any better either."

"Are you sure he just wasn't interested in you-"

"Grrr-"

Morgan quickly cut himself.

"Never mind there are others. I bet no one is stronger than Walhart!"

Severa shook her head.

"No way, that guy is crazy."

"Aside from that there's Gangrel-"

"NO!"

The volume of her voice stunned Morgan, briefly causing him to lose his train of thought, though he wasn't surprised Severa react that way.

"I figured you'd say. That just leaves that new guy, what was his name?" Morgan scratched his head looking pained. He hated it when his memory failed him.

Severa huffed, obvious to Morgan's pain.

"Come on, out with it already!"

Morgan scratched harder before it came to him.

"Oh yeah, Priam!"

Severa suddenly stopped, accidently causing Morgan to lurch forward. He clung on to the end of her bra to avoid being thrown off.

"Be careful!"

Now Severa was in thought. For a few seconds.

"Hmm... I dunno, he is strong but he's kind of weird. Does he even like women?"

"People said the same thing about the Radiant Hero Ike and-"

Severa looked incredulous.

"Is he REALLY Ike's descendant?"

"I don't know, I mean if Mist had the kid and Ike trained him, would it still count?"

Severa stared blankly then shrugged with all the apathy she could manage.

"Who? Not all of us enjoy reading boring old wars."

Morgan bristled, standing as tall as he could manage, which wasn't actually an impressive sight.

"There not boring! You can learn a bunch of interesting tactics from their battles, like when-"

"Whatever. Would I even like him? "

Morgan relaxed, confident in his plans.

"Well he's strong, and if I understand what women are attracted to, he's good looking, i think even Cynthia get's gooey eyed when starts talking, at least until he starts going on about chi or something."

Severa soured at that name.

"Sounds annoying."

Morgan looked a little desperate.

"Come on Severa, he's the last eligible guy in the army, if you turn him down I'll run out of options!" He stopped before lighting up again as new inspiration struck. "Unless you're into woman, in which case that opens a whole lot more. I bet Kjelle would be a great match for you-"

Severa growled.

"Ugh fine! I guess I can meet him, but would he even be into me? I mean every guy's going to go for this killer body, but the giant thing might ruin it unless he's into some weird stuff....."

"I don't know if he's into "weird stuff" other than cheese."

"It's Chi! Not cheese! Gods!"

"But the other guys at camp liked you and he likes strong people so it should be alright."

Severa rubbed her chin.

"Maybe...."

She had stopped walking and looked upwards, clearly weighing up the possibilities.

"Is there a downside to this?" Severa churned the thought over and over in her head, weighing the possibilities; Priam seemed like a strong enough hero, but would he stay in Rosanne after the war let up? Severa didn't want to give up her cushy life so easily, especially now that she could enjoy it from a whole new perspective, and scouring the globe looking for strength didn't sound appealing; if her silver tongue was persuasive enough, she could get Priam to serve as captain of Rosanne's military force and sate his thirst for strength like that. Then came the issue of age, she didn't want some weird age-gap relationship going on between the two of them, the less stares in the army, the better. "How old is this guy again?"

"Last I checked, 20 years." replied Morgan. Severa reeled back in shock, sending the small boy tumbling around between Severa's breasts.

"Seriously?!" she replied, "That guy's built like a brick house, how did he get so strong at 20?!" Severa thought it was perfect, in theory; she was 18, so any relationship they may share might look normal, at least, as normal as you can get between a bear-wrestling mercenary and a rich, snobby giantess. Severa gave it a bit more of a thought, crossing her arms, eyes shut, weighing the options in her head, before giving Morgan her response. "...Alright, I suppose I could give it one date."

"Really?!" Morgan cried, "That's wonderful! I'll search him out tomorrow and Cynthia and I can set you up a date!"

"Remember, it's one date, alright? If I don't like this guy, then it's back to the drawing board with you!" Severa removed Morgan from her breasts and set him upon her shoulder again, remembering Robin's reaction to Morgan's comfy vantage point, and continued marching onto camp with the boy in tow. "This better work Morgan; if this war goes on any longer, I might just go gay before I find a little Duke."

"I'm sure it's going to go well Severa!" replied Morgan with his usual cheer. He sat quietly for a brief moment while the trek back to camp continued, before turning back to Severa's cheek. "Hey, if you were to fall in love with a woman, who would it be if not Kjelle?"

"W-Why the hell do you want to know that, you creep?!" Severa replied, face reddened, taken aback by the question.

"I'm sorry! I'm just a little curious is all!" Severa sighed, letting out some blush with the exhale, and gave the query a brief thought.

"Hmm, probably Lucina. She's strong and beautiful enough, and being royalty of two kingdoms wouldn't be that bad of a thought."

"Ah, I see! So that's how it is!" Severa's blush returned again at Morgan's answer, despite the innocence of his tone.

"What the hell's that supposed to mean?! You don't give an answer like that when asking something so personal!" Severa tried to wrestle Morgan down upon the flesh of her shoulder with her finger, careful not to put to much pressure on the boy or drop him, while the tactician just laughed heartily, happy to be spending time with his dear friend and helping her out to boot.

----------

Robin stood outside of her tent, not brandishing her signature coat, as she stared intensely at a pocket watch. "It's almost sundown..." she spoke, biting down on her finger in anticipation and doing double-takes between the sky and her watch. Libra, in the process of chopping firewood, took notice of his wife's worry easily, the sight almost distracting him from his duty.

"Robin," he spoke, "Please do not worry, I'm sure Severa will be back with Morgan without any problems."

"Libra, you're too relaxed, or maybe you're just too forgiving." replied the tactician, not taking her eyes off the minute hand of her watch. "It's almost 6:00, what if Severa just decided to steal our baby again? With her size, she could easily just run off and nobody would catch her, it's the last problem we need on our march."

"Did we not talk about this earlier today? I understand your worry, but we must place trust our comrades. If you worry about protecting Morgan from Severa, then you might as well just drink Ricken's potion yourself to match her stature." Robin broke from her concentration at Libra's somewhat sarcastic comment and rubbed her hand to her chin.

"You know what? That actually isn't a bad idea!"

"Oh bother..." replied the clergyman, putting a hand to his forehead. The two began to feel a soft rumble coming closer to their tent, and in a mere matter of seconds came Severa into view, with Morgan upon her shoulder. Robin folded her arms and adopted a look of smug satisfaction.

"Well, it looks like you are capable of following direction at this size, I'm impressed!"

"Yeah, laugh it up, real funny; at least I'm a giant and not a fell dragon." Robin fumed inwardly at Severa's response, but recognized she probably deserved it for the way she spoke. Gently, Severa removed Morgan from her shoulder and let him down near his mother; almost immediately, Morgan ran over and gripped part of Robin's tank top, excited to tell his mother about the day.

"It was great Mom! You should've been there! We saw deer, boars, bears, and a whole multitude of birds, some of which weren't even supposed to be around this season! Nature really is a beautiful thing!" Robin smiled and ruffled the boy's soft golden hair, wrapping an arm around his shoulder once she was done.

"That's good to hear! And Severa, was she good on this trip?"

"Absolutely! She's still nice and helpful you know! In fact, Cynthia and I are gonna help her find a boyfriend from here on out!" Severa's face reddened.

"Hey! Don't go around telling the whole camp!" Robin giggled, feeling a sense of schadenfreude at Severa's reaction.

"Well, I'm glad you had a good time Morgan." Robin turned back towards Severa. "Thank you for taking care of my boy, I bid you good-night." Robin turned around and began walking to her tent.

"Robin..." Libra spoke. The tactician stopped in her tracks; she took a deep breath and turned around.

"Severa?" she asked, catching the giant's attention. "Look, tonight we're...I mean we're going to...What I'm trying to say is..." Libra sighed and put down his axe, stepping forward to take over for his wife.

"Severa," he spoke calmly and warmly, "Tonight, we intended to have dinner with your parents, separate from the mess hall in order to discuss your predicament, or rather, fortify the relationship between your family and ours. I've taken the liberty of inviting Cordelia & Virion, and Cynthia insisted on joining as well; if you could join us tonight, we would be honored, and we promise to make you feel right at home." Severa sighed and set a hand to her chin, impulsively tapping her cheek with her finger.

"You know, it's not like I have a choice if you've already invited my parents; it's almost as if I'm the one who's being held hostage now. What time is this again?"

"We've decided on 8:15, in order to give you time to prepare." replied Libra.

"I don't know exactly what preparation I can do, it's not like they make a makeup brush in my size. I guess I'll shake some twigs out of my hair and see you guys then." Libra gave a warm smile and Morgan cheered, excited by the proposition, but Robin didn't look too happy about it, rather worried in fact. Severa turned around and gave a wave, walking back to her parents' tent in an upbeat stride. "See you guys in a few!" she called out while continuing her stride. The two boys waved while Robin merely groaned, receiving a look of confusion from Morgan.

"Mom, what's wrong?" asked the boy. Robin tried her best to put on a straight face, to avoid looking totally stressed by the turn of events.

"Nothing dear, just a little...exhausted by Severa is all."

"'Exhausted'?" inquired the boy, "What's exhausting about Severa?" Robin shook her head at the boy's innocence, not knowing how to break it through to him; Libra saw his wife's mental strain and took over.

"Your mother is still worried about you being around Severa," he responded, "She's afraid she may try to run off with you again or worse." Morgan sighed and tried to speak quell his mother's worries.

"Mom, look, I can handle myself around Severa, just as well as she can handle herself; she's still a person you know. Why, just today she suggested we go to town for lunch, and I-"

"Excuse me?!" Robin replied. "After I specifically told her not to?! Doesn't she understand the panic a giant could cause?!"

"No, Mom, you're not listening! We just-"

"No, I'm listening quite clear! Why, when Chrom hears this, he's gonna-" Robin's thoughts were interrupted by Morgan throwing his arms up in the air and groaning, ejecting shock from the tactician.

"You know, Severa's right! You are impossible sometimes!" The boy began to storm off from his parents.

"Morgan!" Robin cried with worry, "Where are you going?!"

"I'm going to Cynthia's tent! At least she's not as judgmental of her friends! I'll see you at dinner!" Robin felt hurt as she watched her son walk off, causing Libra to put an arm around her in comfort.

"I don't get it," Robin thought aloud, "Why is Morgan so rebellious now? Is Severa putting ideas in his head?"

"Clearly you don't get it." Libra responded. "Robin, forgive me if I come off as rude, but you need a lesson in humility and understanding, your motherly instincts cloud your judgment heavily. I would recommend a quick reread of the scripture before dinner tonight if you continue to have these thoughts, or else you may just lose your son to your attitude." Libra went back to chopping his stack of firewood, leaving Robin to retreat back into her tent and think over how to win her son's love back, as well as plans of how to deal with the giant girl that so causes her frustration.

13532112112111122111111221111.content:
As everyone went their own way, Robin stood where she was, ruminating what had happened.

Had she done the wrong thing? Severa had always been bratty at the best of times, even before this happened. When she kidnapped Morgan she revealed herself as a clear danger to him. Surely she was correct to put her foot down?

Yet her family did not think so and she had isolated the family she sought to protect. Had she failed at her objective?

Perhaps Libra was right about the whole forgiveness thing. She had more than a few misgivings about letting Walhart or Gangrel join the Shepard's, yet they had so far proved trustworthy, following every command issued to them to the letter, though she never completely lowered there guard around either of them.

It was true that if Severa had truly wished to harm Morgan there would have been little that could be done about it, at least as the situation stood. If Ricken's potion could be reproduced then leveling the playing field would be a simple matter. All it would require would be for Robin to bide her time..

Still the fact she had safely returned Morgan not once, but twice hinted that maybe Severa really did regret her actions. Prehaps her size had gone to her head, but her son had showed Severa the error of her ways. If even someone like Gangrel could receive a second chance, then perhaps Severa deserved the same.

Besides, if she were to refuse she would risk isolating herself from Morgan forever. And looking at Severa with an open mind did not mean completely dropping her guard. She could still analyse her and any risk she posed, but right now it would be best to go along with this. Maybe she would find a chance to make up with Morgan over dinner.

Severa tsked stumbling on another downside to her new stature. She wanted to look her best for this dinner, but how was she supposed to do her hair and clothes like this?

"Prehaps I can help?"

Severa looked down and around, only to see her mother at her feet.

"Ugh, what could you even do?"

Cordelia smiled.

"More than you think."

Cordelia disappered, only to come back minutes later on her pegasus, flying level with Severa's head, brandishing a lance. Severa stepped back, looking at Cordelia as thought she was insane.

"What the hell are you doing?!"

"I'm not going to hurt you I promise, hold still."

Cordelia flew to several hair and pushed a part of it straight and down, using the shaft as a crude comb.

"I don't believe it...."

Cordelia was still smiling as she worked.

"I know you want to look good for the dinner, and I know they don't make combs in your size."

Several folded her arms.

"Hmmph I guess it's not bad..." Severa said, grudginly impressed.

"I'm not sure what we can do for a dress, but maybe Maribelle will have some idea."

135321121121111221111112211111.content:
Morgan sat outside Cynthia's tent with her family, trying to calm himself from his mother's outburst; he figured that being around his girlfriend's kind family, weird as they were, would easily bring down his temper by mere proximity. Cynthia sat next to Morgan, cuddling him and ruffling his hair, while Sumia brushed her Pegasus and Henry prodded at some Risen limbs in a questionable fashion, possibly thinking up a new hex.

"I just don't get it Cynthia," Morgan lamented as he felt his blond tuft shift around, "Mother has only seen Severa few times when she was small, and they seemed to get along just fine. Suddenly she becomes large, and now Mother considers her a menace, to both the army and me. Is a height change that severe? I would've thought Mother would be fine with letting me around Severa since we were friends before, especially since she allows me around Walhart and Miss Tharja. Er, uh, don't tell her or Noire I said that." Cynthia tried to think up some comforting words, letting her mouth speak as she thought.

"Well...Maybe she's just worried? Severa was never known to be the nicest person around, so I guess it makes sense for Robin to worry if she's never really talked much with her." Morgan gave a light groan at Cynthia's suggestion, tired of hearing the word "worry" bought up when talking about his mother and Severa. "Sorry Morgan, but that's all I got. For my future mother-in-law, I don't seem to know a lot about Robin, it's a little embarrassing..."

"If I could butt in," Sumia interjected, poking her head up over her Pegasus, "I think Cynthia's right, there's really no other explanation for it. Mothers worry a lot about their children, Fathers too, it's just a natural thing we do; I'm sure Libra must've been worried sick about you when you went missing, even if he was calm when you came back."

"Yeah, for all he knew, a bear could've eaten you, and then he'd have to tuck the bear in every night! Lemme tell you, that's not easy! Nya Ha!" Henry added with his signature cackle. Morgan looked at Cynthia's parents, trying to understand their words, yet feeling the cloud of emotion still covering his judgment.

"I can understand that," Morgan rebutted, arms folded, "But it still feels hurtful that Mother would turn away one of our friends like that. Severa's just trying to do the best she can, it's not like she asked for this in the first place."

"But is she enjoying it?" Sumia inquired.

"I mean, she hasn't complained about being big, and she didn't talk about wanting to be normal again."

"Well, then there shouldn't be a problem. If Severa's anything like her mother, she's a strong girl, and I don't think anything Robin says can shake her confidence."

"Thanks Miss Sumia, but it's less Severa's feelings I'm worried about and more Mother's." Morgan tilted his head forward and looked at the ground. "She's been constantly threatening to report Severa to Chrom, and I don't want to see her get kicked out, where could she go? What would she do? I doubt a town would be so willing to store a giant woman, except maybe Regna Ferox, but she'd freeze to death up there."

"You know Morgan," Henry interjected, "I could always just curse Robin's mouth off! Like literally, it'd just fall off her face like that, no fuss, no muss!" Everyone recoiled in horror, not sure when Henry was joking or being serious.

"Father!" Cynthia shouted, "We just want to help Severa out, not hurt Robin!" Henry just let out a childlike giggle in response, an eerie thing to hear, but one his family was used to by now. With her cheeks puffed up, Cynthia looked at a small pocket watch and sprang up the moment she saw the clock's face. "Holy crap! Dinner's almost starting, we're gonna be late!" Morgan immediately sprang up as well, partially due to Cynthia gripping his arm, partially due to his polite, timely nature.

"Ah! Father's making bear steak, he'll be upset if we aren't there on the dot! Mr. Henry, Miss Sumia, thank you for listening to me!" Morgan bowed politely to the couple while Cynthia ran over to hug them, starting with Sumia and following with Henry.

"I promise we'll be back before nightfall!" she cried as she ran back over to Morgan.

"Have fun dear!" Sumia cried while she and Henry waved to their daughter and Morgan. The couple waved back and ran off back to Morgan's tent.

----------

Libra worked tirelessly to set whatever he could of the table, setting platters and silverware across the oak, moving tables and benches together for everyone to sit, making sure enough room was cleared for Severa to sit down; if he didn't say anything, one could easily mistake Libra for a housewife. As he continued setting the table, he noticed Robin through the flaps of their tent, sitting on her cot, looking deep in thought, bordering between sad and devious looks. Libra felt bad for his wife, he could understand the stress she went through, but didn't agree with her methods; talking was of no help because Libra simply parroted the same psalms he was taught in the clergy, something that clashed with Robin's motherly paranoia and frustrated her to no end, and there was no action that could be taken to keep the giant Severa in check without drastic consequence - it was a puzzle of emotion that stumped even the star tactician of the Shepherds.

"Robin." Libra beckoned while poking his head through the tent. Robin looked up in response. "Dinner will be ready in a few minutes. Does something ail you?"

"I'm fine Libra," Robin responded "I'll be out in a bit." The woman returned to her deep thoughts as Libra removed his head from the tent. The clergyman couldn't get over the lack of feeling in Robin's voice, no, rather it was as if she was concentrating on another matter entirely. Libra couldn't help but wonder, was it a reaction to Morgan's prior outburst, or did Robin have something more on her mind?

"Father!" Libra's thoughts were interrupted by the cry of his son; Morgan ran over and enveloped his father with a hug, an action that Libra warmly returned, as he noticed the presence of his son's girlfriend behind him.

"Hello Morgan, and good day to you as well Cynthia, I'm glad you could join us tonight."

"I'm glad you let me come!" replied the energetic girl, "I'm sorry I springed the invite on you so suddenly."

"It's quite alright, you may become part of our family one day, it's only natural. And speaking of family..." Libra looked Morgan deep in the eyes; almost sensing what he was going to ask, Morgan glanced away from his father's face. "Morgan, is there something you'd like to say to your mother?"

"...Only if she apologizes to Severa first. It's not fair for Mother to judge Severa based on how big she is now."

"Fair enough. I'll see to it your mother apologizes proper." As if on cue, in response to being talked about, the stomping noise of Severa's footprints reverberated across the ground, and in just a few seconds, the three saw Severa come into view, parents upon her shoulder. Her hair was properly brushed by a lance and looked more radiant than ever, and her clothes looked cleaner than when she took them from the tent stack; for a giantess, Severa cleaned up pretty nice. Virion and Cordelia were let to the ground gently, and the duo greeted Libra warmly.

"Good day Libra, Morgan, Cynthia, thanks for having us over for dinner tonight." Cordelia greeted with a smile and a handshake.

"We realize that our daughter's attire isn't exactly the norm for a family gathering," Virion added with his usual innocent smarm, "But I do hope you'll forgive us in that we couldn't find anything else to wear, and dear Maribelle could only manage to clean it with her magic. Besides, doesn't Severa just look lovely in that bright, angelic white?" Severa blushed and nudged her father with her finger.

"Dad!" she cried, "You're such an embarrassment! Talking about my clothes is creepy as hell!" Severa stopped prodding her father for a moment and looked down at the rest of the group with an alluring smile. "Though now that you mention it, I do look hot, don't I?"

"You look good tonight Severa." Morgan replied with his usual friendly demeanor. Severa let out a light giggle, clearing getting what she wanted to hear.

"Thanks Morgan, you know exactly what a girl wants to hear. And seeing it from up here, you and Cynthia do look a little cute together."

"Gee, thanks Severa!" Cynthia replied, giving her rival a big thumbs up with a small jump.

"Alright, dial it down a bit." Severa responded, always never a fan of Cynthia's wild enthusiasm. Robin exited her tent, hearing the commotion outside, and joining the rest of the party.

"Good evening everyone." Robin spoke with a smile. She tried to pat her son's head, but Morgan wrestled himself from Libra's arms and clung to Cynthia's waist, not easy to forget what went over just moments ago. Robin looked at her son with a soft sorrow in her eyes. "Morgan..." she lamented.

"I'm sorry Mom." Morgan responded. "You know what'll make me forgive you." Robin glanced at Severa and locked eyes with her; the two women muttered soft grumbles under their breath, their eyes seemed to do battle with one another, sending a tension through the air that told everyone the night wasn't going to be easy. Noticing the mood, Libra motioned for the night to continue.

"Perhaps we should take our seats. I hope the food is to your liking, may we bless Naga for our bounty tonight." Severa tried to reach across to the large pot of potatoes, but despite her long arms, she had trouble maneuvering around everyone, without the risk of sending the other dishes flying.

To everyone's surprise, upon seeing Severa trying to reach the dish, Robin held up the pot so that she could take it.

The tension in the room hit's peak when the two locked eyes, everyone waiting to see what would happen, but the exchange was complete with no problem.

"...Thanks." Severa said, in her usual grudging way.

"You're welcome." Robin's eyes were still narrowed, but she sounded polite and without any trace of passive aggressiveness. She sighed and lowered her head a little. "I didn't want to admit, but I think i was wrong about you. I can see you brought back Morgan safe and sound, that you genuinely care for him."

"Hmmph. I'm glad you've finally figured that out."

Morgan jabbed her leg.

"Severa!"

Severa sighed loudly.

"I mean... thanks. I guess I didn't make the best impression when I-"

Robin's eyes narrowed again.

"Kidnapped my son."

Severa threw her other arm up in frustration.

"I know! But I brought him back and he was just fine with me today!"

Robin sat back, relaxing her posture.

"I see that now. I was too blinded by worry to see it earlier, I am sorry."

Libra leaned forward and smiled, placing an arm around Robin's shoulder.

"It is human to err, but the gods grant us the grace to forgive so that we may learn from our mistakes."

Cordelia nodded emphatically.

"It is only natural for mothers to worry about there offspring. I keep thinking about all the times I wasn't there for Severa..."

Virion wrapped an arm around Cordelia.

"You could not have helped that, and we are here for her now."

Robin nodded.

"As I will be for Morgan." She turned to Severa, still looking serious, but far less tense. "But I realize I have been overbearing. As long as you treat my boy well and bring him home in good time, I will not interfere with you're friendship."

Everyone was clearly relieved. Cynthia even clapped at Robin's speech, before the looks she recieved told her this was not the proper time. Robin suddenly glared at Severa again.

"But if you ever harm him, I don't care how big you are I will find you and-"

Morgan yelled out, loudly scolding his mother.

"Mom!"

Robin was suddenly aware of herself. She looked at the ground for a second.

"Sorry."

Severa sighed, less loudly or bitterly than before.

"I get it, I'm not going to hurt Morgan, ok? Not that you could do much if I-"

Morgan scolded her the same way.

"Severa!"

Severa huffed, and kept her attention on Robin.

"Whatever, I'm not going to harm him, I promise. I mean why would I? I li- well I mean I guess he's alright." Severa's cheeks lit up and she fidgeted with her neck.

Robin regained her composure.

"Very well. So can we agree a truce?" Robin held out her hand.

Severa met it with a finger.

"Truce, I guess."

Everyone was plainly relieved, but the same tension still hung in the air, albeit it at a lesser volume.

13532112112111122111111221111111.content:
As the night came to a close, no other incidents had come up between the two women, and everyone present had breathed a sigh of relief. Both the families of Severa and Robin had felt it a breakthrough for their respective family member to set aside their feelings towards one another for one night, and hoped the truce they set in place would last a while. As the table was being cleared, the children had segregated themselves from their parents in order to speak; Severa, Morgan, and Cynthia sat together out of earshot, the latter two atop their titanic friend's shoulder, talking away of the day's events and the future from that point onward.

"I'm just glad you and Mom made up!" Morgan cheered with enthusiasm, "I didn't know how longer I could go on spurning her, it just tore at my heartstrings! Oh, I hope she's not too hurt..."

"Whatever you did Morgan, it was just right, don't sweat it." Severa rebutted with a gleeful smile. "I hate to ask though, but could you stay the mediator on this one? I dunno how long this truce between us could last; I could probably stay good if Robin doesn't ride me, but I've got no idea what's going through that woman's head half the time."

"Will do Severa! You can count on me!" An over-enthusiastic thumbs up was all Severa needed, she was glad Morgan was such a helpful and kind young lad.

"So Sev!" chimed in Cynthia, "Morgan tells me you got the hots for Priam!" A bright blush came over Severa's face, and she turned her head to shout at the Pegasus Rider.

"Idiot!" she cried, "I don't 'have the hots' for him! I'm thinking about taking him on one date, one! I don't even know if the guy's more than a meathead, he's so hard to find around camp!" Despite getting shouted at, the innocent grin didn't disappear from Cynthia's face, she took pleasure in getting such an excited reaction from her friend.

"Sorry! Sorry!" she responded, "I'm just a little excited to play matchmaker with you two is all! Maybe I could be a bridesmaid if you two hit it off well!"

"Ugggh, stop talking! You're so embarrassing!" Cynthia couldn't help but giggle as Severa ruffled her azure curls in frustration, Morgan found himself smiling at the two girls reactions.

"We'll do all we can to make sure you're happy like this, Severa. We know it hasn't exactly been easy for you to get around in camp."

"Thanks Morgan, that means a lot to hear, I appreciate what you and Cynthia are doing for me." Severa pointed her finger up towards her shoulder, tip aimed at Morgan's chest. "However, whatever catering you two are providing for this date better be damn good, got it?"

"I'll pick out the finest lamb from the town over!"

"Then it's settled!" Severa grasped her hands around her two friends and lowered them to the ground. Once she had dismounted them, Severa got up and started stretching, untensing her muscles as she let out a light yawn. "Alright, it's been a blast, but I need to get to bed. I'll see you two tomorrow, alright?"

"Yup! We'll talk to Priam first thing tomorrow, kay? Have a good night!" Both Cynthia and Morgan waved to Severa, the Lady grinned at their kindness and waved back, turning towards her parents, talking to Robin and Libra, and kneeling down to gather them.

"Yo, Mom? Dad? I don't want to sound rude or anything, but I'm feeling bushed, I think we should leave Morgan and his family alone so they can tuck in at a decent hour."

"Alright, that sounds good. Robin, Libra, thank you for having our family tonight, it means a lot to us. May your rest be pleasant." Cordelia gave a bow to the two, Virion following in turn, before the two stepped upon their daughter's palm and found themselves raised to her shoulder.

"Thanks you two, I appreciate the dinner. It was nice to feel normal." Robin and Libra nodded at Severa's words, Libra with a warm smile upon his face, and in an instant, the Lady walked back off to her parents' tent. Once they were out of eyesight, Libra turned towards his wife.

"See?" he asked, "A little acceptance can go a long way Robin."

"...Hmph..."

"Please don't be like that," he continued, "I'm quite proud of you for your civility towards Severa tonight, as would any other member of this army be. Kindness can make powerful allies, and I don't just say that because of Severa's condition."

"I get that Libra," Robin responded, "But deep down, I still don't feel good about this. There's a lot of danger Severa now presents, and she was known to be a loose cannon even before this. I mean, who will respect me if I let a potential threat roam in camp unchecked?"

"Mom!"

"I can think of one person..." Libra responded with a warm grin. Morgan ran over and threw his arms around Robin's waist, gripping her tightly and rubbing his cheek against her stomach.

"I'm so proud of you!" he cried, "You don't know how much it means to me to have apologized to Severa, it really means a lot to her too!" Robin looked a little puzzled for a moment, the thought of her son spurning her still fresh in her mind, and had no idea how to react; Cynthia lagged behind her boyfriend a bit, finally closing the distance between her and Robin.

"Yeah, it was a really nice thing to do, but just be sure to keep that truce up, kay? Wouldn't want the camp to turn into a battleground between you two!" Robin looked blank for a moment, but then proceeded to smile, returning the hug her son gave her.

"I think I get it now." she spoke. "Yes, of course, I'll make sure to treat Severa right from now on, I trust her. Still Morgan, just stay safe, okay? I don't just mean around Severa, I mean in general, you mean the world to me you know." Morgan gave a rapid series of nods and continued to bury his face into his mother's tank top. Robin looked at the smiling faces of her family and shifted her hands to stroke Morgan's hair, she found herself now content with the situation she was in, and wished nothing could change it. "I love you all..." Robin cooed, as she closed her eyes and embraced the moment.

----------

Severa reached her parents' tent and lowered them to the ground, allowing them to retreat into their tent before she went off to hers.

"Alright, I'm off to bed, I got a big date tomorrow." she called out before turning heel. "You two have a good night now, alright? Thanks for helping me prep for dinner."

"Severa, dear, wait." Virion called out. Severa stopped and turned around to face her parents again.

"What is it?"

"Well," Virion spoke, "We just wanted to say that we're proud of you for reaching a truce with Robin. From what Libra told us, things haven't exactly been easy between the two of you, I'm just happy that nothing came to a head tonight."

"It was nothing," Severa responded, "I just wanted to make sure I didn't kill my chances of seeing Morgan again. I don't know exactly how long Robin will keep our truce going, but Morgan did say he'd try to keep her civil, so I'm gonna put my faith in him on this."

"Well I'm glad to hear it!" Cordelia gleefully spoke. "And, if you'll forgive a mother's curiosity, when you said 'date', who exactly are you planning on going out with?"

"Ugh, nothing gets past you, doesn't it?" Severa grasped her arm and rubbed it, not sure how to answer without feeling embarrassed. "Well...I talked it over with Morgan, and he and Cynthia are going to...well, hook me up with Priam..."

"Priam!" Virion sung.

"W-What the hell's wrong with that?! He looks like a good enough guy!"

"Nothing's wrong with it sweetie!" Cordelia responded with a chuckle, "In fact, we're proud of you for finding someone you might like, it's just that we don't know much about Priam, he's very much of a...how do I say this nicely? 'Loner' type?"

"Believe me, the thought crossed my mind," Severa responded, "But he looks cute enough, and he can hold his own, and that's what I want to see in a guy. Besides, he seems to be unfazed by plenty of things, so I think he'd be accepting of a giant woman."

"Severa, my dear," Virion spoke, "I assure you, everyone would be far accepting of your size once they get to know you. Why, once we all return to Rosanne, I'll see to it that they see you not as a giant, but as a respected Lady of the great House Virion, no matter the cost."

"Don't worry, I'll make them accept me, you don't need to lift a single finger Daddy!" Virion gave a nervous chuckle, fiddling with his cravat as the scenarios his daughter could play out ran through his head. Severa let out a yawn and rubbed her eye. "Well, if that's all, I'm getting to bed. Sweet dreams you two, have a good night."

"Good night Severa, we'll see you tomorrow!" Severa smiled at her mother's words and marched off to her tent, ready to get to sleep. Once she reached it and crawled inside, Severa stacked the tents atop another, threw a stack of cloth atop her body, rested her head atop the pillowy mass of cloth, and drifted off to bed; a warm smile crept along her face as she went to sleep, bright dreams of her and her family & friends entering her mind, some of which she was small again, some of which she was still large, all of which were enjoyable.

Severa spent nearly a half an hour in the stream, feeling the cool, crystal clear water run across her body as she lounged. "This is perfect!" she mused, "Who knew I could find a stream this large, this clean?" She leaned back and let her hair dip under the flowing water, and as she ran her hand through the azure strands, she could feel how soft and clean her hair was, as if the stream was a natural conditioner. Entranced by the natural relaxant, Severa laid her whole body back, allowing it to rest at the bed of the stream, smooth as a tortoise's shell and free of any rocks or wildlife. As the water ran past her body, Severa let out a sigh of relief, taking the time to appreciate the moment of silence she had from the camp's usual bustle. "Ah, it's such a shame that we'll be marching in a few days," she lamented, "This is such a perfect bathing spot - no dumb animals, no filthy junk from upstream, no meatheads coming to ruin my private moments; maybe Morgan was right, nature is awesome!" Severa felt a leaf from the treetop above touch her cheek, and she let out a giggle and relaxed. "I could just take a nap right now, maybe Priam wouldn't mind if I'm an hour or two late..." Severa closed her eyes with a smile upon her face and let her body loosen and unwind.

"Severa!" Severa's eyes shot open and she grumbled as she leaned up, feeling her private moment ruined by Cynthia's voice. Severa watched the girl dart through the trees on her Pegasus, coming to the edge of the stream and touching down gracefully. She watched as Cynthia elegantly dismounted her Pegasus, putting a hand to her face to control her frustration.

"So much for the perfect moment..." Severa mumbled before turning to Cynthia. "Cynthia, what is it? How did you even find me out here?"

"Why, the power of friendship of course!" Severa groaned at Cynthia's ridiculous answer, while the young girl just giggled at her jest. "No, I just saw you walk this way early in the morning, so I just followed the stream; I was up pretty early trying to help you out with your date!" Severa grumbled and went back to laying backwards again, trying to enjoy her bath.

"I appreciate the thought," she replied, "But I'm in the middle of bathing here, as you can see, so can you buzz off for like, oh, I dunno...An hour? I'll come find you and Morgan after that."

"Oh, I see, whoops...So should I send Priam home?" Severa darted up from her resting state and immediately placed her hands to her breasts at this.

"Priam's here?!" she cried, "Where?!"

"In that clearing back there."

"You dolt! Why the hell would you bring him here?! Can't you see I'm naked?!" Cynthia took a bit of time to register Severa's words.

"Oh yeah, I guess that was a pretty bad idea in hindsight! Clumsy me!" Cynthia lightly knocked her head as Severa felt her fury boil.

"You guess?! Don't you know how private girl time works?! Send Priam home right now until I'm do-"

"Cynthia, are you over here? Where is this 'strong warrior' you keep telling me about?" The color drained from Severa's face as she saw Priam come into view, the worn Ragnell sheathed at his side. Though frozen in place, Severa's mind was still active, and she couldn't help but be amazed at how well Priam looked; his hair was a beautiful dark blue, his face was rugged, yet handsome, and he wore his armor well, not a slob like the rest of the soldiers in camp. Priam looked at Severa for a moment, not very phased by the situation. "Oh, you're that giant woman that's part of the army - Severa, right?"

"Yup!" Cynthia butted in, "This is the strong warrior I mentioned! She's excellent at battle and she's got noble blood to boot; pretty awesome choice for a partner, right?"

"I couldn't care less about her blood," Priam responded, "But I can definitely sense her strength, even from here. Her arms are the perfect size, her stomach's well-toned, and her chest is the right size for ar-"

"Alright, that's it!" Severa shouted, returning to reality. She shifted her right arm to cover both her breasts and used her left arm to grab whatever foliage she could. "Out! Now!" Severa begun throwing leaves, twigs, rocks, and whatever else she could grab at the two, trying to get them to leave so she could dress herself. Cynthia yelped in panic as the foliage hit her, but Priam just felt a exciting grin overcome his face.

"She's got a really good throwing arm!" he complimented, "Great form, even when seated! She must have a great exercise routine!"

"We can admire late- Ow!" Cynthia grabbed Priam by his arm and drug him onto her Pegasus, shaking the reins to direct it to the forest clearing. "Retreat! Retreat!" As Severa watched the two disappear into the woods, she was left to her own thoughts, face beet-red and burning hot.

"Great," she thought aloud, "First date and he's already seen me naked. Good job Cynthia, you're the best." Severa sighed and stood up from the stream, grabbing her clothes from the nearby branch and beginning to re-do her pigtails.

Back in the clearing, Priam and Cynthia waited patiently for Severa, the poor Pegasus Rider massaging the lumps on her head, while Priam paced, deep in thought.

"Sorry about that Priam- Ouch!" Cynthia spoke to the swordsman, "I think I might've jumped the gun on that one..."

"It's completely fine Cynthia," the warrior responded, "I'm very impressed with Severa's skill, I can tell she's a good warrior just from first glance. You have impressive comrades."

"Yeah, and how 'bout that whole giantess thing she's got going on, right? Imagine how strong you two would be together!" Priam merely shook his head at Cynthia's comment.

"Size means little for a warrior, only their skill. She's good, but I feel I could best her in combat." Cynthia let out a small snicker, ready to rebut the claim, but chose to keep quiet as she felt the ground increasingly tremor. Soon enough, Severa joined the two in the clearing, now fully robed, face still reddened. Priam gave a quick look over Severa's body, admiring the good health she was in and good posture she carried. "Sorry about earlier," he called out, "But for what it's worth, it was a good display of your skill. I also respect your boldness for the lack of armor in this war." Severa just rolled her eyes, already expecting a crazy-type.

"They don't really make armor in my size, if you didn't notice." she replied. "Even then, I prefer a nice, embroidered dress far better, but I can't complain about the sexy jungle girl look either." Severa looked to the side and started twirling one of her pigtails around, feeling nervous over her lack of dating experience. "So, uh...Are you ready for this date or what?"

"I'm unfamiliar with dating as well, don't worry." Severa stopped her actions in shock, it's almost as if the warrior read her mind.

"Hey, how did you do that?"

"Do what?"

"That whole mind-reading thing! I thought you brawny types were supposed to be total meatheads!" Priam felt humbled by the insult, thinking 'meathead' was a compliment towards his diet plan. He folded his arms and begun explaining.

"It isn't reading the mind so much as reading your actions." he spoke fluently. "By training my mind, I became able to size up a warrior by their actions, and it's easy to tell what they think or who exactly they are by how they act."

"Alright, Mr. Radiant Hero," Severa responded, squatting down towards the swordsman, "Size me up, and it better not be a joke about my height." Priam took a moment to gaze at Severa, trying to collect his thoughts.

"You seem to be strong," he begun, "You have great form and carry yourself well, and though you don't wield one now, your arms are proof enough you've practiced with a sword and bow; you definitely trained well. However, you don't seem disciplined by the manner of your speech, and you have this air of overconfidence towards yourself; as I told Cynthia, I could easily beat you in combat as you are." Severa smirked and chuckled.

"Is this guy for real?" she asked Cynthia, pointing at Priam.

"I mean, everyone does say he's a strong guy." Cynthia replied. Severa giggled and began prodding Priam with her finger.

"Aww, look at the little man!" she scoffed, "He thinks he can beat a woman ten times his size! That's just adorab-" Instantly, Priam yanked on Severa's finger and the girl found herself crashing to the floor, leaving Cynthia amazed at the sight. As Severa shook her head wondering what the hell just happened, Priam walked up near her face and begun to speak.

"As I said," he lectured, "You need discipline. But you're undeniably strong, a great asset to our team." Severa scoffed, feeling emasculated by the incident.

"Whatever, I'll take the compliment. Let's just get back to camp and get this over with." Severa got to her knees and turned towards Cynthia. "Is Morgan awake yet?"

"Yup!" she responded, "He went out to the town to buy some lamb, he should probably be back by now!"

"Alright, then let's get this over with." Severa got to her feet and picked Priam up, holding him in her hand and using the other to point to her shoulder and breasts in a rapid series. "See these? You got to earn these. Work hard enough and you might just see yourself next Duke of Rosanne."

"Titles don't interest me," Priam replied, "But if you're giving me a challenge to overcome, then I'll take it on full force!"

"Such enthusiasm!" Severa complimented, "Maybe you won't be so bad after all!" Severa kept her date steady and begun walking off back towards camp, Cynthia flying behind the two in tow.

Severa stood on the edge of camp, just where the campground met the woods, trying to balance herself on a single leg whilst hoping nobody could see her in such a ridiculous pose. Somehow, Priam managed to appeal to her warrior's instinct, and the date Severa envisioned had become a training session out of nowhere; she couldn't complain if Priam's techniques could get her back on the field, but there was still those girlish & noble instincts in the back of her mind telling her to ditch the training and try to do something fun & dignified for a Lady, like a shopping spree. Severa held boulders in her hands and kept her arms wide and rigid, as part of the exercise; Priam watched intently while pacing, like a drill sergeant, while Cynthia sat on a rock, cheering her friend on.

"Come on Sev!" she cried, "Balance the snot outta those rocks!"

"Can you shut up?!" Severa yelled in response, looking strained and exhausted from the balance exercise. "Gawds, it's hard enough trying to keep these stupid things in place, give me some peace and quiet!"

"A true warrior shrugs off all distractions," Priam spoke, "That is true balance. In fact, it reminds me of a story from my youth." Severa groaned, realizing what those words meant.

"Oh boy, story time..." she thought. Priam sat upon a stump and took a deep breath of air, gathering his thoughts and beginning his long-winded ramble.

"I was young, of the age 8, training myself atop the trees, leaping from branch to branch and balancing upon each tiny wooden structure. Along my travels, I encountered a flock of birds, of the small chirping kind, who had broke out in song at my expense. While soldiers come home to parades and instruments, hailed as heroes after a war, true warriors require no fanfare, they must block it all out and focus on the path that lies ahead of them. I trudged on and on as the birds began to circle me in a playful romp, so I looked into my inner chi, focusing my thoughts into my aura, so that I may block out..." Cynthia listened with bright eyes as Priam rambled on, but Severa couldn't stand the droning story, it dug into her ears like a drill and gave her a headache. She leaned right as she struggled to concentrate, allowing the boulder in her left hand to tumble from its perch and onto her foot.

"Ow!! Son of a-!" Severa yelped in pain and grasped her pained, swollen toes, leaping into a sitting position as she cursed and massaged her digits, dropping the other rock in tandem. Cynthia darted over to check on Severa while Priam slowly walked over, oblivious to his distraction.

"That's one of the disadvantages of your unarmored frame." he spoke, "I suppose we can take a break for now." Severa's eye twitched in response, she looked ready to lose it.

"Ohh, when I get up, I am gonna-"

"Severa! Priam! Are you guys here? I bought lunch!" Severa inwardly blessed her luck that Morgan had arrived, else she'd end up doing something she'd regret. The boy slowly joined the group, carrying a cart of lamb racks in his stead, all roasted to perfection, the heat radiating from the wood. Morgan stopped as he saw Severa upon the ground, massaging her foot, and didn't know what to make of the situation. "Uh, are you alright Severa?"

"I had an accident. An annoying accident." Severa shot a short glare at the oblivious Priam. "Anyways, it's nothing a healer's staff can't fix. Think you can help a girl out?"

"Absolutely." Morgan produced a healer's staff from his coat, a memento from his father, and waved it at Severa. In a warm ray of light, the pain disappeared from Severa's toes and the purple, swollen skin returned to its healthy peach color and usual contraction.

"Ah, much better! You're a godsend Morgan!" The boy blushed and ruffled his hair, humbled by the compliment. Severa peered over the boy's shoulder, noticing the cart of food behind him. "Is that what I think it is?"

"Yup! Fresh lamb from the town! I had them roast it as much as they could manage! I hope I didn't interrupt anything important by showing up."

"We've just reached a resting point in training," Priam responded, "And meat is an optimal step in a warrior's training. You've shown up at just the right time Morgan." Morgan looked confused by the word "training", expecting Severa to partake in a more casual date, but brushed it off as he retreated to the back of the cart. In a short span of time, Morgan set up a pair of blankets across the ground, one for him and Cynthia, one for Severa and Priam, and both groups found themselves sectioned off to each blanket; Morgan and Cynthia helped themselves to a small plate, while Severa and Priam had the rest of the cart, due to the former's stature. Severa popped each rack in her mouth like a small candy, chomping down on both meat and bone with no effort or discomfort, and watched as Priam cleaned the meat off his bone like a ravenous wolf.

"You sure seem hungry." Severa quipped, a bit amazed by the sight.

"Like I said, meat strengthens the body and soul." Priam explained while wiping his mouth. "To eat is to absorb the essence of the creature, to build its strength onto your own, and that is why you must never waste any of your food. I am gladdened that you eat so much, it's the mark of a good warrior."

"I don't really have a choice," Severa replied, "Bigger I am, more food I need to live. I try not to think about it too much." Severa looked over her shoulder at Morgan and Cynthia and watched as they ate; Morgan was feeding Cynthia small bits of meat from a fork, the two lovingly giggling at each other as the scene played out. Severa looked at them a little sadly and looked back at Priam, chowing down on his meat; she rubbed the back of her neck and struggled to speak. "Look, Priam..." she started, catching the swordsman's attention, "I don't think this is gonna work, you and me."

"Is there a problem with the training?" Priam inquired.

"No, rather the problem is the training." Severa responded. "I'm not doubting your strength or anything, but gawds you're a cold fish when it comes to dating. I expected something just nice and relaxing today, you know? Like a normal boyfriend and girlfriend do?"

"We aren't boyfriend and girlfriend though."

"Ugh, but don't you want to be or something? I mean come on, who wouldn't want a girl with this body?"

"I am not a man who's interested in such concepts of beauty or appearance." Priam replied, "I am dedicated to the way of the sword, how someone looks means nothing to me."

"Right, I figured as much. I guess we're done th-"

"However, you have agreed to become a student of mine in the path of the warrior. I've never had much students, but those I've trained in my journey I have never let down. I realize this might not be the best path for you, but I don't intend to let you down here Severa, so if there's anything you wish to change about our routine, then feel free to speak to me - remember that we are equals in this army." Severa was shocked at how such a thick-headed, narrow-minded guy could be so thoughtful to see from another angle, though she never remembered officially signing on to be Priam's "student". The Lady thought it would've been such a shame to let a handsome guy like Priam go so quickly, perhaps she should at least see how Priam reacts outside of his outlandish training routines and long-winded stories, to see if he's actually a sweetie deep down.

"Well, since you mentioned it..." Severa started, twirling a pigtail around, "Perhaps we could, I dunno, spend the rest of the day doing some normal, non-training-related things? Like normal dates go?"

"Alright," Priam responded, "What do you recommend?"

"Well, I dunno," Severa replied, "I usually like to go shopping, but obviously I can't do that without causing a scene. Gawds, being a giant is harder than I thought..."

"Perhaps star-gazing tonight? You can see the constellations the best from center of camp." Severa was taken aback a bit by the response, not expecting such a casual, non-crazy answer from Priam, but as she thought it over, it wasn't really a bad idea; stars were always pretty to see, and as Severa recalled, Morgan told her about how he first asked Cynthia to be his girlfriend during a star-gazing session - perhaps Priam wasn't such a cold fish after all.

"Hey, yeah!" Severa responded, "That's actually a good idea! Gosh Priam, I didn't expect you to have an idea like that!"

"But of course," Priam responded, "Astrology is an important concept for the warriors of the old times, it's vital to study. I was but 11 when I was thrown into the mountains on a training expedition, armed with only a blade at my side and no map to guide me. I had to find my way back to the village, but there was no way to find myself through the bewildering woodland in the deep night, it was almost like an illusory maze; using my wits and the stars above me, my only illumination, I used the images of Polaris, the North Star, to guide me back alongside the instinct my chi spoke to me with - I owe my survival to the Ursa Minor. Come to think of it, I think that was the same day I was attacked by that bear, was I 12 back then? I remember that encounter like it was yesterday: It came like a raging beast through the dense woodland, so with the energy of the woodland around me, I charged forward, and released my..."

"You know what? I'm gonna keep from flattering him until something actually happens between us..." Severa mused inwardly, hoping Priam's ramble would soon end.

1353211211211112211111122111111111121.content:
Severa's eyes flickered as Priam droned on. Was he ever going to shut up? She was starting to rethink her earlier rethinking of this guy. How could he be so smart and so stupid at the same time? How come it sometimes seemed like her understood her perfectly, and other times he was a clueless bore?

Were all men like this? Except Morgan. She sighed at the thought. Then again, even he was prone to bouts of cluelessness at times...

"-And this star reminds connects to the Ura Major. It reminds me of when-"

Severa coughed loudly enough to interrupt Priam. He seemed surprised.

"Is something wrong?"

Severa threw her arms up.

"Ugh enough anecdotes and stuff about chi!"

Priam was taken aback.

"Why are you bored? I thought you would find plenty to learn about from the many tales of my exploits. Why just a month ago there was the time I was heading back and-"

Severa stood up and glared down. Most men would be intimdated by the size difference, but Priam hardly seemed to care.

"Are you really this clueless?! Do you not know when you are boring someone to death?!"

Priam glared back.

"My men have never had a problem with my stories, they have always hung on my every word."

Severa gnashed her teeth.

"There just being polite!"

"How would you know?"

"Because we all think you're a wierdo who talks too much!"

"What do you mean we? Who else are you referring to?"

Severa's arms flailed.

"Everyone around camp!"

"Do you have any proof of this?"

Severa made a loud noise, something between a sigh and a growl.

"Why do you think people avoid or make excuses when you start another of your long rambling stories?! Ever notice it keeps happening and you keep doing it anyway?!"

Priam was silent, merely looking into Severa's eyes. Severa initially assumed she had either stunned him, or he trying to hold back his mounting anger. Had she gone too far? Was she going to alienate other Shepard with her attitude? Stupid, stupid.. she should be better at this by now

However a few seconds later she realized Priam was contemplating what she had been saying, though as usual his face betrayed little emotion.

"I see, that would explain many of my past episodes."

Severa blinked.

"Wait you're not mad?"

Priam was as calm as ever.

"You were blunt and rude, but you cut to the heart of the matter. There is nothing to be gained beating around the bush."

"Thanks, I guess..."

"I sought to impart my wisdom but it is true that I have talked enough." Priam sat back down, as though nothing had happened. "Tell me a tale of your exploits."

"Seriously?"

"Yes, I shall listen in earnest." He leaned in a little closer, appearing true to his word.

"Well uh-" Gawds! I wanted him to shut up and now the spotlight is on me! What do i talk about? That I ran from an awful future and tried to live up to my oh so perfect mom? No way! Maybe I should just tell him about something cool I did last battle. Or change the subject.
