13532112112111122111111221111111111211.content:
Severa rubbed the back of her neck, trying to think of something to talk about, feeling very uncomfortable with the situation presented to her. She didn't exactly have a lot of happy memories to share or exciting tales to tell, unless Priam was really into listening about hellfire and corpses, nor did she exactly want to share what she had, preferring to forget the despair of the doomed future. Severa glanced around, trying to find something to detract the warrior's attention.

"Well," she started, "I don't really have any stories to share, but uh..." Severa looked at the mess tent off in the distance and thought. "Should I ask him for recipes? Or will he get into a crazy story about that?"

"You don't have to tell me about your future if you so wish." Severa put her attention back onto Priam with shock; she never got used to that "mind-reading" she did, but she didn't expect he had known about where she had come from.

"I-I wasn't going to talk about that!" Severa responded, trying to keep her façade of an aloof ice queen up, but her expression shortly softened as she tried to pick his brain. "But out of curiosity, how did you know about the future? Weren't you a recent addition to the army?"

"I'm still a part of this army regardless, and Chrom, Robin, and Lucina have felt it necessary to inform me of the Outrealms to truly understand what we're up against. That, and Owain keeps begging me to take him in as a pupil." Severa rolled her eyes.

"Figures, that guy's got a story for everything."

"In any case, I'm not looking for a story of your exploits, I just want to know you better as an ally."

"'Ally', huh?" Severa put a finger to the corner of her lips, deep in thought; she hadn't really thought Priam's tales, or rather anyone else's, as just annoying show-off yapping, but maybe Priam was on to something in trying to understand his allies - his strength when paired with others was definitely something to boast over. Severa thought it over a bit before addressing Priam again. "Alright, how about this? The story of how I got so big in the first place; how's that for 'knowing me better'?"

"That would be a good start."

"Alright then." Severa relaxed herself and sat down, trying to think back to those few days ago. "It was a few days ago, I was just doing my usual training run, but then I ran into that little dork Ricken and he got me to chug one of his wacky potions."

"He forced it upon you?" Priam inquired, "I didn't think a boy that young had the strength to do something like that."

"Well, I mean, I kinda...drank it myself..."

"Then was it not your mistake?"

"Hell no! He shouldn't have left it out in the first place! Who knows what kind of crazy poison that could've been!" Severa folded her arms and looked off to the side, clearly not willing to admit her mistake. "Anyways, I drank it, grew, tore all my good clothes to shreds, and now here I am. Bam, normal life, gone just like that."

"Yet I haven't heard you complain about it."

"Well it should go without saying!" Severa replied, "I mean, I don't got any good clothes anymore, I don't have any nice cots to sleep on, and how the hell am I supposed to continue my bloodline like this?!" Severa let a small blush come to her face before continuing. "I mean, besides the me of this world actually being born..."

"And yet, you find enjoyment in your predicament." Priam responded, calm and collected, deep in thought. "I believe you said it yourself, the 'sexy jungle girl look'? Your size hasn't kept you from your desire to date as Morgan and Cynthia tell me."

"Well, yeah, I guess you're right..."

"Tell me," Priam asked, "When you grew, how did you feel?" Severa tried to think back to that moment, closing her eyes and envisioning the forest.

"I felt angry, confused, upset, and...naked, I guess..." Severa furrowed her brow, trying to think harder. "But I guess I felt...powerful."

"And you didn't complain afterwards, right?"

"No, I remember trying to throw my weight around a bit, then there was that bit with Morgan, and it was just normal after that." Severa opened her eyes, feeling like she just reached an epiphany. "Come to think of it, this new me has been nothing but good! My life's been better than ever! You know, aside from the lack of cute clothes." Severa looked down at Priam. "So I guess that's what you wanted, right? Do you 'know me better' now or what?"

"Of course." Priam rubbed the small hairs on his chin as he put forward his analysis of Severa. "You're prone to mood swings and you tend to focus on the bad in a situation; you feel as if the world's made to suit you, a real princess stereotype."

"Oh gee, beat up on mean ol' Severa, haven't heard that one a million times before."

"That having been said, I think behind all that lies a great warrior with truly good intentions. I think you need discipline, but more than that, I think you need to vent your problems if you want to truly find the better you. If you want to continue our training, then I'd be happy to listen to you." Severa shrugged, figuring that was the best she could get out of Priam.

"I dunno if I want to keep working on this 'training' stuff you're making me do," she replied, "But if you don't mind me venting my frustrations to you once in a while, I'd be happy to visit and listen to whatever crazy tales you got for me."

"I'd be fine enough with that, a good warrior is always welcome to assist his comrades." Priam responded with a small grin. "As for your 'dating', would you like to continue?"

"I can't really call tonight a 'date' since we kind of just talked and junk instead of the regular hanky-panky stuff like Morgan and Cynthia do..." Severa started before adopting a warm grin and continuing. "But I'd be okay with coming to see you again as a friend. And once Chrom lets me back on the field, I'm definitely going to seek you out as a sidekick. Who knows? Maybe something might spark!" Severa shot Priam a wink and then looked up at the moon, noticing its height in the sky. "Alright, it's getting late, but I guess we could do one more story. Want to spin me one of your epics and help me get to sleep?"

"If it's fine with you, I'd rather you tell me another one." Priam responded. "Listening to others' tales is rather enjoyable."

"Really putting me on the spot here, chief..." Severa thought it over for a bit, trying to think of something interesting to talk about, before arriving at a conclusion. "Alright, how about dreams? I had a good one the other night, or are those not realistic enough for you?"

"Dreams are fine, in some circles, warriors use their dreams to determine the future ahead of them." Severa mulled over Priam's words for a bit, finding that last bit interesting.

"'Ahead of me', huh? You might be onto something, Mr. Swordsman Psychiatrist." Severa shook off the thought and went back to her storytelling. "Alright, anyways, I had this dream the other night: I was a servant for the princess of a far-away kingdom, and we all fought together alongside her family against a large dragon; scary, but it had nothing on Grima. I was on the field supporting the princess' sister, a Manakete, as we fought these big green monsters; I drove my sword right into one of their masks, and the big stupid lug ran around like a chicken with his head cut off! There were a couple more around me, so we paired up together and rushed forward..." Priam sat and listened intently as Severa went into almost-realistic detail, the two forgetting the time passing around them as they got real into the story.

135321121121111221111112211111111112111.content:
The two were wrapped in Severa's tales that they barely noticed the sun go down, at least until the stars came up. Priam almost shook with excitement.

"Look Orion is above us! This reminds me of-"

Severa groaned.

"Not this again."

Priam looked sheepish.

"Sorry, I forgot you were not as engrossed with the stars as I."

Severa sighed.

"No problem." She looked up and smiled "Huh... they do look kinda of nice out here."

"See? And even in the dead of night, they can lead us back to camp, we just follow these ones west and-"

"I can't believe we've been out here all day. I didn't like how it started, but I guess it's been fun." Severa couldn't help but smile.

Priam leaned closer to her.

"I too have enjoyed your company, when would you like to do this again? Tommorow?"

Severa shuffled back

"Woah, don't get ahead of yourself. But I'll meet up with you for more training whenever I'm free. And I guess I'm not going to be that busy....."

Priam didn't seem bothered.

"Training would be a good use of your time."

Severa shrugged.

"I don't let me think about it or something. Let's just get back to camp." She started to get up, when Priam stopped her.

"Wait. The Shepards are likely asleep. Even your lightest tread is likely to rouse many everyone their slumber."

"Pfft, not Stahl, Grima could march into camp and he'd sleep through that. But yeah, I get your point. We sleep out here tonight. But no funny stuff, I'm not the kind of girl to give herself up on a first date!"

Priam almost chuckled.

"Very well, I would be glad to sleep under the stars with a fellow warrior."

Severa was silent for a moment before she spoke again., trying to glance at him without letting Priam see her eyes.

"...Were you thinking about.... you know.... that?""

Priam shrugged. Severa tried to keep up her ice queen act, but couldn't help but sag a little at his casual attitude.

"A warrior must consider his lineage-"

"IS THAT ALL YOU WERE CONSIDERING?!"

"And I to would not rush into such a thing. Though a part of me wondering how the deed might be done and the effect it could have on the offspring. Not to mention the possibility of-"

"Gods, do you have to make a philosophy out of everything?"

"A warrior must consider all possibilities, and prepare themselves for..."

Severa rolled on her side, facing away from him

"Good night." She said curtly.

Priam lay near her, though not close enough to be crushed if Severa were to turn in her sleep.

Severa's mind was not yet at rest., Despite the awkward end to the "date" she had enjoyed herself. She couldn't remember the last time a day had passed her by so quickly, or she had ever shared as much as she did. She did want to do this again, though she hoped Priam wouldn't push her so hard.

Maybe their were good men out there, besides Morgan. Though did they all have to be so clueless?


It took Severa longer to fall asleep than Priam, but both slept well and awoke feeling refreshed, though some of Severa's muscles still hurt. By the time she was awake, Priam had been long up, but waited by Severa, while performing his morning exercises.

"I see you have awakened. Did you sleep well?"

"Yeah, I guess I did." She got to her feet. A part of her was surprised to see him up and active, but after spending the last day with him it surprised her much less than it would have before. "Come on, let's go get some grub."

"I agree, we should return to the camp at once"

"Huh? I thought you would want to hunt or something."

"It is true that foraging is an important skill for any warrior, and one must be able to substain oneself off the land, but the Shepard's are expecting us back and have likely prepared such for us. I would not allow the work and sacrifice to go waste so-"

"Fine, I guess thats easier than scrounging up something here." She sat up and held out her palm. "Climb on."

Priam complied and Severa placed him on her shoulder before beginning the walk back.

The Shepard's were alerted by her tread, and at her size she could be seen some distance off. Most had gotten used to it by now, but her parents and Morgan had awaited anxiously for her return.

Severa entered camp and placed Priam down. Morgan and Cordelia ran to her.

"Severa!" They both called.

Morgan spoke first.

"Did your date go well?"

"I'm not certain how much Severa would classify as a date, but we were satisfied. We will be meeting again, prehaps today. It reminds of when-"

Severa made a noise.

"Yeah yeah, It was alright."

"Did you..." Morgan twiddled his fingers "You know...."

"NO! Not on a first meeting! What kind of girl do you thik I am?!"

"Well you did take me and-"

Severa urgently cut him off.

"That was different!" I barely knew Priam before today and I stopped when- Nevermind!"

Priam looked up and glared.

"You did not mention any such incident."

Severa tried to look away.

"Sheesh do I have to share everything?" The suspicious look on Priam's face intensified. "Look nothing happened ok!"

Fortunately Cordelia was ready to bail her out.

"I am glad you are well, but why were you back so late?"

Severa huffed.

"We're both adults!"

"I know but-"

"The reason we're back so late is because Priam said my steps are too loud and would wake everyone! Really."

Priam nodded. Cordelia looked a little embarrassed, but was satisfied with that answer.

"Oh I see. I just wanted to make sure you were ok, and also tell you that we are marching on. We were waiting for you to return."

Severa folded her arms across her chest.

"Ugh, great, I haven't even had breakfast yet. What happened anyway?"
135321121121111221111112211111111112111.title: A bad end does not equal a bad night.

1353211211211112211111122111111111121111.content:
It was a simple attack, but an attack nonetheless; a rowdy bunch of Risen had found their way into the nearby village, and by simple chance alone, had found themselves spotted by Chrom, Robin, and Lucina during their morning marching ritual of checking the perimeter for the start of the march. It didn't take much to lead them away from the village, just tossing a used-up tome at the chieftain's head, but the 3 managed to drag the zombies back closer to camp and away from the villagers. Though it wasn't a large army of Risen like they were used to, small groups of reinforcements came from the camp when the watchtower sounded the alarm, slowing the packing process for the march. Blue-hooded lance soldiers fought in small platoons against the weaker Risen while Chrom, Robin, and Lucina fought against what could be considered "the strongest", mere remnants of Plegian Berserkers and Sorcerers; Robin controlled the enemy march with her summoned flames while Lucina swiftly danced through the shambling masses of corpses, cutting down each Risen with each gap she cleared. The blue-haired woman peered her head above the torso of a bulky Berserker she had felled and watched as her father fought against the chieftain, a howling revenant swinging around an axe; Chrom stood his ground firmly, dodging blows with ease and landing slash after slash with Falchion.

"Father!" Lucina called out as she stabbed her blade through another Risen's chest, "Are you alright?" The Exalt wiped a small trickle of sweat from his head, clearly exhausted by the zombie's unwavering assault.

"I'm fine," Chrom responded as he blocked a blow from the axe, "Focus on your enemies!" As he said this, a Risen Assassin had made a mad dash from behind Lucina, intending to take her life with a dagger in one split second; in just one split second, the corpse was instead baptized in a searing jolt of electricity, collapsing to the ground before dissolving into a shadowy miasma. Lucina shot a glance at Robin, bobbing her head in appreciation for the save.

"Heads up Lucina, more on your left!" The tactician dashed to the princess' aid, creating a flamethrower from the pages of her tome, burning the creatures as they shambled forward and allowing Lucina to cut them down with further ease. Chrom looked at the sight for only a second, admiring how the two worked together smashingly, and in that second the Risen chieftain had slammed an elbow into Chrom's cheek, sending him stumbling backwards and leaving him open. The zombie bought its axe down on Chrom's shoulder and a loud scream had broke the air, alerting Lucina and Robin as they finished their streak. They looked in horror as Chrom clutched his wound, blood spraying from the gash, and the Risen dashed charged towards Chrom with its axe; with his sword arm incapacitated, Chrom had no way to defend himself, and the two women ran desperately to clear the distance and save their leader from death.

"Chrom!!!"

"Father!!!"

As the chieftain attempted to bring down its ghastly axe, it was punted skyward by a massive foot and screamed in agony as it left the ground; in just a few seconds, the howling stopped as it exploded into a dark dust. The 3 tried to register what just happened, too concerned with the thought of Chrom's demise, and as they returned to reality, they finally saw Severa, pumping her fist in the air at her kill.

"Hell yeah!" she cried with glee, clenching her teeth in a large grin, "How's that for a close save?! Better luck next time Grima! Try sending something a little bigger next time!" Severa's victory chant was interrupted as she felt a sensation at her heel; she looked down and saw Lucina clutching it in as big a hug as she could muster.

"Oh gods Severa," she warmly spoke, "Thank you for saving Father! If you hadn't shown up, I don't even want to begin thinking what would happen!" Severa removed her heel from Lucina's hug and spun around, leaning down as she rubbed the back of her neck in a smug sense of satisfaction.

"It was nothing Luce!" she replied, "Heck, if you should be thanking anyone, thank Mom; I'd still be looking for breakfast if it wasn't for her!" Robin walked forward, stuffing her tome into her coat and clearing her throat.

"Well Severa," she began, "I was going to lecture you for not being in camp in the morning, but that was an impressive save you just made." Severa merely groaned in response.

"You too? Look, it was Priam's idea to sleep outside of camp, not mine, and we had good reason too. Go lecture him if you want to yell at someone." Robin let out a giggle, with only a hint of smug arrogance in her laugh.

"Regardless, you saved Chrom's life, and there's no way to properly thank you for that. We're in your debt, and I'll be sure to thank your mother too."

"Severa." Chrom called between gasps of chugging a vulnerary, the healing potion already having effect on the wound. The azure-haired girl looked down at Chrom with a slight glare, still not forgetting the insult to her mother.

"What do you want? We're not exactly on speaking terms, you know."

"Fair enough," Chrom replied, "But you did save my life, and I have to give you thanks for that. So thank you, I owe you my life on this." Severa merely scoffed, not wanting to hear the Exalt's thanks.

"Save your butter-talk, your son already gives me enough of it already." Severa clicked her tongue for a moment, giving Chrom's admiration a second thought. "But now that I think about it, if you really wanted to give me thanks, you'd let me back on the field for the next couple of battles."

"Done." Chrom replied with a smile, "Your ban's lifted as of now."

"Woah, woah, woah!" Robin protested, waving her palms in the air, "Chrom, look, Severa just saved your life, I realize that requires a lot of praise, but didn't you yourself want to keep the knowledge of Severa's size from the enemy? To prevent further giant problems? Hell, just to prevent panic of seeing a giant woman from nearby villages?" Severa winced a little at the phrase 'giant problems', not exactly appreciating Robin's tone.

"I did say that," Chrom replied, "But if it wasn't for her being so big in the first place, I wouldn't be here right now. I might as well give Severa what she wants." Robin sighed a little in defeat, but quickly recovered.

"I can't argue that logic I suppose...Alright, I'll begin planning her position for the next battles."

"I'll keep watch over her Robin, Father." Lucina chimed in. "I'll make sure nobody captures Severa for as long as I can wield a blade." Severa appreciated the way she was being treated like the princess she felt she deserved to be, but couldn't help but wince at Lucina's claim.

"Now don't say that dummy," she thought, "The last thing I want is you losing your life over me."

"Well alright then, I suppose we should get back to camp and prepare to march." Robin turned towards Severa again and looked her in the eyes. "Severa, is there something you'd like to say to Chrom before we go back?"

"What?" she asked, "'Stay focused on the enemy next time'?"

"Severa, you know what. Remember? That first night you grew?" Severa folded her arms.

"Yeah, no. I'm not apologizing for Chrom making an ass of himself in front of Mom."

"Severa," Chrom chimed in, prompting the giantess to look at him, "Your mother came by yesterday to check on me, I promise you that I apologized for the way I spoke to her that night. It was a stupid thing of me to say, I admit that. If you don't want to apologize, then that's completely fine, I understand." Severa rolled her eyes at Chrom's words.

"I'm going to have to check with her you know," she replied, "To make sure you aren't full of crap." A little blush came over her face as she looked off to the side. "But...I guess I can say I'm sorry for yelling at you, even if what I said wasn't wrong."

"Thanks Severa." Chrom responded. "Now let's get back to camp, I'll fill out your paperwork for rejoining the field before we march." With a nod, the giant Lady stood back up again and begun her march back to camp, the other 3 following in turn. Robin closed the distance between her and Chrom and whispered softly into Chrom's ear.

"I really hope you know what you're doing with this..." she whispered, wary of what Grimleal and brigands could be capable of.

"I don't," Chrom responded, "But I'm going to put trust in Severa on this." Robin rolled her eyes at Chrom's far-too-trusting nature and ran forward a bit to discuss with Lucina formations and defense plans for Severa on the field.

1353211211211112211111122111111111121111.content:
A portly gentleman made his way to the front of the pack of villagers; his robes were that of a far more refined material than what the rest of the rabble wore, showing his status as a village authority figure. Clearly out of shape and out of manners, he choked out small gasps of air and smacked his lips, wiping away the sweat of panic from his head, and pointed at Severa, intent on singling out the giantess. "Exalt or no Exalt," he cried, "We villagers won't tolerate you bringing that thing anywhere near our village! She could just as easily step on any of our people on complete accident, then what will we do? Huh? She's a menace to us normal people!" The rabble of villagers seemed to rally behind the portly man's shouts of prejudice, raising their farm equipment and fists and shouting in agreement.

"Yeah, he's right!"

"That's not a girl, that's a monster!"

"What kind of woman wears something like that?! Think of the children!"

The speech frustrated Severa to no end, as well as a sizeable chunk of the other Shepherds, but mostly Virion and Cordelia found themselves furious, having their child spoke about in such an undignified manner. Virion stepped forward, ready to defend his daughter, shouting with the pride of a lion.

"That's enough!" he cried in fury, pointing his finger straight at the chunky troublemaker's chest. "I'll have you know that Severa is of the royal blood of House Virion of Rosanne! She is not only human, but of a pure and dignified bloodline, statuses you lack you vile swine! You will treat my daughter with respect or feel my wrath!"

"Oh sure!" the plump man rebutted, "Being royal makes it soooo much better! Great to know that monster's considered more human than us hard-working village folk!" The cries rallied from behind the man as he rubbed his fat cheeks, focusing on Virion's face and trying to remember his words. "Hold up, did you just say 'House Virion' before? Aren't you him? That Duke who turned tail from his country when an armored lobster started building an army? What a damned loser! Anything that came out of your loins is hardly considered 'royal'!" As the porky man chortled in self-satisfaction, Severa found her rage boiling; she could tolerate her insults, but how dare this no-name wannabe fatso try to drag her father's name through the mud - she wanted nothing more than to smash this jerk into a fine red mist. Priam and Morgan took notice of the giantess' trembling fist and reddening face.

"Why you ungrateful son of a-" Severa's rampage hadn't even begun yet when she felt Priam's armored hand touch her ankle. She looked down at the Radiant Hero, observing his eyes were closed and he looked to be in a sense of calm.

"Remember your inner chi, Severa. Let your mind wander." Taking his advice, Severa calmed herself, taking deep breaths and assessing the situation before her; her father looked like he was going to explode, and her mother was about ready to give the village rep a black eye - this wouldn't end well for the Shepherds' reputation unless someone did something, and Chrom & Robin themselves didn't look too happy about the hate speech going on before them. The Lady cleared her throat loudly, bringing all eyes to her and halting any action that might have been ready to erupt. She took a short while to gather her thoughts before she spoke, and let loose her words.

"Alright, look," she begun, "I don't give a damn what you think about me, but I really don't appreciate the tone you're taking with my Father, Chunks. As much as I'd love to throw you halfway across this country right now, that'd look pretty bad for everything the Shepherds worked for, so here's what we're gonna do." She leaned down as she got into her speech, singling out the portly gentleman, watching the rest of the villagers shuffle away from him. "We're going to march onward, right now, as we get closer to the giant Fell Dragon that's threatening your entire livelihood, and we aren't coming back here anytime soon. And as much as I'd like to curl up in my Father's nice, comfy castle and start living like the princess I deserve to be, I think I'm going to take my sweet time working toward that goal, on the off-chance that another pack of Risen come crawling near your village." Severa let a nasty smile come over her face and prodded at the fat man's belly. "I'm going to let you in on a secret: They go for the meaty ones first. Believe me, I've seen it." She got back up from her leaning position and walked off back into camp, intending to start packing away all the Shepherds' equipment; the village's last look at Severa while she walked off was of a full view of her backside and a middle finger directed at all of them.

"W-Well...I...A-Are you just going to let her talk like that?!" shouted the portly man to Chrom's face, "Isn't she part of your army?! What kind of soldier speaks like that to a village they're supposed to defend?!"

"I don't know what you're talking about." Chrom responded, "Last I checked, it's not a monster's job to be nice to an ungrateful lot of villagers, am I right?" As the portly man was taken aback by Chrom's words, Chrom turned to Virion and Cordelia to address them. "I got this one handled you two, go check on Severa. Make sure she's alright."

"Thank you, my lord." Cordelia nodded her head in respect, as did Virion, and the two ran off back into camp to go check on their daughter. The two made it to the mess tent where Severa had usually slept and were treated to the sight of their daughter beginning to take it down, easily removing the ropes and posts at her massive stature; her face looked like it was welling up with tears, and she sniffled a little as she was taking down the tent. Severa didn't notice her parents getting closer to her, and was finally startled when Cordelia spoke. "Sweetie, are you alright? Are you crying?"

"H-Heck no I'm not crying! I just got something in my eyes is all!" The Lady stopped her packing duty for a moment and sat back, allowing her legs to stretch out and her palms to rest upon the ground. "Although, now that you mention it, I'm a little steamed about that guy back there. Gawds! Where does Naga find the time to make people like that?! He didn't just stop at insulting me, noooo, he had to go and bring you guys into it! You didn't do anything wrong!" Severa's parents moved closer to comfort her as the girl hugged her knees to her face, very steamed about the incident; Virion was the first to clear his throat and speak.

"Well, to be fair, my reputation does tend to precede me, and not in a very positive light...However, my darling daughter, you mustn't worry about us, you've clearly fought enough battles in your time, so please allow us to defend you once in a while."

"But-"

"Virion's right dear." Cordelia added in, smiling warmly. "Look, just focus on yourself for now, you deserve a break from fighting, physical or not. I don't know how being that big is, but I'm sure it must not be easy, so until you work into the right rhythm, don't worry about us, we'll take care of you and ourselves. We're more than happy to help you with anything you need - just say the word." Tears welled in the young Lady's eyes as she heard her mother's words, getting flashbacks of her parents before their demise in the future; when she usually thought of their last words, she thought of it with selfish malice, but having grown older and spent more time with their past selves, Severa found Cordelia's speech to be heart-warming, and a very loving gesture. The girl plucked both of her parents from the ground and squeezed them tight to her chest, pulling them in for a hug.

"WAAAAAAAAAAH! Y-You guys are the best parents a big girl could ask for! Don't ever leave me, okay?!" As Severa sniffled in bliss, Virion and Cordelia struggled to free themselves from the bone-crushing hug, sandwiched between the flesh of Severa's arm and her breasts.

"Y-Yes! We promise! J-Just please stop crushing us!" Virion struggled to shout, feeling the air draining from his lungs quickly. Hearing this, Severa quickly set her parents down, listening to them gasp for air as they tried to regain their composure.

"Uh...Whoops. Guess I forgot my own strength..." Severa rubbed the back of her head and looked at the rest of the tents around camp present; she thought it'd be easy to rip them from their foundations and fold them up, but when it came to all the little knick-knacks the Shepherds owned, she was a lost cause. She looked down at her parents, still trying to recover, and coughed a bit as she re-spoke. "So, um, if it isn't too much to ask, can you guys help me with packing up camp? You know, 'more than happy to help' and all."

"Yes, sure thing honey..." Cordelia gasped out as she clutched her knees and tried to take in more air. "Just...Just give us...5 more minutes..."

Virion took a breath, though with his crushed lungs it was a struggle.

Virion followed suit.

"Sometimes you have to do the right thing, for it's own sake. Not everyone will understand, but even when no one else knows, you will know when your actions have saved lives."

1353211211211112211111122111111111121111.content:
Severa puffed her cheeks out in a pouty mood, it didn't exactly make her happy to hear the same old "Doing good things is a reward in itself" spiel all parents tell their kids, but it was nice enough to hear her parents were trying in the first place. "I guess you're right..." she pouted, "But it'd just be nice to hear a 'Thank You' once in a while..."

"Not to worry dear," Virion proudly stated, "For I will provide you with as much gratitude as necessary to fully neutralize the venom you may receive!"

"Not from your mouth dummy! I meant the village people!" Severa's words stung Virion and took the wind right from his sails, leaving Cordelia to only giggle at her husband's misfortune.

"Right, right, but just know that we'll still be here for you sweetie, so if you ever want to talk, just say the word." A small blush came over Severa's face at her mother's words, so she turned around and went back to working to hide her mixed feeling of joy and embarrassment.

"Hmph. Whatever." Cordelia let out a giggle and helped her husband back to their tent to prepare for the march, counter-balancing the hurt pride that weighed him down. Severa looked over her shoulder once more as she undid the final rope from the mess tent, glancing at her parents before going back to folding up the cloth structure. "What a bunch of goobers..."

----------

The march took a whole day, but the Shepherds had managed to set up camp westward. The work was far easier at Severa's size, as she was able to carry about half of the camp's supplies all by herself with such tremendous strength; setting up was a completely different story, as grounding the tent poles and arranging each Shepherd's tent around the perimeter was such a tiresome task for Severa, having to constantly lean over the whole time, not doing wonders for her back. Eventually, after 2 hours of strenuous assisted work, camp was all set up, and Severa took the time to lay down in a grassy field just a small bit outside of camp, meaning anyone could easily check on her and get her back into camp in case anyone showed up, lest the Shepherds have a repeat of their last campground.

"Ugh, I'm exhausted!" Severa complained while fiddling with her hair. "At least the boys in camp appreciate what I do for them, but really, why do we need that many tomes and swords? Meh, at least I can take the time to relax now. The grass feels pretty nice around here, and I like the peace and quiet..."

"Severaaaa!" Severa groaned at hearing Cynthia's voice, it usually was never followed by anything good, but rather headaches instead.

"And there goes the peace and quiet." Severa lifted her head up and saw Morgan and Cynthia walking toward her, the latter skipping with her usual spring in her step. The two came just short of Severa's head, and the Lady turned over on her side to speak with them more comfortably. "What do you two want? I'm trying to relax after all that setup work I just did, if you haven't noticed."

"Sorry Severa," Morgan answered, "We just thought about checking up on you after what happened at that last village. Are you feeling okay?" Severa let out a gruff scoff in response, but truly did appreciate Morgan's thought about her as a friend.

"It's fine, you don't need to worry about it. My parents do enough already to keep me in a good mood. Though, it's definitely going to impact my thoughts on saving the next town we come across."

"Now don't say that!" Morgan replied, "I know that it doesn't seem like it, but there are people who truly appreciate what the Shepherds do, and that includes you; don't let one mean old man ruin your entire perspective of people in general."

"Oooh!" Cynthia shouted with glee, jumping up and down, "I know what we should do! Let's take Severa out into the nearby town to meet some townsfolk! That way, they'll be used to having a giant hero come and save them from some monsters and Grimleal!" Severa gave Cynthia this look like she had two heads, baffled by her suggestion.

"Have you completely lost it? Is your head full of rocks? Are you actually suggesting I go into town and scare the hell out of people right after we just set up camp?"

"You don't know that for certain!" Cynthia protested. "Look, it's almost late into the night, which means the rest of camp's gonna be asleep soon; we can just go out, come back, and then the rest of camp will never know!"

"Yeah, unless we scare the hell out of the townsfolk first and lead an angry mob back into camp!" Severa massaged her temple in frustration, losing her patience on Cynthia's absurd plan. "Morgan, please talk some sense into your girlfriend, you're the smart one in this relationship."

"Actually, I think I agree with Cynthia on this; I'm all for order and everything, but I think it'd be beneficial if we try to get some townsfolk used to your stature first. Besides, it could be fun!" Severa couldn't believe what Morgan was saying, he was always one of the most brilliant members of the Shepherds, sensible and calm, and here he was suggesting one of the most harebrained schemes she had ever heard; either she was having a crazy dream, or Cynthia had rubbed off on Morgan too much.

"Morgan, are you insane?! Do you want to see pretty old me roped up and put on display in a circus like some monster from one of the stories you read?! Is this whole army going to come down with the crazy?!"

"Look Severa, I promise I'm not going to do anything to expose you in such a negative light," Morgan assured, "I promise that we'll just do a perimeter check around the town and we won't do anything to frighten the townsfolk, we'll only look for church-goers, children, and other good-natured townsfolk to prove to you there are some good people who will accept you for your size; I promise the moment you feel uncomfortable, we'll go right back home and never speak of it again."

"Come on Severa, pleaaaaseeeee~?" Cynthia looked at Severa with gooey eyes and her hands clasped together, expectation in her voice. Severa wanted to say "No" and have that be the end of it, but she just knew Cynthia would be on her case the whole time; even then, there was some nagging voice in the back of Severa's mind telling her to humor Cynthia, to prove to her that there are good people out there and get the vile thought of the entire previous town calling her a monster out of her mind once and for all. Severa looked down at Cynthia and Morgan & weighed the choice presented to her carefully.

Severa vigorously shook her head.

"Have you lost your minds? I saved the last village's hides and they still hated me!"

Morgan and Cynthia were undettered.

"Not every village or town is like that. We'll find the good people and we'll show you!"

"Even if this could work, and I'm not saying it could, who the heck is going to be around at this time? Some old drunks?!"

Cynthia and Morgan looked at each other, both hoping the other had a good answer. Neither of them could find it

"What? I told you, I'm not doing it!"

Morgan took a deep breath and suddenly looked more serious, as though he had suddenly gotten older.

"Severa, I get it, you're afraid of being rejected again."

Severa's eyes widened for a second. She immediately shouted back.

"I'm not afraid!"

Cynthia stepped towards her.

"Really? Cause you seemed-"

"SHUT UP!"

The volume of Severa's voice momentarily startled the two, and even managed to knock Cynthia's hair out of place. When they recovered, Cynthia was distressed, but Morgan's eyes narrowed. Severa hadn't seen this too often but he was actually angry!

"Severa! We only want to help you! There's no need to yell at me, and espeically not Cynthia."

Severa looked down at the ground, away from them.

"Sorry... I know you're only trying to help, but what makes you think this will turn out any better than last time?"

Cynthia immediately recovered her peppy attitude.

"Because this time we'll find better people!"

Her arms swung through the air as she came back to life. Severa merely rolled her eyes again.

"Pfft."

Morgan looked serious again.

"Severa. don't you trust us? Don't you trust my judgement?"

Severa paused for a second, first looking at Morgan, then at the sky behind them.

"...Most of the time. But you've been wrong before. And..." She clenched fists and gritted her teeth, as though in pain. "I don't want to go through that again..."

Morgan walked towards her.

"We can't make you come."

Cynthia jumped in.

"Well yeah your super hu-" The look Morgan and Severa gave told her that maybe she should hold back for just a second.

Morgan continued on.

"-And even if we could, we wouldn't. But if you don't do this, you'll keep wondering if they would have accepted you and you'll keep worrying about the same thing every time we pass any kind of settlement."

Severa folded her arms. She glanced at Morgan before continuing her till stare into the distance.

"Hmmm..." Her expression softened

Cynthia skipped next to Morgan. Now was her time!

"Yeah you gotta put yourself out there or you'll never know who you could have been friends with."

Severa pursed her lips.

"Easy for you to say." Severa muttered under her breath, louder than she intended.

Both Cynthia and Morgan were surprised, though Cynthia more so.

"Huh? What do you mean?"

"Never mind." Severa turned her head away.

Morgan decided not to dwell on that out burst. He held out his hand to the giant.

"So will you join us?"

Severa glanced at him peripherally, but did not meet his shake. Cynthia vigorously extended her own palm.

"There's no way daddy will suspend you again after you saved his life! And even if he did, I can talk him out of it, because I'm his Pega Pony Princess!"

Severa rolled her eyes. Only Cynthia could say something that stupid with a straight face. They still kept there hands out. They were nothing if not optimistic

But Morgan did raise a compelling point, if she refused his invitation, would she not be running and hiding herself away from people? How would she find someone who might like her if she did not put herself out there?

After almost a minute of further hesitation, Severa came to a decision.

"Fine." Severa said grudgingly, meeting Morgan and Cynthia's outstretched palms with her pinkie fingers.

"Let's do this thing... I guess."

"Yes!" Morgan and Cynthia pumped a fist into the air before Cynthia ran towards the stables.

"I'll get my pegasus!"

Severa sighed.

"Try not to wake anyone up, I don't want to be busted before we even foot near this place."

Cynthia stopped running, her sprint changing to a slow, careful walk.

"Opp sorry."

Morgan and Severa waited, as Cynthia carefully led her steed back, only taking to the skies when she outside of camp.

She flew down to Morgan, tapping the back of her pegasus.

"Hop on."

Morgan did so, then turned to Severa.

"Wait here, we'll be back when we find some good people."

Severa sighed once more.

"Thanks..."

She wasn't sure what was going to happen, she felt nervous yet a part of her was curious and eager.

1353211211211112211111122111111111121111.content:
Morgan and Cynthia touched down outside of the town, leaving Cynthia's Pegasus to graze in a field, also as a marker for Severa to find them in case they were gone too long. The couple walked into town, going through the alleyways, until they found themselves in the main plaza of town. As they looked around for someone, or rather a candlelight to a tavern, store, home, or structure of the like, the two began to notice an eerie silence around them, combining with the darkness to make an unsettling scene.

"Now this is odd..." Morgan mused, placing his fingers to his chin. Morgan peered around, looking for any sign of life, feeling a slight sense of dread in the back of his mind the more he gazed off into the darkness "Cynthia, maybe this wasn't as good a plan as we thought, Severa might be right, but not for the right reason. Should we just..." Morgan trailed off as he looked at his girlfriend sniffing the air, like a puppy looking for food. "Uh, Cynthia? What are you doing?"

"Father taught me how to pick up scents of other animals, he learned it from a pack of wolves growing up! We'll find someone in no time like this!" Morgan rubbed the back of his head as Cynthia continued sniffing, she really was like a puppy.

"Um, Cynthia? I don't doubt Mr. Henry, but he's a little, um, eccentric. I don't know if we're going to find anyone like-"

"Found someone! This way, come on!" Cynthia started walking off towards the scent's source, Morgan following closely behind her. After a couple twists and turns, the two found a church, causing a light smile to come upon Morgan's face.

"Ah, men of the clergy! If they're anything like Father, they should be understanding of Severa's condition!" Cynthia gave the air a final whiff, and her light smile turned to a confused grimace. She gave the air a couple more whiffs, prompting Morgan to look at her. "What's wrong Cynthia?"

"Something's wrong Morgan. I smell-"

"Greetings, young ones!" The two were interrupted by the words of a priest, they watched as he had come closer to them, and Morgan bowed in glee.

"Hello minister, praise be to Naga!" answered the young boy in excitement.

"Yes, yes." the minister answered, a tad unenthusiastic. "You two must be exhausted to have come out here in the middle of the night, please, come inside and rest." Morgan followed behind the priest without pause, but Cynthia seemed reluctant to go, ducking behind Morgan and holding his shoulders tight as she followed him. "Your woman friend seems to be afraid of something. That hair, that complexion, she is Plegian, correct?"

"Only half-Plegian, and I assure you father, her faith in Naga is as unshaken as my own. She's my partner in the Shepherds."

"The Shepherds? The squadron of knights from Ylisse? Most interesting." The three had found themselves inside the church, it was well-lit and spacious, the floor, pews, and pedestal seemed to be well-cleaned, the sight pleased Morgan immensely to see the church in good condition. "Now then, what brings you two out to this town in the middle of the night?" Cynthia seemed reluctant to talk, so Morgan immediately picked up for her.

"Well father, we've come looking for some people for our friend. She's come down with a condition, and she needs some support from another person to keep her morale up. The last encounter with a town left her in a bad mood, and we just want to help her smile again."

"Now, now, child, I'm sure some sickness wouldn't cause a town to shun her, people are good-natured by, well, nature after all."

"Well, it's not exactly a 'sickness'..." Morgan ruffled the back of his head and took a deep breath. "You see father, our friend is a, well, a giant." The priest let out a little chuckle.

"Aren't you children a little too young to be drinking? Giants don't exist."

"Please father, you have to believe us. We can't really explain it either, but she had drank a potion that made her like this. We ask only that you and any of this other town's people could treat her nicely to put any fears in her mind to rest. And please, refrain from using the word 'monster' around her." The priest put a hand to his chin and pondered the thought before giving his answer.

"Alright, I understand child. Please, allow me to explain the situation to the other townspeople. I'll just be a moment." The priest left the church, leaving Morgan and Cynthia alone in the building by themselves. Cynthia let out a tiny sniff and whispered to Morgan, afraid people would be listening to her.

"Morgan, I don't know about this, something isn't right. We shouldn't have told that priest anything." The smile Morgan had left his face and he adopted a serious expression as he looked at Cynthia.

"Yeah, I felt it too. I had to make it seem like things were normal, I'm sorry." Morgan looked around the church, and the cleanliness of the building began to unsettle him. "You looked so worried before, did you smell something horrible?"

"Yes, at first I smelled a person, then I smelled people, but more than anything, I smelled the stench of blood, and it was strong." Cynthia gave another light sniff. "In fact, there's blood around us right now."

"Alright, lets investigate." Cynthia began sniffing like a dog and Morgan followed as they tried to find the stench of blood's source. They looked around for a bit, before stopping at a door in the back wall of the church; from what Libra told him, Morgan knew this was to the storeroom. Morgan set his hand on the handle and turned to Cynthia; the two nodded at each other before turning back to the door. "Alright: 1...2...3!"

When the door was opened, Cynthia stuck her hands to her mouth and Morgan looked ready to vomit; the two were appalled by the sight in front of them. It was a small mound of corpses, faces all frozen in fear, and from the look of their clothes, they seemed to be the residents of the town; drawn on the wall in blood was the symbol of the Fell Dragon, a mark Morgan was too familiar with, branded on the back of his Mother's hand and strewn across the future he and his friends came from. The sight was sickening, and Cynthia in particular looked ready to cry, taking note that the smell of blood was fresh; this implied to her that she and Morgan could have saved them, had they only been minutes earlier, had they only elected to bring Severa with them.

"M-Morgan, this is...!" Morgan buried Cynthia's face into his coat and began stroking her hair, trying to calm her down.

"I know Cynthia, I know, but we can't do anything now. We have to get out of here and report back to Mother and Chrom, right now." Morgan clutched Cynthia's arm tight and began leading her out of the church, opening the door slowly and peering around for that priest or anyone else, now knowing they were purely Grimleal and nothing else. The two began to quietly run back the way they came, hoping to reach the alleyways and fly back on Cynthia's Pegasus; as they ran, Cynthia sniffed the air and smelled someone's presence - she looked in the direction of the scent, at an adjacent alleyway, and saw a glimmer of light shine in her eyes.

"Morgan, look out!" Cynthia pushed her boyfriend forward into safety, and as he was pushed into a safe zone, Cynthia instead took the arrow meant for him, hitting her square in the chest. She cried out in pain and fell backwards, blood began to slowly drain from the wound and Cynthia's breathing became more intense; Morgan looked behind him and the color drained from his face.

"Cynthia, no!" Morgan immediately went to Cynthia's aid and tried putting pressure on the wound to stop the bleeding, panicking frantically in response to the surprise attack. He drew a small thunder tome from his coat with a free hand and begun looking around in a panic for the attacker; as if on command, a Plegian assassin came out brandishing a bow with a wicked smile upon his face, followed by three other swordsmen and the "priest" from before.

"Well, well boys, look what we got here: a couple of Ylissean dogs who're try to disrupt Master Grima's advent upon this world. How about we put 'em out to pasture, huh?" Morgan glared at the priest with malice, he couldn't defend himself and keep Cynthia alive at the same time, so he tried to delay the attack with words, something that could let out his anger too.

"You! How dare you! You hurt my girlfriend, murdered the townspeople, and sullied Naga's name with your imitation! You Grimleal are the worst!"

"Aw, whoops, did we hit your little lover with that arrow? Don't worry, you'll be joining her in the afterlife soon enough." The false minister raised his hand, signaling his assassin friend to ready his bow. "Gotta hand it to you kid, you did a good job trying to make that 'giant woman' nonsense sound real, we could use writers like you back in Plegia. I tell you what, I'd love to run my hands across her legs, those things must run for miles!" Morgan grit his teeth and spat out his response.

"Everything I said was the truth, charlatan, and if you strike us down, Cynthia and I will at least look down from Heaven knowing you incurred her wrath!"

"Yeah yeah, whatever you say kid. When you see that old lady Emmeryn up there, be sure to tell her that her message of peace had no place in Master Grima's world." Morgan had no idea what to do, if he tried to defend himself, Cynthia would surely be killed, but if he threw himself atop her, she could probably still be safe until help arrived, provided help arrived, at the cost of his own life; though irrational, he much preferred the second option, because at least he could die knowing he tried to protect the love of his life. Dropping the tome, Morgan threw himself over Cynthia's wound, putting pressure on it to stop the bleeding, and closed his eyes as he waited for death to come.

Two Pegasi flew through the night sky, each mounted by two riders.

“I’m still not sure this is necessary.” Cordelia said.

Riding behind Sumia, Henry raised his arms into the air.

“Nyhheh I always liked the night sky!”!

“This is not a field trip!” Robin scolded, before taking a deep breath. “It’s the dead of night and all children our missing again. Its clear that Severa has either kidnapped my boy again or dragged them both into town and is likely causing a wave of hysteria.”

Cordelia frowned.

“She wouldn’t do that again , would she?”

Henry sniffed the air.

“I can't smell Severa but I can smell... death!”

“Death?!" Robin grunted. "This better not be one of your jokes?”

Sumia frowned.

“I think he means the risen!”

“By Naga I hope not!”

Cordelia drew closer to the town, having to fly down lower than she normally would to see it at this time of night. She looked back to Robin

“I don’t see any sign of Severa, and if she were here, we would have seen her immediately.”
Robin wasn’t satisfied, and checked around herself. Something was wrong, she could feel it.
Suddenly a flash of magical lighting filled the air.

“There!” Robin pointed to the light. “That’s the flash of a thunder tone! It could be Morgan!”

Coredlia steered her pegasus in it’s direction, diving down to get there fast. As she did, she heard the thunk of an arrow. The pegasus wretched in pain and start heading for the ground. Cordelia tried to ease it's landing.

“My pegasus has been hit!”

“Get us down, I’ll handle this!” Robin said. She chanted something, then launched a large ball of fire in the direction of the arrow.

Cordelia stroked the neck of her pegasus, trying to calm it down as she prepared to land for landing,

An arrow flew at Sumia’s Pegasus, but forewarned from the attack on Cordelia, she was able to swerve and dodge it. Henry gleefully reached for his tome and chant something. Dark light struck the assassin and he writhed in pain.

The priest looked annoyed, but then he smiled, like a predator going in for the kill.

“Someone clearly cares for you. No matter this just gives more bodies for our horde, and these look to possess quite the amount of quintessence.”

Morgan gaped up in delight as he struggled to stall the advancing Risen.

“Mom!”

Cordelia landed next for them, with Sumia right behind her.

“What are you doing out so late?” Robin scolded, before remembering where she was. “Never mind,
we have to fight our way out.”

Sumia caught sight of her injured daughter.

“Cynthia!” She quickened her descent.

Henry snarled, suddenly looking serious.

“Oh we're going to make you pay for this!”
Sumia landed as quickly as she could, and brandishing a stave as she approached her daughter, while. Cordelia took her mend stave and worked on her pegasus's wounds.

Cynthia's eyes flickered open.

“Mom? Dad?”

Cordelia whirled round to her.

“Where's Severa?”

“We told her to wait outside town, we had no idea there were risen!”

Morgan,Robin and Henry were flinging spells at the advancing horde, but they kept coming! Morgan began losing his cool.

“There’s too many to fight with just us, what do we do?”

Robin looked behind her, scanning the battlefield for any possible exit. Unfortunately there didn’t seem to be any, only Risen marching from all sides. She bit her lip

“Keep fighting and see if we can cut a path out.”

Morgan's eyes grew wide.

“Can we really fight a whole town of Risen?”

“I-I don’t know, but we’ve survived worse than this!” Robin checked the battlefield again. “The one
dressed as priest is directing them, we need to take him out! They have archers, so falcon knights
stay on the ground and heal, we'll take point!”

Unfortunately, he was protected by several swordmasters and the assassin.

They did there best to fight through, but soon found themselves surrounded by risen going in for the kill. They weren’t sure how much longer they could hold out, but could suddenly feel enormous steps drawing closer and closer to them.

1353211211211112211111122111111111121111.content:
“Severa!” Cordelia yelled out.

They looked to the horizon to see Severa running towards the frey.

The priests eyes widened in excitement.
“So your far fetched story was not so far fetched after all! She will make an exquisite Risen! Archer and mages, focus your fire on the giant!”

Severa staggered back as the volley hit here, crying out in pain, staggering back and almost falling over. She couldn't handle another assault like that, but what was she supposed to do? Her first instinct was to charge forward, regardless of the pain she felt but she stopped. The area was too small to allow her to move around much, and its was true her unarmored body left her exposed.

What was it Priam said? Something a warrior and their weapon? Making the best use of her body?
How was she supposed to do that now?

The mages and archers readied themselves for another volley. Close range units she could handle but at range she felt helpless. She quickly searched for something that might help. Priam was right, she did need a weapon and armor. That was it!

Moving with extraordinary speed, she lifted up a nearby house, using it to and careful movements to block the incoming strikes. Another barrage came and she did the same, changing her stance and guiding her “shield” into the path of the attacks.

The “priest” scowled but sneered at her.

“You can’t keep doing that forever!”

Severa grimaced but tried to appear confident. At least there was a little more room to dodge, but he was right.

The archers and mages readied themselves for another volley…. Only to be interrupted as Robin and
Henry cut their way through.

“NO!” The priest howled

Now was her chance, as the mages and archers tried to engage the new attackers, Severa closed in and stomped them down, eagerly tramping the risen under her. The risen that had been left behind came after them, but now Severa was gleeful, confident in her close range prowess.

“Leave this to me!”

“Wait, you need healing!” Cordelia raised a stave and Sumia followed her lead.

“Thanks I guess.” Severa brushed Herself off. “Now its time to end this!”

Severa charged forward and trampled down the remain risen, waiting only till she had crushed the last one before pausing to catch her breath.

“Whose the best Risen crusher EVER?”

Robin glared up at her, as though the size difference between them was nothing.

“You dragged my son into danger and have the nerve to start boasting?”

Severa glared back.

“I saved your behinds! Your welcome by the way!”

“We were only in danger because you dragged them into town!”
Morgan fidgeted with is neck, for a second daring not to speak. Somehow more afraid to face his mother’s wrath than the Risen. But he soon found his courage.

“Stop! Mom it was me! It was all my idea to go into town! I even had to talk Severa into going!”

Robin whirled around.

“Don’t lie for her!”

Cynthia moved forward.

“He’s not! I even helped talk her into it!”

“Why would you-“

Morgan seemed on the verge of tears.

“I wanted to show Severa their were good people out there, people who could appreciate and see her as something other than a monster. I didn’t think the first village we picked would be filled with risen… I didn’t mean to put everyone in danger.”

Cynthia handed him a handkerchief. Severa twitched uncomfortably, not enjoying Morgan being so upset on her behalf

“Dry your eyes kid, I appreciate the effort.”

Now that the battle was over, Severa looked at the group.

“Where the hell is dad?”

Cordelia frowned.

“Our pegasi can only carry two people at a time.”

Morgan looked to Robin.

“And my dad…”

Robin hesitated to look for a second.

“He thought I was overreacting! But look!”

Cordelia turned to her.

“You’re being unfair to Severa, this wasn’t her fault.”

Robin stopped.

“Wait, how did she know we were here?”

“I was told to wait outside town, I saw your pegasuses-”

“That's pegasi-” Morgan tried to stop himself realizing that wouldn't help.

Severa ignored him.

“Whatever. Your PEGASI flying into town. How many other people are going to be riding them at this time of night? And mom knows how to ride a pegasus, she isn't going to dive like that unless she's been hit. So I ran in and saved your hides. You're welcome by the way.”

Robin hung her her.

“I see. I’m sorry Severa. Though we told you not to approach villages, especially at night!” She also looked at Morgan and Cynthia as she said this.

Severa placed her hands on her hips.

“Hey, you can’t blame me for this.”

“This time I agree with you.” Robin focused all her attention on Morgan. “What do you have to say for yourself? We have curfews for a reason you know! Risen prowl around at night!”

Morgan choked back the tears, barely able to get a word out.

“I-I.”

Cordelia placed a hand on her shoulder.

“Robin wait, they shouldn’t have been out this time, but they did this for my daughter, they just wanted to find someone who would accept her.”

Sumia stood next to her.

“I know my Cynthia, she always means well. Whatever her involvement, she was just trying to help.”

This only made Robin angrier.

“Why are you taking his side?!”

“They couldn’t possibly have known there would be so many Risen here.”

“And we made sure those Risen will never bother anyone ever again!”

Severa coughed.

“You mean I did.”

Robin glared back

“We saved you as much as you saved us!”

“Pfft.. I’d loveee to have seen you take on all those Risen without me!”

Morgan tried to get between.

“No fighting please! If either of you hadn’t showed up we’d both have been-“

Robin looked at pavement.

“You’re right, your appearance did give us a chance to regroup and heal.”

Severa looked away.

“And I guess I’m glad someone drew fire away from me.”

Cynthia raised a hand.

“So does this mean we’re off the hook?”

They were met with cold silence from all three mothers. Sumia was the first to break the silence.

“I know you meant well, but you still shouldn’t have been sneaking around.”

Cordelia was next.

“I respect what you were trying to do for Severa, but you should have gone to Chrom, he would have
understood.”

“Since you meant well, I’ll go easy on you this time. You’re grounded for a day and have cooking duty tomorrow.”

Robin hung his head.

“Yes mom.”

Sumia nodded.

“That seems fair. You to, Cynthia.”

“But I was only trying to help!”

“I know, but next time ask.”

Cynthia bit her lip but said nothing.

Severa folded her arms and sulked.

“So that’s it then? I just stay the hell away from any other humans? Cause there just going to think I’m a monster or actually be monsters and try and kill us?”

Coredlia would have placed an arm around Severa if she could. Instead she leaned against her leg.

“Severa, Morgan and Cynthia were just unlucky. There are good people out there.”

“Pfft that’s what Morgan said before and look how everything’s turned out!”

“Severa, I promise you, we will find somewhere that will accept you.”

“Everywhere is just going to be the same.”

Morgan spoke up.

“You still have us.”

Severa looked around grimacing to herself.

“I guess....”

As the excitement was dying down, the group heard the shatter of a flowerpot from an alleyway, breaking the melancholy silence in the air. The adult ladies readied their weapons, cautious in case of another Grimleal attack, but Henry instead threw his arms up, motioning the group to hold it, as he sauntered over to the alley with his usual unsettling cheer.

"Ladies, ladies, I got this! No need to get feisty!" he called out with his usual childish smarm. "When you learn how to use your sniffer like me, then you can easily tell the enemy from some scared folks, and oh man! It sure smells like someone needs a wardrobe change! Nya ha!" Henry stopped at a pile of garbage and ruffled around it for a while, whistling a cheerful, yet creepy tune as he worked; in just a mere manner of seconds, he found a small child hidden away in the trash, shuddering in fear. "Hey guys! There's a kid here! What should we do with her?" Upon hearing this and taking a look at Henry's robes, the little girl shuddered even further and begun screaming.

"G-Grimleal!!! Go away! Leave our town alone! P-Please don't kill us!" Henry looked with a little confusion, looking at his robes before snapping his fingers.

"You know what? I just knew I was forgetting something when I joined the Shepherds! I gotta retire this old Plegian stuff and pick up something more bubbly and Ylisse-like!" Sumia tumbled on over in an attempt to control the situation, realizing just how scary her husband could be sometimes.

"Um, dear?" she asked, "Could you just go over there for a bit? I think Cynthia would appreciate your attention." Henry flashed a thumbs-up and skipped away back with the party, allowing Sumia to have some alone time with the girl. The Pegasus rider put a hand to her cheek, trying to control the little girl's tears and fears. "Shhhh, shh, shh. Nothing's going to hurt you dear, the Grimleal are all gone now. We're part of the Ylissean knights; my name is Sumia, what's yours?"

"S-Sally..." the little girl choked out in fear.

"Sally, I get that it's a bit scary with all those nasty criminals and Risen about, but I assure you, they're all gone. Could you take my hand and meet my friends with me?" With some reluctance, the young girl extended her arm towards Sumia's, and the Pegasus rider helped the girl to her feet, beginning to lead her out into the open and into safety. The first thing Sally noticed was the massive frame of Severa's legs towering above the rest of the party; at first, she yelped and whimpered in fear, but as her eyes travelled up the monoliths, she saw Severa staring down at her, hands at her hips, and instantly took note of how pretty the giantess looked, calming her a little. Severa was less than impressed by this reaction, and let out a huff as she turned her head to the side.

"Oh boy, another knee-jerk reaction. Didn't see that one coming from a mile away." Cordelia shot Severa a glance, unsure of whether to scold or comfort her child, before shaking off the thought and stepping forward and kneeling down, getting on eye-level with the young girl.

"Hello there, Sally!" she begun, trying to lighten the mood, "My name's Cordelia, I see you've already met my best friend Sumia; the both of us are Pegasus Knights in the Shepherds of Ylisse, and we're out looking to keep innocent people like you safe from the nasty monsters and brigands. Tell me, have you ever seen a Pegasus before?" Sally shook her head no, clutching the shoulders of her clothes tightly; Cordelia just rubbed the little girl's head, ruffling her hair up. "Then I guess we'll just have to show you what one looks like, huh? These are the rest of our friends, Henry, Robin, Cynthia, Morgan, and the big girl in the back is Severa; you might not believe it, but she's actually the princess of a kingdom in Valm, despite the strange choice in attire!"

"Mom!" Severa yelped with a blushing face, embarrassed by Cordelia's antics. Cordelia giggled as Sally looked confused at the "Mom" response. At this time, Robin came over and got down to eye level with the girl, trying to get more information on the situation in a gentle and approachable way.

"Sally, do you have a home around here?" The girl shook her head yes in response. "Great, how about a family?" Again, a yes response. "Alright, and do you happen to know where they are right now?" Sally looked down and rotated her leg around the ground a bit, unsure of how to answer.

"W-Well, I don't know where they are, mom and dad. Th-They usually go to the church for town meetings, th-they might be there..." Hearing "church" Morgan waved his mother over and beckoned her ear to his mouth. Having the town's fate whispered to her upset Robin deeply, and she could see Sally didn't look any happier that she wasn't getting a straight answer. Taking a deep breath, Robin walked back over to the little girl and got down to her level again, trying to mask the upsetting news as best she could.

"We're going to send a squad to investigate first thing tomorrow morning, is that okay?" The girl reluctantly shook her head yes, a little upset that she didn't receive her family's fate straight-up, and Robin stroked her cheek in return. "Alright, that's good. For now, I don't think this town is the safest place for you to be right now, so I want you to come back to camp with us. We have fresh food, fresh water, and there's extra room in my tent for you to sleep in; is that alright with you?" Sally clutched her body tighter and looked highly resistant to going.

"B-But what if there's more Grimleal and monsters?! I-I don't want to go! No! P-Please don't make me!" Cordelia gently put her arms on the girl to try and get her to stop shaking.

"Hey, hey! Calm down! I promise you, nothing bad is going to happen to you as long as we're around, okay?" Cordelia turned around and pointed to her daughter, her face turned sideways towards the night sky, looking at the moon. "Do you see Severa up there? She's the one that squashed the Grimleal around here, quite literally I might add. As long as she's standing, she'll be able to keep you safe, and it's going to take a whole lot of rope to bring her down, even to a knee." Severa glanced down at the two for just a moment, still trying to feign disinterest, and saw the little girl worriedly coming closer to her.

"Well, spit it out." she spoke up, "I'm in the middle of stargazing." Cordelia was a little annoyed Severa was acting so cold, but Sally looked undeterred.

"M-Miss Severa?" she asked, "I-Is that true?"

"...I mean yeah, I might have stepped on, like, one or two of those Plegian jerks."

"A-And you'll keep us safe? Y-You're that strong?"

"Strongest darn girl in camp!" Severa replied, some bluster in her voice. "That's not a problem, is it?"

"Oh no, no, no!" Sally replied, waving her hands back and forth, "I-It's just that, um, the princesses in my storybooks aren't all that strong, a-and you look just as pretty as them, so..."

"R-Really? You think I'm pretty?" Severa rubbed the back of her neck with a slight blush, then shook off the thought and kneeled down towards her little fan. "Well, most storybook princesses aren't 50 feet tall either. I mean, we got two of those types back in camp already, so you could always talk with them, but if you stick with me kid, I could show you how a real royal parties!" Cordelia shook her hands back and forth, imagining a repeat of Severa's sexy dance show from day 1 of being a giant, while Sally just blushed and let out a small cheer.

"W-Wow! Three real princesses! O-Okay, I'll go back to your camp, but can Miss Severa show me around?"

"Of course, I'm sure she'd be happy to!" replied an enthusiastic Morgan. He twirled around and looked up at his friend, staring her in the eyes. "See Severa? I just knew you'd find a friend around here! No need to give up hope just yet!" Severa let a small smile come to her face and the two friends went on smiling at each other for a short moment. This moment was soon interrupted by Robin tugging at Morgan's ear.

"What are you so happy about, Little Mister? You're still in trouble for organizing this little operation in the first place! You almost got your girlfriend killed!" Robin begun dragging Morgan off and beckoned for Cynthia to follow her. "Cynthia, sweetie, where did you put your Pegasus? I'll fly it back home for you while you recover."

"Um, sure thing Mrs. R! It's uh...I think I put it this way..." The three wandered off in the alleys as Morgan shouted.

"H-Hey! Mom! Ow! That's my earlobe! Please lighten your grip for just one second! Ouch!" Once out of sight, Henry and Sumia got on their shared Pegasus and Cordelia began to saddle up on hers.

"Severa, dear," Cordelia called out, "I need to make space for Cynthia to rest, could you carry Sally back to camp for us?"

"Sure thing." Severa gently put her hand down and let the little girl climb on. As she got up, she watched the little girl tumble and try to keep her balance, and Severa instantly began to rethink the mode of transport. "Yeah, maybe my hand isn't the best idea. You wouldn't mind the Bra Express, would you?"

"Severa!" Cordelia cried at the lewd suggestion.

"N-No! It's alright Miss Cordelia! I-It looks safer and warmer in there anyways." Severa stuck her tounge out at her mother and tugged open the front of her makeshift bra.

"Alright, down you go, little lady!" Severa tilted her hand and let Sally tumble into her cleavage, before removing her finger from the hem of her bra and fondling her breasts to make sure it was comfy. The two girls smiled at each other while Cordelia put a hand to her face, feeling a small headache coming on.

"Good grief..." With that, the group departed from town and back to camp.

As Severa headed back the little girl still starred up at her starry eyed.

“So you really squished those bad men and Risen?”

Severa smiled involuntary as she thought about the battle.

“Yeah I stomped them flat.” She stomped her foot for effect, impressing her new fan rather than scaring her. “The others helped to, I guess.”

“Wooow. So how did you get so big and strong?”

“Uhhh... “ Severa stopped herself, not wanting to tell her what she really did. She took a few seconds to come up with a semi convincing lie. “Eat your greens and I'm sure you'll grow big and strong.”

“Like you?”

“Pfft, I doubt you'll grow this big, kid, and there's no way you'd want to.”

Sally stared back blankly, before her eyes filled with conviction.

“Huh why not? If I were as big as you, I could squash the bad men and find my parents!”

Severa winced.

“Their-.... Never mind. And you don't want to be this big because everyone would think your a monster like me.”

Sally's eyes widened.

“Huh?! Who could ever think you're a monster? You saved used from the monsters!”

Severa rolled her eyes.

“Yeah you see a saviour, and everyone else just sees a giant freak.”

“Who?! I don't think you're a freak.”

“Well that makes one of you.”

Sally blinked, not able to imagine how anyone could dislike a giant saviour.

“Those people with you didn't think you were a freak.”

Severa sighed.

“Yeah, but they already knew me.”

“Who could ever think you're a freak?”

“The last village we-" Severa cut herself off, shaking her head. "Why am I telling you this? Just enjoy the ride, kid!” She tried to look away, while still preiphally looking at the path in front of her.

Sally still didn't understand.

“But if you saved them why would they not like you?”

“I don't know!" Severa flailed her arms in frustration. "Some people are just jerks...”

Sally stood up, despite her unstable position. She stretched out her slightly to improve her balance.

“There just mean people! I know there are people out there who think your pretty and amazing.”

Severa made a noise.

“So far it's just you. And sit down”

“Mommy and Daddy will see it to!”

Severa bit her lip and looked away, trying to hide her pained expression.

“Whatever... people keep telling me that but your the first one I've met.”

Rather than being detttered, Sally was even more fired her up, pumping her her up.

“I know we'll find more! How many villages have you been to?”

“2... so far.”

“See! There could be way more out there who like you!”

"I doubt that... enough about me, lets just enjoy the scenery...."

Meanwhile, flying on their pegasi, the others arrived back at camp before Severa. Their absence had been noticed and Chrom was there waiting for them, a hand on his hip.

“Where did you go?! You know Risen roam at night..”

Robin sighed as she dismounted.

“Retrieving our wayward children.” She pulled at Morgan's ears.

Chrom glared at him.

“What is the meaning of this?”

Morgan tried to loosen himself from his mother's grip. “Ow Ow! Not so rough Mom!” He faced Chrom and lowered his head. “It was all my fault, after that last village Severa felt alone and I wanted to show her there were still good people out there.”

Cynthia ran to Morgan.

“But I wanted to help to.”

Chrome's firm gaze was focused on the pair.

“And where is Severa?”

Robin answered.

“She's heading back on foot carrying the last survivor.”

Chrom's eyes widened.

“Surviour? Was the village under attack?”

“It had been taken over by a Grimleaf cult, the head priest had raised a horde of Risen."

Morgan prostrated himself before Chrom.

“I'm sorry! I dind't know, I couldn't have known!”

Chrom relaxed and motioned for him to get him.

“I believe you. You shouldn't have wondered so far from camp but you were only trying help.”

Cordelia stepped forward.

“Chrom, if I may, Morgan acted hastily but his plan was not without merit. Ever since Severa became a giant, Severa has felt like an outcast. If it would not be too much to ask, could we not scout around for a village that might accept my daughter?”

Chrom looked thoughtful but uncertain.

“Hmm.. I don't know.. it's hard to tell how anyone would react to her. Even that village we saved turned her aside."

"Like Morgan, I believe there are good people out there would accept Severa, and if we found these people, it would be good for moral."

Robin turned her.

"How would we find such a village? Almost everyone would panic at the sight of a giant."

Cordelia held her hands together..

"I don't believe that is the case. Many but not all, we just need to find somewhere open minded." She had been adressing Robin, but slowly turned to Chrom, hoping she had persuaded him.

“it’s true, Severa has been treated. She fought well but it was lucky we arrived when we did.”

Virion was satisfied.

“Very well.”

Sally looked up at Severa her eyes flickering with disappointment.

“But- I thought you were.”

Severa growled.

“No one is invincible no matter how big they are!”

“I’m not invincible but I promise I’ll protect you from the monsters.”

Cordelia stepped closer.

“You wanted someone who would appreciate you and not see you as a monster, and it looks like you found her.”

Severa mellowed out just a little.

Cordelia looked up at her.

done it alone or only with Cynthia.”

Virion stood by her.

“And it was unlucky the first village he picked happened to be overrun by Grimleaf. On the other hand, if you hadn’t stumbled upon that village what other lives could have been lost to them?”

Cordelia placed an arm around Virion.

“Exactly, you’re a hero Severa, and even if you don’t feel that way I’m sure your passenger does.”

Sally cheered.

“Yeah Severa is the greatest!”

Severa stomped off, passenger in toe.
