Robin took out a small pocket watch to check the time - quarter after 4, meaning the two girls had about 4 or so hours until night fell.

"Well," Robin spoke, opening the forum for conversation, "We have a few hours until nightfall, and based on your mother's report on the severity of damages to the castle..." Cynthia's mood dampened at this, looking a little guilty for wrecking her room. "I estimate she could be back anywhere from late tonight onward. Until then, we have some time to kill. What would you like to do?" Cynthia stuck her finger to her lips, unsure of how to answer.

"I dunno. There aren't any folk tales of what giants do for fun, so I'm a little lost here..."

"You know," Robin spoke, "Just because you're huge doesn't mean you don't have to do normal girl things anymore. It just needs a little...adjustment, is all." Cynthia listened to Robin's words and then took a clump of her hair in her hand, bringing the blue strands to the side of her vision. Cynthia looked at her hair and could see all manner of rubble, leaves, and twigs covering it, detracting from the royal blue luster it normally provided.

"Actually," Cynthia begun, "I know it's a tall order, but is their anything you could do about my hair? I hate to ask you, I know you didn't become a hair-stylist or anything after the war. What did you become anyways?"

"Librarian, dear." Robin replied, making her way over to a basket of goods. "And that doesn't mean I don't know anything about the trade either; there's a couple books in the reserves on the history of hairstyles and their effects on the culture of kingdoms & morale of the armies - it's quite a fascinating read! I could bring it over to the castle sometime once we resolve this situation." Cynthia let out a little smile and waved, resisting every urge to laugh at how much of a nerd Robin was.

"I think I'm fine, thanks though!"

"Suit yourself." Robin produced a large hairbrush from the basket, possibly Sumia's by how large it was in Robin's hand, and made her way over to Cynthia. Once reaching the titaness, she raised her hand upwards as if giving a signal. "Could you raise me up a bit?" Cynthia complied and let her hand down, allowing Robin to get on her palm.

"I appreciate the help Robin," the princess spoke, "But I don't think it's going to be easy with that brush. I mean it's big, but not too big."

"I understand your concerns, but don't worry about it, I'll just use my magic to handle the rest of your hair. In fact, I found some old tomes when cleaning out the library, so I got around to practicing with them for a bit." Robin was bought up to Cynthia's eye level. "Just move me behind your head, dear." Cynthia complied and Robin got the full view of the back of Cynthia's hair - she could see the chunks of brick and foliage caught between her blue strands. "Now, this is going to feel a little cold, so try not to react, okay?"

"Cold?" Before Cynthia could inquire, Robin produced a small blue tome from her overcoat and begun preparing the magic. In an instant, a cool stream of water was produced from the pages and engulfed Cynthia's hair, washing away the bits of debris caught within it. Cynthia jerked forward a bit, not expecting anything like it, but soon relaxed as she felt the soothing water touch her scalp; she immediately felt refreshed. "Wow Robin! Was that a water tome? Where the heck did you find something so cool?"

"Storage room," Robin answered, "The place was so unclean for years, the city council just let me take home whatever I felt like; of course, they had to step in a bit once they saw Priam carrying a huge cart of books behind him back to our house!" The two girls laughed a little at the story before Robin continued. "I did some research, and it turns out that this tome was crafted based upon the legends of Nohr and Hoshido."

"You mean the mythical kingdoms? Mother used to tell me about them all the time when I was young! And, uh, still a little bit nowadays, when I can't sleep." Once finished washing, Robin begun to work on Cynthia's hair, a brush in one hand and her Elwind tome in the other, brushing droplets of water away from Cynthia's hair until it dried.

"Then you know the part about the water-wielding songstress? The author of this tome based the spells in here upon her, in fact, some of her fabled lyrics are in this tome too. The author must've been around when the legends were first crafted, I would assume." Cynthia smiled as her hair continued to be brushed, but her expression turned to that of deep thought as a question rattled her mind.

"Hey, Robin?" Cynthia asked, "Do you know Inigo's wife, Peri? The one he just showed up with one day?"

"You mean the girl with blue & pink hair?" Robin asked, "Yes, I know her, she comes in to check out cookbooks once a week."

"Doesn't she kind of look familiar to you?"

"Not really, I just assumed she was from somewhere in Plegia based on her combat abilities, skin complexion, and...generally unsettling behavior."

"Well, I mean, it might be just me and all, but I swear I remember someone who looked like her from an old picture book on Nohr that Mother used to read to me. Could they be the same person?"

"Nonsense Cynthia, those stories are a myth, a myth created thousands of years ago too, I might add."

"It's just a thought, she's always dodging the question with jokes and stories about Inigo whenever I asked her where she came from. But I mean, that girl in the story had a green eye, and Peri's is red."

"It could be heterochromia." Robin answered, smiling mischievously as she played upon Cynthia's paranoia. "She does have her hair covering her other eye. You could always get closer and check."

"Heck no am I getting anywhere near her! She scares me!" Robin giggled at Cynthia's somewhat childish reaction, causing her to puff her cheeks out. "You wouldn't be laughing if you were in the same platoon as her!"

"Alright, alright, I'll take your word for it." Robin wiped her brow after finishing the back of Cynthia's hair. "Alright, the back's done, could you help me out with the sides?"

"Sure thing!" Cynthia moved her arm to her right shoulder, allowing Robin to step off her palm and onto the shoulder, where she begun to go to work the right side.

"I've probably bored you with my book-talk a bit, so why don't you hit me with a topic?"

"No, no, I like talking about old legends!" Cynthia replied, "But since you asked...Oh! Just the other day, I was in the market, when there was this thief who stole from the fruit bazaar! Naturally, the first thing I did was leap into action! So after recovering from tripping, I ran full-speed ahead, and then the next thing you know..." The two girls went on for hours sharing stories and gossip between one another, until Cynthia's hair was luscious and full once more, and night began to set over the sky.

choices: Stick with Cynthia or skip to the morning
13533211221112112111.content:
Cynthia's laughter filled the air. She grinned at Robin.

"I never knew we could have so much fun just hanging out together!"

Robin smiled and lay back.

"Yes it has been a while since I've been able to relax and hang out. Between my job at the library, my husband's constant training sessions and teaching Morgan, I've barely had a moment to myself."

Cynthia rubbed her hands together.

"I guess that means some good came out of this.. then again I didn't need to get really big just so we could hang out...."

"But it is true that with our busy schedules we would not have thought of it otherwise."

Cynthia frowned.

"That's sad, friend's shouldn't need an excuse to hang out with each other!"

Robin nodded.

"True, but as we get older we find more and more demands on our time. And when we were at war, I had a lot of duties and a lot of people demanding my time."

Cynthia rest her head on her other hand.

"Hmm I see...."

Robin tried to think of something to cheer up. The obvious question immediately sprang to mind.

"What about everyone else from the future?"

Cynthia grimaced.

"Ehhh most them went on to do their own thing." Cynthia suddenly became animated. "Oh oh! We should totally reform the Justice Cabal!"

Cynthia bounced up down obvious to her surroundings. Robin was knocked off her feet, now sitting in Cynthia's palm. She stood and looked at Cynthia with scolding eyes.

"Be careful! At your size you could cause a lot of unintended damage."

Cynthia looked down sheepishly.

"Oh.. yeah I found that out the hard way."

Robin dusted herself off, suddenly looking puzzled.

"And... the Justice Cabal?"

"Yeah!" Cytnhia bounced again. Robin wobbled, but this time she kept her balance, and gave Cynthia the same withering stare. Cynthia was sheepish once more.

"Opps sorry. Anyway its a game I used to play as kids with Owain and Gerome before Gerome got too grumpy pants for it, but Morgan agreed to replace him."

"Hmm.. that might be an idea. I some sure Morgan would like to spend time with you again and I'll see if Owain is around."

"Great!" This time Cynthia stopped herself from bouncing too hard.

Robin was curious though wary.

"What do you do in this Justice Cabal thing?"

"Mostly we just pretend to be heroes of old."

"I see.... though I'd prefer we get you some proper clothes... Morgan is at that age."

"Huh?"

"Nevermind."

"But what am I supposed to wear?"

"I suppose for now tying the cheesecloth around you should suffice, maybe adding something to it to ensure it stays on."

"Oh that sounds easy enough."

They talked a little longer before being interrupted by the sudden beat of pegasus wings. Sumia was riding along, with several bags t of food tied to her pegasus. Cynthia turned to her, delighted to see her.

"Mom!"

Sumia was flying level with her daughter's face and flew closer..

"Sorry it took me so long!"

"That's ok, we've had a great time just hanging out here!"

"Did you manage to find it?" Robin said.

"Yes, and don't worry I didn't touch it."

"Good, take me to it."

Sumia flew next to Cynthia's while Cynthia frowned.

"I'll wait here, I guess."

Robin looked up to her.

"If all goes well I'll be able to restore you to normal soon enough, though I can't promise you anything."

Cynthia moved her plam closer to her head.

"How long will it take?"

Robin frowned.

"I'm sorry can't say... could be minutes could be hours, if i can find something. If I can't... I'm sorry."

Cynthia sighed.

"So i guess I'm spending the night out here by myself?"

Robin lowered her head.

"I'm sorry..."

Sumia rode her pegasus higher.

"I can spend the night with you if you really want. Just this once though."

Cytnhia forced a smile.

"Nah I wouldn't want to force you out of the nice warm caslte. I'll be fine, really."

"Are you sure?"

Cynthia pumped her other fist through the air.

"Totally! i can handle anything, this will be nothing!"

"Well.. if you're sure...."

Robin climbed onto Sumia's pegasus. She turned and waved to Cynthia.

"Goodbye Cynthia. Don't worry, we'll see each other again soon."

"I'd like that."

As they flew off, Cynthia rested her head on the grass, taking handfuls of the food her mother had left for her.

"Hmm.. alone again. I never knew being a giant could be so.. lonely.. I guess if Robin succeeds everything will be back to normal but if I'm stuck like this...." She shivered, imagining herself all alone.

"No, I still have my friends and family no matter what happens!"

Even that couldn't completely push away her negative thoughts.

"Still... if I get any bigger I bet the whole of Ylisse will be able to see me!"

135332112211121121111.content:
At Castle Ylisstol, Robin and Sumia had gathered themselves inside the royal bedroom Chrom and Sumia shared to examine the stone. On a small coffee table, an orb of bright light contained the magic stone Sumia had found, the orb bound in place by one of Robin's tomes. The two girls sat in two regal-looking armchairs, just watching the stone and theorizing with each other what it could be; Sumia looked away for one moment, and could see a blush set over Robin's face.

"Robin?" Sumia asked, "What's wrong?" Robin seemed startled for a moment, as if she was just bought back to reality.

"Oh, sorry!" she replied, "It's just that, well, it's a little odd being in Chrom's bedroom and all, even when he's not here. It just seems a little strange after all we've been through together."

"You're referring to the time he walked in on you on the bath?" Sumia begun to giggle, remembering when Chrom recounted the story to her; she remembered how embarrassed he felt, and how he recounted how bad of a welt thrown soap could leave on the skin. "Even I don't think I could be that clumsy! And that's saying something!"

"I don't know Sumia..." Robin replied, a mischievous grin on her face. "If memory serves me correct, Lucina came into my tent one day, draped in only a blanket, and exposed herself to me because 'Mother said this would strengthen our bonds!'." Sumia's face became as red as a tomato, and she quickly clocked her head towards the shimmering orb on the table.

"A-Anyways!" she begun with a stutter. "So Robin, this stone, can you analyze what exactly it is?"

"I couldn't see anything odd when preparing this setup, but I could always try again." Robin got up from her armchair and begun examining the stone inside its magical casing, making sure she wasn't close enough to accidently break the seal on her magic or trigger any reaction from the rock. "It seems to be an onyx-like stone, black, with a small shimmer of light towards it. I can feel it in my bones though, this light it puts off isn't a normal jewel's glitter, it's magical in nature."

"Well, what could it be?" Sumia inquired, "Is it a natural magic, or a trap as Cynthia insists?"

"This I cannot say. Natural magic does exist, however, I've heard no tales of anything like this happening. On the other hand, turning Cynthia into a giant has no strategical advantage whatsoever for any enemies we might have, which are limited purely to random brigands and other ruffians now that Plegia and Valm have calmed down." Robin took her head away from the stone's inspection and carefully went back to sitting down in the armchair, turning her head towards Sumia to continue the conversation. "Further experiments would need to be run in order to figure out exactly what it is, and between you and me, I don't exactly want Miriel or Laurent touching this, lest we have an infestation of giants on our hands. I think the best course of option is to look through some books from the library, and if that fails, then we'll just have to find a way to transport this to Tiki."

"Seriously?" Sumia asked, feeling let down. "But Valm is so far away, we don't know if we have time or not to travel there. What if Cynthia continues growing? Furthermore, Chrom and Lucina are still away, who will run the kingdom in my absence?"

"You bring up good points," Robin replied, "Which is why we're going to have to just do some reading research until they get back. I could always try sending a letter to Tiki, but that will take a few weeks to arrive via carrier, and she could always be in one of her regular month-long naps too." Sumia looked down, feeling defeated by the luck of the situation. "Hey, cheer up Sumia. If it helps, Cynthia hasn't grown an inch since we waited for you, and the way you and her put it, she grew pretty fast in the span of two days. If I had to guess, she must've topped off around say...60 feet? There must be a limit to the growth this stone gives."

"Well, that's good to hear at least. Still, I don't think it's fair for Cynthia to have to go through this alone, she could end up feeling persecuted by her new size. I know it doesn't look like it Robin, but Cynthia really has some low self-esteem; I've had to pull a couple guards aside and chew them out just for chatter about 'weird hero poses'."

"I feel you Sumia, it's only natural for mothers to worry about their kids. If something like this happened to Morgan, I'd probably worry myself until I had a heart attack. Keep in mind though, I'm going to do everything in my power to help Cynthia - we're all family, you, me, and the rest of The Shepherds." Sumia gave a big smile, and moved her arm over the edge of the chair, grasping Robin's hand tightly.

"Thank you Robin, you're a true friend." Robin smiled back, glad to be a help to the humble Pegasus Knight-turned-Queen. "It's getting to be late, you should probably get back to your family soon. Is there any chance you could have some tea with me before you go?"

"I'd like that, yes."

"In that case, I'll go fetch my favorite blend! Be right back!" Sumia got up off the chair and began to work her way towards the small kitchen attached to the bedroom. Robin looked down and could see a hump in the rug from uneven settling; this surely meant disaster for Sumia.

"Sumia, look out! There's-" Robin's words came too late as Sumia's foot came in contact with the rug, causing her to slip backwards and hit her head on the coffee table. Be it because of poor luck or loose legs, the table tilted with great force, launching the tome up in the air and shattering the magical barrier around the stone. Robin's heart froze and she felt a pit open in her stomach as the stone began to glow violently when airborne and it began to come back down, free from its magical prison.

1353321122111211211111.content:
Sumia let out a gasp as she realised what she had done.

"Oh no!"

"Sumia you...." Robin took a deep breath, cutting herself off just before saying something too harsh.

Sumia was also trying to manage her breathing.

"I'm sorry! I guess I'm a still a bit clumsy but maybe the stone won't-" Sumia was cut off as her dress began to rip. She was already taller than Robin,

Robin furrorowed her brow. Fortunately she was used to thinking quickly in crisis situations.

"Sumia take your clothes off before you destroy them."

"Huh? Ow!" Sumia suddenly understood as she felt the pain of her tightening clothes. She started stripped."But what if someone comes by?"

"I'll make sure the way is clear. For now throw the bed sheet over yourself and follow me. If your growth is like Cynthia's there should be enough time to get you out before you get stuck. Wait here."

Robin ran ahead, telling any nearby guards, servants and any other personal to go to another part of the castle. As Chrom's trusted advisor her word's were listented to. Robin came back and led Sumia out the castle. By now she was having to bend her head to avoid the door frame.

"Call for your pegasus, we want to reach the clearing as quickly as possible."

Sumia shook her head.

"I'm sorry but I can't be sure how fast I'm growing and I don't want to risk putting that much weight on my pegasus"

Robin gave her a questioning look.

"Even if people see you like this or naked?"

Sumia’s eyes widened at the thought btu then she looked resolved.

"Well I'd rather they don't but I'm not going to risk harming my pegasus.."

"Very well, we're just going to have to run as quickly as possible." Robin said. Sumia ran after her and with her longer legs soon overtook her, though she soon tripped.

“What was that about not being clumsy?”

Sumia got herself up.

“I-I’ve been getting better. But my body feels weird.. I don’t know how to explain it.”

“Hmm it makes sense that your centre of balance would be thrown by a sudden growth spurt. Hopefully you’re growth will stop at a fixed point and you’ll be able to adapt to your new size. We’ll have to keep you away from crowded areas.”

Sumia nodded reluctanly.

“Alright.”

Sumia did not want to waste further time talking, focusing on reaching the clearing. She was a fair bit ahead of Robin, who also knew she could not catch up.

“I’ll have back to the castle and get you another cheesecloth. Hopefully you’ll only grow as big as Cynthia or there abouts.”

“Thanks!”

Sumia continued on her own, soon reaching Cynthia.

Cynthia’s eyes grew wide at the sight of Sumia.

"Mom?!" She leaned forward.

Sumia frowned.

"I was trying to show Robin where the stone but I tripped and landed on the stone."

Cynthia tried to hug Sumia against her face.

"Oh mom, I didn't want you dragged into this to!"

Sumia smiled and placed a hand on Cynthia.

"Not so tight dear!”

“Sorry!” Cynthia said, loosening her grip, letting Sumia sit in her palm, though Sumia no longer fitted it so perfectly.

“And… I-I'm sure Robin will find a way to help us.” Sumia tried to sound confident but couldn’t keep the doubt out of her voice. “Or at least someone find someone who can. At least now you don't have to do this alone."

Cynthia looked thoughtful.

“So how big do you think you’re going to get?”

“Well none of us can be sure, but Robin thinks I might end up the same size as you.”

“That’d be great!” Cynthia said without thinking before frowning. “I mean.. it wouldn’t be great that you’re stuck like this to but at least we won’t be alone.”

Sumia smiled.

“I know what you mean, dear.”

"I wonder what dad and sis are going to say when they sees the two of us!"

Sumia giggled, imaging then both shocked..

"They'll be in for quite a surprise!"

Cynthia let out an involuntary yawn. She rubbed her eyes.

“I’m so tired it must be really late.”

Sumia yawned as well.

“I’m tired as well. Maybes its stress or maybe its something about this stone.”

Cynthia lay down, while keeping careful hold of her mother.

“Then let’s get some shut eye! Good night mother.”

“Good night Cynthia.”

13533211221112112111112.content:
Morning broke through the trees in the clearing, rays of light illuminated the green, dew-covered grass, the chirping birds, and two giantesses, both at 60 feet, sleeping next to each other, curled-up and snoozing. Cynthia looked at peace being next to Sumia, as Sumia with her daughter; the two slept so close to one another, they were practically cuddling, Sumia even managed to drape part of Cynthia's cheesecloth over her body like a blanket, covering both their naked frames. Into the peaceful grove, two figures approached, one large, another small, and slowly made their way towards the two titanesses. The larger of the two set a hand upon Sumia's calf and begun to jostle her.

"Sumia, wake up." No response. Another jostle. "Sumia, it's morning." The large queen smacked her lips and yawned.

"Mmmhhh, five more minutes Chrom..." The larger of the two sighed and made a signal with their hand, prompting the smaller of the two to pull out a fire tome. They aimed it skyward and begun firing it off, the fireballs exploded with a loud, audible "POP" mid-air and dissipated into nothing. The fireworks prompted Cynthia and Sumia to awake, and they did so with a jolt. The cheesecloth was discarded to the ground and both giants sat up with astounding speed, exposing their nude bodies; the smaller figure blushed and covered their eyes.

"We're under attack! Man the ballistae! Guard the castle walls!" Cynthia cried in a panic.

"Where's my lance?! Quick, save the Pegasi!" Sumia cried in equal panic. When the two girls came to, they realized they were awake in the forest clearing, looking around like maniacs. As the two tried to calm themselves, the large figure extended an arm, a large piece of cloth held in it.

"Here's that cheesecloth, Sumia." Sumia grabbed it slowly, bowing her head in response.

"Oh, thank you Robin, it was a cold...Wait, Robin?!" Cynthia turned her head to her mother's viewing angle, and her eyes became equally as large as her mother's. There kneeled Robin, looking a little grumpy, about the same size as both of them, body draped in black velvet wrapped to resemble a strapless bikini. Robin sighed and looked left, leaving an awkward silence in the air, which Cynthia soon broke.

"Robin, what the heck happened to you?!" she cried, partially panicked, partially enthused.

"On my way back to the castle, I seemed a little taller. Imagine my surprise when I fished around in my coat pockets and found the stone. I'm pretty sure you kicked it into my coat pocket when you got up so hurriedly last night, Sumia." Sumia chomped down on her bottom lip and started twiddling her thumbs, feeling embarrassed. "I ran home to get another magic prison for the stone, but I could barely fit into my room anymore. I had to strip down, rip the drapes down, break open the roof, run to the castle, grab the cloth, then come back here, all without causing a panic in town - all in all, not a great night." Sumia began to bow apologetically.

"I'm so sorry! This is my fault! Me and my clumsy behavior! Please forgive me Robin!" Robin raised a hand and waved it.

"It's fine, I'd be lying if I said I never saw something like this coming. Just...They were really good drapes too..." Robin shook off the melancholy emotions towards her repurposed curtains, and continued her explanation. "In any case, the stone's safe, I chucked it in my room and Priam's guarding it; he's swamped down by questions of a 'giant naked librarian' running through the streets at midnight, he's not going to let anyone into my room with his skill. Morgan and I are going to be working with you two from here on out."

"Morgan?" Cynthia asked.

"Um..." came a gentle, polite voice. Cynthia and Sumia turned to see Morgan covering his eyes, face red as a tomato. "Cynthia, Miss Sumia, could you please, um, cover up...?" The two girls looked down and jumped; they immediately got to work covering themselves tightly in their cheesecloth dresses before relaxing back into a seating position.

"Okay Morgan! You can look now!" Morgan heeded Cynthia's words and uncovered his eyes. The first thing he noticed was how pretty Cynthia looked with her hair down, the brilliant blue of her hair blending with the vibrant white of her skin, the pale yellow cloth wrapped tightly around her like a spring dress. The second thing he noticed was truly how large she had become, which having seen his own mother become titanic in front of him, didn't bother him in the least. Morgan's eyes got all gooey, which Cynthia picked up on; she chuckled and scratched the back of her head. "Okay, okay, you can stop staring now." Morgan immediately snapped back to reality and turned around, feeling embarrassed.

"Oh gosh, um, sorry Cynthia! I didn't mean to make you feel weird!"

"It's fine! It's fine! Though really, you're coming off a bit weird here though!"

"H-Hey! What's that supposed to mean?" Both Robin and Sumia looked at their children in slight bliss, noting how perfect of a match they'd make together. Sumia turned back towards Robin, staring the white-haired tactician deeply in the eyes.

"So the stone is completely safe, right?"

"That is correct." Robin answered. "Short of dropping through the gaping hole in our roof, nobody's getting into my family's house while Priam's on the prowl."

"Alright then. In that case, let's just go into town and get it." Cynthia and Morgan stopped their back-and-forth conversation and looked at Sumia, a little thrown back by her suggestion. Robin raised a brow in curiosity.

"But Mother," Cynthia began, "Won't the townspeople be staring? I thought that our goal was to prevent a panic with this?" Sumia looked around at her staring audience and begun to twiddle her thumbs as she tried to explain her logic.

"Well, I mean...Robin makes it sound like people have already seen her as a giant, so I didn't think it would cause a panic, and plus I'm still the Queen, and townsfolk really like me, and um..." Robin heard enough, she raised her palm, indicating Sumia to stop her thoughts and relax a little.

"I'm going to have to agree with you Sumia, we got nothing to lose at this point. I'd rather we cause a panic over this then to have a potentially dangerous situation erupt in town with people touching the stone. At this point, I'm starting to think even research into this stone might get dangerous. We might even need to dispose of it altogether, throw it into the ocean or something."

"So what then?" Cynthia asked, a little worried. "Are we going to have to stay big like this? I'm not really seeing the benefits of being a giant hero anymore, to be completely honest..." Robin sighed a little, seeing Cynthia's concerns; she didn't exactly want to do her job as a scantily-clad giant, and handling late fees and the stamp-book would become near-impossible at this size. Morgan raised his hand, indicating he had an idea.

"Well, I mean, what if we just tried the Outrealms? Or maybe Naga herself? I'm sure one of the traveling Anna sisters have seen something like this all throughout their journeys." Morgan looked at Cynthia deeply. "Look Cynthia, we're really good friends, so I'm not going to leave you hanging like this, I promise. If Mother's too big to work, then I'll just pick up right where she left off." Cynthia blushed a little; it wasn't the world's greatest or most motivational speech ever, but Morgan sounded so cool and level-headed when he said it, and she admired that about him.

"Then it's settled," Sumia spoke, "We're marching right into town and fixing this situation!" She stood and pointed towards town, fist pumped, to get all charged up; Cynthia looked at her mother's pose and giggled, feeling like she rubbed off on her a bit.

"Well, I guess it's alright if I have all you around me!" Cynthia leapt to her feet, sending Morgan a little off-balance, no effect on the other two giantesses. "But you know, if we head into town now, we might just really cause a panic. Like, a super big one that'll cause riots n' stuff." Sumia's pose drooped slowly until her hands were at her sides and her head was downward.

"O-Oh..."

"Well, we could always travel by night, giving us some element of surprise." Robin added in, trying to cheer up Sumia's mood. "Priam should have our house locked down for months if I know him, so we certainly have the time to wait and plan this out." Robin turned her head towards Cynthia's. "Really, I think it should be your call Cynthia."

"M-Me?!" Cynthia replied, pointing at herself in disbelief.

"Yes, you. You were the first of us to grow, so technically, you're like the leader to us all. From what Sumia and Chrom tell me, you're aiming to become new captain of the Pegasus Knights, right?" Cynthia rubbed her hair, looking off sideways with a blush and goofy grin on her face.

"Well, I mean, that'd be really cool and all..."

"Then we'll use this situation as a test for your judgment and leadership abilities. I'm at your command, Cynthia." Sumia looked towards Cynthia, she looked ready to panic a little.

"It's fine sweetie," Sumia spoke, "Just breathe a little and think, we have all the time in the world. If you need help with anything, we're always here to help out!" Cynthia shook her head at her mother and started breathing deeply, making poses and gestures with her hands as she did.

"Okay, breathe deep - in, and out. In, and out. I'm calm now. Cynthia's calm." She looked around at the faces of her friends and family as they waited on her decision.

135332112211121121111121.content:
Cynthia gave it some thought.

"Well... I don't want to sit around here all day again but I don't want everyone to start screaming as soon we go into town.... but wait." Cynthia looked at Robin. "You said people saw you last night but you didn't scare anyone right?"

"No... though it did help people recognise me. In sense..” Robin put a hand to her head. “Actually I wish I hadn't been recognised, I could do without people reminding us of this later on."

This did not damper Cynthia’s mood/

"So that means if we head into town we might be fine!"

Robin was unimpressed.

"But we can't be sure, invariably people will react different but at least some will see us as frightening monsters."

Morgan’s eyes widened, clearly bewildered that anyone could view these woman as monsters.

"I could never see you that way!"

Robin half smiled and half frowned.

"I know, but it helps that you recognise us and that you have an open mind."

Cynthia pumped a fist into the air.

"That's it! Morgan could head into town and say that we're coming! Like "Here comes Queen Sumia, Royal Librarian and Giant he- I dunno what title I want for myself Cynthia!"

"The direct approach.. I cannot factor in how an entire town would react to us... and Morgan, you are not used to public speaking, are you?"

Morgan was nervous but tried to appear brave.

"N-no but I could still give it a shot." He tried to stand a little taller, as though that hide his fear, but the three giants saw through it.

Cynthia spun round to face Robin.

"Hey! You said I was the leader and you'd give my idea a shot!"

"I'm just trying to minimise the risks."

Sumia placed a hand on her shoulder.

"I think it was a good idea honey. But maybe we should start with the guards and fellow Shepards, their sure to recognise us."

Cynthia held herself and shuddered.

"I nearly got shot full of arrows!"

"But you said Stahl recognised you on sight, right?"

"Yeah but...."

Robin saw her chance to speak.

"If we approach slowly and carefully, Castle Ylisse will surely recognise its Queen, Princess and Royal Librarian." She forced a smile. "Maybe my new size will encourage people to return the books on time."

Cynthia jumped to her feet, the impact nearly knocking Robin and Morgan off theirs.

"Then it's settled! Let's do that!"

"Be careful!” Robin scolded. “The two of you should practise moving at your sizes before you go anywhere near the castle."

"Hey I got this! I just need to move slowly and watch everything around me."

"Yes, but you also need to watch yourself when you get excited, especially in a tight. Around here you've only damaged a few trees,but in a crowded areas you could damage buildings or endanger lives. Not to mention if Morgan was too close to you..."

"I get it! I get it! Take it slow, don't get too excited." Cynthia tried to restrain her movement.

Sumia looked at her feet.

"And it was because I was clumsy that Robin and I were enlarged..."

"Precisely. So both of you take it slow and."

"I understand."

Sumia carefully got up and took a few steps.... only to hit the ground face first. Sumia winced.

"I thought I had gotten better..."

Cynthia offered her a hand while Robin offered guidance.

"You had, but growing to giant size has changed your centre of balance. Don't worry, we have time to practice this, just make sure you are nowhere near my boy. And Morgan, keep away from Sumia while she practises."

Morgan nodded reluctantly.

Sumia continued practising walking at various speeds before plummeting to the ground. She must surely have been noticed by anyone even close to the clearing, but fortunately no one dared to approach the 3 giants.

Eventually Sumia felt practised that she thought she could walk as ably as she could at normal size. She was proud fo the progress she had made.

“There! Now if I just take it slow I can avoid tripping.”

Robin nodded. She was larger now, coming past Sumia’s stomach.

“Yes. No matter what happens both of you need to be constantly aware of your surroundings. You both have issues with this. Though it would be best if you avoided standing anywhere crowded or cramp.”

Sumia creased her lips.

“Hmm that does sound tough...”

Cynthia looked nervous for a second but pushed it away with her usual fist pump.

“But we can do it!”

Robin made a noise.

“Don’t take this lightly! Lives could be at stake. In fact even when you are just waiting around you should always check to see who and what is around you.”

“I get it, I get it! We just need to be aware of everything like you, Robin! Though come to think Robin is aware, she’s SUPER aware!”

Robin rolled her eyes but said nothing.

“Like Morgan says that on a battlefield she sees ALL the enemy soldiers and all of us at all times, no matter how far away everyone is.”

Sumia turned to Robin, suddenly awestruck.

“Wow could you teach us how to do that? It would help us a lot.”

“It’s not that easy. I was born with an aptitude for it.” Robin shuddered, recalling what she was told by Validar “But I imagine even then I had to work at it. But I will teach you what I can.”

“Thank you.”

Cynthia went on, sounding more and more excited with each word.

“-And I hear she sees each part of the battlefield as a tiny square and knows exactly how far everyone can move at a time and can see all the weapons the enemies have an exactly how strong they are and even sees numbers above our heads that indicates how healthy we are!”

“Honey I think you’re exaggerating”

“I’m not!”

Robin sighed casting a look at Morgan for spilling her secrets.

“Come on everyone.” She bent down to her son and held out her open palms. Morgan climbed on.

The three walked slowly and carefully towards the castle. Sumia and Cynthia were almost side by side, with Sumia just a little in front. Robin walked a few steps behind so she could keep an idea on the other giants, while Morgan rested on her shoulder, keeping hold of a strand of hair just to be safe.

Soon they were in sight of the castle They several more steps until Robin ordered them to stop.

“Wait I see archers preparing to fire, we have to show them we are not a threat. Hold at your hands as though you were surrendering.” Robin demonstrated and Sumia and Cynthia followed suit, though Cynthia hesitated for a second.

Robin looked towards the castle.

“Hold your fire! I am Royal Librarian Robin and beside me is Queen Sumia and Princess Cynthia. We mean you no harm! We have been enlarged due to a magical accident that I wish to make right. Please lower your weapons and let us pass. Call for any of our fellow Shepards and they will be sure to recognize us.”

Sumia took a tip toe forward.

“It’s me Sumia, I mean Queen Sumia, you can trust us! Even though we are giants, surely at least some of you recognise us?”

1353321122111211211111211.content:
Upon Sumia's words, the castle guards immediately lowered their weapons. The group could hear some chatter amongst the rabble of guards and Shepherds below.

"Hey, is that really Queen Sumia?!"

"Gods, how did they get so big?!"

"At least Cynthia's wearing clothes this time, now if we can just get that castle fixed..."

"Hehehe! I bet they could really kill a whole lotta bad guys at that size!"

A familiar red-headed Shepherd ran up along the length of the wall, looking perplexed, aghast, and very concerned.

"Sumia?!" Cordelia shouted, concerned by her best friend's growth spurt. "Dear Naga, what on earth happened to you?! What happened to you all?!"

"Oh Cordelia!" Sumia kneeled down and grasped the border wall, shaking it slightly as her fingers dug into the concrete, causing the guards along the wall to stumble, some toppling over. Sumia spoke fast and panicked, as she usually did when recounting her issues to Cordelia. "There was this rock and it made Cynthia grow and then I accidently made me and Robin grow and now it's at Robin's house and we need to get there fast and-!"

"Slow down! Calm down!" Cordelia waved her arms, trying to focus Sumia's attention onto her and detract her motor-mouth. "Take a deep breath girl, there's no need to freak out." Sumia took Cordelia's advice, unhanging herself from the wall and turning around, sitting with her back to the wall as she began to take deep breaths. Cordelia focused her attention on the other two giants. "Now then, what's Sumia talking about? What happened?"

"Um, hey there Auntie Cordelia!" Cynthia spoke up, waving politely to her mother's dear friend. "So, uh, this is gonna sound kind of weird, but, uh, we got stung by a nasty rock, and then we became huge. What a day, am I right?"

"Excuse me?" Cordelia asked, furrowing her brow.

"It was an adverse reaction to a magical stone." Robin cut in, trying to clarify the situation. "We don't know where it came from or why it's done this to us, but it's potentially dangerous. I was hoping we could retrieve it from my house before someone gets hurt."

"I see..." Cordelia tried to process the situation, taking deep breaths to calm herself. She glanced over at Sumia and could see that she was having a tough time trying to stay calm, more than usual; Cordelia walked over slowly and gripped a couple strands of Sumia's hair, the gargantuan strands comparable to rope, and begun to rub them. Sumia tilted her head slightly, making sure she didn't clumsily drag Cordelia to the floor.

"Thanks Cordelia."

"Any time Sumia." Cordelia looked up at Robin again, trying to get further answers from her. "So what happened to cause this? 'Stung' by the rock? What does that mean?"

"Cynthia's not exaggerating, that stone was touch-activated. If you touch it, then you grow, from a rate of anywhere slow to quickly, depending on how reactive it is. Don't touch it if you find it, if you do, then your clothes aren't coming with you."

"That explains your...interesting choice in attire, Robin." Robin blushed and tried to cover herself, both arms over her navel and her legs scrunched together, trying to hide as much skin as she could. Morgan blushed too, now realizing that the rest of the Shepherds could basically see his mother in her smallclothes. Cordelia giggled at Robin's embarrassment, before getting back on track. "So where is this rock now?"

"Robin's house." Cynthia answered. "We need to get into town, but we're probably gonna scare everyone if we do."

"I can see how you'd think that."

"Um, Auntie Cordelia? Could you help Morgan let the town know that we're here and huge? So the town doesn't get thrown into a panic? He doesn't like public speaking all too much." Cordelia looked at the young boy atop Robin's shoulder; he let out a small wave.

"I mean, it's not that I don't want to, but...Would the town even believe us?"

"Well of course! You're one of Ylisse's top Pegasus Knights! You're the captain for Naga's sake! You're so loved by the people, and-"

"And I'm still one person, Cynthia, and with Morgan, that makes us two. A town with a population of tens of thousands large would be a hard sell if there were just two people walking around like raving lunatics, talking about giant humans, much less our Queen being one of them." Cynthia looked a little down, feeling like she didn't think this through enough.

"Um..." Morgan piped up, focusing all the attention onto him. "If it's no trouble to the other knights here, we could probably all go around town and tell them about Cynthia, Queen Sumia, and Mother. Two alone would be a little unbelievable, but if we had a hundred or so of Ylisse's trusted royal guard speaking to the people, we could probably soften the impact of shock towards seeing giant humans." Cordelia put a hand to her chin, intrigued by the young tactician's plan; Morgan glanced at his Mother a bit before continuing. "Besides, there's been rumors about Mother running through the streets huge and nude since last night..."

"Morgan!" Robin shouted with a blush.

"In that case," Cordelia responded, "I think this plan could work, we'll have you all stay here until we've assured the whole town of how big you've allo become. All I'd need is a royal order from the Queen herself, and we'll be ready to move out." Cordelia stopped stroking Sumia's hair and leaned on over towards her friend, staring her directly in the eye. "What do you say Sumia? Would you mind if we go out marching a bit?"

"Of course not, are you kidding?" Sumia answered, "This whole experience is really scary, I just want to go back to being Sumia-sized again!"

"As you command, my liege." Cordelia replied jokingly; she knew how much she didn't like royal titles. Cordelia turned around to face the other guards and Shepherds in the courtyard, and spoke to them in a loud, commanding voice, worthy of her title as captain. "Alright, listen up! Our mission is to march through town and let all the townsfolk know about the now-giant Cynthia, Robin, and Queen Sumia! We'll separate into six groups, each with a captain to command each district of town, each with a team of 30-40 soldiers." Cordelia begun to point out each of the Shepherds, pointing out the commander of each small army. "Stahl, you take care of the North Residential District." As she named them, each Shepherd gave a salute.

"Roger ma'am!"

"Sully, you handle the Industrial District."

"On it, Captain!"

"Vaike, take the West Residential District."

"Ain't the sexiest job in the world, but you can count on me, Captain!"

"Kellam, take the Administrative District."

"Oh, you noticed me? That's a relief. You can count on us, Captain."

"Peri, take the Commercial District."

"Oooh! Maybe I can find something new for dinner with Inigo tonight there! I'll scour the area reeaal good, Captain!"

"As for the East Residential District, Morgan and I will handle it; all of my squadron is not to step anywhere inside Robin's house until our situation's properly assessed, is that clear?" An approving rabble came from the courtyard below, following Cordelia's words. "If that's so, then we break now! All troops - march!"

"Yes ma'am!" The troops in the castle grounds gathered into six groups; five of them scattered through the gates through the wall, while another six waited for their Captain's beginning march. Robin removed Morgan from her shoulder and lowered him to the floor of the wall, next to Cordelia.

"Now Morgan," Robin spoke, "When you and Cordelia get inside our house, don't let her touch the stone, nor you either. Get my sealing magic from my bookshelf, it's in the silver binding. Use it on the stone, and if it doesn't look movable, then just leave it there and let Priam guard it."

"Yes, Mother."

"Um, Auntie Cordelia?" Cordelia turned to look at Cynthia. "Thanks for helping us, I really appreciate it."

"Any time Cynthia, you're practically family, you know?" Cynthia giggled and blushed, making a teasing swipe at Cordelia.

"Oh stop it, you're such a tease!" Cordelia giggled, then whistled, causing her Pegasus to come forth and touch down on the stone wall. She saddled up on it and helped Morgan onto the winged equine.

"Have you ridden before, Morgan?"

"A little bit, on the back of Cynthia's during the war."

"Well, be sure to hang on tight either way. I'll go slowly, in case you get airsick." Cordelia stared down at her troops and begun to issue them a command. "All troops, move out!" Cordelia took to the skies and begun to head East, towards Robin's home, with her troops following behind her. After all was done, only the three giantesses and a small handful of troops remained within the castle grounds.

"Well, on that note," Sumia begun, "Are you all feeling hungry? I could get some chefs to whip something up. Hopefully we don't run through the entire food supply before Chrom and Lucina come back."

"Now that you mention it Mother, I could really go for some meat or something now."

"Sure thing Sumia. I'll just have something light, like some salad."

"Well alright then." Sumia stepped over the walls of the castle and into the grounds. She kneeled down towards some guards and begun to address them. "Um, excuse me? Could you get the chefs to make something for me, my daughter, and my friend? Nothing too big, despite how we currently are, I don't want to inconvenience the castle workers." The guards saluted and retreated into the castle. Cynthia and Robin stepped over the walls and sat down next to Sumia, forming a triangle between the three.

"Welp, I guess now we just play the waiting game. What should we talk about?" The three girls begun chatting gossip with each other, waiting for their meals to come out and for the Shepherds to return with results.

Cynthia wore a bright smile.

"That went well."

Robin nodded cautiously.

"Yes, that could have been a lot worse."

Cynthia huffed.

"Oh come on, it was a great plan!"

"it is fortunate they recognised us."

"With our faces all big and stuff we should be easier than ever to recognise!"

"In theory.. in practice.. only if they know us."

Cynthia looked her dead in the eyes.

"Well, we just need to find people who know and gives those who don't a chance to know us."

Sumia moved between them.

"I'm just glad everything worked out."

Cynthia nodded.

"Yeah, I didn't want to be stuck on my own again."

Robin still wore a frown.

"I don't mean to nag, but you're going to have to watch yourself when you're around the castle and other buildings, one careless motion and you could do a lot of damage."

Cynthia looked down at her hand.

"Hmmm.. I noticed the effect I had on the border wall. I know we're giants, but I'm surprised how strong I am."

Robin scratched her chin, equal parts worried and curious.

"It is strange.. given the unintended damage we've caused, we're much stronger than I'd expect. Perhaps its a side effect of whatever enlarged us or perhaps beings of our size need this kind of strength to survive."

Cynthia slammed her fist down.

"Ha!I like the bit about being able to kill loads of bad guys at this size!"

Robin glared at her,

"I just told you to be careful!"

"Sorry." She took a deep breath and spread her arms out, consciously trying to still herself. "Keep calm, keep calm no sudden movements...."

Sumia leaned closer.

"I'm not sure there are many "bad guys" left anyway."

Robin looked in thought.

"Hmm.. we can't be certain. Though things seem peaceful we don't know what is being plotted behind closed doors. And I suppose their will always be brigands."

"Yeah!" Cynthia's arm twitched as she fought the urge to pump her fist through the air again.

Sumia placed her hand on Cynthia's arm.

"Though you would need to be careful as having a lot of strength would come with a lot of..." Sumia tried to search for the right word.

"Responsibility?" Cynthia said.

"Yes, exactly!"

"I think I heard Owan say something similar once.".

Robin was now deep in though, as though she was preparing the Shepard's for a mighty battle.

"While it's true our sizes grant us a lot of strength, they also make us easier targets, especially to enemy archers..."

Cynthia tilted her head.

"But if we're super strong than maybe we're super tough?"

"It's possible, but an arrow or a lance is likely to hurt at any size...."

Sumia frowned.

"Robin, I hope you don't mind me saying this, but you think about war a lot."

Robin looked a little embarrassed.

"Yes. Sorry, it helps keep my mind focused while avoiding other worries." She shivered, then looked down at herself. "Now that I'm not thinking about tactics, I'm reminded I need another Cheesecloth."

"Oh sorry, I'll get someone to bring you one!".

Cynthia smiled.

"I guess we all like to think about other things when we're feeling worry or scarred. Read any good books lately, mom?"

Sumia looked a little embarrassed.

"Well I have been cutting down, but I did like Tharcia 776, even if it was very difficult to get through at times."

"Ever read anything about giants?"

"No. I've only seen giants in fiction, and they are usually treated as simple monsters."

"Ugh no wonder people were so scared of us!"

Robin sighed.

"I'm not aware of any historical accounts of giants. We may be the first."

Sumia tensed up/

"Oh... I just hope the others arrive soon so we can reach your house and you can begin your research"

Cynthia through her arms around them still minding her surroundings.

"I'm just glad we can spend some time together again!"

Sumia glanced back, jittering back and fourth .

"Everyone is staring at us... even as a queen I'm not used to this."

Cynthia and Robin looked in the direction. Indeed they had attracted quite an audience, though more eyes were on Robin than anyone else.

Cynthia waved back at her observers and bystanders.

"Well we are three really big ladies, I guess its only natural people stare, I mean how often does anyone see this?"

Robin looked flushed, trying to cover herself with her arms and legs.

"I think most of them are looking at me, and not for any good reason."

Sumia frowned.

"I sent someone to get another Cheesecloth, I'm sure they''l be back soon."

"Assuming their not part of the gallery."

Cynthia tilted her head.

"Wouldn't you see them if they were?"

Robin huffed.

"I can't see through walls! My abilities are not magic."

Cynthia blinked.

"Aside from the spells you cast?" She ask in earnest.

As Robin shifted into teaching, she relaxed, forgetting about her wardrobe malfunction.

"Those are magic. Though thinking of it that way, I suppose both do require an attentive and focused mind."

Cynthia's eyes widened and she lurched forward.

"Does that mean Miriel could do what you do?"

"An interesting example. Not to the same degree I can, though when she is not distracted by one particular detail she can be very preceptive. Mages are generally good at perceiving what is around them."

"Even Ricken?"

"Yes, though since he is still young he is easier to distract than most mages."

Two servants approached the group, carrying another Cheesecloth. They placed it down at Robin's knees.

"H-here you go."

"Thank you-" Robin's eyes suddenly widened as she remembered why she had asked for it, hastily trying to wrap it around her. "This is not ideal but I suppose it will do for now."

Sumia shut her eyes. and pursed her lips.

"I'm sorry, if we're still stuck like this I'll try to get you some proper clothes."

Cynthia was not normally one to laugh at others but she couldn't help but giggle. For all of Robin's constant lectures, it was amusing to see her forget her surroundings.

"Did you forgot why you asked for the other Cheesecloth?"

Robin sighed.

"I have to admit, even as one who prides herself on her awareness I can still occasionally be distracted. Awareness is not merely about seeing with your eyes, its keeping your mind on what you are doing, and I doubt anyone who is completely immune to distraction."

Cynthia nodded.

"Yeah... but sometimes it's fun to think about other things. Like how our conversation got our minds off the whole giant thing."

"True, one can't focus all the time or they'd drive themselves mad, the key is balance."

Sumia opened her eyes..

"Like how I cut back on the amount of fiction I read, but still enjoy it in moderation"

Cynthia's eyes narrowed.

"But... my dreams of being a hero. Other than sis and some friends, it was all I had during those times... I needed to get stronger just to survive, so I did."

Sumia wrapped her arms around her and drew and her closer.

"There, there, it's all over now. Grima is dead, his cultists are scattered and we're at peace."

"I know mom, and I'm glad but... it's not just that. I spent almost my whole life training and now what? And before when I messed up, some people might laugh but now...."

"You just need to be more careful."

"I guess.. I never needed to worry about that stuff this way before."

Robin placed an arm on Cynthia.

"Cynthia regardless of whether or not I can get us back to normal size, I will help you find a use for your strength."

"Really?" She suddenly pounced on Robin and glomped her. "Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!"

Robin called out in pain.

"Not so tight!"

"Oh sorry." She sheepishly let go.

Robin rubbed her somewhat sore arms.

"And if what you want is intense training, my husband will be more than happy to provide, but I must warn you his routines are intense."

"He can't be anymore intense than Frederick, I mean I'm not even sure he sleeps!"

Robin smiled mischievously.

"Oh you'd be surprised."

Cynthia eyes grew like saucers, simultaneously horrified and curious.

After what seems like an age to Sumia, but no time at all to Cynthia and Robin the Shepard's came back.

Cordelia was the first to arrive, flying her pegasus level with Robin’s face.

"I've checked with the others. We have covered all of Ylisse."

Sumia clapped her hands.

"Well done, everyone!"

Robin merely looked satisfied.

"Methodical as always, Cordelia."

"Hey, you actin' like she did it all herself!” Vaike shouted from below.” The Vaike told plenty of people!"

Robin suppressed a sigh.

"I did not mean to imply it was not a group effort. Thank you, everyone."

Vaike puffed up his chest.

"Though I have to say it was a mighty tall tale! I dunno how many people really believed me."

"They will soon see the truth for themselves. The important thing is that when civilians see us, they will not think of us as monsters or invaders." Robin got to her feet, gesturing for Sumia and Cynthia to do the same. "It is important the citizens of Ylisse see me walking with you, so that they'll know I am a companion of yours. This way I am also less likely to be bothered while I do my research."

After quickly checking nothing and no one was near her, Cynthia pumped her fist through the air.

"Sounds good to me!"

"And remember, take it slow and careful. Pay attention to everyone and everything around you, lives could be at stake."

Cynthia and Sumia spoke almost simultaneously.

"Got it!" "Understand!"

The 3 giantess approached Ylisse, Robin walking directly behind Sumia and Cynthia. Their pace was slow and deliberate, Sumia even holding her arms to improve her balance. Fortunately practice and Robin's guidance proved to pay off, as the trio had no problems approaching the city. Gasps were heard as they neared, but having been forewarned their presence did not send Ylisse into a frenzy, though there plenty of commotion and gossip. Robin moved closer to Sumia and whispered to her.

"Say something."

"Oh.." She cleared her throat. "I am Queen Sumia. With me is Princess Cynthia, and our Royal Librarian and Tactician, Robin. I know our sizes might seem alarming, but we are still the same people we always were. We mean you no harm and merely wish to pass through Ylisse."

The tension in the air lessoned, crowds parter to let them through. The gossiping and murmuring did not completely stop, and many eyes were still on them, filled with differing emotions. Cynthia tried to lighten the mood.

"This isn't going bad... I guess."

Robin took a breath.

"Even forewarned, it will take Ylisse a while to adjust to us, but hopefully this will the worse of it. Now let's head to my house."

They walked in single file. Even with the peasants clearing out of the way, the streets were still tight for the trio, though their larger sizes allowed them to step over several buildings, and Sumia and Cynthia merely slowed down when they needed to.. Now that she towered over all the buildings, Cynthia marvelled at her new view of the city, and how it appeared like a model to her, though Sumia and Robin simply focused on getting to Robin's house.

Despite not being able to walk as fast they could, their longer legs carried them across Ylisse quicker they had thought possible and they soon found themselves at Robin's house.. Priam was waiting, but at the sight of them, especially Robin, the normally stoic Priam looked more surprised than anyone had ever seen. Robin allowed herself a moment of levity.

"I am a lot take in aren't I?"

Priam, who could normally talk the hind-legs of a donkey was lost for words. Robin was not surprised, but turned to Sumia.

"I should be able to research our condition now. If I need anything else I'll let you know. Though if you can find me something that could clothe me better, I would appreciate that."

Sumia nodded.

"I'll see what I can do."

Cynthia frowned.

"But what do we do now?".

Robin shrugged.

"I don't know. Until I complete my research, I suppose all you can do is wait."

"Oh. Well at least people don't think I'm scary monster anymore!"

13533211221112112111112111211.content:
Night approached quickly after the hullabaloo of the day calmed down. The mood of the townsfolk in Ylisse was still a little tense; many couldn't believe that there was now 3 giants that lived in their kingdom, of which 2 were of the royal family. There were small meetings made in each district of the capital, small discussions between homeowners, business owners, peasantry, and the like - there was no clue within the town demographic of how to react to the giants, and the growing size and intensity of the ramblings just went to show how much the topic monopolized the minds of the townsfolk.

"Is it really okay to trust them?"

"What if it's a trap?"

"They don't look like they mean harm."

"They're our rulers and neighbors!"

"True, but Queen Sumia's so clumsy..."

"These giants are a menace!"

"Mommy, I'm a little scared..."

The intensity of the discussions were at their worst in the East Residential District, where townsfolk had a full view of the giant-sized Robin, sitting in the giant hole she had put in her roof, toiling away with small books and scraps of paper as she did her research, her smaller family standing guard around the home to prevent any injuries or magical accidents. Despite this, the discussions were quiet and controlled, and evenly split down the middle in opinion; for the while though, it seemed as if there wouldn't be violent outcry in response to the 3 titanic girls. Within the walls of Castle Ylisstol, the mood was far more relaxed; though surprised at the 3 giants, the castle's servants and the Shepherds were used to arguably far more unbelievable scenarios, and at this point, they were already dull to the fact their fellow Pegasus Knight and Queen they served stood as 60-foot tall monoliths. As for Cynthia and Sumia, away from the rest of their family, they only had each other to entertain each other, and tried to make the best out of their situation; the two girls sat in a large wooden tub of water, of which a small ring of fire surrounded it, and tried desperately to relax after the hectic last couple of days.

"Ahhh~!" Cynthia sighed in relief, "It was so nice of the other Shepherds to let us use the water tower to bathe! I can just feel all my troubles melting away!" Cynthia sank her body deeper into the hot waters with a wide grin on her face, feeling relaxed. Sumia looked a little more rigid, looking around nervously, despite the small smile on her face.

"Well, it is nice..." she agreed, "But, you know...It just doesn't feel right to bathe out in the open like this, people could be watching..." Sumia's gaze focused on some cavaliers marching by; she took notice of their stares and immediately covered her arms over her area of cleavage uncovered by the water, her face blooming into a blush.

"Mother, you worry way too much sometimes; we're around trusted friends here, nobody's going to make any advances on you or anything! Except maybe Vaike..."

"Well...I guess you're right..." Sumia let her arms relax and took a deep breath, sinking a bit into the bath waters. Cynthia flipped over from her relaxing position and hung her arms and head over the side of the tub.

"Mother, could you scrub my back for me? I got an itch back there that's been killing me all day."

"Oh, sure thing!" Sumia reached over the side of the tub and grabbed a large broom, used for washing the wyverns in Shepherd employ, and begun to scrub Cynthia's back with it. The princess let out a delighted purr, enjoying the soft bristles against her skin.

"Oh yeah! That's the spot! Just keep that going for like, 5 minutes or so!" As she scrubbed, Sumia's eyes affixed to the Brand of the Exalt on Cynthia's right shoulder blade; the regal design never ceased to impress Sumia, despite seeing it daily upon Chrom's shoulder and Lucina's eye. Sumia smiled and ran her fingers softly across the brand, causing Cynthia to jump, splashing water over the side of the tub and putting out some of the flames surrounding it. "Eek!!!"

"Oh! I'm sorry Cynthia! I didn't mean to scare you!"

"N-No, no, it's fine! Your fingers are so ticklish, just warn me next time before you do that!" Sumia looked a bit down as Cynthia ran her palm across the spot her mother touched. "You were touching my Brand, right?"

"Well, yes." Sumia replied. She looked at her daughter with a smile, her eyes showed she was in deep thought. "I just couldn't help but think how alike to your father you became, almost right down to your Brand. You're a true contender for his heir when up against Lucina."

"How so? I mean, at least Lucina can use Falchion, that should be proof enough that she's next-in-line for Queen."

"Well, that's true, but aside from that, I couldn't help but notice the similarities. You're both kind, brave, a little reckless, have a strong love for justice, and you both break far too many things during practice; now that I think about it, the only thing you probably inherited from me was your love for animals."

"But Mother, all those things can apply to you too. Especially the 'breaking stuff' part." Sumia blushed and giggled a little, not expecting Cynthia to be so blunt about her clumsiness.

"Well, it was just a thought. You and Lucina took away a lot of royal genes from Chrom, right down to your hair color, I just couldn't help but wonder if there was anything I passed down to the both of you."

"Well, we're both girls, that needs to count for something, right? And besides..." Cynthia let out a sharp whistle, and in a short instance, Cynthia's personal Pegasus had come from its stall and flew to her master, perching upon the rim of the tub. Cynthia used her oversized finger to rub the winged horse's back, and it let out a pleased neigh as the finger stroked across its back. "If it wasn't for you, I don't think Lucina or I would've ever taken the path we did. When Father was killed in the future, we were truly sad, but we had you to raise us, and you always taught us the importance of fighting for the friends and family you cared for. The day you died was the day we took up our sword and lance, and then from there, Owain, Severa, Inigo, and everyone else joined us as well, to change the fate of the future - when you get down to it, you're probably the thing that got Grima killed in the end!"

"Well, I guess when you put it that way..." Sumia let out a laugh and stuck her hand on Cynthia's cheek, stroking it gently. "Have I ever told you how proud I am to have you two as my daughters?"

"Never a single day without! And you'll always have the two babies in the castle to care for too, so you get Double-Daughters Funtime! Oh, hey! That could be a really cool special move name!" The two girls laughed before getting back to relaxing; Cynthia only had 12 seconds of R&R before a thought ate up at her mind. "So hey, if we're gonna be this big from now on, how are you going to handle Baby Me and Baby Lucina?" Sumia flipped over and took a look at the castle, watching some mason workers begin to repair the sections Cynthia broke.

"It's going to be a little tough to tuck them in, or read stories to them from now on, but I'll find a way. Heck, I'm still trying to think about how I'm going to sleep with Chrom like this..." Sumia flipped back, looking Cynthia directly in the eyes. "Cynthia, sweetie, I hope you're not feeling outcast by this."

"Oh, no, I'm cool! It was a little terrifying at first, but I think I'm used to it now - I'm more worried about you to be honest!" Cynthia leaned back over the tub's rim, letting her blue hair drape over the side as she stared at the stars. "I can easily get used to this, but I want to know where that rock came from. Someone could really get hurt if that magic gets in the wrong hands, and what kind of hero just lets her townspeople become endangered with no response?" Cynthia pumped her arm skyward, pointing a fist towards the constellations above. "No, not while Super-Giant Hero Cynthia's on the job! I wanna use this magic to my advantage; I'm gonna find whoever or whatever that stupid rock came from, and then I'm gonna kick the crap out of them, once for embarrassing me, twice for putting my city in danger, and then three times for making Mother huge & sad! There's no brakes on this pain-carriage!" Sumia giggled at her daughter's enthusiasm.

"Well, at least it's good to know you're psyche is still strong! For now, let's just wait for Robin's diagnosis, and then I'll be happy to let 'Super-Giant Hero Cynthia' do whatever she needs to keep Ylisse safe."

"Yeah!" Sumia looked at the sky, watching the moon shine down directly over the tub.

"It's getting late, I think I'm done bathing for the night. Do you want me to leave the fire on for you?"

"Yeah, I'm gonna keep soaking & relaxing for a bit. I'll take care of the fire before I hit the hay, knight's honor."

"Alright, then I'll be in the barn, come join me when you're ready to come to bed." Sumia used her arms to cover her privates before climbing out of the tub, watching cautiously to make sure no one was watching her. Quickly, she grabbed her cheesecloth dress from the watchtower it was draped over and wrapped it loosely around her body, enough to cover her as she marched to the barn. "Goodnight Cynthia!" Sumia held her arms together and stepped slowly, being careful not to trip, as Cynthia sank into the hot bath water and continued her daydream of her gigantic hero adventures, accompanied by mental songs, cheers from the people, and heroic special effects.

135332112211121121111121112111.content:
The next morning, Cynthia and Sumia tried to resume their day as normally as they could. For the most part, the Shepards still treated them the same way as before, but others who did not know them so well were still visibly wary.

Cynthia drooped.

"Do you think they'll ever get used to us?"

"We can only hope so." Sumia tried to appear strong, but she couldn’t hide her folded lips.

In the distance, they could see Robin heading for the castle. She tried to manurer through the village as carefully as she could, using her almost supernatural awareness. At the sight of her, Cynthia instinctively wanted to spring up, but Sumia raised her hand, reminding her to be careful. Taking heed, Cynthia got up slowly, making sure to look around. Sumia was just as excited, if not more so, but feared that if she showed it Cynthia would get careless. She stood up soon after Cynthia, ready to greet Robin. Instead of running to meet her, they waited for Robin to come closer.

"Did you find anything?"

Robin shook her head.

"It is as I fear, nothing like this has happened in recorded history. And if rocks turning people into giant had happened in the past, I'm sure it would be recorded."

Cynthia puffed her cheeks.
"Really? I'm sure I read a story like this before..."

"It must be your imagination. Anyway, I've tried to study the magic that's effecting us, I must confess I am not as well versed as Miriel or Laurent, but it is like nothing I've seen."

Sumia’s frowned deepened.

"So there's nothing you can do?"

"No."

Sumia clasped her arms together, unable to hide her building anxiety.

"Does that mean we're stuck like this forever?!

Robin barely showed any hint of distress.

"Hopefully not. I said there was nothing I could do, but others may be able to help. We could have Miriel and Laurent analyse the shards, though we would have to make sure Miriel's curiosity would not get the best of her."

Sumia brightened up.

"That is something."

"But even they may not be able to counteract the stone's magic. It possible this stone is other worldly in origin."

"But what do we do then?" Cynthia asked.

"If anyone can do it, it would be those two. Should it prove impossible, we could ask Tiki for help."

Sumia’s eyes widened.

"Tiki?! But the Divine Dragon Grounds are so far away! And I'm pretty sure we're much to big for any boat!"

"Indeed. And I would rather not travel in this state."

"And I don't want to leave my kingdom without a king or queen!"

"So I propose that if Miriel and Laurent are unable to help us, we send a message to Tiki."

"But that means staying like this for longer…. And I will be expected to hear my subjects soon."

"We will have to live with it for now We've endured worse."

"True.. but I'm not sure people are willing to see the queen like this..."

Cynthia had been quiet as she listened. She wasn’t as worried as Robin and Sumia, her arms almost flaliling with exictment.

"Hey maybe I can help people like this."

"No. there is already a backlash brewing."

Cynthia blinked.

"What kind of backlash?!"

"I have been observing the townsfolk and overheard plenty of their mutterings. Some still see us as we are, others fear what we might do, intentionally or otherwise-"

Sumia looked at the ground.

"You mean their worried I'll crush someone because I'm clumsy....."

Robin placed an arm on her shoulder.

"I know you have been doing your best to improve, but not everyone sees that."

"I see.. I'll just have to keep my distance."

Cynthia tilted her head.

"So wouldn't it make things easier if I tried to help out?"

"Perhaps when things settle down. Right know, no not when people are still frightened of you."

“But...”

“Robin has a point. We can’t risk frightening the townsfolk anymore. Maybe when things calm down.”

Cynthia sighed deeply.

“Oh alright.”

Sumia called for Miriel and Laurent. It had proved fortunate that Chrom had employed them as court magicians. Robin explained the situation as succinctly as she could, the two mages listening with interest. Robin showed them the strange rock, keeping it carefully wrapped up, and cautioned them not to touch it no matter how curious they were. The two were excited at the chance to study such a strange and powerful artefact, Miriel more than her son but they both promised to do what they could.

After they left, Cynthia swung her arms, mindful of everything around her.

“Ugh I’ve never had to be so still for so long! Can I please go and train or something?”

Robin gave it a second’s thought.

“Some exercise could do us all good, though not here. If you want to practice you can use the clearing you rested at. And I know you might find it difficulty to practice without a lance suited to your size, but if this persists I’m sure Priam will be happy to help you work out a training regime.”

“Really? He’d do that for me.”

Robin smiled.

“Sometimes he’s too into his training.”

“Speaking of which, which are Morgan and Priam?”

Robin almost rolled her eyes.

“Need you ask? Priam talk Morgan off to their usual morning training session. Speaking of which I should go check up on them.”

Cynthia and Robin got up and began to go there separate ways. Cynthia turned to her mother, who remained seated.

“Aren’t you coming to?”

“I’d like to but I can’t. Someone has to hold down the fort while everyone is away. Oh Robin! Aren’t you hungry? I can get you something.”

“No that’s ok-” Robin stopped, putting a hand on her stomach. She looked sheepish. “Hmm.. it seems I am hungrier than I realized. I tend to forget such things when my mind is on a problem. I wouldn’t mind something to eat.”

“Well have fun!” Cynthia said cheerfully, though as she turned form them she frowned, suddenly feeling alone again. As she walked, thoughts followed her.

What if we really are stuck like this? She tried to push it back Well we’ll just have to make the best of it!” But the villagers are still scared of us. “They’ll come around.”

As Cynthia drew closer she heard what sounded like a panic yell. She was sure that someone needed her help! Robin and Sumia’s word briefly came into her head, but she shrugged. A hero, no a Shepard could not ignore anyone in need of assistance!
