1353321122111211211111211121112211111211.content:
"Well..." Sumia began. She intended to start right off on the big question, however, got a feeling of cold feet when seeing her tiny friend surrounded by the daunting figures of her, Cynthia, & Robin - it almost felt like bullying her into growing. Sumia quickly changed the topic in her mind and put it into words. "You know, I just couldn't help but wonder how the wheather was today!"

"The wheather?" Cordelia asked in confusion.

"Yeah! Boy, is it sunny out today! Hey, if we have some time later, you should bring Severa over to play with Lucina & Cynthia! I'll set up a small playground in the courtyard!"

"Oh, what a lovely idea! I do want her to grow up a little nicer than her future counterpart if we're being truthful." Cordelia folded her arms. "Now, what we're you really going to ask, and no detractions this time." The words shot Sumia like an arrow, sending her into a state of fumble.

"Am I really that transparent?"

"We've been good friends for how many years now? I think I've picked up on your habits well at this point. Now please, your question?" Sumia sighed, hoping that she wouldn't offend her friend, despite her true feelings on the matter.

"Well, you know how you have a natural drive to protect others, right?"

"Yeah..." Cordelia trailed her words, trying to forsee Sumia's point.

"And how you have that natural urge to teach others as a mentor?"

"Go on..."

"And, well...How you've always told me you've wanted to be a little taller? Just a teeny bit, to offset your perfect stature?" Cordelia could see Cynthia behind her mother, trying to stifle a giggle whilst bobbing up & down.

"Sumia, you're not asking me to turn myself into a giant too, are you?" Sumia bowed her head in rapid & hard motions, afraid her request had gone wrong.

"I'm sorry! I'm sorry! I know it was selfish to ask! Forget I said anyth-"

"Woah! Woah! Calm down Sumia, I didn't say no!" Cordelia couldn't help but giggle as her friend halted her apologies. "If you want me to, I'll do it, it's no trouble to me! What kind of soldier denies a personal request from her leige? Besides," Cordelia shifted her head past Sumia's body, eyeing Cynthia's excited figure, "I can see my recruit in the back there moving around in excitement, how can I say no to her?"

"Yes!" Cynthia shouted in excitement. "See Mother, you got nothing to worry about, so you can go get a cure for yourself and Robin, while the Captain & I keep super-protecting Ylisse!" Sumia felt a warm smile overcome her face at watching her daughter's innocent happiness. Robin however remained stoic, & continued to question Cordelia.

"Forgive me if I ruin this moment," she began, "But I want you to realize the severity of this choice. Food & clothing would be scarce, prejudice against your size would come naturally from groups of people, and when we find a cure for this, if there is one, there would potentially no going back for you. Are you still sure about this?" The weight of Robin's words & truths crashed down upon Cordelia for a moment, but like a true perfect soldier, she showed no backing downin her expression, she stood tall & rigid, unaffected by Robin's claims. Slowly, Cordelia sat upon a log and crossed her legs, cupping her hands over her dominant knee.

"Robin, let me tell you a story." Cordelia looked skyward as she tried to recount details of her tale. "When I was young, my parents told me a lot of stories, the usual lot of tales; of Nohr, of Hoshido, other fairy tales of that nature, but one story stuck out to me as a child. It was a tale of a young child's quest to save a town from the moon crashing upon it; he scoured the four corners of the continent & summoned the giants who guarded the land to push the moon back into the sky. Most children I played with emulated the young boy, always traveling towards another quest, but I always wanted to be like the giants - towering over everyone, danger always in my sights, protecting the one place of my birth from harm." Cynthia was clearly going wild over Cordelia's recount of her childhood.

"See, that's my Captain! I knew she got her true heart of a hero from somewhere like me!" Cordelia giggled a little at Cynthia's commentary.

"Yes, well, it's a little selfish-sounding, but I always did want to be bigger than everyone else so I could protect them. And, as you mentioned, Sumia, I am getting a little tired over people saying I'm the 'perfect height' in the Shepherds." Robin continued onwards with her facts & inquiries.

"So you're fine with the permanent change?"

"Yes."

"The prejudice?"

"I welcome it."

"The scarce resources?" Cordelia sucked some air through her teeth, making a noise of slight discontent.

"The lack of clothing bugs me a little..." Cordelia referred to her flat chest, a complex that plagued her for her whole life, but nobody present needed to know about that. "But I'll cross that bridge when I get there. I'll make sure ample meals are dealt to Cynthia & I that won't starve the kingdom."

"I see..." Robin stopped her inquiries & folded her arms, giving off a slight smile. "Well then, I guess you're ready to become a giant, forgive me for my nonstop questioning."

"It's fine." Cordelia happily replied, giving a wave. Cynthia squealed and snatched up Cordelia, jumping up & down happily with her in her grasp.

"Yaaaaay!! This is gonna be so fun! Just me & the Captain - two giant maidens out on a quest to protect their home from evil! This rocks!"

"Cynthia! Stop shaking!" Cordelia cried as Cynthia kept on jumping. Upon these words, Cynthia stopped & uncupped her hands, looking down at a dizzy Cordelia who looked ready to hurl.

"Oh, uh, whoops! I keep forgetting my own habits!" Sumia looked over Cynthia's shoulder, down at Cordelia.

"Thanks again for this, Cordelia. I honestly don't know how to repay you."

"It's fine," the red-haired knight replied, "You can repay me by continuting to run the kingdom as you do. I'll get used to my new position quickly."

"Okay, that's what I'll do." Sumia began to twiddle her thumbs, feeling another sensation of bashfulness overcome her. "Umm, I don't think this is proper to ask, but that cure isn't coming along fast right now, so..." Cordelia shook off the feeling of nausea and addressed her friend.

"What time would work best for me to grow?" she asked, almost reading Sumia's thoughts.

"Sorry!" Sumia bowed her head again; Cordelia was happy to know the title of royalty never got to her friend's head, but still wished Sumia didn't apologize as much. Cordelia looked her friend in the eyes and spoke her choice.

The group all look around them to see the deciduous trees around them. Some are just barely shorter than the 60ft tall woman, but other trees manage to surpass them at 70ft, making them great hiding spots for the girls.

"So Captain," Cynthia said trying to wait out the growth process, "How's Severa doing so far? Honestly, I was worried when she, Inigo, and Owain headed out to that tree in Valm, only for them to never come back for a while."

"She's doing well, Cynthia," Cordelia responded as she felt another growth spurt, "She's matured so much the last time I saw her. Maybe a bit TOO much, because..." She began to tear up, "They grow up so fast..." Sumia inched closer to Cordelia, making sure not to cause any noise that will give away their position.

"You're strong enough to tell us, Cordelia," she assured her, "Is there anything about Severa that changed?"

"She's...married, not to mention a mother like me."

"Huh?! Severa has a husband?" Cynthia said. She was surprised by this point, though to be fair, Severa was seclusive when it comes to personal matters. Inigo was bound to have someone accept him eventually, as evident by Peri, but Severa being a mother took her by surprise.

"I cannot believe it," she continued, growing a bit anxious, "What's her husband's name? Name of her child? When did-"

"Cynthia, honey, this isn't the time for that," Sumia interrupted, not knowing Cordelia grew a bit more.

"Sorry, guess I got too excited. Anyways, so how are you feeling Captain?"

Cordelia looked at the stone, or rather, pebble in her hand. She's currently at the halfway mark, though it's quite hard for the team to measure.

"Doing well, thank you. I'll be honest, I'm quite eager to get to work at my new height. I hope you and I can protect the people of Ylisse once we find a way to reverse the process for Sumia and Robin."

"Don't forget about Lucy! She'll be joining us to fight crime once you're done growing!"

Lucina was staggered when Cynthia suddenly pointed her finger at her.

"Yes, I made a deal with her that I will grow also after Cordelia's growth-"

Lucina was interrupted when something flew over them. Robin quickly looked up to examine it. One glance was all she needed to identify it to be a pegasus, coupled with some faint screaming. The pegasus landed in an area quite close to them.

"Someone's coming," Robin informed the group as she stood up, ready to take action, "Get ready." Cynthia crawled her way to the forest opening, waiting for them to come.

That is, until they heard screaming from that direction. Lucina walked closer to make out who it was, Falchion in hand.

"Hurry up, slowpoke!" The voice cried out.

"You know I'm not as fast as you, right Severa?" Another voice came out, this time masculine.

"Of course I know that, mister perfection, so pick up the pace!"

Lucina sheathed her sword, knowing who's coming.

"It's Severa along with another partner." Cordelia's eyes widened.

"Oh no," she realized, "If she was on that pegasus, then that means-"

"MOTHER," Severa greeted wholeheartedly as she ran past Lucina, "I saw you while I was-ACK!" She was startled to see Cynthia, Sumia, Robin, and Cordelia all 60ft tall, 40ft for Cordelia, "W-What's going on?" Meanwhile, the man that was with her caught up to Severa, panting as he slowed down. He had long, crimson red hair similar to Cordelia, and wore the clothes of a Pegasus Knight.

"Wow, Severa, you're quick," the man stated as he was catching his breath, "I'm gonna have to train harder if I want to satisfy you." Robin grew suspicious and lowered her head towards him.

"And just who are you?" Robin questioned him as the others explained to Severa what happened.

"Huh? Oh, sorry," he apologized, somewhat unfazed that the 60ft tall tactician is staring right at him "I'm Subaki, one of the captains of the pegasus knights along with my mother-in-law."

"Mother-in-law?" Robin questioned.

"Oh, did Severa not tell you? To be fair, she is a person who doesn't like to let information spread."

"No, what is it?"

"We're husband and wife, to put it short."

"What?" Robin suddenly yelled, turning towards Severa, "You never informed us that you're married to Subaki!"

"I-I was going to tell you guys eventually," Severa stuttered, "But anyways, what happened next after you were attacked?"

The group spent the next half-hour explaining to the two what happened. Deep in Severa's mind, however, is another stir of thoughts. She glanced at her 50ft mother. At that height, she'll do more work that she can. They were on par ever since she came back from another adventure, but now that Cordelia is huge, she cannot help but be irritated that she'll be bested by her mother again. A thought crossed her mind suddenly. She smirked as she imagined the possibility. Her expression returned to normal as Sumia rounded up the chain of events.

"And that's it," Sumia concluded, "We've been through a lot as you can tell."

"Certainly," Subaki commented, "I'll get some of our pegasus knights to scout the area for the remaining bandits. Severa, what will you do?"

"Well, there's only one thing left to do," she replied while smiling, "I'll be joining you guys, huge and all." Everyone, especially Cordelia, grew concerned as to what Severa was thinking.

"Severa," Lucina informed her, "You do know what will-"

"Yeah, my clothes won't fit, I'll have to pay attention to my surroundings, etcetera. If my mother is going to be 60ft tall, then she'll need some competition, which will be me," she pointed out, "I'll be fine, so there's no need to worry."

Cordelia couldn't help but smile. Her daughter has been through so much, yet she still hasn't let go of her competitive side. At 60ft tall, she rolls the stone close to Severa for her to pick up.

"Alright, dear," she confessed, "There's no way we can change your mind, so pick the stone up whenever you're ready."

"I'll go get the cheesecloth," Robin said as she stood up, "Make sure to undress yourself as I go retrieve it." She left the forest to get the apparel.

"Alright, I'll be going," Subaki said, "Severa, please be careful." She couldn't help but sigh. He's usually focused on his improvement, but never did he stop caring for her.

"Okay, I'll be careful. I'll see you soon." She approached her husband and gave him a quick kiss on the lips. She blushed as Subaki smiled before he leaves. At the same time, Robin returned and handed Severa the cheesecloth for her to put on. Robin also carried some extra cheesecloth for Lucina, and should they be damaged. Severa undressed herself and picks up the stone, smiling as she watched it glow.

Cynthia shivered slightly as she look at Severa.

"I know Lucina can be scary when she gets angry," she thought to herself, "But now that Severa will be huge, I can't imagine how she will be."

But Cordelia was here to keep an eye on Severa, so she couldn't act up too much but then again even Cordelia couldn't watch her all the time.....

Cynthia belt down over Severa.

"Yeah well-" Before she could come up with what she hoped was the perfect comeback, Sumia and Cordelia got between them.

"Girls please stop bickering." Sumia said

"Yes, there is really no need." Cordelia agreed.

Cynthia smiled, easily forgetting their silly quarrel, though Severa was still sour.

"You're right, there's no need to argue, cause we're all going to be part of the Giant Girl Guard!"

Lucina blinked.

"Giant... Girl... Guard?"

Severa rolled her eyes.

"At least it's a better name than your silly Justice Cabal."

Sumia sighed loudly.

"Girls...."

Cynthia hung her head.

"Sorry."

Severa pouted.

"Oh fine, take your stupid rock."

She threw it at Lucina's feet. Cordelia placed an on Severa' shoulder, getting her daughter's attention.

"Not that it really matters, but if it's any consolation, you will probably reach our size before Lucina."

"it's a good thing mother had so many of these....."

"Why do you have so many of them anyway?"

Sumia shrugged.

"Oh uhh.. I don't know. I suppose there useful to have around the castle. You can never be sure when they'll come in handy, right?"

"I suppose..."

Maybe she could recruit all the Shepards! Her plans could come to fruition, without her needing to force this on anyone! After all with Lucina in this group, who wouldn't want to join?

Besides with some giant warriors those bandits would think twice before messing with her again! Not to mention she'd never have to worry about feeling lonely again.

Still if Lucina turned out to be a better guard than her, where would that leave her? She tried to banish the thought but no matter she tried it still lurked in the back of her mind, coming back as Lucina continued to rise.

After a couple minutes of waiting, both Severa and Lucina have finally grown to their 60ft status. The space the group were in became cramp, so some of them had to take down some trees to make some more room.

"Mmh," Severa moaned as she stretched to her full height, "It feels so good being this tall." Lucina stood up to her full height, taking in the height difference between the trees around the entire group.

"I'll admit, it does feel good," she said as she she shielded her eyes from the sun, "But remember, we must use this to protect the kingdom."

Cynthia looked at her sister. She couldn't help but feel envious as the thought of Lucina being a better guard loomed on her. She shook her head to get the nasty thought out of her mind. Needing a distraction, Cynthia looked at the ground beneath them.

"Hm," Cynthia thought as she saw something next to Lucina's feet, "Is that...?" She reached out towards the object and picked it up by what appears to be the hilt of a blade. She held it up to the sun to get a better view, only for her to be blinded as light poured out of the opening of the object.

"NGH," she grunted as she turned her head away from the hole, "Sis, look at this." Lucina turned towards Cynthia to examine what she was holding. Her eyes widened as she realized what Cynthia had in her possession.

"Is that Falchion?" She questioned as she took the weapon from the hilt, "It look exactly like it. Well, there's only one way to find out." She turned towards the direction where they came from and held Falchion with both hands. Everyone's eyes turned towards Lucina as she got into a battle position.

"Um, honey," Sumia asked her daughter, "What do you plan to-" Her question is silenced when Lucina cleaved the path in front of her. Many of the trees in front of her were sliced in half, surprising the entire group, including Lucina.

"That's definitely Falchion." Severa stated.

"That's strange," Lucina added, "Why did it grow along with me?" She thought about it for a moment until she heard something.

"Lucina," the voice said, "Did you do that?" Robin glanced over to see who it was.

"M-Morgan?" Robin stammered as she saw her son standing in the wake of destruction.

"Mother, I'm fine. Father taught me to be prepared for anything." Robin contained her frustration, knowing that her son was in danger.

"Alright," she said as she picked him up, bringing him closer to her face, "I'll take your word for it. But you're coming with me for now on until we get things sorted."

"Ah, perfect," Morgan added, finding the perfect time to say what's on his mind, "I came here to deliver a message from Chrom." Sumia walked closer to Morgan, hearing her husband's name.

"What did Chrom want to tell us?"

"He gave you all, including me, Soleil, Inigo, and Father, a skirmish to do. He said that it would be best if you all would get used to your current height."

"Alright, what's our mission?" Severa asked the tiny tactician. Morgan skipped a heartbeat when he saw Severa, but quickly regained his composure.

"There were some reports of some unusual activity in a nearby town, so he assigned us all to check on the place until further notice. Father went on ahead to skim the place." Morgan pulled out a map and held it up high so that the entire brigade could see it.

"So it's just down south from where we are," Lucina commented as she placed Falchion in its sheath that also grew, "Well, it's time to get moving."

"Agreed," Cordelia said, "I'll go on ahead in search of our destination." She left as she waved goodbye to Sumia, who also waved back.

"Hey," Severa yelled, "Don't leave me behind!" She chased after her mother, knocking a few trees over in contrast with her mother's careful maneuver.

"That's our Severa," Cynthia sighed, "Competitive as always." Who knew that the girls' first mission would be to protect a town from any suspicious activity? She was eager to arrive at the town so that she could drive off any villains that come close! But alas, that will have to wait.

"Hey, Cynthia," Sumia called out to her, "We're leaving!"

"Oh, right," she responded, "Hold on!" She caught up to her mother as the group embark on their first mission.

Morgan was excited. She'd finally come up with a hex that would knock her mother's socks off. Even her father would sing her praises when he saw it's battle applications. The war against Grima and the Shepherd's enemies would be a breeze. The only thing left to do now was to see how it reacted to human.

She knew for a fact the hex worked as it was a success on the pebbles near camp. A human test subject would only confirm her hex's application. The only question was who to hit with it? She thought about using it on herself, but her mother forbade her from using herself as a guinea pig after her failed attempt at restoring her memories.

She then thought about her big sister Noire. If she remembered correctly she had a pretty hardy constitution, and she was hexed constantly by their mother in the future and still functioned properly. She would be the perfect test subject. She just had that look about her. Nothing could possibly go wrong.

Walking through camp she searched high and low for Noire. So far she hadn't seen heads or tails of her. She couldn't have gone into town as they always went together. So maybe she was out by the shooting range practicing with her bow? Yeah, that seemed the mostly place to find her.

Channeling her inner Tharja, she began to sneak through the camp and around the nearby shrubs. Morgan traveled deep into the woods until she came across a small clearing where she spotted the shooting range. Behind a tree she sat as she peaked her head around. There was Noire all by her lonesome shooting targets with her bow.

This was perfect. She was all alone and unsuspecting. This would be as easy as beating Yarne in sparring practice. Morgan reached into her coat's sleeve and pulled out her makeshift tome. She began whispering a small chant and channeled the power into her finger.

Meanwhile, while this was going on, Noire was busy trying to nail another bullseye. She never even knew her sister had just volunteered her to test her latest creation. Right as she pulled back another arrow to take the shot, she felt a bizarre feeling wash over her. She turned her head towards Morgan's position but saw nothing.

Perhaps her mind was playing tricks on her...

Two years have passed since the era of gods have ended, and the foundation of the One Kingdom of Valentia. Although the first few months have been rough, its king and queen, Alm and Celica-once Anthiese-, have plowed the way for humans to take their first steps in a land without the need of gods, with the Brotherhood of Knights aiding the commoners and nobles alike. No matter where the duo goes, people always see them with their personal weapons, Alm with the divine sword Falchion, and Celica with the Beloved Zofia.

So what journey do these two face now? After sealing away an alchemist's creation in Archanea, deep within the Thabes Labyrinth, it seems like there's nothing left for them to do. After all, there's nothing that can top the gods of old and man's greatest creation...right?

Celica rises from bed, clearing her vision from the strands of red hair covering her face. She looks on the other side of the bed to see her husband still sound asleep. All she could do was smile as she got out of bed and walked over to the bathroom to change her clothes. As she removes her nightshirt to reveal her red bra and undressed herself, Celica began thinking back to when the whole team returned to Furia Harbor after exploring the labyrinth.

"Excuse me, miss," an old man politely asks her, apologizing for interrupting her travels, "I'm sorry for interrupting you, but by any chance you are heading to Valentia?"
"Yes, I am," Celica responds without giving any hints of her royal lineage, "Is there anything you wish to share with me?"
"Consider this only a rumor, but I heard of a spell that grants women like you immense power," he shares, "I have heard it from sailors, but I do not believe them one bit. Besides, if such a spell existed, would we not have learned of its existence already?"
"Hmm, I suppose so," she agrees, "But they are only rumors. I wouldn't worry about it if I were you." With those words, Celica ran off to catch up with the others, swearing she could hear Alm calling to her.

So why is Celica thinking of that event two years ago? Maybe curiosity got to her. As she stepped out of the bathroom in her titular outfit, she decides to visit the nearby city and see what the market has in store as she waits for Alm to get up.

Walking down the street, she waves to the folks, both commoners and nobles, with grace and dignity. People have always thought she was a reincarnation of the past goddess Mila, but such comments have always made her blush. As she takes her time looking at what the market has in store, she decides to visit a library to see if they have anything new.

The library is small, yet it still proves to be an effective studying spot for both scholars and mages. Either way, Celica decides to read into the spells she has learned to pass the time as she waits for Alm to wake up. As she was looking through the books, she came across a peculiar book that the Brand reacted to. She takes out to book to examine it.

"That's weird," Celica told herself as she examined the cover, "No author, no cover, bot even a title. I'll have to check this out myself..."

Celica walks out of the library and sits on a bench close to the entrance. She was allowed to keep the book for herself, as even the librarians did not know of the book's existence. As she got seated, she opened the book to examine further.

"Text is in this," she thought as she went through the pages, "What is this book...ah! There's a spell in here. Let's see..."

As Celica begins chanting the text, the Brand on her palm begins to glow brightly. Once the light died down, Celica stared at the book.
"What just happen-" Celica questioned until a light headache descended upon her. She grunted a bit, trying to fight off the pain...

15312121111.content:
Perhaps the most scariest part about Celica is that she has the strength to protect herself. Even before she was struck with the spell, she was know to be as strong as Alm. Now that she's 100ft tall, Celica could only imagine how strong she is.

She couldn't remember how long she was walking, but eventually, she found something that caught her eye: a large group, probably no more than 15, were stalking a trader. The team was quite balanced, consisting of some mercenaries, archers, and brigands.
"Bandits," she thought to herself, "Most likely up to no good. Let's see how my size affects their decision." She began by raising her foot and quietly planting it on the ground. While it still left an imprint on the ground, it made little tremors so that the bandits are not alarmed. She repeated this process for every step she made. If she were to be honest, this felt kinda fun. It always reminded her of the times when she was young in the castle, playing games with Conrad. But right now, this isn't a game. This is a serious problem that she needs to resolve. As she got closer to the group, she drew the Beloved Zofia carefully from its sheath. She's in top condition, all her spells are ready to go, and her blade is well-sharpened. She can see her shadow covering the entire group; she's on top of them. They'll HAVE to listen to her; she's Anthiese, the Queen of Valentia, now 100ft tall. There's no way they'll deny her.

Right?

The bandits see the trader stop to count for his supplies. Everyone was ready to ambush him. That is, until something got their attention
"Stop!" Celica told them as she stood up straight. To her, it was like telling someone to stop what they're doing; to the bandits, it felt like an explosion. The rogues turned around to see what who interrupted them. To say they were surprised to see a 100ft girl looming over them is an understatement. Even the trader stopped and looked at the queen in awe.
"I am Anthiese, the Queen of Valentia. If you know better, I suggest you cease your plans at once." Just to the point, short and sweet. Hopefully her intimidating size helped in getting the point across...
"Sorry, girl, but you shouldn't be snooping into other people's business." One of the bandits retorted.
"Yeah, what makes you think we were going to commit a crime?" Another one followed up. This got the crowd rallied, ready to retaliate should she make any sudden movement.
"I know you're up to no good," Celica responded by pointing her massive blade towards the group, "If you let down your arms and leave the trader alone, then I'll let you live for now." The bandits began looking at each other and began conversing, making gestures and what not. Celica began to smile a bit. Maybe she can negotiate peacefully at her height...

That is, until a sharp sting struck her right cheek. Celica quickly turned her head towards the source of the pain, only to find an archer with a Steel Bow in hand. Instantly, her hands began to clench as she turned back towards the bandits, this time armed with Silver weapons and Devil Axes.

"So, you refuse to make peace..." Celica murmured as she sheathed her weapon and began stretching her gloves, "Very well. Then fall." She raised her right hand high and began reciting the incantation for a spell. At the very moment, the army of 15 began to disperse. The magic circles began surrounding her, and with a wave of her hand, the circles began to disperse. The first spell she casted? A great bolt of lightning struck where the bandits once were. The electricity managed to get some of them, but it wasn't as effective as a direct hit. Still, the current hurt, and it got a few of them debilitated.
"Run!" Celica ordered the trader as she casted another Thunder spell. The trader nodded and packed his thing before moving towards a safe spot to watch the action unfold. She smiled as she watched him move away from the action, now she can use her more dangerous spells.

With him out of the way, Celica can now focus on taking down the bandits with no qualms. Every spell she fired this time either glazed them, or directly struck them. Celica charged a Fire spell and shot it towards a pair of bandits. The fireball to the bandits looked like a meteor coming from a sky, and unfortunately, they couldn't dodge it in time and were incinerated. Her first kill at her height. She justified that it was necessary for peace, nevertheless, she continued her assault.

Be it death by the force of Excalibur, or the electricity of Thunder, the bandit's numbers were dwindling; they forces were now only four strong. An archer drew his bow and aimed directly at Celica. Warding Shot was prepped and it struck Celica directly at her chest.
"AAUUGGH," she wailed as she took some steps back, "THAT HURT!" She could feel all of her energy fading as the fight continued on. She barely has any energy left to cast her strongest spell, but even then, she was silenced. She took a few steps back as she avoided the volley of arrows aimed at her...

And she froze in place as she was greeted with a snap and burst underneath her shoe. She looked underneath her sole to see what she stepped on, only to be greeted by the sight of blood. She was horrified, but at the same time, it felt...satisfying. She began thinking of a different strategy to finish off the last three bandits. She unsheathed her weapon and began walking towards the archer pestering her. She raised her weapon and slammed it down on the ground, knocking the archer off his feet. He could only watch as the titanic queen approached him with an emotionless expression, raised her foot above him, and planted it directly on him, ending his life at that moment. Celica turned around towards the last two bandits. She knew what she had to do, and it was simple. She can feel the rush of magical energy flowing through her and settling at the palms of her hands. She planted the Beloved Zofia into the ground and began to concentrate. She raised her palms and moved her arms in a circular motion. At that moment, her palms were sent ablazed, and the Brand on her right hand began to glow. She opened her eyes are glared at the remaining survivors of her skirmish.
"It's over." Celica said as she raised her hands towards the sky and casted her ultimate spell.

Meanwhile, at Zofia Castle, Alm was studying the book Celica used to make her huge in the castle's library. The text was very complicated. Even with the basic reading Celica taught her, the text was archaic and beyond his skill level.
"Ugh, this is tough." He muttered as he exited the library.
"Have you reached a breakthrough, Sir Alm?" A soldier asked him. Alm turned around and shook his head in denial.
"No, unfortunately. I'll have to write a letter to them to let them know that we're coming."
"'Them', sir?"
"Luthier and Delthea-"
His thought were interrupted when an earthquake shook the castle, followed by a massive sound burst that sounded like an explosion.
"What the-?" Alm screamed as the sound blast waves through the castle. Much of the glass windows were shattered by the blast, and some of the fragile object inside fell and cracked, though luckily, nothing of value was damaged.
"Your Majesty!" Another soldier cried as he rushed towards the king. "The balcony! Come quickly." Alm nodded and the three rushed towards the balcony where Celica dropped him off.

"By the gods..." Alm muttered as he saw the massive fireball and smoke coming from the distant south. There was only one person who was capable of making an explosion of that caliber...

A couple minutes later, Alm was traveling towards the sight of the explosion just down south of the castle with his squad. Those minutes felt like a few hours to him, and during those moments, he was cursing himself for leaving Celica out of his sights. Those thoughts would stop when he runs into a trader, who looks like he's in a hurry.

"Excuse me," Alm paused and asked him, "Have you seen a girl with red hair around 100ft tall?"
"You mean Queen Anthiese? Yes, she's just back there; in fact, I came here looking for help!" He pointed in the direction where he was running from.
"No..." Alm was beginning to dread even further, "Is she safe?"
"I don't know. I ran the moment she casted an enormous explosion on some bandits. It looked like she was in bad shape.
"I see...thank you." Those words were the only thing that could come out of Alm's mouth before departing. His face was consumed in fear. If what the trader said was true, then Celica was in danger.

"Please be safe, Celica..."

A couple more minutes later, they have arrived at the destination. The result of Celica's "skirmish" was a sight to behold. Burnt marks of lightning and fire were scattered all over the field, arrows were everywhere, blood stains were marked in a peculiar shape, and most importantly, the amount of corpses on the battlefield. In the center was the main attraction: Celica...

Her body was had several arrows sticking out of it and she had her hand over some of her wounds, she was breathing but her breath was slower. Alm raised his sword, in case any danger was nearby, though the battlefield appeared empty of anyone living and ran to Celica.

Celica looked serious, though a part of her suppressed a smile.

“Oh Alm. I knew our land was still ravaged by bandits and pirates, and I thought with my size I might do something to help.”

“What?! Why would you run off on your own like that?! You could have been killed!”

“But why did you run off by yourself?”

Celica sighed.

“Oh Alm, you’ve done so much for the land. You led the Deliverance, pushed back Emperor Rudolf’s armies and slew Duma. All I did was run for Millia, and even in that you needed to save me.”

Alm would have held her hand, but she was much too high for him to reach. He settled for placing an arm on our leg.

1531212111111.content:
There was something about Celica that just seemed to intimidate Alm. She seemed determined on stopping the pirates and bring them to justice. He wish he could say no, but between Celica's massive size and her selflessness, Alm couldn't bear to see Celica get severely hurt again.

"Alright, I'll help you," Alm agreed to Celica's offer, "But promise me to not run off again on your own..." Celica smiled brightly as she held her wounds tightly.
"I promise. I won't be as reckless like I was today." Celica got down on her knees once again and reached down towards Alm with her other hand; she perched him on her shoulder as Alm looked at her wife's glimmering face, although it was a bit bloody from her wounds. Speaking of her wounds, many of the clerics began treating them, although due to her size, it required multiple spot treatments. Still, it didn't void the fact that Celica was as beautiful as Alm remembered as the sun began to set...

A sudden growl came out of nowhere. It wasn't too loud per se, but it got the rest of Alm's squad into a fighting position. However, there was one person who knew where the sound came from.
"U-umm..." Celica stuttered as her face turned bright red, "That...was my stomach. Sorry, everyone, I haven't eaten anything since this morning." A sigh of relief echoed the barren battlefield, but some of them grew worried for her. To Alm, it didn't feel too long since Celica first arrived to find him, but it has been an eventful day. Now that Celica is hungry, he and Celica can go back to the castle and relax.

"Oh no..." Alm realized as she stared at her massive wife, "Celica, what do you plan on eating today?"
"Well, aren't we-ohhhh..." Celica realized the problem everyone was worried about: how is she going to eat at her height?
"Don't worry, Celica, we'll find a way." Alm assured her in an attempt to cheer her up.
"We'll help you, Lady Anthiese!" A soldier yelled towards her.
"We'll do anything to make sure you're safe and happy!" Another one pitched in. The entire squad was rallied, lifting Celica's mood a bit. To her surprise, she felt a warm touch on her cheeks. She turned her head to see Alm's hand stretched out towards her. Tears began to build up in her eyes. To think that she had to rely on others once again so that they can make her happy again.
"Thank you..." Celica said as she sniffed from the build-up of tears, "Thank you, all. I hope my new strength will find happiness and bring peace to Valentia."

A few hours has passed ever since Celica's first skirmish at her height. When the squad arrived at the castle, the first thing Alm did other than calming the people was to arrange a feast for everyone outside. It had been a long and eventful day for both Alm and Celica, so the feast was much needed. Nobles, soldiers, even some of the locals were invited for this rare occasion to dine with not only the king, but also the massive queen. Much of the food served was enough for double the amount of people that arrived, but it was prepared for a certain someone. But still, everyone had a good time, and some even got to speak with the 100ft tall queen, although they were a bit nervous at first.

A few hours later, the feast was over. Everyone was stuffed and felt satisfied with their bellies filled. Some stayed inside the castle and were given guest rooms due to the amount of ale or wine they have consumed, especially since Alm requested some of the finest wine from Ram Village. Celica laid her titanic figure down on the ground. She looked at the moon in the sky. If she was honest, she couldn't believe the events that have transpired today. From visiting a town, to annihilating a band of pirates, Celica grew accustomed to her new size. She couldn't ignore the cons, however, as evident by today's dinner. A plentiful amount of meat was present, but Celica ate what was pretty a whole Dagon in order for her stomach to be satisfied! Still, she couldn't deny that the fillet was delicious, and she was grateful for the meal. In the corner of her eye, she saw Alm walking towards her, tired from probably the meeting he had after dinner.
"How was the meeting?" Celica curiously asked him.
"Tiring," he responded with little emotion, "I just got to finishing the letter for the Forest Village, but before that, I had to discuss our plans for tomorrow."
"You must be exhausted, huh?" Celica asked him while turning her whole body towards him. She could barely make out a nod from him as he yawned. She smiled a bit.

"Hehe, good." Celica giggled.

For roughly the next hour, Celica kept on searching the castle for Alm or any of her subjects. It was strange for everyone to simply disappear into thin air. Just as she was about to abandon her search, the red-haired queen happened upon the castle’s dining hall. One more look here couldn’t hurt...

To the shrunken denizens of Valentia, reaching the dining hall was a long, exhausting trial. However, standing around and doing nothing would get them nowhere, so they pressed on towards one of the table’s monolithic legs, where Clive could make out an exhausted, green-haired figure.

“Alm..? Your majesty!”

Clive rushed over to comfort the equally-tiny king, checking his body for injuries.

“My apologies...” the knight said through a caring hug.

“Clive...thank you...” Alm replied, returning the embrace. “I’m glad to see the townspeople are okay. Well, other than being mysteriously reduced in size...” Just then, the miniaturized king’s eyes widened as a thought occurred to him. “Celica! Where is she? Is she small as well?”

A series of booming footsteps approaching the table gave Alm his answer. Then came another loud noise...

*Grrrrrrrrrrgle*

Celica’s cheeks turned a bright red as she put a hand to her stomach. “I guess I should prepare myself a meal, before I get back to finding them...” The giantess exited the room for a while, her steps rattling the tiny people under the table.

“At least Celica wasn’t shrunken...” Alm mused. “Maybe she can help us return to normal size!”

Although uncertain at first, the crowd quickly warmed up to Alm’s suggestion and began to scale the table’s legs...though not without a bit of difficulty. Eventually, the downsized king led his subjects onto the tablecloth and towards the nearest plate, just as the familiar queen made her way back to the table, holding a salad plate in her hands. Celica set her plate and utensils down, sat herself in the nearby seat, and started to enjoy her meal.

Against his better judgement, Alm leapt into his wife’s salad and waved his arms, yelling her name. Unfortunately, his tiny voice failed to reach Celica’s ears from down upon the plate. The massive woman scooped up another forkful of veggies, unknowingly taking Alm with said forkful! As her soft lips parted, revealing the moist cavern of her mouth to the unlucky victim...
